subsection.leadIn: Where the Commission is satisfied that it is appropriate to do so—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the interest of the investing public or in the public interest; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the facilitation of the management and administration of the compensation fund under Part XII,

subsection.continued: it may, after consultation with the Financial Secretary, by notice in writing served on a company, recognize the company as an investor compensation company—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: subject to such conditions as it considers appropriate specified in the notice; and

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: with effect from a date specified in the notice for the purpose.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting the generality of conditions which may be specified in a notice under subsection (1), the Commission may, by notice in writing served on a recognized investor compensation company, amend or revoke any condition specified in the first-mentioned notice or impose new conditions, where the Commission—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is satisfied that it is appropriate to do so on a ground specified in paragraph (a) or (b) of that subsection; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has consulted the Financial Secretary.

subsection.content: Where the Commission amends or revokes any condition or imposes any new condition by a notice under subsection (2), the amendment, revocation or imposition takes effect at the time of service of the notice or at the time specified in the notice, whichever is the later.
Where a company becomes a recognized investor compensation company, the Commission shall cause notice of that fact to be published in the Gazette.

Where a company is seeking to be a recognized investor compensation company and the Commission is minded not to recognize the company under subsection (1), the Commission shall give the company a reasonable opportunity of being heard before making a decision not to recognize the company.

Where the Commission refuses to recognize a company as an investor compensation company under subsection (1), the Commission shall, by notice in writing served on the company, inform the company of the refusal and of the reasons for it.

section.name: s80
section.heading: Transfer and resumption of functions of Commission

subsection.content: The Commission may request the Chief Executive in Council to transfer, by order (transfer order) published in the Gazette, to a recognized investor compensation company (designated investor compensation company), a function to which this section applies, if the Commission is satisfied that the designated investor compensation company is willing and able to perform the function.
This section applies to a function of the Commission under Part XII (other than sections 240(4) and (9) and 244(2)) or rules made under that Part.

For the purposes of subsection (2), the function of the Commission under Part XII to maintain the compensation fund includes a function to maintain all or any part of the compensation fund, and the other provisions of this Ordinance shall apply accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: A function to which this section applies may be transferred by a transfer order either in whole or in part, and the transfer may be subject to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reservation that the Commission is to perform the function concurrently with the designated investor compensation company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: such other conditions as the Commission considers appropriate.

subsection.content: A transfer order may contain such incidental, supplemental and consequential provisions as may be necessary or expedient for the purpose of giving full effect to the order.

The Commission may at the request or with the consent of a designated investor compensation company resume a function transferred by a transfer order, but the resumption takes effect only by order of the Chief Executive in Council.

The Chief Executive in Council may order that the Commission resume a function transferred to a designated investor compensation company by a transfer order if the Commission so requests and if it appears to the Chief Executive in Council to be in the public interest to do so.

section.name: s81
section.heading: Immunity, etc.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting the generality of section 380(1), no civil liability, whether arising in contract, tort, defamation, equity or otherwise, shall be incurred by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a recognized investor compensation company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: any person acting on behalf of a recognized investor compensation company, including—

subparagraph.content: any member of any committee established by the company,

subsection.continued: in respect of anything done or omitted to be done in good faith in the discharge or purported discharge of the duties to which this subsection applies.

subsection.leadIn: The duties to which subsection (1) applies are those—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that relate to or arise out of a function that has been transferred to the recognized investor compensation company under section 80; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to which the company is subject under rules made under Part XII.

section.name: s82
section.heading: Rules by recognized investor compensation company
section.leadIn: Without limiting any of its other powers to make rules, a recognized investor compensation company may make rules for such matters as are necessary or desirable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the proper and efficient management and operation of the company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the obtaining of such insurance, surety, guarantee or other security or the making of such financial arrangement by the company as may be necessary or appropriate for the purposes of its operation;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for the proper and efficient performance of a function transferred to the company under section 80.

section.name: s83
section.heading: Approval of rules or amendments to rules of recognized investor compensation companies

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (7), no rule (whether or not made under section 82) of a recognized investor compensation company or any amendment thereto shall have effect unless it has the approval in writing of the Commission.

subsection.leadIn: A recognized investor compensation company shall submit or cause to be submitted to the Commission—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for its approval the rules and every amendment thereto that require approval under subsection (1), together with explanations of their purpose and likely effect, including their effect on the investing public, in sufficient detail to enable the Commission to decide whether to approve them or refuse to approve them; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for its information the rules which belong to a class the subject of a declaration under subsection (7) and every amendment to the rules, as soon as reasonably practicable after they have been made.

subsection.content: The Commission shall, not later than 6 weeks after the receipt of a submission under subsection (2)(a) from a recognized investor compensation company, by notice in writing served on the company, give its approval or refuse to give its approval (together with its reasons for the refusal) to the rules or amendment of the rules (as the case may be) or any part thereof, the subject of the submission.
The Commission may give its approval under subsection (3) subject to requirements which shall be satisfied before the rules or amendment of the rules or any part thereof take effect.
The Commission may in a particular case, with the agreement of the recognized investor compensation company concerned, extend the time prescribed in subsection (3).
The Financial Secretary may, after consultation with the Commission and the recognized investor compensation company concerned, extend the time prescribed in subsection (3).

The Commission may, by notice published in the Gazette, declare any class of rules of a recognized investor compensation company to be a class of rules which are not required to be approved under subsection (1) and, accordingly, any rules of the company which belong to that class (including any amendment thereto) shall have effect notwithstanding that they have not been so approved.
A recognized investor compensation company shall make its rules available to the public in a manner approved by the Commission.
Neither the rules under section 82 nor a notice under subsection (7) is subsidiary legislation.

section.name: s84
section.heading: Production of records, etc. by recognized investor compensation company

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may, by notice in writing served on a recognized investor compensation company, require the company to provide to the Commission, within such period as the Commission may specify in the notice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: such books and records kept by it in connection with or for the purposes of its business or in respect of the management and administration of the compensation fund under Part XII; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: such other information relating to its business or the management and administration of the compensation fund under Part XII,

subsection.continued: as the Commission may reasonably require for the performance of its functions.

subsection.content: A recognized investor compensation company served with a notice under subsection (1) which, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with the notice commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5.

section.name: s85
section.heading: Withdrawal of recognition of investor compensation company

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (3), (4) and (5), the Commission may, after consultation with the Financial Secretary, by notice in writing served on a recognized investor compensation company, withdraw the company’s recognition as an investor compensation company with effect from a date specified in the notice for the purpose.

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may by the notice served under subsection (1) permit the recognized investor compensation company to continue, on or after the date on which the withdrawal is to take effect, to carry on such activities affected by the withdrawal as the Commission may specify in the notice for the purpose of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: closing down the operations of the company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: protecting the interest of the investing public or the public interest.

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may only serve a notice under subsection (1) in relation to a recognized investor compensation company that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: fails to comply with any requirement of this Ordinance or with a condition imposed under section 79;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is being wound up;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: ceases to perform any function transferred to it under section 80; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: requests the Commission to do so.

subsection.content: Except where responding to a request under subsection (3)(d), the Commission shall not exercise its power under subsection (1) in relation to a recognized investor compensation company unless it has given the company a reasonable opportunity of being heard.

Except where responding to a request under subsection (3)(d), the Commission shall give the recognized investor compensation company not less than 14 days’ notice in writing of its intention to serve a notice under subsection (1) and the grounds for doing so.
Where the Commission withdraws a company’s recognition as an investor compensation company under subsection (1), it shall cause notice of that fact to be published in the Gazette.
A notice served under this section shall take effect immediately.

section.name: s86
section.heading: Appeals

subsection.content: A company served with a notice under section 85(1) may appeal against the notice to the Chief Executive in Council not later than 14 days after the date of service of the notice or such longer period (if any) as the Commission specifies in the notice.
The decision of the Chief Executive in Council on an appeal under subsection (1) shall be final.

section.name: s87
section.heading: Subrogation of recognized investor compensation company to rights, etc. of claimant on payment from compensation fund

subsection.leadIn: Where a recognized investor compensation company makes any payment out of the compensation fund in respect of any claim made under rules made under Part XII—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (1A), the company shall be subrogated, to the extent which that payment bears to the loss sustained (without taking into account any compensation paid or payable out of the compensation fund for the loss) by the claimant by reason of the default on which the claim was based, to all the rights and remedies of the claimant in relation to the loss; and (Amended 7 of 2004 s. 55)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the respective rights of the claimant and the company in bankruptcy or winding up or by legal proceedings or otherwise to receive in respect of the loss—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any sum out of the assets of the person concerned who is in default; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any property held on trust by that person for the claimant,

paragraph.continued: shall rank equally.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: The company is not subrogated to any rights and remedies of the claimant in respect of compensation from the Deposit Protection Scheme Fund established by section 14 of the Deposit Protection Scheme Ordinance (Cap. 581). (Added 7 of 2004 s. 55)

All assets (whether in cash or otherwise) recovered by the recognized investor compensation company under subsection (1) shall be dealt with in such manner as the Commission may direct and shall become part of the compensation fund.

section.name: s88
section.heading: Financial statements of a recognized investor compensation company

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), a recognized investor compensation company shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: prepare such financial statements and other documents, for such periods, as are prescribed by rules made under section 397 for the purposes of this section; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: submit the financial statements and other documents, together with an auditor’s report, to the Commission not later than 4 months after the end of the financial year to which they relate.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting the generality of subsection (1), the requirements under that subsection relating to the financial statements and other documents, and the auditor’s report, referred to in that subsection include the requirements that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the financial statements and other documents are to relate to such matters and contain such particulars as are prescribed by rules made under section 397 for the purposes of this section;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the auditor’s report is to contain such particulars, including such statement of opinion, as are prescribed by the rules;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the financial statements and other documents, and the auditor’s report, are to be prepared in accordance with such principles or bases as are prescribed by the rules; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: without limiting the generality of section 387 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622), the financial statements and other documents are to be signed by the chief executive officer of the recognized investor compensation company, by which they are prepared. (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

subsection.content: On an application in writing by the recognized investor compensation company by which any financial statements and other documents, and any auditor’s report, are required under subsection (1) to be submitted, the Commission may, where it is satisfied that there are special reasons for so doing, extend the period within which the financial statements and other documents, and the auditor’s report, are required to be submitted, for such period and subject to such conditions as the Commission considers appropriate, and upon the Commission granting the extension, subsection (1) shall apply subject to the extension accordingly.

A recognized investor compensation company shall cause a copy of each of the financial statements and other documents and the auditor’s report that are required under subsection (1) to be submitted by it to be sent to the Financial Secretary and to be published in the Gazette.
A reference in this section to financial statements shall not be construed as including a reference to financial statements of the compensation fund.

section.name: s89
section.heading: Employees of and delegations by a recognized investor compensation company

subsection.content: The Commission may arrange for any of its officers, employees, agents or consultants to assist in the operations of a recognized investor compensation company.

A recognized exchange company or recognized exchange controller may, with the consent of a recognized investor compensation company, arrange for any of its officers, employees, agents or consultants to assist in the operations of that recognized investor compensation company.

A recognized investor compensation company may by resolution and subject to the approval of the Commission, with or without restrictions or conditions as the company considers appropriate, delegate in writing to any person any of its powers and duties other than its power under section 82.

section.name: s90
section.heading: Further activities of recognized investor compensation company

subsection.content: A recognized investor compensation company may, in addition to performing a function transferred to it under section 80, conduct such activities or businesses as may be approved in writing by the Commission.

The Commission shall not approve the conduct of any activities or businesses referred to in subsection (1) unless it is satisfied that such activities or businesses are incidental to the management or administration of the compensation fund under Part XII.

division.name: D6
division.heading: General—Exchange companies, clearing houses, exchange controllers and investor compensation companies

section.name: s91
section.heading: Supply of information

subsection.leadIn: The Commission, a recognized exchange company, a recognized clearing house, a recognized exchange controller or a recognized investor compensation company shall be entitled to supply each other with information about its affairs and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a recognized exchange company, the affairs of any of its exchange participants;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a recognized clearing house, the affairs of any of its clearing participants;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of a recognized exchange controller, the affairs of any of its subsidiaries; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in the case of a recognized investor compensation company, any claim made against the compensation fund,

subsection.continued: if the supply of information is reasonably required for the performance of—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: in the case where the information is supplied to the Commission, the functions of the Commission under the relevant provisions; or

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: in any other cases, the functions of the recognized exchange company, recognized clearing house, recognized exchange controller or recognized investor compensation company to which the information is supplied, under this Part or their respective rules.

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may, by notice in writing served on a recognized exchange company, recognized clearing house, recognized exchange controller or recognized investor compensation company, require it to supply the Commission with such information as the Commission may reasonably require for the performance of the functions of the Commission under any of the relevant provisions, including information in its possession relating to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a recognized exchange company, the affairs of any of its exchange participants;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a recognized clearing house, the affairs of any of its clearing participants;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of a recognized exchange controller, the affairs of any of its subsidiaries; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in the case of a recognized investor compensation company, any claim made against the compensation fund.

subsection.content: The supply of information under subsection (1) or (2) shall not be treated as publication for the purposes of the law of defamation and, without limiting the generality of section 380(3) but subject to section 378, a person supplying the information does not incur liability as a consequence thereof.

Where any information is supplied under subsection (1) to a recognized exchange company, recognized clearing house, recognized exchange controller or recognized investor compensation company, the company concerned, the clearing house or the controller to whom the information is supplied shall not disclose the information, or any part of it, to any other person without the consent of the Commission.

section.name: s92
section.heading: Additional powers of Commission—restriction notices

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (2), (6) and (14), where the Commission is satisfied that it is appropriate to do so—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the interest of the investing public or in the public interest;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the protection of investors; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for the proper regulation of a recognized exchange company, recognized clearing house, recognized exchange controller or recognized investor compensation company,

subsection.continued: it may by notice in writing (restriction notice) served on the exchange company, clearing house, exchange controller or investor compensation company do any or all of the following—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.leadIn: require the exchange company, clearing house, exchange controller or investor compensation company before the expiry of a period specified in the notice—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: to amend, supplement, withdraw or revoke, in the manner specified in the notice, a provision of its rules or other instrument so specified;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: to take such action relating to the management, conduct or operation of its business as may be so specified;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: prohibit the exchange company, clearing house, exchange controller or investor compensation company from doing, during a period so specified, such act or other thing relating to the management, conduct or operation of its business as may be so specified.

subsection.leadIn: The Commission shall not serve a restriction notice unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it has previously consulted the Financial Secretary in relation to the notice;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it has previously requested in writing the exchange company, clearing house, exchange controller or investor compensation company concerned to put, or cause to be put, into effect a provision (which includes a request to refrain from doing any act or other thing) specified in the request and similar in effect to the requirement or prohibition specified in the restriction notice or, where there is more than one such requirement or prohibition so specified, provisions the combined effect of all of which is similar to the combined effect of the requirements or prohibitions so specified; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a request under paragraph (b) which—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: contains a provision requesting the exchange company, clearing house, exchange controller or investor compensation company concerned to amend, supplement, withdraw or revoke any provision of its constitution under subsection (1)(i), the provision has not been complied with before the expiration of the period specified in relation thereto in the request being not less than 45 days; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: contains a provision requesting the exchange company, clearing house, exchange controller or investor compensation company concerned to do or refrain from doing any act or other thing, the Commission is satisfied that the provision has not been complied with.

subsection.content: A recognized exchange company, recognized clearing house, recognized exchange controller or recognized investor compensation company may appeal to the Chief Executive in Council against a restriction notice that requires the exchange company, clearing house, exchange controller or investor compensation company to amend, supplement, withdraw or revoke any provision of its constitution.
The decision of the Chief Executive in Council on an appeal under subsection (3) shall be final.
A restriction notice served under this section shall take effect immediately.
A period specified in a restriction notice in relation to a prohibition under subsection (1)(ii) shall not exceed 6 months beginning on the date of the notice.

The Commission may, after consultation with the Financial Secretary, by notice in writing served on the exchange company, clearing house, exchange controller or investor compensation company concerned, extend, for a period or successive periods of not more than 3 months each, the period during which a restriction notice is to remain in force.
Where a restriction notice is issued or extended under this section, the Commission may publish in the Gazette a copy of the notice or, as may be appropriate, particulars of the extension.
A restriction notice may, on the application of the Commission to the Court of First Instance, be enforced by an order of the Court as if it were a judgment or order of the Court.

subsection.leadIn: Where a recognized exchange company, recognized clearing house, recognized exchange controller or recognized investor compensation company is in breach of a requirement in a restriction notice under subsection (1)(i)(A) relating to a provision of its rules or other instrument—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a requirement to amend or supplement such provision, the provision shall be deemed to have effect as if the requirement had been complied with; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a requirement to withdraw or revoke such provision, the provision ceases to have effect.

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a restriction notice includes a requirement described in subsection (1)(i)(A) and the requirement relates to the constitution of a company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by virtue of subsection (10) the provision to which the requirement relates has effect as if the requirement had been complied with or has ceased to have effect (as the case may be),

subsection.continued: the Commission shall, as soon as may be, deliver to the Registrar of Companies a copy of the notice.

subsection.content: If there is an appeal under subsection (3) against the notice and the appeal is not withdrawn, the Commission shall, as soon as may be, inform the Registrar of Companies in writing of the outcome of the appeal.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting the generality of section 380(1), no civil liability, whether arising in contract, tort, defamation, equity or otherwise, shall be incurred by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a recognized exchange company, recognized clearing house, recognized exchange controller or recognized investor compensation company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an officer or employee of a recognized exchange company, recognized clearing house, recognized exchange controller or recognized investor compensation company;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an exchange participant; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a clearing participant,

subsection.continued: in respect of anything done or omitted to be done in good faith in compliance or purported compliance with a restriction notice.

subsection.content: This section shall not be construed as enabling the Commission to do under this section anything which may be done by the Commission by direction under section 28(1)(b) or 29.

section.name: s93
section.heading: Additional powers of Commission—suspension orders

subsection.leadIn: Where the Commission is satisfied that it is appropriate to do so—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the interest of the investing public or in the public interest;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the protection of investors; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for the proper regulation of a recognized exchange company, recognized clearing house, recognized exchange controller or recognized investor compensation company,

subsection.continued: it may, after consultation with the Financial Secretary, make an order (suspension order) relating to all or any of the following—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the functions of the board of directors or governing body of the exchange company, clearing house, exchange controller or investor compensation company;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: the functions of a director of a board or a member of a body referred to in paragraph (i);

paragraph.name: iii
paragraph.content: the functions of a committee, including a sub-committee, established by a board or body referred to in paragraph (i);

paragraph.name: iv
paragraph.content: the functions of the chief executive officer (by whatever name called) of the exchange company, clearing house, exchange controller or investor compensation company.

subsection.leadIn: While a suspension order is in force the following provisions apply—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: neither the recognized exchange company, recognized clearing house, recognized exchange controller or recognized investor compensation company to which the order relates nor any board, governing body, committee or officer of it shall perform a function to which the order relates;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a function to which paragraph (a) applies may be performed by the person specified in the order in relation to that function;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a person referred to in paragraph (a) shall not, by act or omission, either directly or indirectly, affect the manner in which a function referred to in that paragraph is performed.

subsection.content: A recognized exchange company, recognized clearing house, recognized exchange controller or recognized investor compensation company may appeal to the Chief Executive in Council against a suspension order made in respect of the exchange company, clearing house, exchange controller or investor compensation company.
The decision of the Chief Executive in Council on an appeal under subsection (3) shall be final.
Subject to subsection (9), a suspension order shall continue in force for the period not exceeding 6 months specified in the order.

A suspension order or an extension of it under subsection (9) shall take effect when a copy of the order or notice of the extension is served under subsection (10)(a) on the exchange company, clearing house, exchange controller or investor compensation company to which the order relates.

Where a suspension order is made or extended under this section, the Commission shall, as soon as reasonably practicable to do so, give a copy of a suspension order or, as may be appropriate, notice of its extension to the chief executive officer of the exchange company, clearing house, exchange controller or investor compensation company to which the order relates and to the directors or members of its committee (if any) as the Commission considers appropriate in the circumstances.
Nothing in subsection (7) affects subsection (6).

The Commission may, after consultation with the Financial Secretary, extend for a period or successive periods of not more than 3 months each the period during which a suspension order is to remain in force.

subsection.leadIn: Where a suspension order is made or extended under this section, the Commission shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: forthwith serve a copy of the order or notice in writing of the extension on the exchange company, clearing house, exchange controller or investor compensation company to which the order relates; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: publish in the Gazette and publish through at least one other medium a copy of the suspension order or, as may be appropriate, notice of its extension.

subsection.content: A suspension order may, on the application of the Commission to the Court of First Instance, be enforced by an order of the Court as if it were a judgment or order of the Court.

The exchange company, clearing house, exchange controller or investor compensation company concerned shall pay to the Commission on demand costs and expenses reasonably incurred by the Commission or a member or employee of the Commission in connection with a suspension order.
The amount of the costs and expenses demanded under subsection (12) are recoverable by the Commission as a civil debt.

subsection.leadIn: A person who knowingly contravenes subsection (2)(c) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s94
section.heading: Application of Companies Ordinance and Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance
section.content: Where there is any inconsistency between this Part and the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622) or the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32) in its application to a recognized exchange company, a recognized clearing house, a recognized exchange controller or a recognized investor compensation company, this Part prevails.

section.name: s95
section.heading: Authorization for providing automated trading services

subsection.leadIn: No person shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: provide automated trading services; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: offer to provide automated trading services,

subsection.continued: unless that person—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: is authorized under subsection (2);

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: is an employee or agent of a person authorized under subsection (2), and is acting in that capacity for or on behalf of that person;

paragraph.name: iii
paragraph.content: is an intermediary licensed or registered for Type 7 regulated activity;

paragraph.name: iv
paragraph.content: is a licensed representative for Type 7 regulated activity, and is acting in that capacity for the licensed corporation to which the representative is accredited; or

paragraph.name: v
paragraph.content: is an individual whose name is entered in the register maintained by the Monetary Authority under section 20 of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155) as that of a person engaged in respect of Type 7 regulated activity by a registered institution registered for that regulated activity, and is acting in that capacity for the registered institution.

subsection.leadIn: Where the Commission is satisfied that it is appropriate to do so, the Commission may upon application by a person, by notice in writing served on that person, authorize that person to provide automated trading services—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to such conditions as it considers appropriate specified in the notice; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: with effect from a date specified in the notice for the purpose.

subsection.content: Where a person is granted an authorization under subsection (2), the Commission shall cause notice of that fact to be published in the Gazette.

Where a person is seeking an authorization to provide automated trading services and the Commission is minded not to grant the authorization under subsection (2), the Commission shall give the person a reasonable opportunity of being heard before making a decision not to grant the authorization.

Where the Commission refuses to authorize a person to provide automated trading services under subsection (2), the Commission shall, by notice in writing served on the person, inform the person of the refusal and of the reasons for it.

The Commission shall prepare and publish in the Gazette or otherwise guidelines setting out the principles, procedures and standards in relation to authorization for providing automated trading services under this section.
Guidelines published under subsection (6) are not subsidiary legislation.

Subject to subsection (9), for the purposes of subsection (1)(b), a person offers to provide automated trading services only if the services are actively marketed, whether in Hong Kong or elsewhere, to persons in Hong Kong by the first-mentioned person or by another person on his behalf.

For the purposes of subsection (1)(b), a person shall not be regarded as offering to provide automated trading services if the persons to whom the offer is made are persons to whom the first-mentioned person or a related corporation thereof, at any time during the period of 3 years immediately preceding the day on which the offer is made, has provided or has agreed to provide any financial services, including automated trading services.

section.name: s96
section.heading: Application for authorization

subsection.leadIn: An application under section 95(2) shall be accompanied by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: such information and particulars as the Commission may reasonably require; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an application fee prescribed by rules made under section 395 for the purposes of this section.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting the generality of subsection (1)(a), an application under section 95(2) shall also be accompanied by such information as may reasonably be required by the Commission regarding—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the services and facilities which the applicant will hold itself out as being able to provide if the application is allowed;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the business which the applicant proposes to carry on and to which the application relates, and any person whom the applicant proposes to employ or with whom the applicant intends to be associated in the course of carrying on the business;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the business which the applicant is carrying on, the officers it employs and the persons with whom the applicant is associated in the course of carrying on the business; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: its directors and substantial shareholders and, if any of its substantial shareholders is a corporation, the directors and substantial shareholders of that corporation.

subsection.content: In considering an application under section 95(2), the Commission may have regard to any information in its possession whether provided by the applicant or not.

section.name: s97
section.heading: Conditions for authorization

subsection.content: Without limiting the generality of conditions which may be specified in a notice under section 95(2), the Commission may, by notice in writing served on a person authorized under that section, amend or revoke any conditions specified under that section or impose new conditions, where the Commission is satisfied that it is appropriate to do so.

Where the Commission amends or revokes any condition or imposes any new condition under subsection (1), the amendment, revocation or imposition takes effect at the time of service of the notice or at the time specified in the notice, whichever is the later.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting the generality of subsection (1) or section 95(2), a notice served thereunder may contain a condition that the person authorized to provide automated trading services shall comply with all or any of the following requirements, that is to say, the person shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: provide the services according to rules approved by the Commission for the purpose;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: ensure as far as is reasonably practicable that there is an orderly, informed and fair market in relation to all transactions which are carried out by means of or through the services;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: ensure that the securities or futures contract, the sale or purchase of which is to be negotiated or concluded by means of or through the services, belongs to a class of securities or futures contracts specified in the notice by the Commission for this purpose;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: ensure that the transaction that is to be novated, cleared, settled or guaranteed by means of or through the services belongs to a class of transactions specified in the notice by the Commission for this purpose;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: disclose to the Commission within the time and in the manner specified in the notice, such information as the Commission may request for the purpose of performing its functions under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: permit any person authorized in that behalf by the Commission to enter at any reasonable time the premises on which the services are provided and to inspect the electronic facilities by means of which the services are provided;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: provide and maintain automated systems with adequate capacity, facilities to meet contingencies or emergencies, security arrangements and technical support for the provision of the services;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: notify the Commission of any changes to the information and particulars required by the Commission under section 96(1) or (2);

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: pay to the Commission a fee prescribed by rules made under section 395 for the purposes of this section.

section.name: s98
section.heading: Withdrawal of authorization

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (4), where the Commission is satisfied that it is appropriate to do so in the interest of the investing public or in the public interest, it may, by notice in writing served on a person who has been granted an authorization under section 95(2), stating the reasons in support of the ground or grounds for the notice, withdraw the authorization with effect from a date specified in the notice for the purpose.

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may by the notice served under subsection (1) permit the person to continue, on or after the date on which the withdrawal is to take effect, to carry on such activities affected by the withdrawal as the Commission may specify in the notice for the purpose of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: ceasing to provide the automated trading services to which the withdrawal relates; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: protecting the interest of the investing public or the public interest.

subsection.content: Where the Commission has granted a permission to a person under subsection (2), the person shall not, by reason of its carrying on the activities in accordance with the permission, be regarded as having contravened section 95.

The Commission shall not exercise its power under subsection (1) in relation to a person who has been granted an authorization under section 95(2) unless it has given the person a reasonable opportunity of being heard.
Where the Commission withdraws an authorization under subsection (1), it shall cause notice of that fact to be published in the Gazette.
A notice served under this section shall take effect immediately.

section.name: s99
section.heading: Commission to maintain register of authorized automated trading services

subsection.content: The Commission shall maintain a register of authorized automated trading services in such form as it considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: The register maintained under subsection (1) shall contain in relation to each person who has been granted an authorization under section 95(2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name and business address of the person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: such conditions of the authorization as the Commission considers appropriate; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: such other particulars as are prescribed by rules made under section 397 for the purposes of this subsection.

subsection.leadIn: The register may be maintained—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in a documentary form; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by recording the information required under subsection (2) otherwise than in a legible form, so long as the information is capable of being reproduced in a legible form.

subsection.content: For the purposes of enabling any member of the public to ascertain whether he is dealing with a person who has been granted an authorization under section 95(2) in matters of or connected with any automated trading services and to ascertain the particulars of the authorization of such person, the register shall be made available for public inspection at all reasonable times.

subsection.leadIn: At all reasonable times, a member of the public may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: inspect the register, or (where the register is maintained otherwise than in a documentary form) a reproduction of the information or the relevant part of it in a legible form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: obtain a copy of an entry in or extract of the register on payment of a fee prescribed by rules made under section 395.

subsection.leadIn: A document purporting to be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a copy of an entry in or extract of the register maintained under this section; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: certified by an authorized officer of the Commission as a true copy of the entry or extract referred to in paragraph (a),

subsection.continued: shall be admissible as evidence of its contents in any legal proceedings.

subsection.content: Without derogating from the other provisions of this section, the Commission shall, in addition, cause the register to be available to the public in the form of an on-line record.

section.name: s100
section.heading: Rules by Commission

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to section 398(7) and (8), the Commission may make rules to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: require a person authorized to provide automated trading services to supply the Commission with such information as the Commission requires to satisfy the Commission that the conditions specified in a notice served on the person under section 95(2) or 97 are complied with;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provide for the time within which and the manner in which the information under paragraph (a) shall be provided;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: provide for the regulation of automated trading services and any other matters incidental thereto.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting the generality of rules which may be made under subsection (1), such rules may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: provide for the standards of conduct and practices to be complied with in relation to the provision of automated trading services;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: prohibit the use of misleading or deceptive advertisements in relation to the provision of automated trading services or impose conditions for the use of advertisements in relation to the provision of such services;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: require a person authorized to provide automated trading services—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to take steps to avoid conflicts of interests, and specify the steps that shall be taken in the event that there is a potential or actual conflict of interest; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: to take such steps as the Commission may specify to ensure that there is integrity, orderliness, transparency and fairness in transactions conducted through the services, including steps to ensure that—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: a request for the services is to be dealt with properly and as expeditiously as is appropriate in the circumstances; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: access rights to the services and the relevant trading conventions relating to the transactions to be conducted through the services are properly explained to the persons to whom the services are provided;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: provide for measures designed to discourage and identify any money laundering activities.

subsection.leadIn: Rules made under this section may provide that a person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes any specified provision of the rules that apply to the person commits an offence and is liable to a specified penalty not exceeding—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment a fine at level 6 and a term of imprisonment of 2 years;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction a fine at level 3 and a term of imprisonment of 6 months.

section.name: s101
section.heading: Providing automated trading services without authorization
section.leadIn: A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes section 95(1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $5,000,000 and to imprisonment for 7 years and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $100,000 for every day during which the offence continues; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s101A
section.heading: Interpretation of Part IIIA
section.leadIn: In this Part—
section.def: authorized financial institution incorporated in Hong Kong (在香港成立為法團的認可財務機構) means an authorized institution incorporated in Hong Kong as defined by section 2(1) of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155); (Added 14 of 2025 s. 241)

def.name: ClearingObligation
def.leadIn: clearing obligation (結算責任)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a prescribed person that is an authorized financial institution incorporated in Hong Kong, means—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an obligation imposed by section 101C(1); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an obligation imposed by section 101C(3); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to any other prescribed person, means an obligation imposed by section 101C(1);

def.name: Deregistration
def.leadIn: #deregistration (撤銷登記), in relation to a specific class, means the removal of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a name under section 101V(1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an entry under section 101V(2);

section.def: designated CCP (指定中央對手方), in relation to a class or description of specified OTC derivative transactions, means a person designated as a central counterparty under section 101J for that class or description;

#designated trading platform (指定交易平台), in relation to a class or description of specified OTC derivative transactions, means a person designated as a trading platform under section 101K for that class or description;

def.name: NotificationLevel
def.leadIn: #notification level (具報水平), in relation to a specific class, means the threshold prescribed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for that specific class; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by rules made under section 101Z(a)(i);

section.def: prescribed fee (訂明費用) means a fee prescribed by rules made under section 395;

def.name: PrescribedManner
def.leadIn: prescribed manner (訂明方式)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to an application for designation as a central counterparty, means in the manner prescribed by rules made under section 101Q(a)(i); and

paragraph.name: b

def.name: PrescribedPerson
def.leadIn: prescribed person (訂明人士)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to the reporting obligation, means—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an authorized financial institution;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an approved money broker;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a licensed corporation; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: a person of a class or description specified in the reporting rules as being subject to the reporting obligation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to the clearing obligation, means—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an authorized financial institution;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an approved money broker;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a licensed corporation; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: a person of a class or description specified in the clearing rules as being subject to the clearing obligation;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to the trading obligation, means—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an authorized financial institution;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an approved money broker;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a licensed corporation; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: a person of a class or description specified in the trading rules as being subject to the trading obligation; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to the record keeping obligation, means—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an authorized financial institution;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an approved money broker;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a licensed corporation; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: a person of a class or description specified in the record keeping rules as being subject to the record keeping obligation;

def.name: RecordKeepingObligation
def.leadIn: record keeping obligation (備存紀錄責任)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a prescribed person that is an authorized financial institution incorporated in Hong Kong, means—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an obligation imposed by section 101E(1); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an obligation imposed by section 101E(3); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to any other prescribed person, means an obligation imposed by section 101E(1);

section.def: record keeping rules (《備存紀錄規則》) means rules made under section 101P;

def.name: ReportingObligation
def.leadIn: reporting obligation (匯報責任)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a prescribed person that is an authorized financial institution incorporated in Hong Kong, means—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an obligation imposed by section 101B(1); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an obligation imposed by section 101B(3); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to any other prescribed person, means an obligation imposed by section 101B(1);

section.def: reporting rules (《匯報規則》) means rules made under section 101L;

def.name: SpecifiedOTCDerivativeTransaction
def.leadIn: specified OTC derivative transaction (指明場外衍生工具交易)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to the reporting obligation, means a transaction specified in the reporting rules for the purposes of that obligation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to the clearing obligation, means a transaction specified in the clearing rules for the purposes of that obligation;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to the trading obligation, means a transaction specified in the trading rules for the purposes of that obligation; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in relation to the record keeping obligation, means a transaction specified in the record keeping rules for the purposes of that obligation;

def.name: SystemicallyImportantParticipant
def.leadIn: #systemically important participant (系統重要參與者) means a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to whom section 101R(1) applies; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whose position in respect of a specific class has reached the notification level;

def.name: TradingObligation
def.leadIn: #trading obligation (交易責任)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a prescribed person that is an authorized financial institution incorporated in Hong Kong, means—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an obligation imposed by section 101D(1); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an obligation imposed by section 101D(3); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to any other prescribed person, means an obligation imposed by section 101D(1);

def.name: UnderlyingSubjectMatter
def.leadIn: underlying subject matter (標的項目)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a transaction in an OTC derivative product that falls within subsection (1)(a)(i) of section 1A of Part 1 of Schedule 1, means any type or combination of types of securities, commodity, index, property, interest rate, currency exchange rate or futures contract;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a transaction in an OTC derivative product that falls within subsection (1)(a)(ii) of section 1A of Part 1 of Schedule 1, means any basket of more than one type, or any combination of types, of securities, commodity, index, property, interest rate, currency exchange rate or futures contract; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to a transaction in an OTC derivative product that falls within subsection (1)(a)(iii) of section 1A of Part 1 of Schedule 1, means any specified event or events (excluding an event or events relating only to the issuer or guarantor of the instrument or to both the issuer and the guarantor).

division.name: D2
division.heading: Reporting, Clearing, Trading and Record Keeping Obligations

section.name: s101B
section.heading: Reporting obligation

subsection.leadIn: A prescribed person must report an OTC derivative transaction to which subsection (2) applies—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to the Monetary Authority; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in accordance with the reporting rules.

subsection.leadIn: This subsection applies to an OTC derivative transaction that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: is specified in the reporting rules—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in relation to the prescribed person; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: as a transaction that is required to be reported to the Monetary Authority;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: falls within the circumstances and the criteria specified in those rules—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in relation to the prescribed person; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: for the application of the requirement to report referred to in paragraph (a)(ii); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: does not fall within the circumstances specified in those rules—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in relation to the prescribed person; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: as circumstances in which the requirement to report is taken to have been complied with.

subsection.content: In addition, a prescribed person that is an authorized financial institution incorporated in Hong Kong must ensure that a subsidiary of that institution specified under subsection (5) complies in relation to an OTC derivative transaction with the requirement set out in subsection (4).

subsection.leadIn: The requirement is that the subsidiary reports to the Monetary Authority, in accordance with the reporting rules, an OTC derivative transaction—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to which the subsidiary is a counterparty; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that is specified in those rules as a transaction to which subsection (3) applies.

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may, by a written notice given to an authorized financial institution incorporated in Hong Kong, specify for the purposes of subsection (3)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a particular subsidiary;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: more than one subsidiary; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: subsidiaries generally.

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority may specify under subsection (5) a subsidiary incorporated outside Hong Kong or a subsidiary incorporated in Hong Kong.

Subject to an express agreement to the contrary by the parties to the transaction, a contravention of the reporting obligation in relation to an OTC derivative transaction does not of itself invalidate the transaction or affect any rights or obligations arising under, or relating to, the transaction.

section.name: s101C
section.heading: Clearing obligation

subsection.leadIn: A prescribed person must clear an OTC derivative transaction to which subsection (2) applies—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: with a designated CCP; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in accordance with the clearing rules.

subsection.leadIn: This subsection applies to an OTC derivative transaction that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: is specified in the clearing rules—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in relation to the prescribed person; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: as a transaction that is required to be cleared with a designated CCP;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: falls within the circumstances and the criteria specified in those rules—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in relation to the prescribed person; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: for the application of the requirement to clear referred to in paragraph (a)(ii); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: does not fall within the circumstances specified in those rules—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in relation to the prescribed person; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: as circumstances in which the requirement to clear is taken to have been complied with.

subsection.content: In addition, a prescribed person that is an authorized financial institution incorporated in Hong Kong must ensure that a subsidiary of that institution specified under subsection (5) complies in relation to an OTC derivative transaction with the requirement set out in subsection (4).

subsection.leadIn: The requirement is that the subsidiary clears with a designated CCP, in accordance with the clearing rules, an OTC derivative transaction—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to which the subsidiary is a counterparty; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that is specified in those rules as a transaction to which subsection (3) applies.

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may, by a written notice given to an authorized financial institution incorporated in Hong Kong, specify for the purposes of subsection (3)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a particular subsidiary;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: more than one subsidiary; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: subsidiaries generally.

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority may specify under subsection (5) a subsidiary incorporated outside Hong Kong or a subsidiary incorporated in Hong Kong.

Subject to an express agreement to the contrary by the parties to the transaction, a contravention of the clearing obligation in relation to an OTC derivative transaction does not of itself invalidate the transaction or affect any rights or obligations arising under, or relating to, the transaction.

section.name: s101D
section.heading: Trading obligation

subsection.leadIn: A prescribed person must execute an OTC derivative transaction to which subsection (2) applies—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: only on a designated trading platform; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in accordance with the trading rules.

subsection.leadIn: This subsection applies to an OTC derivative transaction that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: is specified in the trading rules—

subparagraph.content: in relation to the prescribed person; and
as a transaction that is required to be executed only on a designated trading platform;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: falls within the circumstances and the criteria specified in those rules—

subparagraph.content: in relation to the prescribed person; and
for the application of the requirement to execute as described in paragraph (a)(ii); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: does not fall within the circumstances specified in those rules—

subparagraph.content: in relation to the prescribed person; and
as circumstances in which the requirement to execute as described in subsection (1) is taken to have been complied with.

subsection.content: In addition, a prescribed person that is an authorized financial institution incorporated in Hong Kong must ensure that a subsidiary of that institution specified under subsection (5) complies in relation to an OTC derivative transaction with the requirement set out in subsection (4).

subsection.leadIn: The requirement is that the subsidiary executes only on a designated trading platform and in accordance with the trading rules an OTC derivative transaction—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to which the subsidiary is a counterparty; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that is specified in those rules as a transaction to which subsection (3) applies.

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may, by a written notice given to an authorized financial institution incorporated in Hong Kong, specify for the purposes of subsection (3)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a particular subsidiary;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: more than one subsidiary; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: subsidiaries generally.

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority may specify under subsection (5) a subsidiary incorporated outside Hong Kong or a subsidiary incorporated in Hong Kong.

Subject to an express agreement to the contrary by the parties to the transaction, a contravention of the trading obligation in relation to an OTC derivative transaction does not of itself invalidate the transaction or affect any rights or obligations arising under, or relating to, the transaction.

section.name: s101E
section.heading: Record keeping obligation

subsection.content: A prescribed person must keep, in accordance with the record keeping rules, records relating to an OTC derivative transaction to which subsection (2) applies.

subsection.leadIn: This subsection applies to an OTC derivative transaction that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: is specified in the record keeping rules—

subparagraph.content: in relation to the prescribed person; and
as a transaction the records of which are required to be kept;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: falls within the circumstances and the criteria specified in those rules—

subparagraph.content: in relation to the prescribed person; and
for the application of the requirement to keep record referred to in paragraph (a)(ii); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: does not fall within the circumstances specified in those rules—

subparagraph.content: in relation to the prescribed person; and
as circumstances in which the requirement to keep record is taken to have been complied with.

subsection.content: In addition, a prescribed person that is an authorized financial institution incorporated in Hong Kong must ensure that a subsidiary of that institution specified under subsection (5) complies in relation to an OTC derivative transaction with the requirement set out in subsection (4).

subsection.leadIn: The requirement is that the subsidiary keeps, in accordance with the record keeping rules, records relating to an OTC derivative transaction—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to which the subsidiary is a counterparty; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that is specified in those rules as a transaction to which subsection (3) applies.

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may, by a written notice given to an authorized financial institution incorporated in Hong Kong, specify for the purposes of subsection (3)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a particular subsidiary;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: more than one subsidiary; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: subsidiaries generally.

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority may specify under subsection (5) a subsidiary incorporated outside Hong Kong or a subsidiary incorporated in Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: A person specified in subsection (9)(a) must, when requested by the Commission—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: give the Commission access to the records kept under this section; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: produce the records to the Commission within the time and at the place specified by the Commission.

subsection.leadIn: A person specified in subsection (9)(b) must, when requested by the Monetary Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: give the Monetary Authority access to the records kept under this section; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: produce the records to the Monetary Authority within the time and at the place specified by the Monetary Authority.

subsection.leadIn: The person specified—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: for the purposes of subsection (7) is—

subparagraph.content: a prescribed person that is a licensed corporation; or
a prescribed person that is a person of a class or description specified in the record keeping rules as being subject to the record keeping obligation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for the purposes of subsection (8) is—

subparagraph.content: a prescribed person that is an authorized financial institution; or
a prescribed person that is an approved money broker.

subsection.content: Subject to an express agreement to the contrary by the parties to the transaction, a contravention of the record keeping obligation in relation to an OTC derivative transaction does not of itself invalidate the transaction or affect any rights or obligations arising under, or relating to, the transaction.

section.name: s101F
section.heading: Application by Commission to Court of First Instance for contravention of obligations

subsection.content: If a prescribed person that is not an authorized financial institution or an approved money broker contravenes the reporting obligation, clearing obligation, trading obligation or record keeping obligation, the Commission may apply to the Court of First Instance in respect of the contravention.
The application must be made by originating summons that is in Form No. 10 in Appendix A to the Rules of the High Court (Cap. 4 sub. leg. A).

The Court of First Instance may inquire into the case and, if satisfied that there is no reasonable excuse for the contravention, impose a financial penalty not exceeding $5,000,000 on the prescribed person.

editorialNote.text: # The new section 101F added by the Securities and Futures (Amendment) Ordinance 2014 (6 of 2014) came into operation on—

paragraph.content: (a)10 July 2015, in so far as it relates to the contravention of the reporting obligation and the record keeping obligation; please see paragraph (c)(iii) of the Securities and Futures (Amendment) Ordinance 2014 (Commencement) Notice 2015 (L.N. 95 of 2015); and

(b)1 September 2016, in so far as it relates to the contravention of the clearing obligation; please see paragraph (a)(iii) of the Securities and Futures (Amendment) Ordinance 2014 (Commencement) Notice 2016 (L.N. 27 of 2016).

section.name: s101G
section.heading: Application by Monetary Authority to Court of First Instance for contravention of obligations

subsection.content: If a prescribed person that is an authorized financial institution or an approved money broker contravenes the reporting obligation, clearing obligation, trading obligation or record keeping obligation, the Monetary Authority may apply to the Court of First Instance in respect of the contravention.
The application must be made by originating summons that is in Form No. 10 in Appendix A to the Rules of the High Court (Cap. 4 sub. leg. A).

The Court of First Instance may inquire into the case and, if satisfied that there is no reasonable excuse for the contravention, impose a financial penalty not exceeding $5,000,000 on the prescribed person.

editorialNote.text: # The new section 101G added by the Securities and Futures (Amendment) Ordinance 2014 (6 of 2014) came into operation on—

paragraph.content: (a)10 July 2015, in so far as it relates to the contravention of the reporting obligation and the record keeping obligation; please see paragraph (c)(iv) of the Securities and Futures (Amendment) Ordinance 2014 (Commencement) Notice 2015 (L.N. 95 of 2015); and

(b)1 September 2016, in so far as it relates to the contravention of the clearing obligation; please see paragraph (a)(iv) of the Securities and Futures (Amendment) Ordinance 2014 (Commencement) Notice 2016 (L.N. 27 of 2016).

section.name: s101H
section.heading: Exemptions from obligations

subsection.leadIn: On application by a prescribed person and on payment of the prescribed fee, the Commission may, with the consent of the Monetary Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: exempt the person from one or more of the following—

subparagraph.content: the reporting obligation;
the clearing obligation;
the trading obligation;
the record keeping obligation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on granting the exemption, impose conditions.

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may, with the consent of the Monetary Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: suspend or withdraw an exemption on—

subparagraph.content: the ground that a condition has not been complied with; or
any other ground that the Commission considers appropriate; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: amend any condition.

subsection.content: The Commission must publish on the Internet particulars that it considers appropriate of an exemption granted, suspended or withdrawn under this section.

editorialNote.text: # The new section 101H added by the Securities and Futures (Amendment) Ordinance 2014 (6 of 2014) came into operation on—

paragraph.content: (a)10 July 2015, in so far as it relates to the exemptions from the reporting obligation and the record keeping obligation; please see paragraph (c)(v) of the Securities and Futures (Amendment) Ordinance 2014 (Commencement) Notice 2015 (L.N. 95 of 2015); and

(b)1 September 2016, in so far as it relates to the exemption from the clearing obligation; please see paragraph (a)(v) of the Securities and Futures (Amendment) Ordinance 2014 (Commencement) Notice 2016 (L.N. 27 of 2016).

section.name: s101I
section.heading: Guidelines on exemptions

subsection.content: The Commission may, with the consent of the Monetary Authority and after consultation with the Financial Secretary, publish guidelines for granting exemptions from the reporting obligation, clearing obligation, trading obligation or record keeping obligation.

subsection.leadIn: The Commission—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may exercise its powers under section 101H only after guidelines have been published; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must have regard to the published guidelines when exercising its powers under section 101H.

subsection.content: Guidelines published under subsection (1) are not subsidiary legislation.

editorialNote.text: # The new section 101I added by the Securities and Futures (Amendment) Ordinance 2014 (6 of 2014) came into operation on—

paragraph.content: (a)10 July 2015, in so far as it relates to the guidelines on the exemptions from the reporting obligation and the record keeping obligation; please see paragraph (c)(vi) of the Securities and Futures (Amendment) Ordinance 2014 (Commencement) Notice 2015 (L.N. 95 of 2015); and

(b)1 September 2016, in so far as it relates to the guidelines on exemption from the clearing obligation; please see paragraph (a)(vi) of the Securities and Futures (Amendment) Ordinance 2014 (Commencement) Notice 2016 (L.N. 27 of 2016).

division.name: D3
division.heading: Designation of Central Counterparties and Trading Platforms

section.name: s101J
section.heading: Designation of central counterparties

subsection.leadIn: On application by a person in the prescribed manner and on payment of the prescribed fee, the Commission may, with the consent of the Monetary Authority and after consultation with the Financial Secretary—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: designate the person, in accordance with the designation rules and by a written notice served on the person, as a central counterparty for the purposes of this Part; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: refuse, in accordance with the designation rules, to designate the person.

subsection.leadIn: A person may be designated only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: at the time of designation, the person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is a recognized clearing house; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is a person authorized under section 95(2) to provide automated trading services; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the requirements prescribed by the designation rules have been met.

subsection.leadIn: A designation may be for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: OTC derivative transactions generally; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a class or description of OTC derivative transactions specified in the designation.

subsection.content: A person outside Hong Kong or in Hong Kong may be designated under this section.

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may, with the consent of the Monetary Authority and after consultation with the Financial Secretary, in accordance with the designation rules and by a written notice served on a person, do the following with regard to a designation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: impose conditions;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: amend or revoke a condition;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: impose additional conditions;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: revoke the designation.

subsection.content: Before exercising a power under subsection (1)(b) or (5)(d), the Commission must give the person concerned a reasonable opportunity of being heard.

If the Commission amends or revokes a condition or imposes an additional condition under subsection (5)(b) or (c), the amendment, revocation or imposition takes effect at the time of the service of the notice or at the time specified in the notice, whichever is the later.
If the Commission revokes a designation under subsection (5)(d), the revocation takes effect at the time of the service of the notice or at the time specified in the notice, whichever is the later.
