If, under this section, a person is designated or a designation is revoked, the Commission must publish notice of that fact in the Gazette.
A notice published under subsection (9) is not subsidiary legislation.

section.name: s101K
section.heading: Designation of trading platforms

subsection.leadIn: On application by a person in the prescribed manner and on payment of the prescribed fee, the Commission may, with the consent of the Monetary Authority and after consultation with the Financial Secretary—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: designate the person, in accordance with the designation rules and by a written notice served on the person, as a trading platform for the purposes of this Part; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: refuse, in accordance with the designation rules, to designate the person.

subsection.leadIn: A person may be designated only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: at the time of designation, the person—

subparagraph.content: is a recognized exchange company; or
is a person authorized under section 95(2) to provide automated trading services; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the requirements prescribed by the designation rules have been met.

subsection.leadIn: A designation may be for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: OTC derivative transactions generally; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a class or description of OTC derivative transactions specified in the designation.

subsection.content: A person outside Hong Kong or in Hong Kong may be designated under this section.

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may, with the consent of the Monetary Authority and after consultation with the Financial Secretary, in accordance with the designation rules and by a written notice served on a person, do the following with regard to a designation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: impose conditions;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: amend or revoke a condition;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: impose additional conditions;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: revoke the designation.

subsection.content: Before exercising a power under subsection (1)(b) or (5)(d), the Commission must give the person concerned a reasonable opportunity of being heard.

If the Commission amends or revokes a condition or imposes an additional condition under subsection (5)(b) or (c), the amendment, revocation or imposition takes effect at the time of the service of the notice or at the time specified in the notice, whichever is the later.
If the Commission revokes a designation under subsection (5)(d), the revocation takes effect at the time of the service of the notice or at the time specified in the notice, whichever is the later.
If, under this section, a person is designated or a designation is revoked, the Commission must publish notice of that fact in the Gazette.
A notice published under subsection (9) is not subsidiary legislation.

division.name: D4
division.heading: Rule Making Powers on Obligations and Designations

section.name: s101L
section.heading: Rule making power—reporting obligation

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may, with the consent of the Monetary Authority and after consultation with the Financial Secretary, make rules—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: generally for the purposes of the reporting obligation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: without limiting paragraph (a), to prescribe the particular matters set out in this section.

subsection.leadIn: Rules made under this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.def: may specify for the purposes of paragraph (a)(iv) of the definition of prescribed person in section 101A, a class or description of persons; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must provide in relation to a person of such a class or description that the person is subject to the reporting obligation only if the person is a counterparty to a specified OTC derivative transaction.

subsection.leadIn: Rules made under this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may specify generally, or with reference to a class or description of transactions, the OTC derivative transactions that are subject to the reporting obligation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: without limiting paragraph (a), may provide that an OTC derivative transaction is subject to the reporting obligation—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: even if a counterparty or more than one counterparty is a person outside Hong Kong;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: except in relation to a person of a class or description specified under subsection (2), even if a prescribed person is not a counterparty to the transaction; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: even if the transaction is entered into or conducted wholly or partially outside Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (3), OTC derivative transactions may be specified under that subsection with reference to any factor relating to an OTC derivative transaction, including—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the underlying subject matter of the transaction;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the features or characteristics of the transaction; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the persons involved in the transaction.

subsection.leadIn: Rules made under this section may specify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the circumstances relating to a specified OTC derivative transaction in which the reporting obligation—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: applies;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: does not apply; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: is taken to have been complied with;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the criteria (including thresholds) for the application of the reporting obligation; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: different circumstances and criteria for different prescribed persons or different OTC derivative transactions.

subsection.leadIn: Rules made under this section may provide that a prescribed person is subject to the reporting obligation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to OTC derivative transactions entered into before the date on which the reporting obligation started to apply—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to the class or description of persons to which the person belongs; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in relation to the class or description of OTC derivative transactions to which the transaction belongs; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the OTC derivative transaction referred to in paragraph (a)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: belongs to a class or description of transactions that is specified by rules made under this section for the purposes of the reporting obligation; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if at the time the reporting obligation started to apply to the person or the transaction, the transaction is still outstanding within the meaning given by rules made under this subsection.

subsection.leadIn: Rules made under this section may specify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the form and manner in which a specified OTC derivative transaction is to be reported to the Monetary Authority;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: without limiting paragraph (a), that any requirement as to the form and manner of reporting is complied with if the specified OTC derivative transaction is reported by means of an electronic system operated by or on behalf of the Monetary Authority for submitting and receiving reports on OTC derivative transactions for the purposes of section 101B;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any documents, information or particulars that must be submitted for complying with the reporting obligation;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the period within which the reporting obligation must be complied with; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any other matter relating to the procedure for complying with the reporting obligation.

subsection.leadIn: Rules made under this section may specify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that a prescribed person may report a specified OTC derivative transaction to the Monetary Authority directly or through a third party; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that a subsidiary specified under section 101B(5) that is a counterparty to a specified OTC derivative transaction may report the transaction to the Monetary Authority directly or through a third party.

section.name: s101M
section.heading: Rule making power—fees

subsection.content: The Chief Executive in Council may, after consultation with the Monetary Authority, make rules to require and provide for the payment to the Monetary Authority of the fees for using the electronic system referred to in section 101L(7)(b).

subsection.leadIn: Rules made under this section may provide—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the amount of any fees may be fixed by reference to a scale set out in the rules;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the payment of different fees by or in relation to persons or cases of different classes or descriptions;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for the time and manner of payment of the fees;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: that the payment of any fees may, either generally or in a particular case, be reduced, waived or refunded;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: that the Monetary Authority may recover any outstanding amount of the fees as a civil debt due to the Monetary Authority; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: for any other matters relating or incidental to a matter mentioned in paragraph (a), (b), (c), (d) or (e).

subsection.content: This section is in addition to and not in derogation of sections 29 and 29A of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1).

section.name: s101N
section.heading: Rule making power—clearing obligation

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may, with the consent of the Monetary Authority and after consultation with the Financial Secretary, make rules—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: generally for the purposes of the clearing obligation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: without limiting paragraph (a), to prescribe the particular matters set out in this section.

subsection.leadIn: Rules made under this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.def: may specify for the purposes of paragraph (b)(iv) of the definition of prescribed person in section 101A, a class or description of persons; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must provide in relation to a person of such a class or description that the person is subject to the clearing obligation only if the person is a counterparty to a specified OTC derivative transaction.

subsection.leadIn: Rules made under this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may specify generally, or with reference to a class or description of transactions, the OTC derivative transactions that are subject to the clearing obligation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: without limiting paragraph (a), may provide that an OTC derivative transaction is subject to the clearing obligation—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: even if a counterparty or more than one counterparty is a person outside Hong Kong;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: except in relation to a person of a class or description specified under subsection (2), even if a prescribed person is not a counterparty to the transaction; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: even if the transaction is entered into or conducted wholly or partially outside Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (3), OTC derivative transactions may be specified under that subsection with reference to any factor relating to an OTC derivative transaction, including—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the underlying subject matter of the transaction;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the features or characteristics of the transaction; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the persons involved in the transaction.

subsection.leadIn: Rules made under this section may specify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the circumstances relating to a specified OTC derivative transaction in which the clearing obligation—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: applies;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: does not apply; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: is taken to have been complied with;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the criteria (including thresholds) for the application of the clearing obligation; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: different circumstances and criteria for different prescribed persons or different OTC derivative transactions.

subsection.leadIn: Rules made under this section may specify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the manner in which a specified OTC derivative transaction is to be cleared with a designated CCP;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the period within which the clearing obligation must be complied with;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the circumstances in which a specified OTC derivative transaction that is cleared otherwise than with a designated CCP is treated, for the purposes of the clearing obligation, as having been cleared with a designated CCP;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: that a prescribed person may clear a specified OTC derivative transaction with a designated CCP directly or through a third party; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: that a subsidiary specified under section 101C(5) that is a counterparty to a specified OTC derivative transaction may clear the transaction with a designated CCP directly or through a third party.

section.name: s101O
section.heading: Rule making power—trading obligation

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may, with the consent of the Monetary Authority and after consultation with the Financial Secretary, make rules—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: generally for the purposes of the trading obligation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: without limiting paragraph (a), to prescribe the particular matters set out in this section.

subsection.leadIn: Rules made under this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.def: may specify for the purposes of paragraph (c)(iv) of the definition of prescribed person in section 101A, a class or description of persons; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must provide in relation to a person of such a class or description that the person is subject to the trading obligation only if the person is a counterparty to a specified OTC derivative transaction.

subsection.leadIn: Rules made under this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may specify generally, or with reference to a class or description of transactions, the OTC derivative transactions that are subject to the trading obligation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: without limiting paragraph (a), may provide that an OTC derivative transaction is subject to the trading obligation—

subparagraph.content: even if a counterparty or more than one counterparty is a person outside Hong Kong;
except in relation to a person of a class or description specified under subsection (2), even if a prescribed person is not a counterparty to the transaction; or
even if the transaction is entered into or conducted wholly or partially outside Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (3), OTC derivative transactions may be specified under that subsection with reference to any factor relating to an OTC derivative transaction, including—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the underlying subject matter of the transaction;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the features or characteristics of the transaction; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the persons involved in the transaction.

subsection.leadIn: Rules made under this section may specify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the circumstances relating to a specified OTC derivative transaction in which the trading obligation—

subparagraph.content: applies;
does not apply; or
is taken to have been complied with;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the criteria (including thresholds) for the application of the trading obligation; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: different circumstances and criteria for different prescribed persons or different OTC derivative transactions.

subsection.leadIn: Rules made under this section may specify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the manner in which a specified OTC derivative transaction is to be executed on a designated trading platform;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the circumstances in which a specified OTC derivative transaction that is executed otherwise than on a designated trading platform is treated, for the purposes of the trading obligation, as having been executed on a designated trading platform;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that a prescribed person may execute a specified OTC derivative transaction on a designated trading platform directly or through a third party; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: that a subsidiary specified under section 101D(5) that is a counterparty to a specified OTC derivative transaction may execute the transaction on a designated trading platform directly or through a third party.

section.name: s101P
section.heading: Rule making power—record keeping obligation

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may, with the consent of the Monetary Authority and after consultation with the Financial Secretary, make rules—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: generally for the purposes of the record keeping obligation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: without limiting paragraph (a), to prescribe the particular matters set out in this section.

subsection.leadIn: Rules made under this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.def: may specify for the purposes of paragraph (d)(iv) of the definition of prescribed person in section 101A, a class or description of persons; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must provide in relation to a person of such a class or description that the person is subject to the record keeping obligation only if the person is a counterparty to a specified OTC derivative transaction.

subsection.leadIn: Rules made under this section may specify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: generally, or with reference to a class or description of transactions, the OTC derivative transactions that are subject to the record keeping obligation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the records to be kept;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: different records to be kept under different circumstances or by different classes or descriptions of prescribed persons;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the manner in which, the location at which and the minimum duration for which the records must be kept;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: the circumstances relating to a specified OTC derivative transaction in which the record keeping obligation—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: applies;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: does not apply; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: is taken to have been complied with; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: any other matter relating to the records to be kept.

section.name: s101Q
section.heading: Rule making power—designations
section.leadIn: The Commission may, with the consent of the Monetary Authority and after consultation with the Financial Secretary, make rules to prescribe—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the application procedure for designation—

subparagraph.content: as a central counterparty, including the documents and information to be provided by the applicant; or
as a trading platform, including the documents and information to be provided by the applicant;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: other requirements to be complied with by an applicant for designation;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any matter that may be taken into account when considering an application;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the grounds on which designation may be refused or revoked;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the procedure for exercising a power under section 101J(1) or (5) or 101K(1) or (5); or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: any other matter relating to the process of or procedure for a designation or revocation under section 101J or 101K.

editorialNote.text: # Not yet in operation.

+ The new section 101Q(e) and (f) added by the Securities and Futures (Amendment) Ordinance 2014 (6 of 2014) came into operation on 1 September 2016, except in so far as they relate to the new section 101K. Please see paragraph (a)(viii)(B) and (C) of the Securities and Futures (Amendment) Ordinance 2014 (Commencement) Notice 2016 (L.N. 27 of 2016).

section.name: s101R
section.heading: Persons who must notify positions in OTC derivative transactions

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to a person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: is not—

subparagraph.content: an authorized financial institution;
an approved money broker;
a licensed corporation;
a recognized exchange company;
a recognized clearing house; or
a person authorized under section 95(2) to provide automated trading services; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: engages in OTC derivative transactions.

subsection.content: A person to whom this section applies must notify the Commission in accordance with subsection (4) if the person’s position in a specific class reaches the notification level.

For the purposes of subsection (2), a reference to a person’s position includes the position of another person to the extent to which the performance of the obligations arising from that other person’s position is guaranteed by the person.

subsection.leadIn: A notification must be given—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in writing and within the period prescribed by the notification rules; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in accordance with subsection (5).

subsection.leadIn: A notification must contain—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: sufficient information—

subparagraph.content: to identify the systemically important participant;
to identify the specific class to which the notification relates; and
to show that the notification level has been reached; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any information prescribed by the notification rules (including additional information so prescribed, relating to the matters referred to in paragraph (a)).

subsection.content: A person who without reasonable excuse fails to comply with subsection (2) commits an offence.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (6) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $5,000,000 and to imprisonment for 7 years and, if the offence is a continuing offence, to a further fine of $100,000 for every day during which the offence continues, until the cut-off date for the further fine; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years and, if the offence is a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues, until the cut-off date for the further fine.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (7), the cut-off date for a further fine for which the person is liable is the date on which the person, in writing, notifies the Commission in accordance with subsection (5) of the person’s position in that specific class.

section.name: s101S
section.heading: Commission to maintain register

subsection.content: The Commission must maintain a register, in a form that it considers appropriate, to record information under section 101T.

subsection.leadIn: The SIP register may be maintained—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in a documentary form; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by recording information otherwise than in a documentary form, so long as the information is capable of being reproduced in a legible form.

subsection.leadIn: At all reasonable times, the SIP register must be made available to the public for the purpose of enabling a person who is a member of the public to ascertain—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether the person is dealing with a registered SIP; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the particulars of registration of a registered SIP the person is dealing with.

subsection.leadIn: At all reasonable times, a member of the public may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: inspect the SIP register, or if it is maintained otherwise than in a documentary form, a reproduction of the information or the relevant part of it in a legible form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on payment of the prescribed fee, obtain a copy of—

subparagraph.content: an entry in the SIP register; or
an extract of the SIP register.

subsection.leadIn: A document purporting to be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a copy of an entry in or extract of the SIP register; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: certified by an authorized officer of the Commission as a true copy of the entry or extract,

subsection.continued: is admissible as evidence of its contents in any legal proceedings.

subsection.content: Without derogating from the other provisions of this section, the Commission must, in addition, make the SIP register available to the public in the form of an online record.

section.name: s101T
section.heading: Registration in SIP register

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may enter in the SIP register in respect of a person who has complied with the notification requirement—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the specific class in respect of which the notification level has been reached.

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may enter in the SIP register in respect of a person who has purportedly given a notification, but not in accordance with section 101R(4)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the specific class in respect of which the notification level has been reached.

subsection.leadIn: If the conditions in subsection (6) are satisfied in relation to a person, the Commission may enter in the SIP register—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the specific class referred to in subsection (6)(b).

subsection.leadIn: Before making an entry in the SIP register under subsection (3)(a) or (b) in respect of a person, the Commission must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: inform the Monetary Authority; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give the person concerned a reasonable opportunity of being heard in respect of the proposed entry.

subsection.content: The Commission must inform the person concerned by a written notice as soon as practicable after making an entry in the SIP register under subsection (1)(a) or (b), (2)(a) or (b) or (3)(a) or (b).

subsection.leadIn: The conditions referred to in subsection (3) are that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 101R(1) applies to the person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: either—

subparagraph.content: the Commission has reasonable cause to believe that the person’s position in a specific class has reached the notification level but the person has not given a notification in respect of the specific class; or

the Monetary Authority informs the Commission that the Monetary Authority has reasonable cause to believe that the person’s position in a specific class has reached the notification level but the person has not given a notification in respect of the specific class.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (6)(b), a reference to a person’s position includes the position of another person to the extent to which the performance of the obligations arising from that other person’s position is guaranteed by the person.

A decision to make an entry in the SIP register under subsection (1), (2) or (3) takes effect at the time of the service of the notice under subsection (5) on the person or at the time specified in the notice, whichever is the later.

section.name: s101U
section.heading: Notification not required after registration for specific class

subsection.content: If a person is registered for a specific class, as long as the name of the person remains on the SIP register for that specific class, the person is not required to comply with the notification requirement in respect of that specific class.

Subsection (1) does not affect any liability incurred for a failure by a person who is registered for a specific class under section 101T(2) or (3) to comply with the notification requirement in respect of that specific class.

Also, subsection (1) does not affect the application of section 101R(2) to a person whose position in a specific class reaches the notification level after the first or any subsequent deregistration for that specific class.

For the purposes of this section, a person is taken to be registered for a specific class if the SIP register shows that the person’s position in that specific class has reached the notification level.

For the purposes of subsections (3) and (4), a reference to the position of a person or a person’s position includes the position of another person to the extent to which the performance of the obligations arising from that other person’s position is guaranteed by the person.

section.name: s101V
section.heading: Deregistration

subsection.content: The Commission must remove from the SIP register the name of a person, if the Commission is satisfied that the relevant conditions, circumstances and criteria prescribed by the notification rules for removing a person’s name from the SIP register have been met.

The Commission must remove from the SIP register a specific class entered in respect of a person’s name, if the Commission is satisfied that the relevant conditions, circumstances and criteria prescribed by the notification rules for removing the specific class from the SIP register have been met.

subsection.leadIn: A deregistration may be effected—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by the Commission on its own initiative; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on application by a registered SIP.

subsection.content: The Commission must give the person concerned a reasonable opportunity of being heard before refusing an application for deregistration.
The Commission must consult the Monetary Authority before effecting a deregistration.
The Commission must inform the person concerned of a deregistration or a refusal to deregister by a written notice as soon as practicable after a deregistration or a refusal to deregister.

This section does not prevent the Commission from amending the SIP register to give effect to a decision of the Securities and Futures Appeals Tribunal under Part XI on a review by that Tribunal of a decision of the Commission under section 101T(3).

section.name: s101W
section.heading: Power to require information from registered SIPs

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may, by a written notice, require a registered SIP to give to the Commission, in the form and manner set out in the notice, information required by the notice, regarding one or more of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the registered SIP’s activities and transactions in OTC derivative products;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the risk management systems and policies established in respect of the registered SIP’s transactions in OTC derivative products;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other matter prescribed by the notification rules.

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may, by a written notice, require a registered SIP to give to the Monetary Authority, in the form and manner set out in the notice, information required by the notice, regarding one or more of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the registered SIP’s activities and transactions in OTC derivative products;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the risk management systems and policies established in respect of the registered SIP’s transactions in OTC derivative products;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other matter prescribed by the notification rules.

subsection.content: The registered SIP must give any information required to be given under subsection (1) or (2) within the period specified in the notice.

section.name: s101X
section.heading: Power to require registered SIPs to take certain action

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may, with the consent, or at the request, of the Monetary Authority, take the action specified in subsection (2), if the Commission has reasonable cause to believe that the registered SIP’s activities or transactions in OTC derivative products pose, or may pose, a systemic risk—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the securities and futures industry; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to the financial stability of Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: The action the Commission may take is to require, by a written notice, the registered SIP to do one or more of the following acts specified in the notice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to refrain from increasing, or to reduce, the registered SIP’s exposure arising from its positions in one or more specific classes;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to collect collateral or to increase the amount of collateral collected;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to post collateral or to increase the amount of collateral posted;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: to restrict the use of collateral;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: to restrict the type of collateral collected or posted;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: to take any other action prescribed by the notification rules.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2)(a), a reference to the registered SIP’s exposure arising from its positions is a reference to the risk to which the registered SIP is exposed in respect of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the positions of the registered SIP; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the positions of another person to the extent to which the performance of the obligations arising from those positions is guaranteed by the registered SIP.

subsection.content: A requirement in a notice served under this section takes effect at the time of the service of the notice or at the time specified in the notice, whichever is the later.

section.name: s101Y
section.heading: Application to Court of First Instance

subsection.content: If a registered SIP fails to comply with a requirement made under section 101W(1) or 101X, the Commission may apply to the Court of First Instance for an inquiry into the failure.
If a registered SIP fails to comply with a requirement made under section 101W(2), the Monetary Authority may apply to the Court of First Instance for an inquiry into the failure.

subsection.leadIn: The Court of First Instance may inquire into the case and if satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is no reasonable excuse for the registered SIP not to comply with the requirement, order the registered SIP to comply with the requirement within the period specified by the Court; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the failure was without reasonable excuse, punish the registered SIP in the same manner as if the registered SIP had been guilty of contempt of court.

subsection.content: If there is a reasonable likelihood that a registered SIP will fail to comply with a requirement referred to in subsection (1), the Commission may apply to the Court of First Instance for an order that the registered SIP take such action or refrain from taking such action as the Court directs.

If there is a reasonable likelihood that a registered SIP will fail to comply with a requirement referred to in subsection (2), the Monetary Authority may apply to the Court of First Instance for an order that the registered SIP take such action or refrain from taking such action as the Court directs.
An application under subsection (1), (2), (4) or (5) must be made by originating summons that is in Form No. 10 in Appendix A to the Rules of the High Court (Cap. 4 sub. leg. A).

section.name: s101Z
section.heading: Rule making power—notifications etc.
section.leadIn: The Commission may, with the consent of the Monetary Authority and after consultation with the Financial Secretary, make rules to prescribe—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a specific class—

subparagraph.content: the threshold for the application of the notification requirement;
the period within which the notification requirement must be complied with;
the conditions, circumstances and criteria for deregistration; and
the conditions, circumstances and criteria for regarding a person’s position as reaching the notification level;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: additional information to be given by a person under section 101R(5)(b);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: matters on which information may be required to be given under section 101W(1)(c) and (2)(c);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: action a registered SIP may be required to take under section 101X(2)(f); and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: generally for better carrying out the purposes of this Division.

section.name: s102
section.heading: Interpretation of Part IV

subsection.leadIn: In this Part, unless the context otherwise requires—
subsection.def: advertisement (廣告) includes every form of advertising, whether made orally or produced mechanically, electronically, magnetically, optically, manually or by any other means;

def.name: ApprovedPerson
def.leadIn: approved person (核准人士)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a collective investment scheme, means an individual approved by the Commission under section 104(3); (Amended 8 of 2011 s. 2)

paragraph.name: aa
paragraph.content: in relation to a structured product, means an individual approved by the Commission under section 104A(3); or (Added 8 of 2011 s. 2)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to the issue of an advertisement, invitation or document, means an individual approved by the Commission under section 105(3);

def.name: Document
def.leadIn: document (文件) means any publication (including a newspaper, magazine or journal, a poster or notice, a circular, brochure, pamphlet or handbill, or a prospectus)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: directed at, or the contents of which are likely to be accessed or read (whether concurrently or otherwise) by, the public; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether produced mechanically, electronically, magnetically, optically, manually or by any other means;

subsection.def: exempted body (獲豁免團體) means a body specified in Part 3 of Schedule 4;
invitation (邀請) includes an offer and an invitation, whether made orally or produced mechanically, electronically, magnetically, optically, manually or by any other means;

def.name: Issue
def.leadIn: issue (發出), in relation to any material (including any advertisement, invitation or document), includes publishing, circulating, distributing or otherwise disseminating the material or the contents thereof, whether—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by any visit in person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in a newspaper, magazine, journal or other publication;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by the display of posters or notices;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: by means of circulars, brochures, pamphlets or handbills;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: by an exhibition of photographs or cinematograph films;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: by way of sound or television broadcasting;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: by any information system or other electronic device; or

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: by any other means, whether mechanically, electronically, magnetically, optically, manually or by any other medium, or by way of production or transmission of light, image or sound or any other medium,

def.continued: and also includes causing or authorizing the material to be issued;

subsection.def: relevant authority (監管當局), in relation to a place outside Hong Kong, means an authority which the Monetary Authority is satisfied is a recognized banking supervisory authority of that place;

def.name: Representative
def.leadIn: representative (代表)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a licensed corporation, means an individual—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: who is licensed as a licensed representative for a regulated activity; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: who carries on that regulated activity for the licensed corporation as a licensed corporation to which he is accredited; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a registered institution, means an individual—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: whose name is entered in the register maintained by the Monetary Authority under section 20 of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155) as that of a person engaged by the registered institution in respect of a regulated activity; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: who carries on that regulated activity for the registered institution; (Amended 8 of 2011 s. 2)

subsection.def: securities (證券) has the same meaning as that given by the definition of securities in section 1 of Part 1 of Schedule 1 except that it does not include structured products that are securities only because of paragraph (g) of that definition. (Added 8 of 2011 s. 2)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an advertisement, invitation or document issued by a person shall be regarded as being issued by him on every day on which he causes or authorizes it to be so issued;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an advertisement, invitation or document issued by one person on behalf of another shall be regarded as an advertisement, invitation or document (as the case may be) issued by both persons.

division.name: D2
division.heading: Regulation of offers of investments, etc.

section.name: s103
section.heading: Offence to issue advertisements, invitations or documents relating to investments in certain cases

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (2), (3) and (5) to (9), a person commits an offence if he issues, or has in his possession for the purposes of issue, whether in Hong Kong or elsewhere, an advertisement, invitation or document which to his knowledge is or contains an invitation to the public—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: to enter into or offer to enter into—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an agreement to acquire, dispose of, subscribe for or underwrite securities; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a regulated investment agreement or an agreement to acquire, dispose of, subscribe for or underwrite any other structured product; or (Replaced 8 of 2011 s. 3)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to acquire an interest in or participate in, or offer to acquire an interest in or participate in, a collective investment scheme,

subsection.continued: unless the issue is authorized by the Commission under section 105(1).

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply to the issue, or the possession for the purposes of issue, of any advertisement, invitation or document—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: made by or on behalf of an intermediary licensed or registered for Type 1, Type 4 or Type 6 regulated activity (whether acting as principal or agent) in respect of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: listed securities; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: unlisted securities (excluding unlisted securities that are structured products); (Replaced 8 of 2011 s. 3)

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.leadIn: made by or on behalf of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an authorized financial institution (whether acting as principal or agent); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an intermediary licensed for Type 3 regulated activity (whether acting as principal or agent),

paragraph.continued: in respect of leveraged foreign exchange contracts;

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.leadIn: made by or on behalf of a corporation in respect of securities (excluding securities that are structured products) of the corporation, or of a related corporation of the corporation, to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: holders of securities (excluding securities that are structured products) of the corporation or related corporation;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: creditors of the corporation or related corporation;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: employees employed by the corporation or related corporation; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: agents acting in a professional capacity on behalf of the corporation or related corporation; (Replaced 8 of 2011 s. 3)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: made by or on behalf of the Government in respect of securities or structured products issued by it; (Amended 8 of 2011 s. 3)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: made by or on behalf of a credit union in respect of shares in the credit union;

paragraph.name: ga
paragraph.content: made by or on behalf of a corporation, but only to the extent that the advertisement, invitation or document relates to an offer specified in Part 1 of the Seventeenth Schedule to the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32) as read with the other Parts of that Schedule; (Replaced 16 of 2016 s. 5)

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: made by or on behalf of a person acting as a trustee of a trust, not being a collective investment scheme, to beneficiaries under the trust; or

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: made by or on behalf of a person who is engaged in the business of selling and purchasing property other than securities or structured products (whether acting as principal or agent) in the ordinary course of that business. (Amended 8 of 2011 s. 3)

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply to the issue, or the possession for the purposes of issue—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a prospectus which complies with or is exempt from compliance with Part II of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of a corporation incorporated outside Hong Kong that is not a re-domiciled company, a prospectus which complies with or is exempt from compliance with Part XII of that Ordinance; (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 242)

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a publication falling within section 38B(2) of that Ordinance; (Replaced 30 of 2004 s. 3. Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: of a document relating to the securities of a body corporate incorporated in Hong Kong that is neither a registered company nor an open-ended fund company, being a document which— (Amended 16 of 2016 s. 5)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: would, if the body corporate were a registered company, be a prospectus to which section 38 of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32) applies, or would apply if not excluded by section 38(5)(b) or 38A of that Ordinance; and (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: contains all the matters which, by virtue of Part XII of that Ordinance, it would be required to contain if the body corporate were a corporation incorporated outside Hong Kong that is not a re-domiciled company and the document were a prospectus issued by that corporation; (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 242)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: of a form of application for the shares or debentures of a corporation that is not an open-ended fund company, where it is issued, or the possession is for the purposes of issue, together with— (Amended 16 of 2016 s. 5)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a prospectus with respect to those shares or debentures which complies with or is exempt from compliance with Part II of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32) or, in the case of a corporation incorporated outside Hong Kong that is not a re-domiciled company, complies with or is exempt from compliance with Part XII of that Ordinance; or (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of a body corporate incorporated in Hong Kong that is not a registered company, a document containing all the matters which, by virtue of Part XII of that Ordinance, it would be required to contain if the body corporate were a corporation incorporated outside Hong Kong that is not a re-domiciled company and the document were a prospectus issued by that corporation with respect to those shares or debentures; (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 242)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: of a form of application for the securities of a corporation, where it is issued, or the possession is for the purposes of issue, in connection with an invitation made in good faith to a person to enter into an underwriting agreement with respect to those securities;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: of any advertisement, invitation or document made in respect of the issue, whether in Hong Kong or elsewhere, of a certificate of deposit by an authorized financial institution;

paragraph.name: ea
paragraph.content: of any advertisement, invitation or document made in respect of the issue, whether in Hong Kong or elsewhere, of a currency-linked instrument, an interest rate-linked instrument or a currency and interest rate-linked instrument by an authorized financial institution; (Added 8 of 2011 s. 3)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: of any advertisement, invitation or document made in respect of the issue, whether in Hong Kong or elsewhere, of a certificate of deposit—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the amount or denomination of which is not less than the sum specified in Part 1 of Schedule 4; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: by—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: a multilateral agency; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: a bank incorporated outside Hong Kong and having no place of business in Hong Kong, where the Monetary Authority has declared in writing that he is satisfied that the bank is likely to be adequately supervised by the relevant authority of any place in which it is incorporated or has its principal place of business;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: of any advertisement, invitation or document made in respect of the issue, whether in Hong Kong or elsewhere, of any instrument specified in Part 2 of Schedule 4 (other than a certificate of deposit), where the amount or denomination of the instrument is not less than the sum specified in Part 1 of Schedule 4 and the instrument—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is issued by an authorized financial institution or a multilateral agency, or by an exempted body which, if it is a corporation or a wholly owned subsidiary specified in item 11 of Part 3 of Schedule 4, complies with the relevant condition;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is issued by a corporation which complies with the relevant condition, and is guaranteed by an authorized financial institution or a multilateral agency, or by an exempted body (other than a corporation specified in item 11 of Part 3 of Schedule 4 which does not comply with the relevant condition, or a wholly owned subsidiary of the corporation); or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: is issued by a wholly owned subsidiary specified in item 11 of Part 3 of Schedule 4 and is guaranteed by the corporation of which it is such a subsidiary and which complies with the relevant condition;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: of any advertisement, invitation or document made in respect of the issue of securities the listing of which on a recognized stock market has been approved by the recognized exchange company by which the recognized stock market is operated, where the advertisement, invitation or document complies with the rules made under section 23 or 36 governing the listing of securities, except to the extent that compliance is, in accordance with those rules, waived, modified or not required;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: of any advertisement, invitation or document made in respect of securities regulated in a jurisdiction outside Hong Kong which have been admitted to trading on a recognized stock market under or pursuant to rules made under section 23 or 36;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: of any advertisement, invitation or document made in respect of securities or structured products, or interests in any collective investment scheme, that are or are intended to be disposed of only to persons outside Hong Kong; (Replaced 8 of 2011 s. 3)

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: of any advertisement, invitation or document made in respect of securities or structured products, or interests in any collective investment scheme, that are or are intended to be disposed of only to professional investors. (Replaced 8 of 2011 s. 3)

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 3 years and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $20,000 for every day during which the offence continues; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

subsection.leadIn: A person shall not be regarded as committing an offence under subsection (1) by reason only that he issues, or has in his possession for the purposes of issue—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: as or on behalf of an intermediary licensed or registered for Type 1, Type 4 or Type 6 regulated activity (whether acting as principal or agent) any advertisement, invitation or document made in respect of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: listed securities; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: unlisted securities (excluding unlisted securities that are structured products); (Replaced 8 of 2011 s. 3)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: as or on behalf of an intermediary licensed or registered for Type 2 or Type 5 regulated activity (whether acting as principal or agent), any advertisement, invitation or document made in respect of futures contracts;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: as or on behalf of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an authorized financial institution (whether acting as principal or agent); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an intermediary licensed for Type 3 regulated activity (whether acting as principal or agent),

paragraph.continued: any advertisement, invitation or document made in respect of leveraged foreign exchange contracts.

subsection.leadIn: A person shall not be regarded as committing an offence under subsection (1) by reason only that he issues any advertisement, invitation or document, or has any advertisement, invitation or document in his possession for the purposes of issue—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of any advertisement, invitation or document made in respect of any of the following to an intermediary licensed or registered for Type 1, Type 4 or Type 6 regulated activity, or a representative of such an intermediary that carries on such a regulated activity for the intermediary—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: listed securities; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: unlisted securities (excluding unlisted securities that are structured products); (Replaced 8 of 2011 s. 3)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of any advertisement, invitation or document made in respect of futures contracts, to an intermediary licensed or registered for Type 2 or Type 5 regulated activity, or a representative of such intermediary that carries on such regulated activity for such intermediary; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of any advertisement, invitation or document made in respect of leveraged foreign exchange contracts, to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an authorized financial institution; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an intermediary licensed for Type 3 regulated activity, or a representative of such intermediary that carries on such regulated activity for such intermediary.

subsection.leadIn: A person shall not be regarded as committing an offence under subsection (1) by reason only that he issues, or has in his possession for the purposes of issue, any advertisement, invitation or document if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the advertisement, invitation or document (as the case may be) was so issued, or possessed for the purposes of issue, in the ordinary course of a business (whether or not carried on by him), the principal purpose of which was receiving and issuing materials provided by others;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the contents of the advertisement, invitation or document (as the case may be) were not, wholly or partly, devised—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: where the business was carried on by him, by himself or any officer, employee or agent of his; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where the business was not carried on by him, by himself; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: for the purposes of the issue—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: where the business was carried on by him, he or any officer, employee or agent of his; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where the business was not carried on by him, he,

paragraph.continued: did not select, add to, modify or otherwise exercise control over the contents of the advertisement, invitation or document (as the case may be).

subsection.leadIn: A person shall not be regarded as committing an offence under subsection (1) by reason only that he issues by way of live broadcast, or has in his possession for the purposes of issue by way of live broadcast, any advertisement, invitation or document if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the advertisement, invitation or document (as the case may be) was so issued, or possessed for the purposes of issue, in the ordinary course of the business of a broadcaster (whether or not he was such broadcaster);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the contents of the advertisement, invitation or document (as the case may be) were not, wholly or partly, devised—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: where he was the broadcaster, by himself or any officer, employee or agent of his; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where he was not the broadcaster, by himself;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: for the purposes of the issue—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: where he was the broadcaster, he or any officer, employee or agent of his; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where he was not the broadcaster, he,

paragraph.continued: did not select, add to, modify or otherwise exercise control over the contents of the advertisement, invitation or document (as the case may be); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to the broadcast—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: where he was the broadcaster, he; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where he was not the broadcaster, he believed and had reasonable grounds to believe that the broadcaster,

paragraph.continued: acted in accordance with the terms and conditions of the licence (if any) by which he or the broadcaster (as the case may be) became entitled to broadcast as a broadcaster and with any code of practice or guidelines (however described) issued under or pursuant to the Telecommunications Ordinance (Cap. 106) or the Broadcasting Ordinance (Cap. 562) and applicable to him or the broadcaster (as the case may be) as a broadcaster.

subsection.content: It is a defence to a charge for an offence under subsection (1) for the person charged to prove that he took all reasonable steps and exercised all due diligence to avoid the commission of the offence with which he is charged.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of any proceedings under this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an advertisement, invitation or document which consists of or contains information likely to lead, directly or indirectly, to the doing of any act referred to in subsection (1)(a) or (b) shall be regarded as an advertisement, invitation or document (as the case may be) which is or contains an invitation to do such act;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an advertisement, invitation or document which is or contains an invitation directed at, or the contents of which are likely to be accessed or read (whether concurrently or otherwise) by, the public shall be regarded as an advertisement, invitation or document (as the case may be) which is or contains an invitation to the public.

subsection.content: Nothing in subsection (2)(a), (b), (c) or (i) or (5)(a), (b) or (c) applies to anything done by any person in respect of any interest in a collective investment scheme that is not authorized by the Commission under section 104.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: guaranteed (作出擔保) means guaranteed fully, unconditionally, irrevocably and in writing;
registered company (註冊公司) means a company registered under the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622) or the relevant Ordinance; (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

relevant condition (有關條件), in relation to a corporation (including a wholly owned subsidiary of any other corporation), means a condition that the amount by which the aggregate of the corporation’s assets exceeds the aggregate of its liabilities, as calculated in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles, is not less than the sum specified in Part 4 of Schedule 4.

section.name: s104
section.heading: Commission may authorize collective investment schemes

subsection.content: On an application to the Commission, the Commission may, where it considers appropriate, authorize any collective investment scheme, subject to the condition specified in subsection (2) and to any other conditions it considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: It shall be a condition of authorization of a collective investment scheme under subsection (1) that at any time when the scheme is authorized—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is an individual approved by the Commission under subsection (3) as an approved person for the purpose of being served by the Commission with notices and decisions for the scheme; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the Commission is informed of particulars—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: subject to subparagraph (ii), of the current contact details of the approved person referred to in paragraph (a), including, in so far as applicable, the address, telephone and facsimile numbers, and electronic mail address of the approved person;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where there is any change in the contact details referred to in subparagraph (i), of the change, within 14 days after the change takes place.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (2)(a), on an application by any person to the Commission, the Commission may, where it considers appropriate, approve any individual nominated in the application in respect of a collective investment scheme as an approved person for the purpose of being served by the Commission with notices and decisions for the scheme, and may, by notice in writing served on the person, withdraw the approval.

The Commission may at any time, by notice in writing served on the approved person for a collective investment scheme, amend or revoke any of the conditions (other than the condition specified in subsection (2)) imposed, or impose new conditions, in respect of the authorization granted under subsection (1) in respect of the scheme.

Without limiting any other ground on which the Commission may refuse to authorize any collective investment scheme under subsection (1), the Commission may refuse to do so where it is not satisfied that the authorization is in the interest of the investing public.
An application made pursuant to subsection (1) or (3) shall be accompanied by such information and documents as the Commission requires.

Where the Commission refuses to authorize a collective investment scheme, or to approve an individual as an approved person, pursuant to subsection (1) or (3), it shall by notice in writing notify the person making the application in question of the decision and the reasons for which it is made.
The Commission may publish in such manner as it considers appropriate particulars of any collective investment scheme authorized under subsection (1).
Particulars published under subsection (8) are not subsidiary legislation.

section.name: s104A
section.heading: Commission may authorize structured products

subsection.content: On an application by any person, the Commission may authorize a structured product, subject to the condition specified in subsection (2) and to any other conditions it considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: It is a condition of authorization of a structured product that, at any time when the product is authorized—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is an individual approved by the Commission under subsection (3) as an approved person for the purpose of being served by the Commission with notices and decisions for the product; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the Commission is informed—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: subject to subparagraph (ii), of the current contact details of the approved person, including, as applicable, the address, telephone and facsimile numbers, and electronic mail address of the approved person;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if there is any change in those contact details, of the change within 14 days after the change takes place.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (2)(a), on an application by any person, the Commission may approve an individual nominated in the application in respect of a structured product as an approved person for the purpose of being served by the Commission with notices and decisions for the product.

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may at any time, by notice in writing served on the approved person for a structured product—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: amend or revoke any of the conditions (other than the condition specified in subsection (2)) imposed, or impose new conditions, in respect of the authorization of the product; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: withdraw the person’s approval under subsection (3).

subsection.content: Without limiting any other ground on which the Commission may refuse to authorize a structured product under subsection (1), the Commission may refuse to do so if it is not satisfied that the authorization is in the interest of the investing public.
An application made under subsection (1) or (3) must be accompanied by any information and documents that the Commission requires.

If the Commission refuses to authorize a structured product, or to approve an individual as an approved person, the Commission must notify the applicant in writing of the refusal and the reasons for it.
The Commission may publish, in any manner it considers appropriate, particulars of a structured product authorized under subsection (1).
Particulars published under subsection (8) are not subsidiary legislation.

section.name: s105
section.heading: Commission may authorize issue of advertisements, invitations or documents

subsection.content: On an application to the Commission, the Commission may, where it considers appropriate, authorize the issue of any advertisement, invitation or document which is or contains an invitation to do any act referred to in section 103(1)(a) or (b), subject to the condition specified in subsection (2) and to any other conditions it considers appropriate, including conditions on the matter to which the advertisement, invitation or document relates.

subsection.leadIn: It shall be a condition of authorization of the issue of any advertisement, invitation or document under subsection (1) that at any time when the issue is authorized—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is an individual approved by the Commission under subsection (3) as an approved person for the purpose of being served by the Commission with notices and decisions for the issue; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the Commission is informed of particulars—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: subject to subparagraph (ii), of the current contact details of the approved person referred to in paragraph (a), including, in so far as applicable, the address, telephone and facsimile numbers, and electronic mail address of the approved person;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where there is any change in the contact details referred to in subparagraph (i), of the change, within 14 days after the change takes place.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (2)(a), on an application by any person to the Commission, the Commission may, where it considers appropriate, approve any individual nominated in the application in respect of the issue of any advertisement, invitation or document as an approved person for the purpose of being served by the Commission with notices and decisions for the issue, and may, by notice in writing served on the person, withdraw the approval.

The Commission may at any time, by notice in writing served on the approved person for the issue of any advertisement, invitation or document, amend or revoke any of the conditions (other than the condition specified in subsection (2)) imposed, or impose new conditions, in respect of the authorization granted under subsection (1) in respect of the issue.

Without limiting any other ground on which the Commission may refuse to authorize the issue of any advertisement, invitation or document under subsection (1), the Commission may refuse to do so where it is not satisfied that the matter to which the advertisement, invitation or document relates is in the interest of the investing public.
An application made pursuant to subsection (1) or (3) shall be accompanied by such information and documents as the Commission requires.

Where the Commission refuses to authorize the issue of any advertisement, invitation or document, or to approve an individual as an approved person, pursuant to subsection (1) or (3), it shall by notice in writing notify the person making the application in question of the decision and the reasons for which it is made.

section.name: s106
section.heading: Withdrawal of authorization under section 104, 104A or 105, etc.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (5), where, in relation to an authorization of a collective investment scheme under section 104, an authorization of a structured product under section 104A, or an authorization of the issue of an advertisement, invitation or document under section 105, the Commission decides that— (Amended 8 of 2011 s. 5)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any information provided to the Commission pursuant to section 104(6), 104A(6) or 105(6) (as the case may be) was at the time when it was provided false or misleading in a material particular;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: any information provided to the Commission in purported compliance with any of the conditions imposed in respect of the authorization under section 104, 104A or 105 (as the case may be) was at the time when it was provided false or misleading in a material particular; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: it is desirable to withdraw the authorization in order to protect the interest of the investing public,

subsection.continued: the Commission may withdraw the authorization. (Amended 8 of 2011 s. 5)

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (3), the Commission must withdraw the authorization of a collective investment scheme, a structured product or the issue of an advertisement, invitation or document on a request in writing made by the approved person for the scheme, product or issue (as the case may be). (Replaced 8 of 2011 s. 5)

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (5), the Commission may refuse to withdraw an authorization of a collective investment scheme or structured product or of the issue of an advertisement, invitation or document under subsection (2) where it considers that— (Amended 8 of 2011 s. 5)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of an authorization of a collective investment scheme or structured product, it is in the public interest that any matter concerning the scheme or product should be investigated before the authorization is withdrawn under subsection (2); or (Amended 8 of 2011 s. 5)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the withdrawal of the authorization would not be in the interest of the investing public.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (5), where the Commission withdraws an authorization under subsection (1) or (2), it may impose such conditions on the withdrawal of the authorization as it considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: The Commission shall not—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: refuse to withdraw an authorization of a collective investment scheme or structured product or of the issue of an advertisement, invitation or document under subsection (3); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: impose any conditions on the withdrawal of an authorization of a collective investment scheme or structured product or of the issue of an advertisement, invitation or document under subsection (4),

subsection.continued: without first giving the approved person for the scheme, the product or the issue (as the case may be) a reasonable opportunity of being heard. (Amended 8 of 2011 s. 5)

subsection.leadIn: Where the Commission—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: refuses to withdraw an authorization of a collective investment scheme or structured product or of the issue of an advertisement, invitation or document under subsection (3); or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: imposes any conditions on the withdrawal of an authorization of a collective investment scheme or structured product or of the issue of an advertisement, invitation or document under subsection (4),

subsection.continued: it shall by notice in writing notify the approved person for the scheme, the product or the issue (as the case may be) of the decision and, in the case of paragraph (a), (c) or (d), the reasons for which it is made. (Amended 8 of 2011 s. 5)

subsection.content: Where the Commission withdraws an authorization under subsection (1) or (2), it may publish notice of the withdrawal and the reasons therefor in such manner as it considers appropriate.
A notice or any other matter published under subsection (7) is not subsidiary legislation.

section.name: s107
section.heading: Offence to fraudulently or recklessly induce others to invest money

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if he makes any fraudulent misrepresentation or reckless misrepresentation for the purpose of inducing another person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: to enter into or offer to enter into—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an agreement to acquire, dispose of, subscribe for or underwrite securities; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a regulated investment agreement or an agreement to acquire, dispose of, subscribe for or underwrite any other structured product; or (Replaced 8 of 2011 s. 6)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to acquire an interest in or participate in, or offer to acquire an interest in or participate in, a collective investment scheme.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 7 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section—

def.name: FraudulentMisrepresentation
def.leadIn: fraudulent misrepresentation (欺詐的失實陳述) means—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any statement which, at the time when it is made, is to the knowledge of its maker false, misleading or deceptive;

subparagraph.name: ii
iii
iv
subparagraph.leadIn: any statement or forecast from which, at the time when it is made, its maker intentionally omits a material fact, with the result that—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: in the case of the statement, the statement is rendered false, misleading or deceptive; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: in the case of the forecast, the forecast is rendered misleading or deceptive;

def.name: RecklessMisrepresentation
def.leadIn: reckless misrepresentation (罔顧實情的失實陳述) means—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any statement which, at the time when it is made, is false, misleading or deceptive and is made recklessly;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any promise which, at the time when it is made, is not capable of being fulfilled and is made recklessly;

subparagraph.name: iii
iv
subparagraph.leadIn: any statement or forecast from which, at the time when it is made, its maker recklessly omits a material fact, with the result that—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: in the case of the statement, the statement is rendered false, misleading or deceptive; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: in the case of the forecast, the forecast is rendered misleading or deceptive.

section.name: s108
section.heading: Civil liability for inducing others to invest money in certain cases

subsection.leadIn: Where a person makes any fraudulent misrepresentation, reckless misrepresentation or negligent misrepresentation by which another person is induced—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: to enter into or offer to enter into—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an agreement to acquire, dispose of, subscribe for or underwrite securities; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a regulated investment agreement or an agreement to acquire, dispose of, subscribe for or underwrite any other structured product; or (Replaced 8 of 2011 s. 7)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to acquire an interest in or participate in, or offer to acquire an interest in or participate in, a collective investment scheme,

subsection.continued: the first-mentioned person shall, whether or not he also incurs any other liability (whether under this Part or otherwise), be liable to pay compensation by way of damages to the other person for any pecuniary loss that the other person has sustained as a result of the reliance by the other person on the misrepresentation.
