subsection.content: For the purposes of this section, where a company or other body corporate has made any fraudulent misrepresentation, reckless misrepresentation or negligent misrepresentation by which another person is induced to do any act referred to in subsection (1)(a) or (b), any person who was a director of the company or body corporate at the time when the misrepresentation was made shall, unless it is proved that he did not authorize the making of the misrepresentation, be presumed also to have made the misrepresentation.

For the avoidance of doubt, where a court has jurisdiction to determine an action brought under subsection (1), it may, where it is, apart from this section, within its jurisdiction to entertain an application for an injunction, grant an injunction in addition to, or in substitution for, damages, on such terms and conditions as it considers appropriate.

This section does not confer a right of action in any case to which section 40 of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32) (whether with or without reference to section 342E of that Ordinance) applies. (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

A person may bring an action under subsection (1) even though the person against whom the action is brought has not been charged with or convicted of an offence by reason of a contravention of this Part.
Nothing in this section affects, limits or diminishes any rights conferred on a person, or any liabilities a person may incur, under the common law or any other enactment.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section—

def.name: FraudulentMisrepresentation
def.leadIn: fraudulent misrepresentation (欺詐的失實陳述) means—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any statement which, at the time when it is made, is to the knowledge of its maker false, misleading or deceptive;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any promise which, at the time when it is made, its maker has no intention of fulfilling, or is to the knowledge of its maker not capable of being fulfilled;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: any forecast which, at the time when it is made, is to the knowledge of its maker not justified on the facts then known to him; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.leadIn: any statement or forecast from which, at the time when it is made, its maker intentionally omits a material fact, with the result that—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: in the case of the statement, the statement is rendered false, misleading or deceptive; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: in the case of the forecast, the forecast is rendered misleading or deceptive;

def.name: RecklessMisrepresentation
def.leadIn: reckless misrepresentation (罔顧實情的失實陳述) means—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any statement which, at the time when it is made, is false, misleading or deceptive and is made recklessly;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any promise which, at the time when it is made, is not capable of being fulfilled and is made recklessly;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: any forecast which, at the time when it is made, is not justified on the facts then known to its maker and is made recklessly; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.leadIn: any statement or forecast from which, at the time when it is made, its maker recklessly omits a material fact, with the result that—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: in the case of the statement, the statement is rendered false, misleading or deceptive; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: in the case of the forecast, the forecast is rendered misleading or deceptive;

def.name: NegligentMisrepresentation
def.leadIn: negligent misrepresentation (疏忽的失實陳述) means—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any statement which, at the time when it is made, is false, misleading or deceptive and is made without reasonable care having been taken to ensure its accuracy;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any promise which, at the time when it is made, is not capable of being fulfilled and is made without reasonable care having been taken to ensure that it can be fulfilled;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: any forecast which, at the time when it is made, is not justified on the facts then known to its maker and is made without reasonable care having been taken to ensure the accuracy of those facts; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.leadIn: any statement or forecast from which, at the time when it is made, its maker negligently omits a material fact, with the result that—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: in the case of the statement, the statement is rendered false, misleading or deceptive; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: in the case of the forecast, the forecast is rendered misleading or deceptive.

section.name: s109
section.heading: Offence to issue advertisements relating to carrying on of regulated activities, etc.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (3) to (6), a person commits an offence if he issues, or has in his possession for the purposes of issue—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: an advertisement in which to his knowledge—

subparagraph.content: a person holds himself out as being prepared to carry on Type 4, Type 5, Type 6 or Type 9 regulated activity; and
the person is not licensed or registered for such regulated activity as required under this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any document which to his knowledge contains such advertisement.

subsection.content: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: A person shall not be regarded as committing an offence under subsection (1) by reason only that he issues any advertisement or document, or has any advertisement or document in his possession for the purposes of issue—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of an advertisement in which a person holds himself out as being prepared to carry on Type 4 regulated activity, to an intermediary licensed or registered for Type 4 regulated activity, or a representative of such intermediary that carries on such regulated activity for such intermediary;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of an advertisement in which a person holds himself out as being prepared to carry on Type 5 regulated activity, to an intermediary licensed or registered for Type 5 regulated activity, or a representative of such intermediary that carries on such regulated activity for such intermediary;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of an advertisement in which a person holds himself out as being prepared to carry on Type 6 regulated activity, to an intermediary licensed or registered for Type 6 regulated activity, or a representative of such intermediary that carries on such regulated activity for such intermediary; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in the case of an advertisement in which a person holds himself out as being prepared to carry on Type 9 regulated activity, to an intermediary licensed or registered for Type 9 regulated activity, or a representative of such intermediary that carries on such regulated activity for such intermediary.

subsection.leadIn: A person shall not be regarded as committing an offence under subsection (1) by reason only that he issues, or has in his possession for the purposes of issue, any advertisement or document if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the advertisement or document (as the case may be) was so issued, or possessed for the purposes of issue, in the ordinary course of a business (whether or not carried on by him), the principal purpose of which was receiving and issuing materials provided by others;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the contents of the advertisement or document (as the case may be) were not, wholly or partly, devised—

subparagraph.content: where the business was carried on by him, by himself or any officer, employee or agent of his; or
where the business was not carried on by him, by himself; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: for the purposes of the issue—

subparagraph.content: where the business was carried on by him, he or any officer, employee or agent of his; or
where the business was not carried on by him, he,

paragraph.continued: did not select, add to, modify or otherwise exercise control over the contents of the advertisement or document (as the case may be).

subsection.leadIn: A person shall not be regarded as committing an offence under subsection (1) by reason only that he issues by way of live broadcast, or has in his possession for the purposes of issue by way of live broadcast, any advertisement or document if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: the contents of the advertisement or document (as the case may be) were not, wholly or partly, devised—

subparagraph.content: where he was the broadcaster, by himself or any officer, employee or agent of his; or
where he was not the broadcaster, by himself;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: for the purposes of the issue—

subparagraph.content: where he was the broadcaster, he or any officer, employee or agent of his; or
where he was not the broadcaster, he,

paragraph.continued: did not select, add to, modify or otherwise exercise control over the contents of the advertisement or document (as the case may be); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to the broadcast—

subparagraph.content: where he was the broadcaster, he; or
where he was not the broadcaster, he believed and had reasonable grounds to believe that the broadcaster,

paragraph.continued: acted in accordance with the terms and conditions of the licence (if any) by which he or the broadcaster (as the case may be) became entitled to broadcast as a broadcaster and with any code of practice or guidelines (however described) issued under or pursuant to the Telecommunications Ordinance (Cap. 106) or the Broadcasting Ordinance (Cap. 562) and applicable to him or the broadcaster (as the case may be) as a broadcaster.

subsection.content: It is a defence to a charge for an offence under subsection (1) for the person charged to prove that he took all reasonable steps and exercised all due diligence to avoid the commission of the offence with which he is charged.

section.name: s110
section.heading: Submission of information to Commission

subsection.leadIn: A person that is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an authorized financial institution;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an exempted body or, in the case of a wholly owned subsidiary specified in item 11 of Part 3 of Schedule 4 but incorporated outside Hong Kong, an authorized representative of that subsidiary;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a multilateral agency or an authorized representative of that agency; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a bank incorporated outside Hong Kong or an authorized representative of that bank,

subsection.continued: commits an offence if he fails, within 10 business days, or such longer period as is prescribed by rules made under section 397 for the purposes of this subsection, after the issue of any advertisement, invitation or document referred to in section 103(3)(e), (f) or (g) by the authorized financial institution, the exempted body or the wholly owned subsidiary, the multilateral agency or the bank (as the case may be), to submit to the Commission such information in respect of the advertisement, invitation or document as is prescribed by the rules.

subsection.content: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $5,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

def.name: AuthorizedRepresentative
def.leadIn: In subsection (1), authorized representative (獲授權代表), in relation to the issue of any advertisement, invitation or document, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a wholly owned subsidiary specified in item 11 of Part 3 of Schedule 4 but incorporated outside Hong Kong, the listed corporation of which it is the subsidiary; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a multilateral agency or a bank incorporated outside Hong Kong, a person resident in Hong Kong who is authorized by the agency or the bank (as the case may be) to act on behalf of the agency or the bank (as the case may be) in respect of that issue.

section.name: s111
section.heading: Service of notices, etc. on approved persons

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding section 400, any written notice, decision or direction or other document (however described) to be, or required to be, issued or served (however described) to or on an approved person by the Commission for the purposes of this Ordinance shall for all purposes be regarded as duly issued or served only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is delivered to him by hand; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: it is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: left at, or sent by post to, the last address;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: sent by facsimile transmission to the last facsimile number; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: sent by electronic mail transmission to the last electronic mail address,

paragraph.continued: shown by the particulars of which the Commission is informed in respect of the approved person for the purposes of section 104(2)(b), 104A(2)(b) or 105(2)(b) (as the case may be). (Amended 8 of 2011 s. 8)

subsection.leadIn: Where a notice, decision or direction or other document (however described) is regarded as duly issued or served to or on an approved person under subsection (1)(b), it shall for all purposes be regarded as issued or served to or on the approved person, and as coming to his notice, at the time when—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where it is left at an address, it is so left at that address;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where it is sent by post to an address, it would in the ordinary course of post be delivered to that address;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: where it is sent by facsimile transmission to a facsimile number, it would in the ordinary course of transmission by facsimile be received at that number; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: where it is sent by electronic mail transmission to an electronic mail address, it would in the ordinary course of transmission by electronic mail be received at that address.

section.name: s112
section.heading: Amendment of Schedule 4

subsection.content: The Financial Secretary may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend Part 1 of Schedule 4.
The Commission may, after consultation with the Financial Secretary, by notice published in the Gazette, amend Parts 2, 3 and 4 of Schedule 4.

section.name: s112A
section.heading: Interpretation of Part IVA
section.leadIn: In this Part—
section.def: certificate of re-domiciliation (遷冊證明書) means a certificate issued under section 112ZJC(3)(b); (Added 33 of 2021 s. 3)
non-Hong Kong fund corporation (非香港基金法團) has the meaning given by section 112ZJA(1); (Added 33 of 2021 s. 3)
OFC rules (《開放式基金型公司規則》) means rules made under section 112ZK, 112ZL or 112ZM;

def.name: OpenendedFundCompany
def.leadIn: open-ended fund company (開放式基金型公司) means a collective investment scheme constituted as a corporation that holds— (Amended 33 of 2021 s. 3)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a certificate of incorporation issued under section 112C; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a certificate of re-domiciliation; (Amended 33 of 2021 s. 3)

section.def: proposed company (擬成立公司) means a company intended to be incorporated under this Part;
re-domiciled OFC (經遷冊基金型公司) means an open-ended fund company that has become such a company under Division 8A; (Added 33 of 2021 s. 3. Amended 14 of 2025 s. 243)
sub-fund (子基金)—see section 112R.

section.name: s112B
section.heading: Prohibition against carrying on business as open-ended fund company without registration etc.

subsection.leadIn: A person, not being an open-ended fund company that is registered under section 112D, must not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: carry on business as an open-ended fund company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: hold out as an open-ended fund company.

subsection.leadIn: A person must not manage any property on behalf of another person who, not being an open-ended fund company that is registered under section 112D—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: carries on business as an open-ended fund company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: holds out as an open-ended fund company.

subsection.leadIn: A person must not hold out as acting on behalf of another person who, not being an open-ended fund company that is registered under section 112D—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: carries on business as an open-ended fund company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: holds out as an open-ended fund company.

subsection.leadIn: A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $5,000,000 and to imprisonment for 7 years and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $100,000 for each day during which the offence continues; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

subsection.leadIn: A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (2) or (3) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $20,000 for each day during which the offence continues; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $2,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

division.name: D2
division.heading: Incorporation, Registration, Name and Registered Office

section.name: s112C
section.heading: Incorporation of open-ended fund company

subsection.leadIn: Any person may incorporate a company under this Part by delivering to the Registrar of Companies for registration—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an incorporation form prescribed by the OFC rules; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a copy of the instrument of incorporation of the proposed company that has been signed in accordance with the OFC rules.

subsection.leadIn: The documents specified in subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be delivered in the manner prescribed by the OFC rules; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be accompanied by any document or information prescribed by the OFC rules.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (4), if the Registrar of Companies is satisfied that the requirements for incorporation prescribed by the OFC rules are met with respect to the proposed company, the Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must register the documents delivered under subsection (1); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must issue a certificate of incorporation in respect of the proposed company certifying that it is a company incorporated under this Part.

subsection.content: The Registrar of Companies must not register the relevant documents or issue a certificate of incorporation under subsection (3) unless the Registrar has been notified of the registration of the proposed company under section 112D(7).

section.name: s112D
section.heading: Application for registration with Commission before incorporation

subsection.content: On an application by a person, the Commission may register a proposed company for the purposes of this Part.

subsection.leadIn: An application for the purposes of subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be made in the manner specified by the Commission; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be accompanied by any document or information that the Commission requires.

subsection.content: The registration of a proposed company takes effect on the day on which a certificate of incorporation is issued by the Registrar of Companies under section 112C(3)(b) in respect of it.

The Commission must refuse to register a proposed company unless it is satisfied that the requirements for registration specified in section 112E will, on the day on which the registration takes effect, be met with respect to the company.

Without limiting any other ground on which the Commission may refuse to register a proposed company, the Commission may refuse to do so if it is not satisfied that the registration is in the interest of the investing public.
On registering a proposed company, the Commission may impose any condition that it considers appropriate.
The Commission must, as soon as reasonably practicable after registering a proposed company under subsection (1), notify the Registrar of Companies in writing of the registration.
The Commission must, as soon as reasonably practicable after refusing to register a proposed company under subsection (1), notify the applicant in writing of the refusal and the reasons for it.

section.name: s112E
section.heading: Requirements for registration
section.leadIn: The requirements for registration specified for the purposes of section 112D(4) or 112ZJB(3) are— (Amended 33 of 2021 s. 4)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the requirements relating to the name of an open-ended fund company as set out in section 112H(2), (3), (4) and (5);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the requirement relating to the registered office of an open-ended fund company as set out in section 112I;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: the requirements relating to an investment manager of an open-ended fund company as set out in section 112Z;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the requirement relating to a custodian of an open-ended fund company as set out in section 112ZA(1); and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: any other requirements for registration prescribed by the OFC rules.

section.name: s112F
section.heading: Commission may amend conditions of registration
section.content: The Commission may, by notice in writing served on an open-ended fund company, amend or revoke any of the conditions imposed, or impose new conditions, in respect of its registration.

section.name: s112G
section.heading: Publication of particulars of open-ended fund company

subsection.content: The Commission may publish, in any manner it considers appropriate, particulars of an open-ended fund company.
Particulars published under subsection (1) are not subsidiary legislation.

section.name: s112H
section.heading: Name of open-ended fund company

subsection.leadIn: The name of an open-ended fund company is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the name stated in— (Amended 33 of 2021 s. 5)

subparagraph.content: for a company incorporated under section 112C—its certificate of incorporation; or
for a re-domiciled OFC—its certificate of re-domiciliation; or (Amended 33 of 2021 s. 5)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a change of name has effect under the OFC rules, its new name.

subsection.leadIn: The name of an open-ended fund company must not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the opinion of the Commission, be misleading or otherwise undesirable; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be the same as the name of another existing open-ended fund company.

subsection.content: For an open-ended fund company that has an English name only, the name must end with “Open-ended Fund Company” or “OFC”.
For an open-ended fund company that has a Chinese name only, the name must end with “開放式基金型公司”.

subsection.leadIn: For an open-ended fund company that has both an English name and a Chinese name—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the English name must end with “Open-ended Fund Company” or “OFC”; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Chinese name must end with “開放式基金型公司”.

section.name: s112I
section.heading: Registered office of open-ended fund company
section.content: An open-ended fund company must have a registered office in Hong Kong to which all communications and notices may be addressed.

section.name: s112J
section.heading: Capacity of open-ended fund company
section.content: An open-ended fund company has the capacity, rights, powers and privileges as are prescribed by the OFC rules.

section.name: s112K
section.heading: Instrument of incorporation of open-ended fund company

subsection.content: An open-ended fund company must have an instrument of incorporation prescribing regulations for the company.

subsection.leadIn: The instrument of incorporation of an open-ended fund company must contain—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a statement that the registered office of the company is situated in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the objects of the company;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: provision as to the kinds of property in which the company is to invest;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a statement that the company is an open-ended fund company with variable share capital;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a statement that the amount of the paid-up share capital of the company is at all times equal to the net asset value of the company;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: a statement that the company’s shareholders are not liable for the debts of the company;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: a statement that the company’s scheme property is entrusted to a custodian of the company for safe keeping in compliance with the law; and
any other matters prescribed by the OFC rules.

subsection.content: For an open-ended fund company with sub-funds, its instrument of incorporation must also contain a statement that the assets of a sub-fund of the company belong exclusively to the sub-fund and are not to be used to discharge the liabilities of, or the claims against, any other person, including the company and any other sub-fund of the company.

section.name: s112L
section.heading: Effect of instrument of incorporation

subsection.leadIn: Subject to this Ordinance, the instrument of incorporation of an open-ended fund company, once registered under this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: has effect as a contract under seal—

subparagraph.content: between the company and each shareholder; and
between a shareholder and each other shareholder; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is to be regarded as containing covenants on the part of the company and of each shareholder to observe all the provisions of the instrument.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (1), the instrument of incorporation of an open-ended fund company is enforceable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by the company against each shareholder;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by a shareholder against the company; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by a shareholder against each other shareholder.

subsection.leadIn: Money payable by a shareholder to an open-ended fund company under its instrument of incorporation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is a debt due from the shareholder to the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is of the nature of a specialty debt.

section.name: s112M
section.heading: Contracts made by or on behalf of open-ended fund company

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a contract that would be required by law to be in writing and under seal if made between natural persons;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a contract that would be required by law to be in writing, and to be signed by the parties to the contract, if made between natural persons; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a contract that, though made orally and not in writing, would by law be valid if made between natural persons.

subsection.leadIn: A contract specified in subsection (1)(a) may be made by an open-ended fund company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in writing under the company’s common seal (if any); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in writing executed in accordance with the OFC rules and expressed (in whatever words) to be executed by the company.

subsection.content: A contract specified in subsection (1)(b) may be made on behalf of an open-ended fund company in writing signed by any person acting with the company’s authority (whether express or implied).
A contract specified in subsection (1)(c) may be made on behalf of an open-ended fund company orally by any person acting with the company’s authority (whether express or implied).

subsection.leadIn: A contract made by or on behalf of an open-ended fund company in accordance with this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is effective in law; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: binds the company and its successors and all other parties to the contract.

subsection.content: A contract made in accordance with this section may be varied or discharged in the same manner in which it is authorized by this section to be made.

section.name: s112N
section.heading: Contracts made before open-ended fund company’s incorporation

subsection.content: This section applies if a contract purports to have been made in the name or on behalf of an open-ended fund company before the company was incorporated.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to any express agreement to the contrary—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the contract has effect as a contract made by the person purporting to act for the company or as an agent for the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person is personally liable on the contract and is entitled to enforce the contract.

subsection.leadIn: After incorporation, the company may ratify the contract to the same extent as if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the company had already been incorporated when the contract was made; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the contract had been made on the company’s behalf by an agent acting without the company’s authority.

subsection.content: Despite subsection (2)(b), if the contract is ratified by the company, then on and after the ratification, the liability of the person mentioned in that subsection is not greater than the liability that the person would have incurred if the person had made the contract after the company’s incorporation as an agent acting without the company’s authority.

section.name: s112O
section.heading: Contracts made after cancellation of registration
section.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an open-ended fund company makes a contract after its registration has been cancelled under section 112ZH or 112ZI; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the company fails to comply with any obligation under the contract within 21 days of being called on to do so by the other party to the contract,

section.continued: the person who has authorized the contract is liable, and if the contract was authorized by 2 or more persons, they are jointly and severally liable, to indemnify that other party in respect of any loss or damage suffered by that other party by reason of the company’s failure to comply with the obligation.

section.name: s112P
section.heading: Share capital of open-ended fund company

subsection.content: An open-ended fund company may issue shares.
Shares in an open-ended fund company have no nominal value.
The amount of the paid-up share capital of an open-ended fund company is at all times equal to the net asset value of the company.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: net asset value (淨資產值), in relation to an open-ended fund company, means the balance after deducting the total liabilities of the company from its total assets.

section.name: s112Q
section.heading: Shareholders’ liability
section.content: The liability of the shareholders of an open-ended fund company is limited to any amount unpaid on the shares held by the shareholders.

section.name: s112R
section.heading: Sub-funds of open-ended fund company

subsection.content: The instrument of incorporation of an open-ended fund company may provide for the division of its scheme property into separate parts.
Each separate part of the scheme property of an open-ended fund company is a sub-fund of the company.

section.name: s112S
section.heading: Segregated liability of sub-funds

subsection.content: The assets of a sub-fund of an open-ended fund company belong exclusively to the sub-fund and must not be used to discharge the liabilities of, or the claims against, any other person, including the company and any other sub-fund of the company.
Any liability incurred on behalf of, or attributable to, a sub-fund of an open-ended fund company may only be discharged out of the assets of the sub-fund.

A provision contained in the instrument of incorporation of an open-ended fund company, or in a contract or any other instrument made or executed by an open-ended fund company, is void to the extent that it is inconsistent with subsection (1) or (2).
An application of, or agreement to apply, assets of a sub-fund of an open-ended fund company in contravention of subsection (1) or (2) is void.

subsection.leadIn: An open-ended fund company with sub-funds may allocate any assets or liabilities that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: it receives or incurs—

subparagraph.content: on behalf of its sub-funds; or
in order to enable the operation of its sub-funds; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: are not attributable to any particular sub-fund,

subsection.continued: between its sub-funds in a manner that it considers is fair to its shareholders.

subsection.content: A sub-fund of an open-ended fund company is not a legal person separate from the company but the assets of the sub-fund may be subject to orders of the court as if it were a separate legal person.

Without affecting subsections (1) and (2) and except as provided by the OFC rules, an open-ended fund company may sue and be sued in respect of any sub-fund of the company and may exercise the same rights of set-off in relation to the sub-fund as apply in respect of companies.

division.name: D7
division.heading: Directors, Investment Manager, Custodian, Sub-custodian and Auditor

section.name: s112T
section.heading: Interpretation of Division 7 of Part IVA
section.leadIn: In this Division—
section.def: misconduct (失當行為)—(a)in relation to a director of an open-ended fund company, means negligence, default, breach of duty or breach of trust on the part of the director occurring in the course of performing duties as a director in relation to the company;(b)in relation to an investment manager of an open-ended fund company, means negligence, default, breach of duty or breach of trust on the part of the investment manager occurring in the course of performing duties as an investment manager in relation to the company;(c)in relation to a custodian of an open-ended fund company, means negligence, default, breach of duty or breach of trust on the part of the custodian occurring in the course of performing duties as a custodian in relation to the company;(d)in relation to a sub-custodian of an open-ended fund company, means negligence, default, breach of duty or breach of trust on the part of the sub-custodian occurring in the course of performing duties as a sub-custodian in relation to the company; and(e)in relation to an auditor of an open-ended fund company, means negligence, default, breach of duty or breach of trust on the part of the auditor occurring in the course of performing duties as an auditor in relation to the company;

specified officer (指明人員), in relation to an open-ended fund company, means—(a)a director of the company;(b)an investment manager of the company;(c)a custodian of the company;(d)a sub-custodian of the company; or(e)an auditor of the company.

section.name: s112U
section.heading: Directors

subsection.content: An open-ended fund company must have at least 2 directors.

subsection.leadIn: The first directors of an open-ended fund company are the persons named as directors in— (Amended 33 of 2021 s. 6)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a company incorporated under section 112C—the incorporation form delivered to the Registrar of Companies under section 112C(1)(a); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a re-domiciled OFC—the re-domiciliation form delivered to the Registrar of Companies under section 112ZJC(1)(a). (Amended 33 of 2021 s. 6)

subsection.leadIn: A director of an open-ended fund company owes the open-ended fund company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the same fiduciary duties that are owed by a director of an ordinary company to the ordinary company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the duty to exercise reasonable care, skill and diligence that is owed by a director of an ordinary company to the ordinary company under section 465 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622).

subsection.content: In the case of a breach or threatened breach by a director of an open-ended fund company of any of the director’s duties referred to in subsection (3), the director is liable to the same consequences as would apply if the director were a director of an ordinary company.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: ordinary company (普通公司) means a company formed and registered under the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622).

section.name: s112V
section.heading: Restrictions on body corporate being director

subsection.content: A body corporate must not be appointed a director of an open-ended fund company.
An appointment made in contravention of subsection (1) is void.

subsection.leadIn: However, this section does not affect any liability of a body corporate under this Ordinance for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: purporting to act as a director of an open-ended fund company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: acting as a shadow director of an open-ended fund company.

section.name: s112W
section.heading: Minimum age for appointment as director

subsection.content: A person must not be appointed a director of an open-ended fund company unless at the time of appointment the person has attained the age of 18 years.
An appointment made in contravention of subsection (1) is void.

subsection.leadIn: However, this section does not affect any liability of a person below the age of 18 years under this Ordinance for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: purporting to act as a director of an open-ended fund company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: acting as a shadow director of an open-ended fund company.

section.name: s112X
section.heading: Provisions as to undischarged bankrupt acting as director

subsection.leadIn: A person who is an undischarged bankrupt must not, except with the leave of the Court of First Instance by which the person was adjudged bankrupt—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: act as a director of an open-ended fund company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: directly or indirectly, be concerned, or take part, in the management of an open-ended fund company.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $700,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine of $150,000 and to imprisonment for 1 year.

subsection.content: The Court of First Instance must not give leave for the purposes of this section unless a notice of the intention to apply for it has been served on the Official Receiver.

If the Official Receiver is of opinion that it is contrary to the public interest that an application for leave should be granted, the Official Receiver must attend the hearing of, and oppose the granting of, the application.

section.name: s112Y
section.heading: Validity of acts of director

subsection.leadIn: The acts of a person acting as a director of an open-ended fund company are valid even though it is afterwards discovered—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that there was a defect in the appointment of the person as a director;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the person was not qualified to hold office as a director or was disqualified from holding office as a director;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that the person had ceased to hold office as a director; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: that the person was not entitled to vote on the matter in question.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) applies even if the appointment of the person as a director is void under section 112V or 112W.

section.name: s112Z
section.heading: Investment manager

subsection.content: An open-ended fund company must have an investment manager who is responsible for managing the scheme property of the company.
An investment manager of an open-ended fund company must be an intermediary licensed or registered for Type 9 regulated activity.

section.name: s112ZA
section.heading: Custodian

subsection.content: An open-ended fund company must have a custodian.
All the scheme property of an open-ended fund company must be entrusted to a custodian of the company for safe keeping.
Despite subsection (2), any scheme property of a class or description specified by the Commission for the purposes of this subsection is not required to be entrusted to a custodian.

A custodian of an open-ended fund company must take reasonable care, skill and diligence to ensure the safe keeping of the scheme property of the company that is entrusted to the custodian under subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: This section does not prohibit either of the following persons from entrusting, by an agreement in writing, to another person for safe keeping any or all of the scheme property of an open-ended fund company that is entrusted to the first-mentioned person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a custodian of the company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person to whom any scheme property of the company is entrusted for safe keeping under an agreement in writing, other than the custodian of the company.

section.name: s112ZB
section.heading: Auditor
section.content: An open-ended fund company must appoint an auditor for each financial year of the company.

section.name: s112ZC
section.heading: Provision protecting specified officer from liability void

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to a provision contained in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the instrument of incorporation of an open-ended fund company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a contract, or any other instrument, made or executed by an open-ended fund company.

subsection.content: If a provision purports to exempt a specified officer of the company from any liability that would otherwise attach to the officer in connection with the officer’s misconduct, the provision is void.

If, by a provision, the company directly or indirectly provides an indemnity for a specified officer of the company against any liability attaching to the officer in connection with the officer’s misconduct, the provision is void.

section.name: s112ZD
section.heading: Court of First Instance may grant specified officer relief in proceedings for misconduct

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if, in any proceedings for any misconduct against a specified officer of an open-ended fund company, it appears to the Court of First Instance that the officer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is or may be liable for the misconduct;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has acted honestly and reasonably; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: ought fairly to be excused for the misconduct, having regard to all the circumstances of the case (including those connected with the officer’s appointment).

subsection.content: The Court of First Instance may relieve the specified officer, either wholly or partly, from the liability on any terms that the Court thinks fit.

subsection.leadIn: If the case is tried by a judge with a jury, the judge may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: withdraw the case in whole or in part from the jury; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: direct judgment to be entered for the specified officer on any terms as to costs or otherwise that the judge thinks fit.

subsection.content: To avoid doubt, this section does not apply in relation to criminal proceedings.

section.name: s112ZE
section.heading: Court of First Instance may grant specified officer relief for misconduct on specified officer’s application

subsection.content: A specified officer of an open-ended fund company may apply to the Court of First Instance for relief if the officer has reason to apprehend that a claim will or might be made against the officer for any misconduct.

subsection.leadIn: On an application by a specified officer of an open-ended fund company, the Court of First Instance may relieve the officer, either wholly or partly, from the liability on any terms that the Court thinks fit if it appears to the Court that the officer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is or may be liable for the misconduct;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has acted honestly and reasonably; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: ought fairly to be excused for the misconduct, having regard to all the circumstances of the case (including those connected with the officer’s appointment).

section.name: s112ZF
section.heading: Commission’s power to give directions

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may, by notice in writing, give any of the directions specified in subsection (2) if it appears to the Commission that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: with respect to an open-ended fund company, any of the requirements for registration specified in section 112E is no longer met;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: an open-ended fund company or a director, an investment manager, a custodian or a sub-custodian of an open-ended fund company has contravened—

subparagraph.content: any of the relevant provisions;
any notice or requirement given or made by the Commission under or pursuant to this Ordinance; or
any of the conditions imposed in respect of the registration of the company;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: an open-ended fund company or a director, an investment manager, a custodian or a sub-custodian of an open-ended fund company has, in purported compliance with—

subparagraph.content: any of the relevant provisions;
any notice or requirement given or made by the Commission under or pursuant to this Ordinance; or
any of the conditions imposed in respect of the registration of the company,

paragraph.continued: knowingly or recklessly provided to the Commission any information that is false or misleading in a material particular;

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.content: an investment manager of an open-ended fund company has, in purported compliance with any of the terms and conditions of its licence or registration under this Ordinance, knowingly or recklessly provided to the Commission any information that is false or misleading in a material particular; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: it is desirable to do so in order to protect the interest of the investing public.

subsection.leadIn: The directions are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a direction to the company or its investment manager that the company is to cease to issue or redeem, or cease to issue and redeem, shares or any class of shares in the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a direction to a director of the company that the director is to cease to transfer shares or any class of shares in the company to or from, or to and from, the director’s own holding of shares.

subsection.content: The Commission may, by notice in writing served on the person to whom a direction is given under this section, amend or revoke the direction.

subsection.leadIn: A direction given under subsection (1), or an amendment or revocation of such a direction under subsection (3), takes effect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at the time of the service of the notice in respect of the direction, amendment or revocation; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a later time is specified in the notice, at that time.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (6), if the registration of an open-ended fund company is cancelled under section 112ZH or 112ZI while a direction given under this section in relation to the company is in force—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the direction is not to be affected in any respect by the cancellation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: this section continues to apply to the company as if its registration had not been cancelled.

subsection.content: If an order for the winding up of an open-ended fund company is made by the court under section 212 or the OFC rules, a direction given under this section in relation to the company ceases to have effect on the making of the order.

section.name: s112ZG
section.heading: Application to Court of First Instance in respect of failure to comply with direction

subsection.leadIn: If a person fails to comply with a direction given under section 112ZF, the Commission may apply to the Court of First Instance in respect of the failure and the Court may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if satisfied that there is no reasonable excuse for the person not to comply with the direction, order the person to comply with the direction within the period specified by the Court; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if satisfied that the failure was without reasonable excuse, punish the person, and any other person knowingly involved in the failure, in the same manner as if the person and, if applicable, that other person had been guilty of contempt of court.

subsection.leadIn: If there is a reasonable likelihood that a person will fail to comply with a direction given under section 112ZF, the Commission may apply to the Court of First Instance for an order that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other person whom the Court is satisfied is able to procure the person to comply with the direction,

subsection.continued: take any action or refrain from taking any action that the Court directs.

subsection.content: An application under this section must be made by originating summons in Form No. 10 in Appendix A to the Rules of the High Court (Cap. 4 sub. leg. A).

section.name: s112ZH
section.heading: Commission’s power to cancel registration on open-ended fund company’s application

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), the Commission must cancel the registration under section 112D of an open-ended fund company on an application made by the company in accordance with the OFC rules.

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may refuse to cancel the registration of an open-ended fund company if it considers that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is in the public interest that any matter concerning the company should be investigated before its registration is so cancelled; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the cancellation would not be in the interest of the investing public.

subsection.content: On cancelling the registration of an open-ended fund company, the Commission may impose any condition that it considers appropriate.

The Commission may, by notice in writing served on an open-ended fund company the registration of which is cancelled, amend or revoke any of the conditions imposed, or impose new conditions, in respect of the cancellation.
The Commission must not exercise a power under subsection (2), (3) or (4) in relation to an open-ended fund company without first giving the company a reasonable opportunity to be heard.
If the Commission cancels the registration of an open-ended fund company, it must notify the company in writing of the cancellation.
If the Commission exercises a power under subsection (2), (3) or (4) in relation to an open-ended fund company, it must notify the company in writing of the exercise and the reasons for it.

subsection.leadIn: If the Commission cancels the registration of an open-ended fund company, it—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must, as soon as reasonably practicable after cancelling the registration, notify the Registrar of Companies in writing of the cancellation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may publish notice of the cancellation and the reason for the cancellation in any manner that it considers appropriate.

section.name: s112ZI
section.heading: Commission’s power to cancel registration otherwise than on open-ended fund company’s application

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may cancel the registration under section 112D of an open-ended fund company if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: it appears to the Commission that the company or a director, an investment manager, a custodian or a sub-custodian of the company has contravened—

subparagraph.content: any of the relevant provisions;
any notice or requirement given or made by the Commission under or pursuant to this Ordinance; or
any of the conditions imposed in respect of the registration of the company;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: it appears to the Commission that the company or a director, an investment manager, a custodian or a sub-custodian of the company has, in purported compliance with—

subparagraph.content: any of the relevant provisions;
any notice or requirement given or made by the Commission under or pursuant to this Ordinance; or
any of the conditions imposed in respect of the registration of the company,

paragraph.continued: knowingly or recklessly provided to the Commission any information that is false or misleading in a material particular;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the Commission is not satisfied that the continued registration of the company is in the interest of the investing public; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: an order for the winding up of the company has been made by the court under the OFC rules.

subsection.content: On cancelling the registration of an open-ended fund company, the Commission may impose any condition that it considers appropriate.

The Commission may, by notice in writing served on an open-ended fund company the registration of which is cancelled, amend or revoke any of the conditions imposed, or impose new conditions, in respect of the cancellation.
The Commission must not exercise a power under subsection (1), (2) or (3) in relation to an open-ended fund company without first giving the company a reasonable opportunity to be heard.
If the Commission exercises a power under subsection (1), (2) or (3) in relation to an open-ended fund company, it must notify the company in writing of the exercise and the reasons for it.

subsection.leadIn: If the Commission cancels the registration of an open-ended fund company, it—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must, as soon as reasonably practicable after cancelling the registration, notify the Registrar of Companies in writing of the cancellation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may publish notice of the cancellation and the reasons for the cancellation in any manner that it considers appropriate.

section.name: s112ZJ
section.heading: Permission to carry on essential business operations on cancellation of registration

subsection.content: The Commission may, by notice in writing served on an open-ended fund company the registration of which has been cancelled under section 112ZH or 112ZI, permit the company to carry on essential business operations.
On giving permission to an open-ended fund company, the Commission may impose any condition that it considers appropriate.
A condition imposed under subsection (3) must be specified in the notice in respect of the permission.

subsection.leadIn: A permission given or a condition imposed in respect of it under subsection (3) takes effect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at the time of the service of the notice in respect of the permission; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a later time is specified in the notice, at that time.

subsection.content: The Commission may, by notice in writing served on an open-ended fund company to which permission is given, amend or revoke any of the conditions imposed, or impose new conditions, in respect of the permission.

subsection.leadIn: An amendment or revocation of a condition, or a new condition imposed, under subsection (6) takes effect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at the time of the service of the notice in respect of the amendment or revocation of the condition or the imposition of the new condition; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a later time is specified in the notice, at that time.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: essential business operations (必要的業務運作), in relation to an open-ended fund company, means business operations that are essential for closing down its business.

section.name: s112ZJA
section.heading: Interpretation of Division 8A of Part IVA

subsection.leadIn: In this Division—

def.name: NonHongKongFundCorporation
def.leadIn: non-Hong Kong fund corporation (非香港基金法團)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: means a collective investment scheme constituted as a corporation that is incorporated outside Hong Kong as at the application date; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: does not include a re-domiciled company; (Replaced 14 of 2025 s. 244)

def.name: PlaceOfIncorporation
def.leadIn: place of incorporation (成立地), in relation to a non-Hong Kong fund corporation, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the jurisdiction outside Hong Kong in which the corporation is incorporated and under the law of which the corporation is registered as at the application date; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the corporation has, after its incorporation, transferred its domicile to a jurisdiction outside Hong Kong, and is registered under the law of that jurisdiction as at the application date—that jurisdiction;

subsection.def: re-domiciliation date (遷冊日期) means the date on which the certificate of re-domiciliation is issued.

subsection.content: In this Division, a reference to registration under the law of a jurisdiction outside Hong Kong includes any permission or authorization (however described) of a similar nature under the law of that jurisdiction.

section.name: s112ZJB
section.heading: Registration with Commission before re-domiciliation

subsection.content: On an application by a non-Hong Kong fund corporation, the Commission may register the corporation for the purposes of this Part.

subsection.leadIn: An application for the purposes of subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be made in the manner specified by the Commission; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be accompanied by any document or information that the Commission requires.

subsection.content: The Commission must refuse to register a non-Hong Kong fund corporation under subsection (1) unless it is satisfied that the requirements for registration specified in section 112E will, on the re-domiciliation date, be met in relation to the intended OFC.

Without limiting any other ground on which the Commission may refuse to register a non-Hong Kong fund corporation under subsection (1), the Commission may refuse to so register the corporation if it is not satisfied that the registration is in the interest of the investing public.
On registering a non-Hong Kong fund corporation under subsection (1), the Commission may impose any condition that it considers appropriate.
The Commission must, as soon as reasonably practicable after registering a non-Hong Kong fund corporation under subsection (1), notify the Registrar of Companies in writing of the registration.

The Commission must, as soon as reasonably practicable after refusing to register a non-Hong Kong fund corporation under subsection (1), notify the corporation in writing of the refusal and the reasons for it.
A registration under subsection (1) takes effect on the re-domiciliation date.

subsection.leadIn: Once a registration under subsection (1) has taken effect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the registration is taken to be a registration under section 112D(1) that has taken effect; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a condition imposed under subsection (5) is taken to be a condition imposed under section 112D(6).

section.name: s112ZJC
section.heading: Issue of certificate of re-domiciliation by Registrar of Companies

subsection.leadIn: A non-Hong Kong fund corporation may apply for a certificate of re-domiciliation by delivering to the Registrar of Companies for registration—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a re-domiciliation form prescribed by the OFC rules; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a copy of the instrument of incorporation of the intended OFC that has been signed in accordance with the OFC rules.

subsection.leadIn: The documents specified in subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be delivered in the manner prescribed by the OFC rules; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be accompanied by any document or information prescribed by the OFC rules.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (4), if the Registrar of Companies is satisfied that the requirements for issuing a certificate of re-domiciliation prescribed by the OFC rules are met in relation to the non-Hong Kong fund corporation, the Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must register the documents delivered under subsection (1); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must issue a certificate of re-domiciliation to the corporation certifying that it has become an open-ended fund company.

subsection.content: The Registrar of Companies must not take any action under subsection (3) unless the Registrar has been notified of the registration of the non-Hong Kong fund corporation under section 112ZJB(6).

section.name: s112ZJD
section.heading: Effect of re-domiciliation

subsection.leadIn: On the re-domiciliation date of a non-Hong Kong fund corporation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the corporation becomes, and continues as a body corporate as, a re-domiciled OFC; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: this Ordinance applies accordingly to the re-domiciled OFC.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not operate to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: create a new legal entity;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: prejudice or affect the identity or continuity of the non-Hong Kong fund corporation as a corporation registered in its place of incorporation;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: affect any contract made, resolution passed or any other thing done by or in relation to the corporation;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: affect any function, property, right, privilege, obligation or liability acquired, accrued or incurred by or to the corporation; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: render defective any legal proceedings commenced or continued by or against the corporation.

subsection.content: To avoid doubt, on and after the re-domiciliation date, any legal proceedings that could have been commenced or continued by or against the non-Hong Kong fund corporation may be commenced or continued by or against the re-domiciled OFC.

subsection.leadIn: To avoid doubt—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: with effect from the re-domiciliation date, all property of the non-Hong Kong fund corporation is the property of the re-domiciled OFC; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for tax purposes, the operation of this section does not amount to—

subparagraph.content: a transfer of assets of the corporation; or
a change in the beneficial ownership of those assets.

subsection.leadIn: If the non-Hong Kong fund corporation is registered as a registered non-Hong Kong company under Part 16 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622) immediately before its re-domiciliation date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the registration ceases to have effect on the re-domiciliation date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the re-domiciled OFC is not to be regarded as a non-Hong Kong company (as defined by section 2(1) of that Ordinance).

section.name: s112ZJE
section.heading: Deregistration in place of incorporation

subsection.content: As soon as practicable after the re-domiciliation date of a non-Hong Kong fund corporation, the corporation, which has become a re-domiciled OFC, must take all reasonable steps to procure its deregistration in its place of incorporation.

subsection.leadIn: Within 60 days after the re-domiciliation date, the non-Hong Kong fund corporation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be deregistered in its place of incorporation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must submit to the Commission a document evidencing the deregistration to the satisfaction of the Commission.

subsection.content: On an application by the non-Hong Kong fund corporation, the Commission may extend the 60-day period mentioned in subsection (2) subject to any condition that the Commission considers appropriate.

section.name: s112ZK
section.heading: Commission’s power to make rules

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may make rules to provide for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the carrying on of collective investments by means of open-ended fund companies; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the regulation of open-ended fund companies.

subsection.leadIn: Rules made under subsection (1) may provide for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the requirements for incorporation of proposed companies;

paragraph.name: ab
paragraph.content: the requirements for issuing a certificate of re-domiciliation; (Added 33 of 2021 s. 8)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the requirements for registration of proposed companies or non-Hong Kong fund corporations with the Commission; (Amended 33 of 2021 s. 8)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the naming of open-ended fund companies;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the change of names of open-ended fund companies;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the capacity, objects, powers, privileges, rights and liabilities of open-ended fund companies;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the instruments of incorporation of open-ended fund companies, including the form of such instruments;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the requirements relating to the execution of documents by open-ended fund companies;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the types of investments that open-ended fund companies may make;
the management and operation of open-ended fund companies, including their administration and procedure;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: the management of the scheme property of open-ended fund companies;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: the accounting and reporting requirements with which open-ended fund companies must comply;
the making or issue of statements, certificates or other documents by open-ended fund companies and their officers;

paragraph.name: m
paragraph.content: the keeping of accounts and records by open-ended fund companies, and the inspection of such accounts and records;

paragraph.name: n
o
p
paragraph.content: the requirements relating to segregating the liabilities of sub-funds of an open-ended fund company; and

paragraph.name: q
paragraph.content: the cross investments between sub-funds of an open-ended fund company.

subsection.leadIn: Rules made under subsection (1) may also provide for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the rights, powers and liabilities of a shareholder of an open-ended fund company;

paragraph.name: b
c
d
e
paragraph.content: the notification of the appointment and removal of a director, an investment manager, a custodian, a sub-custodian or an auditor of an open-ended fund company; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the notification of changes in the particulars of a director, an investment manager, a custodian, a sub-custodian or an auditor of an open-ended fund company.

subsection.leadIn: Rules made under subsection (1) may also provide for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the procedures to be followed in relation to the giving, amendment and revocation of directions under section 112ZF;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: the merger of 2 or more open-ended fund companies and the reorganization of an open-ended fund company into 2 or more open-ended fund companies;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: matters relating to the arrangements and compromises entered into, or proposed to be entered into, by open-ended fund companies, including the Commission’s right to be heard in the related court process and the registration of arrangements and compromises with the Registrar of Companies;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the winding up and dissolution of open-ended fund companies, including the grounds and procedures for such winding up and dissolution;

paragraph.name: f
g
paragraph.content: the power of the Court of First Instance to make an order to disqualify a person from acting in any capacity in relation to open-ended fund companies or the scheme property of open-ended fund companies, or from acting in any capacity in the promotion or incorporation of proposed companies or in the process for a non-Hong Kong fund corporation to become a re-domiciled OFC; (Amended 33 of 2021 s. 8)

paragraph.name: h

paragraph.content: a court’s functions in relation to any matter concerning open-ended fund companies and sub-funds of open-ended fund companies; and

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: any other thing that, under this Part, is required or permitted to be prescribed or provided by rules.

subsection.content: Rules made under this section may provide that a person is not excused from complying with a requirement to produce a document or information imposed on the person under those rules only on the ground that to do so might tend to incriminate the person.
Subsections (2), (3), (4) and (5) do not have the effect of limiting subsection (1).

section.name: s112ZL
section.heading: Rules made with consent of Registrar of Companies

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may, with the consent of the Registrar of Companies, make rules to provide for the functions of the Registrar in relation to open-ended fund companies, including—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: specifying requirements in relation to documents and information required or authorized to be delivered to the Registrar;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: keeping records of documents and information relating to open-ended fund companies;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: keeping a list of the names of open-ended fund companies;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: establishing and maintaining a register of open-ended fund companies;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: making available the OFC register for public inspection;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: issuing copies or certified true copies of documents and information on the OFC register;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: requiring an open-ended fund company to resolve any inconsistency between information contained in a document registered by the Registrar in respect of the company and any other information relating to the company on the OFC register;
ensuring that the OFC register is accurate and up-to-date;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: annotating the OFC register;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: issuing certificates of change of name; and
destroying or disposing of documents and information delivered to the Registrar for registration.

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may also, with the consent of the Registrar of Companies, make rules to provide for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the registration by the Registrar of documents delivered by or on behalf of proposed companies, non-Hong Kong fund corporations and open-ended fund companies; (Amended 33 of 2021 s. 9)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: appeals to the Court of First Instance against a decision of the Registrar to refuse registration of a document;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the information to be contained in the OFC register;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the withholding of information on the OFC register from public inspection, and the use and disclosure of the withheld information;

paragraph.name: e
f
paragraph.content: the Registrar taking part in the proceedings for an order mentioned in paragraph (e) before the Court of First Instance;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the forms of the certificates issued by the Registrar;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the admissibility in evidence in judicial or other proceedings of documents and information certified to be true by the Registrar;
the delivery of documents and information required or authorized to be delivered to the Registrar by electronic means;

paragraph.name: j
k
paragraph.content: inquiry by the Registrar into acts that would constitute offences relating to the giving of any misleading, false or deceptive information or statement to the Registrar and the delegation of the Registrar’s powers to inquire into such acts;

calculation of the daily fine imposed under rules made under this section or section 112ZK or 112ZM that make it an offence for failing to comply with a requirement to deliver a document or information to the Registrar under those rules and that impose a fine for each day during which the offence continues;

paragraph.name: m
paragraph.content: the issue of guidelines by the Registrar and the effect of such guidelines; and

paragraph.name: n
paragraph.content: the protection and immunity of the Registrar, other public officers and other persons.

subsection.content: Rules made under this section may provide that a person is not excused from complying with a requirement to produce a document or information imposed on the person under those rules only on the ground that to do so might tend to incriminate the person.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: OFC register (《開放式基金型公司登記冊》) means the register of open-ended fund companies maintained by the Registrar of Companies under rules made under this section.

section.name: s112ZM
section.heading: Rules made with consent of Official Receiver
section.leadIn: The Commission may, with the consent of the Official Receiver, make rules to provide for the functions of the Official Receiver in relation to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the winding up and dissolution of open-ended fund companies; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the winding up and dissolution of sub-funds of open-ended fund companies.

section.name: s112ZN
section.heading: OFC rules may prescribe offences

subsection.leadIn: The OFC rules may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: make it an offence for a person to do, or omit to do, any specified act; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provide that the offence is punishable by a fine, imprisonment or both.

subsection.content: The OFC rules may provide for defences to any offence prescribed by those rules.

For an offence punishable on conviction on indictment, the maximum fine that may be prescribed is $1,000,000 and the maximum imprisonment that may be prescribed is 7 years. In addition, in the case of a continuing offence, a further fine not exceeding level 6 for each day during which the offence continues may be prescribed.

For an offence punishable on summary conviction, the maximum fine that may be prescribed is $500,000 and the maximum imprisonment that may be prescribed is 2 years. In addition, in the case of a continuing offence, a further fine not exceeding level 3 for each day during which the offence continues may be prescribed.

section.name: s112ZO
section.heading: Modification or waiver of requirements of OFC rules by notice

subsection.content: The Commission may, on an application by a person specified in subsection (2), grant a modification or waiver in relation to the person in respect of any of the requirements of the OFC rules.

subsection.leadIn: The person is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an open-ended fund company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a director of an open-ended fund company;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an investment manager of an open-ended fund company;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a custodian of an open-ended fund company;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a sub-custodian of an open-ended fund company; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: an auditor of an open-ended fund company.

subsection.leadIn: An application for the purposes of subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be made in the manner prescribed by the OFC rules; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be accompanied by the fee prescribed by regulations made under section 112ZQ for the purposes of this section.

subsection.content: The Commission may only grant a modification or waiver if it is satisfied that the modification or waiver will not prejudice the interest of the investing public.

The grant of a modification or waiver in relation to a person is to be effected by a notice in writing served on the person specifying the period (if any) for which the modification or waiver is in force.
On granting a modification or waiver, the Commission may impose any condition that it considers appropriate.
The Commission may, by notice in writing served on a person in relation to whom a modification or waiver is granted, amend or revoke the modification or waiver.

The Commission may, by notice in writing served on a person in relation to whom a modification or waiver is granted, amend or revoke any of the conditions imposed, or impose new conditions, in respect of the modification or waiver.
A person who contravenes a condition imposed under subsection (6) or (8), or as amended under subsection (8), commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6.

section.name: s112ZP
section.heading: Modification or waiver of requirements of OFC rules by rules

subsection.content: The Commission may by rules grant a modification or waiver, in relation to a class of open-ended fund companies, or a class of directors, investment managers, custodians, sub-custodians or auditors of open-ended fund companies, in respect of any of the requirements of the OFC rules.
The Commission may only grant a modification or waiver if it is satisfied that the modification or waiver will not prejudice the interest of the investing public.
The Commission may specify in the rules the conditions subject to which a modification or waiver is granted.

subsection.leadIn: The rules may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: make it an offence for a person to contravene any of the conditions specified in respect of a modification or waiver; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provide that the offence is punishable by a fine not exceeding level 6.

section.name: s112ZQ
