section.heading: Financial Secretary may make regulations relating to fees

subsection.leadIn: Despite section 395, the Financial Secretary may make regulations to provide for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the charging or collecting of fees by the Commission—

subparagraph.content: in respect of any things done, or services provided, by the Commission in connection with any other matters specified in the OFC rules;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the charging or collecting of fees by the Registrar of Companies—

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the charging or collecting of fees by the Official Receiver—

subparagraph.content: in respect of any things done, or services provided, by the Official Receiver in performing the Official Receiver’s functions under this Part or the OFC rules; or
in respect of any things done, or services provided, by the Official Receiver in connection with any other matters specified in the OFC rules.

subsection.leadIn: The regulations may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: provide for the amount of the fees to be fixed by or determined under the regulations;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provide for different fees to be payable in respect of the same matter in different circumstances;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: specify when and how fees are to be paid; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: provide for the waiver of payment of any fee prescribed by the regulations, either generally or in a particular case.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar of Companies—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: may, subject to the approval of the Financial Secretary, determine what fees are chargeable in respect of the things done, or services provided—

subparagraph.content: for which fees are not provided for by the regulations; or
in circumstances other than those for which fees are provided by the regulations; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may charge such fees.

section.name: s112ZR
section.heading: Commission may publish codes and guidelines

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may publish, in the Gazette and in any other manner it considers appropriate, any code or guideline to provide guidance in respect of any matter relating to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the incorporation, registration, management and operation of open-ended fund companies, including their administration and procedure; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the business of open-ended fund companies.

subsection.content: Without limiting subsection (1), a code or guideline published under that subsection may refer to obligations to observe any other codes or guidelines issued, or requirements imposed, otherwise than by the Commission.
The Commission may amend any code or guideline published under subsection (1).
Any amendments made to a code or guideline published under subsection (1) must be published in the Gazette and in any other manner the Commission considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: A code or guideline published under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: may be of general or special application and, in particular, may be made so as to apply, or so as not to apply—

subparagraph.content: to a specified extent in relation to a specified person or to members of a specified class of persons; or
in specified circumstances; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may make different provisions for different circumstances and provide for different cases or classes of cases.

subsection.content: A code or guideline published under subsection (1) and all amendments made to it are not subsidiary legislation.

section.name: s112ZS
section.heading: Effect of codes and guidelines

subsection.content: A failure by a person to comply with a provision in a code or guideline does not itself make the person liable to any judicial or other proceedings.

subsection.leadIn: However, a failure on the part of an intermediary acting as an investment manager of an open-ended fund company, or a representative of such an intermediary, to comply with a provision in a code or guideline may be taken into account in considering, for the purposes of any provision of this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of an intermediary, whether it is a fit and proper person to be or to remain licensed or registered;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a representative of an intermediary that is a licensed corporation, whether he or she is a fit and proper person to be or to remain licensed as a representative; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of a representative of an intermediary that is a registered institution, whether he or she is a fit and proper person to be or to remain a person whose name is entered in the register maintained by the Monetary Authority under section 20 of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155) as that of a person engaged by a registered institution in respect of a regulated activity.

subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (1), in any proceedings under this Ordinance before a court—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a code or guideline is admissible in evidence; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if any provision in a code or guideline appears to the court to be relevant to a question arising in the proceedings, the provision is to be taken into account in determining the question.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: code or guideline (守則或指引) means a code or guideline published under section 112ZR.

section.name: s112ZT
section.heading: Offence of fraudulent trading

subsection.leadIn: If any business of an open-ended fund company is carried on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: with intent to defraud creditors of the company or creditors of any other person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for any fraudulent purpose,

subsection.continued: every person who is knowingly a party to the carrying on of the business with that intent or for that purpose commits an offence.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $10,000,000 and to imprisonment for 10 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 3 years.

subsection.content: This section applies whether or not the open-ended fund company has been, or is in the course of being, wound up.

section.name: s113
section.heading: Interpretation of Part V

subsection.leadIn: In this Part, unless the context otherwise requires—

def.name: ExecutiveDirector
def.leadIn: executive director (執行董事), in relation to a licensed corporation, means a director of the corporation who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: actively participates in; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is responsible for directly supervising,

def.continued: the business of a regulated activity for which the corporation is licensed;

subsection.def: prescribed fee (訂明費用) means a fee prescribed by rules made under section 395;
prescribed manner (訂明方式) means such manner as is prescribed by rules made under section 397;
principal (主事人), in relation to a licensed representative, means the licensed corporation to which the representative is accredited;

regulated function (受規管職能), in relation to a regulated activity carried on as a business by any person, means any function performed for or on behalf of or by arrangement with the person relating to the regulated activity, other than work ordinarily performed by an accountant, clerk or cashier;
specified titles (指明稱銜) means the titles specified in column 3 of Schedule 6.

subsection.leadIn: In this Part, a reference to a licence to carry on a regulated activity shall be construed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a licensed corporation, as a licence to carry on a business in the regulated activity; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a licensed representative, as a licence to perform for or on behalf of or by arrangement with a licensed corporation to which he is accredited any regulated function in relation to the regulated activity.

subsection.content: Registration for a regulated activity under section 119 shall be construed as registration for carrying on a business in the regulated activity.

section.name: s114
section.heading: Restriction on carrying on business in regulated activities, etc.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (2), (5) and (6), no person shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: carry on a business in a regulated activity; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: hold himself out as carrying on a business in a regulated activity.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) shall not apply to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a corporation licensed under section 116 or 117 for the regulated activity;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an authorized financial institution registered under section 119 for the regulated activity; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a person authorized under section 95(2) for the regulated activity.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to subsection (1) but subject to subsection (4), no person shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: perform any regulated function in relation to a regulated activity carried on as a business; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: hold himself out as performing such function.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (3) shall not apply to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a licensed representative who carries on for his principal a regulated activity for which the representative is licensed;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: an individual—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: who carries on for a registered institution a regulated activity for which the registered institution is registered; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: whose name is entered in the register maintained by the Monetary Authority under section 20 of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155) as engaged by the registered institution in respect of the regulated activity; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an employee of a person authorized under section 95(2) for the regulated activity who performs any regulated function in relation to the regulated activity for which the person is so authorized.

subsection.content: A person shall not be regarded as contravening subsection (1) in relation to Type 8 regulated activity by reason only of carrying on one or more of the activities specified in Part 3 of Schedule 5.

subsection.leadIn: A person shall not be regarded as contravening subsection (1) in relation to Type 8 regulated activity by reason only of providing financial accommodation if he reasonably believes that the financial accommodation is not to be used to facilitate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the acquisition of securities listed on a stock market (whether a recognized stock market or any other stock market outside Hong Kong); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the continued holding of such securities.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (6), where it is proved in any proceedings for a contravention of subsection (1) that the person had obtained, before providing the financial accommodation to a borrower, a written confirmation from the borrower that the financial accommodation was not to be used to facilitate such acquisition or continued holding as referred to in subsection (6)(a) and (b), that person shall be presumed, unless the contrary is proved, to have reasonably believed that the financial accommodation was not to be so used.

subsection.leadIn: A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $5,000,000 and to imprisonment for 7 years and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $100,000 for every day during which the offence continues; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

subsection.leadIn: A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (3) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $20,000 for every day during which the offence continues; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $2,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s115
section.heading: Application of section 114 in relation to conduct or activities outside Hong Kong

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person actively markets, whether by himself or another person on his behalf and whether in Hong Kong or from a place outside Hong Kong, to the public any services that he provides; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: such services, if provided in Hong Kong, would constitute a regulated activity,

subsection.continued: then—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the provision of such services so marketed shall be regarded for the purposes of section 114(1)(a) as carrying on a business in that regulated activity;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: the person’s marketing of such services as referred to in paragraph (a) shall be regarded for the purposes of section 114(1)(b) as holding himself out as carrying on a business in that regulated activity; and

paragraph.name: iii
paragraph.content: to the extent that the provision of such services involves the performance by a person of a function that, if performed in Hong Kong in relation to a regulated activity, would constitute a regulated function, the performance of such function by that person shall be regarded for the purposes of section 114(3)(a) as performance of that regulated function in relation to that regulated activity.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person actively markets, whether by himself or another person on his behalf and whether in Hong Kong or from a place outside Hong Kong, to the public any function that he performs; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: such function, if performed in Hong Kong in relation to a regulated activity carried on as a business, would constitute a regulated function,

subsection.continued: then—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the performance of such function so marketed shall be regarded for the purposes of section 114(3)(a) as performance of that regulated function in relation to that regulated activity; and

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: the person’s marketing of such function as referred to in paragraph (a) shall be regarded for the purposes of section 114(3)(b) as holding himself out as performing that regulated function in relation to that regulated activity.

section.name: s116
section.heading: Corporations to be licensed for carrying on regulated activities

subsection.content: The Commission may, upon application in the prescribed manner and payment of the prescribed fee, grant to the applicant a licence to carry on one or more than one regulated activity. (Amended 19 of 2015 s. 3)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: The Commission must, on granting a licence under subsection (1), issue to the applicant a printed licence specifying the regulated activity for which the applicant is licensed. (Added 19 of 2015 s. 3)

subsection.leadIn: The Commission shall refuse to grant a licence to carry on a regulated activity under subsection (1) unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the applicant is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a company;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a registered non-Hong Kong company as defined by section 2(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622); or (Replaced 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.leadIn: a corporation (other than a company or a non-Hong Kong company)— (Amended 30 of 2004 s. 3)

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: which carries on a business principally outside Hong Kong in an activity which, if carried on in Hong Kong, would constitute the regulated activity;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: to which section 114(1) would not apply but for the provisions of section 115(1)(i) and (ii); and

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: to which Part 16 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622) would apply if it established a place of business in Hong Kong; (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: applications have been lodged under section 126 in respect of such persons as referred to in section 125(1)(a) and (b) for approval of them as the responsible officers of the applicant in relation to the regulated activity; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an application has been lodged under section 130(1) for approval of premises to be used by the applicant for keeping records or documents required under this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: The Commission shall refuse to grant a licence to carry on a regulated activity under subsection (1) unless the applicant satisfies the Commission that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is a fit and proper person to be licensed for the regulated activity;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it will be able, if licensed, to comply with the financial resources rules; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: it—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: has lodged and maintains with the Commission such security in accordance with rules made under subsection (4); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is insured in accordance with rules made under subsection (5).

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may make rules for the purposes of subsection (3)(c)(i) that provide for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any security to be lodged and maintained by a licensed corporation with the Commission;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the manner in which the security is lodged;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the terms on which the security is maintained;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the Commission’s power to apply a security lodged and maintained with the Commission in such circumstances, for such purposes and in such manner as may be prescribed in the rules;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any other matter relating to the security.

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may make rules for the purposes of subsection (3)(c)(ii) that provide for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: insurance coverage for specified amounts to be taken out and maintained by a licensed corporation in relation to specified risks;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the terms on which the insurance is to be taken out and maintained;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other matter relating to the insurance.

subsection.content: A licence granted under subsection (1) shall be subject to such reasonable conditions as the Commission may impose, and the Commission may at any time, by notice in writing served on the licensed corporation concerned, amend or revoke any such condition or impose new conditions as may be reasonable in the circumstances.

Where the Commission by notice in writing amends or revokes any condition or imposes any new condition under subsection (6), the amendment, revocation or imposition takes effect at the time of the service of the notice or at the time specified in the notice, whichever is the later.

A licensed corporation shall not, when carrying on a regulated activity for which it is licensed under subsection (1), use a name other than the name specified in the printed licence. (Amended 19 of 2015 s. 3)

Without prejudice to the Commission’s powers under Divisions 2 and 3 of Part IX, a licence granted to a corporation to carry on Type 7 regulated activity shall be deemed to be revoked in respect of that regulated activity upon the corporation’s being granted an authorization under section 95(2) to provide automated trading services. (Amended 6 of 2014 s. 11)

section.name: s117
section.heading: Grant of temporary licences to corporations for carrying on regulated activities

subsection.content: The Commission may, upon application by a corporation in the prescribed manner and payment of the prescribed fee, grant to the applicant a licence to carry on, for a period not exceeding 3 months, one or more than one regulated activity (other than Type 3, Type 7, Type 8 and Type 9 regulated activities). (Amended 19 of 2015 s. 4)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: The Commission must, on granting a licence under subsection (1), issue to the applicant a printed licence specifying the regulated activity for which the applicant is licensed. (Added 19 of 2015 s. 4)

subsection.leadIn: The Commission shall refuse to grant a licence to carry on a regulated activity under subsection (1) unless the applicant satisfies the Commission that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it carries on a business principally outside Hong Kong in an activity which, if carried on in Hong Kong, would constitute the regulated activity;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it seeks to be licensed for the regulated activity solely for carrying on in Hong Kong such business in the activity;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: it carries on such business in the activity in the place referred to in paragraph (a) under an authorization (however described) by an authority or regulatory organization in that place which—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the Commission’s opinion, performs a function similar to the functions of the Commission under this Part;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: confirms to the satisfaction of the Commission that the applicant has been so authorized; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the Commission is satisfied is empowered under the law of that place to investigate, and, where applicable, to take disciplinary action for, the conduct of the applicant in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the granting of the licence would not result in its being granted licences under subsection (1) for respective licence periods that in total exceed 6 months in any period of 24 months;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: it is a fit and proper person to be so licensed for the regulated activity;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: it has nominated at least one individual for approval by the Commission for the purposes of subsection (5)(a); and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: an application has been lodged under section 130(1) for approval of premises to be used by the applicant for keeping records or documents required under this Ordinance.

subsection.content: A licence granted under subsection (1) shall be subject to such reasonable conditions as the Commission may impose, and the Commission may at any time, by notice in writing served on the licensed corporation concerned, amend or revoke any such condition or impose new conditions as may be reasonable in the circumstances.

Where the Commission by notice in writing amends or revokes any condition or imposes any new condition under subsection (3), the amendment, revocation or imposition takes effect at the time of the service of the notice or at the time specified in the notice, whichever is the later.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting the generality of subsection (3), it shall be a condition of a licence granted under subsection (1) for carrying on a regulated activity—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: that, in relation to the regulated activity, there is at least one individual who is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: nominated by the licensed corporation and approved by the Commission for the purposes of this paragraph; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: available at all times to supervise the business of the regulated activity for which the corporation is licensed; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the licensed corporation shall not hold any client assets in carrying on the regulated activity.

subsection.content: A licensed corporation shall not, when carrying on a regulated activity for which it is licensed under subsection (1), use a name other than the name specified in the printed licence. (Amended 19 of 2015 s. 4)

section.name: s118
section.heading: Licensing conditions in certain cases

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting the generality of section 116(6), it shall be a condition of a licence granted under section 116(1) for carrying on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a regulated activity—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: that the licensed corporation—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: shall lodge (whether or not in addition to any security that it may have lodged) and maintain with the Commission such security in respect of that regulated activity as may be required by rules made under section 116(4); or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: is insured, in lieu of lodging (where applicable) and maintaining such security, in accordance with rules made under section 116(5); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: that, in relation to the regulated activity, there is at least one responsible officer of the licensed corporation who is available at all times to supervise the business of the regulated activity for which the corporation is licensed;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Type 3 regulated activity, that in relation to any dispute between the licensed corporation and a client regarding or touching upon any matter concerning the carrying on of that regulated activity, the licensed corporation is obliged, if the client so requires, to have the dispute settled by arbitration in accordance with rules made under subsection (2);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: Type 7 regulated activity, that if the Commission in its absolute discretion requires by notice in writing, the licensed corporation shall apply, within such reasonable period as may be specified in the notice, for an authorization under section 95(2) for that regulated activity, and the regulated activity shall be operated in such manner as may be specified in the notice pending the revocation of the licence under section 195(2);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: Type 8 regulated activity, that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the licensed corporation shall carry on no business other than securities margin financing, except business that is necessarily incidental to the carrying on of such business; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where the licensed corporation carries on a business in one or more of the activities specified in Part 3 of Schedule 5, it shall comply with the requirements of such rules made under Part VI as apply to it in relation to such business.

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may make rules for the purposes of subsection (1)(b) that provide for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the establishment and functions of an arbitration panel and relevant matters;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the appointment by the Financial Secretary of members of the arbitration panel, including a chairman and one or more than one deputy chairman;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the appointment from the arbitration panel of a tribunal to hear a dispute between a licensed corporation and its client and the constitution and composition of the tribunal;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the liability or entitlement to costs of a party to a dispute and the recovery of costs;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the practice and procedure in the hearing of a dispute;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the Commission to use the findings of a tribunal for performing its functions under any of the relevant provisions;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the exercise of any discretion by a person under the rules.

section.name: s119
section.heading: Registered institutions

subsection.content: The Commission may, upon application by an authorized financial institution in the prescribed manner and payment of the prescribed fee, register the applicant for one or more than one regulated activity (other than Type 3 and Type 8 regulated activities) and shall, upon such registration, grant to the applicant a certificate of registration specifying the regulated activity for which it is registered.
The Commission shall refer to the Monetary Authority any application made to it under subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: Upon receiving an application for registration for a regulated activity referred to him under subsection (2), the Monetary Authority shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: consider the application;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: consult the Commission upon the merits of the application; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: advise the Commission whether he is satisfied by the applicant that the applicant is a fit and proper person to be registered for that regulated activity.

subsection.leadIn: In deciding whether to register or refuse to register an applicant under subsection (1), the Commission—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall have regard to any advice given to it by the Monetary Authority pursuant to subsection (3)(c); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may rely wholly or partly on that advice in making that decision.

subsection.content: Any registration under subsection (1) shall be subject to such reasonable conditions as the Commission may impose, and the Commission may at any time, by notice in writing served on the registered institution concerned, amend or revoke any such condition or impose new conditions as may be reasonable in the circumstances.

Where the Commission by notice in writing amends or revokes any condition or imposes any new condition under subsection (5), the amendment, revocation or imposition takes effect at the time of the service of the notice or at the time specified in the notice, whichever is the later.

Without prejudice to the Commission’s powers under Divisions 2 and 3 of Part IX, the registration of an authorized financial institution for Type 7 regulated activity shall be deemed to be revoked in respect of that regulated activity upon the institution’s being granted an authorization under section 95(2) to provide automated trading services. (Amended 6 of 2014 s. 12)

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting the generality of subsection (5), it shall be a condition of any registration under subsection (1) for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a regulated activity, that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in relation to the regulated activity, there is at least one executive officer of the registered institution who is available at all times to supervise the business of the regulated activity for which the institution is registered; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any individual whose name is entered in the register maintained by the Monetary Authority under section 20 of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155) as engaged by the registered institution in respect of the regulated activity is a fit and proper person to be so engaged;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Type 7 regulated activity, that if the Commission in its absolute discretion requires by notice in writing, the registered institution shall apply, within such reasonable period as may be specified in the notice, for an authorization under section 95(2) for that regulated activity, and the regulated activity shall be operated in such manner as may be specified in the notice pending the revocation of the registration under section 197(2).

subsection.content: The Commission shall not exercise its power under subsection (5) or (8)(b) unless the Commission has first consulted the Monetary Authority.

section.name: s120
section.heading: Representatives to be licensed

subsection.content: The Commission may, upon application by an individual in the prescribed manner and payment of the prescribed fee, grant to the applicant a licence to carry on one or more than one regulated activity for a corporation licensed under section 116 to which he is accredited. (Amended 19 of 2015 s. 5)

The Commission in its absolute discretion may, upon request by the applicant in the prescribed manner and payment of the prescribed fee, grant to the applicant a provisional licence to carry on, for such corporation, the regulated activity in respect of which the application is made.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.leadIn: On granting a licence under subsection (1) or (2), the Commission must, by notice in writing served on the applicant, inform the applicant of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the grant of the licence; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the regulated activity for which the applicant is licensed. (Added 19 of 2015 s. 5)

subsection.name: 2B
subsection.leadIn: Beginning on the day on which Part 2 of the Securities and Futures (Amendment) Ordinance 2015 (19 of 2015) comes into operation#—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: no printed licence is to be issued on granting a licence under subsection (1) or (2); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a printed licence issued by the Commission to a licensed representative before that day ceases to be effective for indicating that an individual is licensed under subsection (1) or (2). (Added 19 of 2015 s. 5)

subsection.content: The Commission shall refuse to grant a licence to carry on a regulated activity under subsection (1) or (2) unless the applicant satisfies the Commission that he is a fit and proper person to be so licensed for the regulated activity.

The Commission shall refuse to grant a licence under subsection (2) unless the applicant satisfies the Commission that the grant of the licence will not prejudice the interest of the investing public.
A licence granted under subsection (1) or (2) shall be subject to the condition specified in subsection (6) and to any other reasonable conditions as the Commission may impose.

subsection.leadIn: It shall be a condition of a licence granted under subsection (1) or (2) that the licensed representative concerned shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at all times keep the Commission informed of particulars of his contact details including, in so far as applicable, his residential address, telephone and facsimile numbers and electronic mail address; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: inform the Commission of any change in the particulars within 14 days after the change takes place.

subsection.content: The Commission may at any time, by notice in writing served on the licensed representative concerned, amend or revoke any condition imposed under subsection (5) or impose new conditions as may be reasonable in the circumstances.

Where the Commission by notice in writing amends or revokes any condition or imposes any new condition under subsection (7), the amendment, revocation or imposition takes effect at the time of the service of the notice or at the time specified in the notice, whichever is the later.

subsection.leadIn: A provisional licence shall be deemed to be revoked—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: upon the Commission’s refusal of the relevant application made under subsection (1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: upon the grant of the licence sought under the application,

subsection.continued: whichever first occurs.

subsection.content: Without prejudice to the Commission’s powers under Divisions 2 and 3 of Part IX, the Commission may, after having regard to the interest of the investing public and in its absolute discretion, by notice in writing served on the licensed representative concerned, revoke a provisional licence granted under subsection (2). (Amended 6 of 2014 s. 13)

A licensed representative shall not, when carrying on the regulated activity for which the representative is licensed under subsection (1) or (2), use a name other than the name under which the representative is licensed. (Amended 19 of 2015 s. 5)

section.name: s121
section.heading: Temporary licences for representatives

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may, upon application by an individual in the prescribed manner and payment of the prescribed fee, grant to the applicant a licence to carry on, for a period not exceeding 3 months, one or more than one regulated activity (other than Type 3, Type 7, Type 8 and Type 9 regulated activities)— (Amended 19 of 2015 s. 6)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a corporation licensed under section 116 to which he is accredited; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a corporation licensed under section 117 to which he is accredited.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: On granting a licence under subsection (1), the Commission must, by notice in writing served on the applicant, inform the applicant of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the grant of the licence; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the regulated activity for which the applicant is licensed. (Added 19 of 2015 s. 6)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.leadIn: Beginning on the day on which Part 2 of the Securities and Futures (Amendment) Ordinance 2015 (19 of 2015) comes into operation#—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: no printed licence is to be issued on granting a licence under subsection (1); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a printed licence issued by the Commission to a licensed representative before that day ceases to be effective for indicating that an individual is licensed under subsection (1). (Added 19 of 2015 s. 6)

subsection.leadIn: The Commission shall refuse to grant a licence to carry on a regulated activity under subsection (1) unless the applicant satisfies the Commission—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: that he carries on in a place outside Hong Kong an activity which, if carried on in Hong Kong, would constitute carrying on the regulated activity, under an authorization (however described) by an authority or regulatory organization in that place which—

subparagraph.content: in the Commission’s opinion, performs a function similar to the functions of the Commission under this Part;
confirms to the satisfaction of the Commission that the applicant has been so authorized; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: where the application is for a licence under subsection (1)(a), that—

subparagraph.leadIn: he carries on the activity referred to in paragraph (a) for or on behalf of a corporation which carries on the activity as a business principally in a place outside Hong Kong under an authorization (however described) by an authority or regulatory organization in that place which—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: in the Commission’s opinion, performs a function similar to the functions of the Commission under this Part; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: confirms to the satisfaction of the Commission that the corporation has been so authorized; and

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: that the granting of the licence would not result in his being granted licences under subsection (1) for respective licence periods that in total exceed 6 months in any period of 24 months; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: that he is a fit and proper person to be so licensed for the regulated activity.

subsection.content: A licence granted under subsection (1) shall be subject to the condition specified in subsection (4) and to any other reasonable conditions as the Commission may impose.

subsection.leadIn: It shall be a condition of a licence granted under subsection (1) that the licensed representative concerned—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: shall inform the Commission of any change in the particulars within 14 days after the change takes place; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: shall not hold any client assets in carrying on the regulated activity for which he is so licensed.

subsection.content: The Commission may at any time, by notice in writing served on the licensed representative concerned, amend or revoke any condition imposed under subsection (3) or impose new conditions as may be reasonable in the circumstances.

Where the Commission by notice in writing amends or revokes any condition or imposes any new condition under subsection (5), the amendment, revocation or imposition takes effect at the time of the service of the notice or at the time specified in the notice, whichever is the later.

A licensed representative shall not, when carrying on the regulated activity for which the representative is licensed under subsection (1), use a name other than the name under which the representative is licensed. (Amended 19 of 2015 s. 6)

section.name: s122
section.heading: Approval and transfer of accreditation

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may, upon application in the prescribed manner and payment of the prescribed fee, approve the accreditation of a licensed representative—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: who is licensed under section 120(1) or (2) or 121(1)(a), to a corporation licensed under section 116; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: who is licensed under section 121(1)(b), to a corporation licensed under section 117,

subsection.continued: and on the Commission’s approving the accreditation, the corporation becomes the representative’s principal. (Amended 19 of 2015 s. 7)

subsection.content: The Commission may, upon application in the prescribed manner and payment of the prescribed fee by a licensed representative licensed under section 120(1) or (2) or 121(1), approve the transfer of his accreditation to another corporation licensed under section 116 or 117 (as the case may be), and on the Commission’s approving the transfer, the corporation becomes the representative’s principal. (Amended 19 of 2015 s. 7)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: On granting an approval under subsection (1) or (2), the Commission must, by notice in writing served on the applicant, inform the applicant of the approval. (Added 19 of 2015 s. 7)

subsection.leadIn: The Commission shall refuse to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: approve an accreditation under subsection (1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: approve a transfer of accreditation under subsection (2),

subsection.continued: unless the applicant satisfies the Commission that he will be competent to carry out his duties to the requisite standard as a licensed representative for or on behalf of the licensed corporation concerned.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting the generality of subsection (3), where a licensed representative who is licensed under section 121(1)(a) applies—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: under subsection (1)(a) for approval of an accreditation; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: under subsection (2) for approval of a transfer of accreditation,

subsection.continued: to a corporation licensed under section 116, the Commission shall refuse to grant the approval unless the applicant satisfies the Commission that the licensed corporation to which he seeks to be accredited is a member of the same group of companies as the corporation referred to in section 121(2)(b)(i).

section.name: s123
section.heading: Commission to be notified, etc. if licensed representative ceases to act for principal

subsection.leadIn: If an individual licensed under section 120(1) or (2) or 121(1) ceases to act for or on behalf of his principal as a licensed representative, he thereupon ceases to be accredited to the principal and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the principal shall, within 7 business days after such cessation, notify the Commission of the cessation; and (Amended 19 of 2015 s. 8)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: where the individual has not applied for transfer of his accreditation to another corporation licensed under section 116 or 117 (as the case may be) within 180 days after such cessation, the licence shall be deemed to have been revoked upon such cessation.

subsection.content: A person who contravenes subsection (1)(a) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6.

section.name: s124
section.heading: Duplicate printed licence, etc.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), the Commission may, upon application in the prescribed manner and payment of the prescribed fee by a licensed corporation or a registered institution on the ground that its printed licence or certificate of registration is lost, defaced or destroyed, issue to the licensed corporation or the registered institution a duplicate of the printed licence or certificate of registration (as the case may be).

subsection.leadIn: In support of an application under subsection (1), the licensed corporation or the registered institution shall— (Amended 19 of 2015 s. 9)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: submit to the Commission a statutory declaration made by the licensed corporation or the registered institution stating the ground of the application and such other particulars as the case may require in order to verify the loss, defacement or destruction (as the case may be) of the printed licence or certificate of registration; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: furnish to the Commission such other information as the Commission may reasonably require in relation to the application.

section.name: s125
section.heading: Requirement for executive officers

subsection.leadIn: A corporation licensed under section 116 shall not carry on any regulated activity for which it is licensed unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: every executive director of the licensed corporation who is an individual is approved by the Commission as a responsible officer of the corporation in relation to the regulated activity; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: not less than 2 individuals, at least one of whom shall be an executive director of the licensed corporation, are approved by the Commission as the responsible officers of the corporation in relation to the regulated activity.

subsection.content: A registered institution shall not carry on any regulated activity for which it is registered unless it has complied with section 71D of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155) in respect of the appointment of executive officers and such executive officers are in compliance with section 71C of that Ordinance (including section 71C of that Ordinance as read with section 71E of that Ordinance).

If a licensed corporation contravenes subsection (1) or a registered institution contravenes subsection (2), without reasonable excuse, the licensed corporation or registered institution (as the case may be) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $2,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s126
section.heading: Approval of responsible officers

subsection.content: The Commission may, upon application by a licensed representative in the prescribed manner and payment of the prescribed fee, approve the applicant as a responsible officer of the licensed corporation to which he is accredited.

subsection.leadIn: The Commission shall refuse to approve an applicant as a responsible officer of a licensed corporation under subsection (1) unless the applicant satisfies the Commission that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he is a fit and proper person to be so approved; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: he has sufficient authority within the licensed corporation.

subsection.content: An approval under subsection (1) shall be subject to such reasonable conditions as the Commission may impose on the licensed corporation and the responsible officer concerned, and the Commission may at any time, by notice in writing served on the licensed corporation or the responsible officer concerned, amend or revoke any such condition or impose new conditions as may be reasonable in the circumstances.

subsection.leadIn: The approval of an individual as a responsible officer of a licensed corporation shall be deemed to be revoked if the individual—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: ceases to act as a licensed representative for or on behalf of; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: ceases to be accredited to,

subsection.continued: the licensed corporation.

section.name: s127
section.heading: Variation of regulated activity for which licensed person or registered institution is licensed or registered

subsection.content: The Commission may, upon application in the prescribed manner and payment of the prescribed fee, vary the regulated activity for which a licensed person or registered institution is licensed or registered by adding to or reducing the regulated activity. (Amended 19 of 2015 s. 10)

If a person applies for variation under subsection (1) by adding a regulated activity, the application is, for the purposes of this Part, to be regarded as an application for a licence or registration (as the case may be) in relation to that regulated activity. (Replaced 19 of 2015 s. 10)

section.name: s128
section.heading: Applicant to provide information

subsection.leadIn: A person who applies—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a licence under section 116, 117, 120 or 121;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for registration under section 119;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for approval of accreditation or approval of transfer of accreditation to a principal, under section 122;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: for approval to be a responsible officer under section 126;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: for variation, under section 127, of the regulated activity for which the person is licensed or registered;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: for approval of premises under section 130(1);

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: for approval to become or continue to be (as the case may be) a substantial shareholder under section 132;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: for a modification or waiver under section 134; or

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: for any other matter requiring the approval of the Commission under this Part,

subsection.continued: shall provide the Commission with such information as it may reasonably require to enable it to consider the application.

subsection.content: In considering an application referred to in subsection (1), the Commission may have regard to any information in its possession whether provided by the applicant or not.

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may make rules providing for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the information to be provided by an applicant to enable the Commission to consider his application;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the form, manner and time period in which such information is to be provided;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other matter relating thereto.

section.name: s129
section.heading: Determination of fit and proper

subsection.leadIn: In considering whether a person is a fit and proper person for the purposes of any provision of this Part, the Commission or the Monetary Authority (as the case may be) shall, in addition to any other matter that the Commission or the Monetary Authority (as the case may be) may consider relevant, but subject to section 134, have regard to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the financial status or solvency;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: the ability to carry on the regulated activity competently, honestly and fairly; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the reputation, character, reliability and financial integrity,

subsection.continued: of—

paragraph.content: where the person is an individual, the person himself;
where the person is a corporation (other than an authorized financial institution), the corporation and any officer of the corporation; or

where the person is an authorized financial institution, the institution and any director, chief executive, manager (as defined in section 2(1) of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155)) and executive officer of the institution.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting the generality of subsection (1), the Commission or the Monetary Authority (as the case may be) may, in considering whether a person is a fit and proper person for the purposes of any provision of this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: take into account a decision made in respect of the person by—

subparagraph.content: (in the case of the Commission) the Monetary Authority or (in the case of the Monetary Authority) the Commission;
the Insurance Authority;
the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes Authority; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: take into account any information in the possession of the Commission or the Monetary Authority (as the case may be), whether provided by the person or not, relating to—

subparagraph.content: where such consideration relates to a licence under section 116 or 117 or an application for the licence, any other person who is or is to be employed by, or associated with, the person for the purposes of the regulated activity for which the licence is granted or the application is made (as the case may be);

where such consideration relates to a licence under section 116 or 117 to carry on a regulated activity or any registration for a regulated activity under section 119 or an application for the licence or registration, any other person who will be acting for or on behalf of the person in relation to the regulated activity; or

subparagraph.leadIn: where the person is a corporation in a group of companies—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: any other corporation in the same group of companies; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: any substantial shareholder or officer of the corporation or any corporation referred to in sub-subparagraph (A);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: take into account, where such consideration relates to a licence under section 116 or 117 or any registration under section 119 or an application for the licence or registration, whether the person has established effective internal control procedures and risk management systems to ensure his compliance with all applicable regulatory requirements under any of the relevant provisions, having regard in particular to the information provided in accordance with section 128; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: have regard to the state of affairs of any other business which the person carries on or proposes to carry on.

section.name: s130
section.heading: Suitability of premises for keeping records or documents

subsection.content: The Commission may, upon application in the prescribed manner and payment of the prescribed fee, approve premises to be used by a licensed corporation for keeping records or documents required under this Ordinance or the Anti-Money Laundering and Counter-Terrorist Financing Ordinance (Cap. 615). (Amended 15 of 2011 s. 88; 4 of 2018 s. 43)

subsection.leadIn: The Commission shall refuse to approve premises under subsection (1) unless the applicant satisfies the Commission that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the premises are suitable for being used for the purpose referred to in that subsection; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the premises are used partly for residential purposes, such residential use of the premises will not affect the exercise of any powers under this Part or Part VI or VIII.

subsection.content: A licensed corporation shall not, without the prior approval in writing of the Commission, use any premises for the keeping of records or documents relating to the carrying on of the regulated activity for which it is licensed.
The Commission shall inform the applicant in writing of its decision under subsection (1) as soon as reasonably practicable after receipt of the application.

section.name: s131
section.heading: Restriction on substantial shareholding, etc.

subsection.content: A person shall not become and continue to be a substantial shareholder of a corporation licensed under section 116 without first being approved by the Commission under section 132(1)(a).

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years, and to a further fine of $5,000 for every day during which the person continues to be such substantial shareholder without the Commission’s approval under section 132(1)(b); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months, and to a further fine of $500 for every day during which the person continues to be such substantial shareholder without the Commission’s approval under section 132(1)(b).

subsection.leadIn: It is a defence for a person charged with an offence under subsection (2) to prove—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that he did not know, and could not have by the exercise of reasonable diligence ascertained, the existence of the act or circumstances by virtue of which he became such a substantial shareholder; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where he subsequently became aware of such act or circumstances, that he applied under section 132(1)(b), as soon as reasonably practicable and in any event within 3 business days after he became so aware, for approval to continue to be a substantial shareholder of the corporation.

subsection.leadIn: If a person becomes a substantial shareholder of a corporation licensed under section 116 without the Commission’s prior approval under section 132(1)(a) by virtue of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a transfer of shares;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an issue of shares; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a transfer of the right to be issued with shares,

subsection.continued: then, unless and until the Commission approves the person to continue to be a substantial shareholder of the corporation under section 132(1)(b), the voting rights conferred by the shares concerned are not exercisable.

subsection.leadIn: A person who purportedly exercises any voting right that is not exercisable by virtue of subsection (4) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 1 year; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: It is a defence for a person charged with an offence under subsection (5) to prove that he—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: did not know; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: could not have by the exercise of reasonable diligence known,

subsection.continued: that the voting right which he purportedly exercised is by virtue of subsection (4) not exercisable.

section.name: s132
section.heading: Approval to become or continue to be substantial shareholder

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may, upon application in the prescribed manner and payment of the prescribed fee, approve the applicant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to become; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to continue to be,

subsection.continued: as the case may be, a substantial shareholder of a corporation licensed under section 116.

subsection.content: The Commission shall refuse to approve an applicant to become or continue to be (as the case may be) a substantial shareholder of the licensed corporation concerned unless the applicant satisfies the Commission that the corporation will remain a fit and proper person to be licensed if the application is approved.

An approval under subsection (1)(a) or (b) shall be subject to such reasonable conditions as the Commission may impose on the applicant and on the licensed corporation concerned, and the Commission may at any time, by notice in writing served on the approved substantial shareholder and the corporation, amend or revoke any such condition or impose new conditions as may be reasonable in the circumstances.

Where the Commission by notice in writing amends or revokes any condition or imposes any new condition under subsection (3), the amendment, revocation or imposition takes effect at the time of the service of the notice or at the time specified in the notice, whichever is the later.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting the generality of subsection (3), it shall be a condition of an approval under subsection (1)(a) or (b) that the approved substantial shareholder shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at all times keep the Commission informed of particulars of his contact details including, in so far as applicable, his business address, residential address, telephone and facsimile numbers and electronic mail address; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: inform the Commission of any change in the particulars within 14 days after the change takes place.

section.name: s133
section.heading: Commission’s power to give directions

subsection.leadIn: Where a person became a substantial shareholder without the Commission’s prior approval under section 132(1)(a), whether or not he has applied under section 132(1)(b) for approval to continue to be such shareholder and regardless of whether such approval is granted or not, the Commission may by notice in writing direct the licensed corporation concerned—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: not to permit or acquiesce in the involvement of the person in the management of the business of the corporation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to deem void and of no effect any votes cast by the person and any of his associates (if any) at any meeting of the corporation;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to reconvene any such meeting for voting anew on the business on which the votes were cast; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: to take such other reasonable steps as it may specify in the notice.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the operation of subsection (1), where the Commission refuses to approve an application to continue to be a substantial shareholder made under section 132(1)(b), it may by notice in writing direct the applicant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to reduce, within such reasonable time as the Commission may require, the interest in shares by virtue of which he became a substantial shareholder of the licensed corporation concerned to the extent that he is no longer a substantial shareholder of the corporation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to take such other reasonable steps as the Commission may specify in the notice.

subsection.leadIn: If a person fails to comply with any direction under subsection (1) or (2), the Commission may, by originating summons or originating motion, make an application to the Court of First Instance in respect of the failure, and the Court may inquire into the case and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the Court is satisfied that there is no reasonable excuse for the person not to comply with the direction, order the person to comply with the direction within the period specified by the Court; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the Court is satisfied that the failure was without reasonable excuse, punish the person, and any other person knowingly involved in the failure, in the same manner as if he and, where applicable, that other person had been guilty of contempt of court.

subsection.content: An originating summons under subsection (3) shall be in Form No. 10 in Appendix A to the Rules of the High Court (Cap. 4 sub. leg. A).

section.name: s134
section.heading: Modification or waiver of requirements

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may, upon application in the prescribed manner and payment of the prescribed fee by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a licensed corporation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an applicant for a licence under section 116 or 117;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a registered institution;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: an applicant for registration under section 119;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a licensed representative;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: an applicant for a licence under section 120 or 121;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: a responsible officer approved under section 126;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: a substantial shareholder approved under section 132;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: an applicant for approval under section 132 to become or continue to be (as the case may be) a substantial shareholder; or

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: an associated entity,

subsection.continued: grant a modification or waiver, in relation to the applicant, in respect of any condition specified in section 118 or imposed under section 116, 117, 119, 120, 121, 126 or 132 or any of the requirements of the following—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: sections 116(2)(b) and 125(1) and (2);

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: sections 116(2)(c) and 130;

paragraph.name: iii
paragraph.content: rules made under section 118(2);

paragraph.name: iv
paragraph.content: section 121(2)(a);

paragraph.name: v
paragraph.content: section 129;

paragraph.name: vi
paragraph.content: rules made under section 145;

paragraph.name: vii
paragraph.content: rules made under section 148;
rules made under section 149;

paragraph.name: ix
paragraph.content: rules made under section 151;

paragraph.name: x
paragraph.content: rules made under section 152;

paragraph.name: xi
paragraph.content: rules made under section 168;

paragraph.name: xii
paragraph.content: rules made under section 173;
section 175(1), (2) and (3); or

paragraph.name: xiv
paragraph.content: any provision of rules made by the Commission under this Ordinance.

subsection.content: The grant of a modification or waiver under subsection (1) shall be effected by a notice in writing served on the applicant specifying the period (if any) for which the modification or waiver is valid.

subsection.leadIn: The Commission shall refuse to grant a modification or waiver under subsection (1) unless it is satisfied by the applicant that to do so will not prejudice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a modification or waiver granted in respect of a condition imposed under section 116, 117 or 119, the interests of any client of the applicant; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a modification or waiver granted in respect of a condition specified in section 118 or imposed under section 120, 121, 126 or 132, or in respect of any requirement of a provision specified in subsection (1)(i) to (xiv), the interest of the investing public.

subsection.leadIn: A modification or waiver granted under subsection (1) to a person shall be subject to such reasonable conditions as the Commission may impose, and the Commission may at any time, by notice in writing served on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the person is an intermediary or an associated entity, an executive officer of the intermediary or the entity; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: where the modification or waiver is granted pursuant to an application made under subsection (1)(e), (f) or (g), the principal to which the person is accredited,

subsection.continued: amend such modification or waiver, or amend or revoke any such condition or impose new conditions as may be reasonable in the circumstances.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (4), a modification or waiver granted under subsection (1) remains in force—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if a period is specified in the notice served under subsection (2) in respect of the modification or waiver, until the end of the period; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if no such period is specified, until revoked by the Commission by notice in writing served on—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the person;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where the person is an intermediary or an associated entity, an executive officer of the intermediary or the entity; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: where the modification or waiver is granted pursuant to an application made under subsection (1)(e), (f) or (g), the principal to which the person is accredited.

subsection.leadIn: In relation to a modification or waiver under subsection (1) to a person, the Commission shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the grant of the modification or waiver;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on its amendment or an amendment or revocation of its conditions or the imposition of any new condition on it under subsection (4); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: on its revocation under subsection (5)(b),

subsection.continued: subject to subsection (7), publish, by the use of the Internet, notice of— (Amended 9 of 2012 s. 39)

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the name of the person;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: the event referred to in paragraph (a), (b) or (c) (as the case may be) and the reasons for the event;

paragraph.name: iii
paragraph.content: any condition imposed on the modification or waiver on its grant, or the condition amended or revoked or newly imposed subsequently under subsection (4) (as the case may be); and

paragraph.name: iv
paragraph.content: (if applicable) the period for which the grant or amendment or the condition so imposed is valid.

subsection.leadIn: If the applicant satisfies the Commission that publishing notice of any condition in compliance with subsection (6)(iii) would prejudice, to an unreasonable degree, the commercial interests of the applicant, the Commission may, in lieu of publishing notice of the condition, include in the notice referred to in subsection (6)— (Amended 9 of 2012 s. 39)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a brief account of its reasons for not publishing notice of the condition; and (Amended 9 of 2012 s. 39)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: such appropriate information on the condition as the Commission considers incapable of prejudicing, to an unreasonable degree, the commercial interests of the applicant.

subsection.content: The Commission may by rules grant a modification or waiver, in relation to a class of licensed persons or registered institutions or associated entities, in respect of any of the requirements of the rules referred to in subsection (1)(vi), (vii), (viii), (ix), (x) or (xi).

The Commission shall not make any rules under subsection (8) to grant a modification or waiver referred to in that subsection unless the Commission is satisfied that to do so will not prejudice the interest of the investing public.

The Commission may specify in the rules referred to in subsection (8) the conditions subject to which the modification or waiver is granted and the rules may provide that a person who fails to comply with such a condition commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine not exceeding level 6.

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may at any time by rules—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: revoke a modification or waiver granted under subsection (8); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: amend, revoke or add to, any condition subject to which such modification or waiver is granted.

subsection.content: The Commission shall not exercise its power under subsection (1), (4), (8), (10) or (11) in relation to any registered institution or any associated entity that is an authorized financial institution unless the Commission has first consulted the Monetary Authority.
A person who fails to comply with a condition imposed under subsection (4) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6.

section.name: s135
section.heading: Events to be reported by licensed persons and registered institutions

subsection.content: A licensed person or registered institution who intends to cease to carry on any regulated activity for which he is licensed or registered shall notify the Commission and (in the case of a registered institution) the Monetary Authority in writing of such intended cessation as soon as reasonably practicable and in any event not later than 7 business days before such intended cessation.

An intermediary shall give to the Commission and (in the case of a registered institution) the Monetary Authority at least 7 business days’ advance notice in writing of any intended change of address at which it proposes to carry on the regulated activity for which it is licensed or registered.

Subject to subsection (5), where a person has provided any information to the Commission under any provision of this Part and a change in the information occurs, then in such circumstances as are prescribed by rules made under section 397 for the purposes of this subsection, the person shall, within 7 business days of the change, give notice in writing of the change containing a full description of it.

subsection.leadIn: The notice referred to in subsection (3) shall be given to the following person or persons—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: (where the information has been provided in connection with an application under any provision of this Part and the Commission is still considering the application) the Commission; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (in other cases) the Commission and (if the information provided relates to a registered institution) the Monetary Authority.

subsection.content: Where the information has been provided in connection with an application under any provision of this Part and the application has been refused or withdrawn, subsection (3) shall no longer apply in relation to the information.

Where a person becomes or ceases to be a director of a licensed corporation, both the person and the corporation shall, within 7 business days thereafter, notify the Commission in writing of the name and address of the person and of the nature of the position which he occupies or has ceased to occupy (as the case may be).
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1), (2), (3) or (6) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5.

section.name: s136
section.heading: Commission to maintain register of licensed persons and registered institutions

subsection.content: The Commission shall maintain a register of licensed persons and registered institutions in such form as it considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: The register maintained under subsection (1) shall contain in relation to each licence or registration—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name and business address of the licensed person or registered institution (as the case may be);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: such conditions of the licence or registration (as the case may be) as the Commission considers appropriate;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to each licensed representative, the name of his principal;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in relation to the licensed corporation or registered institution (as the case may be) the name and business address of each of its executive officers; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: such other particulars as are prescribed by rules made under section 397 for the purposes of this subsection.

subsection.leadIn: The register may be maintained—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in a documentary form; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by recording the information required under subsection (2) otherwise than in a documentary form, so long as the information is capable of being reproduced in a legible form.

subsection.content: For the purposes of enabling any member of the public to ascertain whether he is dealing with a licensed person or a registered institution in matters of or connected with any regulated activity and to ascertain the particulars of the licence or registration of such person or institution (as the case may be), the register shall be made available for public inspection at all reasonable times.

subsection.leadIn: At all reasonable times, a member of the public may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: inspect the register, or (where the register is maintained otherwise than in a documentary form) a reproduction of the information or the relevant part of it in a legible form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: obtain a copy of an entry in or extract of the register on payment of the prescribed fee.

subsection.leadIn: A document purporting to be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a copy of an entry in or extract of the register maintained under this section; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: certified by an authorized officer of the Commission as a true copy of the entry or extract referred to in paragraph (a),

subsection.continued: shall be admissible as evidence of its contents in any legal proceedings.

subsection.content: Without derogating from the other provisions of this section, the Commission shall, in addition, cause the register to be available to the public in the form of an on-line record.

section.name: s137
section.heading: Publication of names of licensed persons and registered institutions

subsection.content: The Commission shall at least once in each year publish at such time and in such manner as it considers appropriate the name and address of each licensed person and registered institution, the regulated activities for which the person or institution is licensed or registered and such conditions of the licence or registration as the Commission considers appropriate.

If the Commission amends the register maintained under section 136 by adding or removing the name of a licensed person or registered institution or varying the regulated activity for which a licensed person or registered institution is licensed or registered or any condition of a licence or registration, it shall publish particulars of the amendment within one month after making the amendment.

section.name: s138
section.heading: Annual fee and return

subsection.content: A person licensed under section 116 or 120(1) or a registered institution shall pay to the Commission an annual fee prescribed by rules made under section 395 for the purposes of this subsection.

The annual fee shall be payable within one month after each anniversary of the date of grant of the licence or certificate of registration (as the case may be), or on such other date as may be approved by the Commission by notice in writing.

subsection.leadIn: In default of full payment of the annual fee as required under subsection (2), the person shall pay to the Commission an additional sum calculated as follows—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: 10% of the fee or such part of the fee (as the case may be) that remains unpaid for the first month after the due date for its payment;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: 20% of the fee or such part of the fee (as the case may be) for each subsequent month when it remains unpaid,

subsection.continued: and in calculating the additional sum for the purposes of this subsection, any fraction of a month shall be treated as a month.
