subparagraph.content: where subsection (1)(a), (b), (c), (d) or (e) applies, the matter described in such subsection as being suggested by the circumstances referred to in such subsection; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: where subsection (1)(f) applies, the matter in respect of the investigation of which the Commission decides to provide assistance under section 186(1) or (2); and (Amended 19 of 2015 s. 21)

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: cannot be obtained by giving a direction to any other person under subsection (1)(i), (ii), (iii) or (iv).

subsection.leadIn: The power of an authorized person to give any direction under subsection (1) (other than subsection (1)(iii)) to any corporation which is an authorized financial institution may be exercised only in respect of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subsection (1)(e); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subsection (1)(f), if, and only if, the matter in respect of the investigation of which the Commission decides to provide assistance under section 186(1) or (2) is, in the opinion of the Commission, of a nature similar to the matter described in subsection (1)(e) as being suggested by the circumstances referred to in that subsection (1)(e). (Amended 19 of 2015 s. 21)

subsection.leadIn: Before an authorized person gives any direction under subsection (1) (other than subsection (1)(iii)) to any corporation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the corporation is an authorized financial institution or a corporation which, to the knowledge of the authorized person, is a controller of an authorized financial institution, or has as its controller an authorized financial institution, or has a controller that is also a controller of an authorized financial institution, the authorized person shall consult the Monetary Authority; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the corporation is an insurer authorized under the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41), the authorized person shall consult the Insurance Authority. (Amended 12 of 2015 s. 139)

subsection.content: The Commission may authorize in writing any person as an authorized person for the purposes of this section.

The Commission shall furnish an authorized person with a copy of his authorization, and the authorized person, before exercising any power under this section, shall produce a copy of the authorization to the person in respect of whom the power is exercised for inspection.

subsection.leadIn: A person who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with a requirement imposed on him by an authorized person under this section commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 1 year; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: A person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in purported compliance with a requirement imposed on him by an authorized person under this section, produces any record or document or provides or makes an explanation or statement which is false or misleading in a material particular; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: knows that, or is reckless as to whether, the record or document or the explanation or statement is false or misleading in a material particular,

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: A person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: with intent to defraud—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: fails to comply with a requirement imposed on him by an authorized person under this section; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in purported compliance with a requirement imposed on him by an authorized person under this section, produces any record or document or provides or makes an explanation or statement which is false or misleading in a material particular; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: being an officer or employee of a corporation, with intent to defraud causes or allows the corporation to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: fail to comply with a requirement imposed on it by an authorized person under this section; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in purported compliance with a requirement imposed on it by an authorized person under this section, produce any record or document or provide or make an explanation or statement which is false or misleading in a material particular,

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 7 years; or

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.content: A person is not excused from complying with a requirement imposed on the person by an authorized person under this section only on the ground that to do so might tend to incriminate the person.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: authorized person (獲授權人) means a person authorized under subsection (11);

def.name: MaterialTime
def.leadIn: material time (關鍵時間) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where subsection (1)(a), (b), (c), (d) or (e) applies, the time at which the matter described in such subsection as being suggested by the circumstances referred to in such subsection appears to the Commission as occurring; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where subsection (1)(f) applies, the time at which the matter in respect of the investigation of which the Commission decides to provide assistance under section 186(1) or (2) appears to the Commission as occurring; (Amended 19 of 2015 s. 21)

def.name: RelevantTime
def.leadIn: relevant time (有關時間)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a corporation which is listed, means any time since the formation of the corporation; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a corporation which was listed, means any time since the formation of the corporation but before the corporation ceased to remain listed.

section.name: s180
section.heading: Supervision of intermediaries and their associated entities

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (9) and (10), an authorized person may at any reasonable time, for the purpose of ascertaining whether an intermediary or an associated entity of an intermediary is complying or has complied with, or is likely to be able to comply with, the requirement specified in subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: enter—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: in the case of an intermediary—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: where it is a licensed corporation, its premises as approved by the Commission under section 130(1); or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: where it is a registered institution, the premises of the registered institution; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of an associated entity of an intermediary, the premises of the associated entity;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: inspect, and make copies or otherwise record details of, any record or document relating to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the business conducted by the intermediary or the associated entity (as the case may be);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any transaction carried out by a related corporation of the intermediary or the associated entity (as the case may be); or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: any transaction or activity which was undertaken in the course of, or which may affect, the business conducted by the intermediary or the associated entity (as the case may be); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: make inquiries of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the intermediary or the associated entity (as the case may be);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a related corporation of the intermediary or the associated entity (as the case may be);

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: subject to subsection (7), any other person, whether or not connected with the intermediary or the associated entity (as the case may be), whom the authorized person has reasonable cause to believe has information relating to, or is in possession of, any record or document referred to in paragraph (b),

paragraph.continued: concerning any record or document referred to in paragraph (b), or concerning any transaction or activity which was undertaken in the course of, or which may affect, the business conducted by the intermediary or the associated entity (as the case may be).

subsection.leadIn: The requirement specified for the purposes of subsection (1) is the requirement not to contravene—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any provision of this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: ba
paragraph.content: any provision of Part 2 (except section 6) of the Anti-Money Laundering and Counter-Terrorist Financing Ordinance (Cap. 615); (Added 15 of 2011 s. 89. Amended 4 of 2018 s. 44)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any notice or requirement given or made under or pursuant to any of the relevant provisions;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any of the terms and conditions of any licence or registration under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any other condition imposed under or pursuant to any provision of this Ordinance; or (Amended 16 of 2016 s. 7)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any provision in a code or guideline published under this Ordinance. (Added 16 of 2016 s. 7)

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (9) and (10), an authorized person in exercising any of his powers under subsection (1)(b) may require—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the intermediary or the associated entity (as the case may be);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a related corporation of the intermediary or the associated entity (as the case may be);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (8), any other person, whether or not connected with the intermediary or the associated entity (as the case may be), whom the authorized person has reasonable cause to believe has information relating to, or is in possession of, any record or document referred to in subsection (1)(b),

subsection.continued: to—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: give the authorized person access to any record or document referred to in subsection (1)(b), and produce, within the time and at the place specified by him, the record or document; and

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: answer any question regarding the record or document.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (9) and (10), an authorized person in exercising any of his powers under subsection (1)(c) may require the intermediary or the associated entity, the related corporation or the other person (as the case may be) referred to in subsection (1)(c), to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: give the authorized person access to any record or document referred to in subsection (1)(b), and produce, within the time and at the place specified by him, the record or document; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: answer any question raised for the purposes of subsection (1)(c).

subsection.name: 4A
subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (10), if the Commission decides to provide assistance in relation to a licensed corporation under section 186(2A), an authorized person may require the licensed corporation or a related corporation of the licensed corporation to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: provide to the authorized person, within the time and at the place specified by the authorized person, a copy of any record or document relating to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any regulated activity carried on by the licensed corporation; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any transaction or activity which was undertaken in the course of, or which may affect, any regulated activity carried on by the licensed corporation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: answer any question raised by the authorized person regarding any record, document, regulated activity, transaction or activity referred to in paragraph (a). (Added 19 of 2015 s. 22)

subsection.content: An authorized person may in writing require the person giving an answer under this section to verify within a reasonable period specified in the requirement the answer by statutory declaration, which may be taken by the authorized person.

If a person does not give an answer in accordance with a requirement under this section for the reason that the answer was not within his knowledge, an authorized person may in writing require the person to verify within a reasonable period specified in the requirement by statutory declaration, which may be taken by the authorized person, that he was unable to comply or fully comply (as the case may be) with the requirement for that reason.

An authorized person shall not exercise any of his powers under subsection (1)(c)(iii) unless he has reasonable cause to believe that the information sought cannot be obtained by the exercise of any of the powers under subsection (1)(c)(i) or (ii).

An authorized person shall not exercise any of his powers under subsection (3)(c) unless he has reasonable cause to believe that the record or document or the information sought cannot be obtained by the exercise of any of the powers under subsection (3)(a) or (b).

This section shall not be construed as requiring an authorized financial institution, not being the intermediary or the associated entity in question as referred to in subsection (1) or a related corporation of the intermediary or the associated entity (as the case may be), to disclose any information or produce any record or document relating to the affairs of a customer unless the relevant authority is satisfied, and certifies in writing that it is satisfied, that the disclosure or production is necessary for the purposes of this section.

subsection.leadIn: Before an authorized person exercises any power under this section (other than subsection (1)(c)(iii) or (3)(c)) in respect of a corporation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the corporation is an authorized financial institution or a corporation which, to the knowledge of the authorized person, is a controller of an authorized financial institution, or has as its controller an authorized financial institution, or has a controller that is also a controller of an authorized financial institution, the authorized person shall consult the Monetary Authority; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the corporation is an insurer authorized under the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41), the authorized person shall consult the Insurance Authority. (Amended 12 of 2015 s. 140)

subsection.content: The relevant authority may authorize in writing any person as an authorized person for the purposes of this section.

The relevant authority shall furnish an authorized person authorized by it with a copy of his authorization, and the authorized person, when exercising any power under this section, shall as soon as reasonably practicable produce a copy of the authorization for inspection.

Where a copy of any record or document is supplied or made for the purpose of complying with a requirement imposed under this section and a facility of a person other than the relevant authority is used to make the copy, the relevant authority shall reimburse the expenses which, in the opinion of the relevant authority, have been reasonably incurred by the person in making the copy.

subsection.leadIn: A person who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with a requirement imposed on him by an authorized person under this section commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 1 year; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: A person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in purported compliance with a requirement imposed on him by an authorized person under this section, produces any record or document or gives an answer which is false or misleading in a material particular; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: knows that, or is reckless as to whether, the record or document or the answer is false or misleading in a material particular,

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: A person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: with intent to defraud—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: fails to comply with a requirement imposed on him by an authorized person under this section; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in purported compliance with a requirement imposed on him by an authorized person under this section, produces any record or document or gives an answer which is false or misleading in a material particular; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: being an officer or employee of a corporation, with intent to defraud causes or allows the corporation to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: fail to comply with a requirement imposed on it by an authorized person under this section; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in purported compliance with a requirement imposed on it by an authorized person under this section, produce any record or document or give an answer which is false or misleading in a material particular,

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 7 years; or

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: authorized person (獲授權人) means a person authorized under subsection (11);

def.name: RelevantAuthority
def.leadIn: relevant authority (有關當局) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: where—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the intermediary in question as referred to in subsection (1) is a registered institution; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the associated entity in question as referred to in that subsection is the associated entity of a registered institution,

paragraph.continued: the Monetary Authority; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case, the Commission.

section.name: s181
section.heading: Information relating to transactions

subsection.leadIn: An authorized person may, for the purpose of enabling or assisting the Commission to perform a function under any of the relevant provisions, require—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person registered as the holder of securities in a register of members kept under the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622); (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person whom the authorized person has reasonable cause to believe holds any securities, futures contract, leveraged foreign exchange contract, OTC derivative product, or an interest in any securities, futures contract, leveraged foreign exchange contract, OTC derivative product or collective investment scheme;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a person whom the authorized person has reasonable cause to believe has acquired or disposed of any securities, futures contract, leveraged foreign exchange contract, OTC derivative product, or an interest in any securities, futures contract, leveraged foreign exchange contract, OTC derivative product or collective investment scheme, whether directly or through a nominee, trustee or agent, and whether as beneficial owner, nominee, trustee, agent or otherwise;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a licensed person or registered institution through whom or which the authorized person has reasonable cause to believe any securities, futures contract, leveraged foreign exchange contract, OTC derivative product, or an interest in any securities, futures contract, leveraged foreign exchange contract, OTC derivative product or collective investment scheme has been acquired, disposed of, dealt with, traded or arranged,

subsection.continued: to furnish to him any of the information specified in subsection (2) within the time and in the form specified by him. (Amended 6 of 2014 s. 16)

subsection.leadIn: The information specified for the purposes of subsection (1) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the particulars (including, in so far as applicable, the name and aliases, address, telephone and facsimile numbers, electronic mail address, occupation and particulars of any document of identity (including, if not an individual, any document evidencing incorporation or registration)) that are reasonably capable of establishing the identity of the person on whose behalf, or by, from, to or through whom, the securities, futures contract, leveraged foreign exchange contract, OTC derivative product, or the interest in securities, futures contract, leveraged foreign exchange contract, OTC derivative product or collective investment scheme in question is held, or has been acquired, disposed of, dealt with, traded or arranged (as the case may be);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the particulars (including the quantity) of and, in the case of acquisition or disposal, the consideration (if any) for the securities, futures contract, leveraged foreign exchange contract, OTC derivative product, or the interest in securities, futures contract, leveraged foreign exchange contract, OTC derivative product or collective investment scheme; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the instructions (if any) given to or by the person referred to in paragraph (a), or any officer, employee or agent of such person, in relation to the holding, acquisition, disposal, dealing, trading, arrangement of or in respect of the securities, futures contract, leveraged foreign exchange contract, OTC derivative product, or the interest in securities, futures contract, leveraged foreign exchange contract, OTC derivative product or collective investment scheme. (Amended 6 of 2014 s. 16)

subsection.content: An authorized person may in writing require the person furnishing any information under this section to verify within a reasonable period specified in the requirement the information by statutory declaration, which may be taken by the authorized person.

If a person does not furnish any information in accordance with a requirement under this section for the reason that the information was not within his knowledge or in his possession, an authorized person may in writing require the person to verify within a reasonable period specified in the requirement by statutory declaration, which may be taken by the authorized person, that he was unable to comply or fully comply (as the case may be) with the requirement for that reason.
The Commission may authorize in writing any person as an authorized person for the purposes of this section.

The Commission shall furnish an authorized person with a copy of his authorization, and the authorized person, when exercising any power under this section, shall upon request by the person in respect of whom the power is exercised produce a copy of the authorization for inspection.

subsection.leadIn: A person who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with a requirement imposed on him by an authorized person under this section commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 1 year; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: A person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in purported compliance with a requirement imposed on him by an authorized person under this section, furnishes to the authorized person information which is false or misleading in a material particular; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: knows that, or is reckless as to whether, the information is false or misleading in a material particular,

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: A person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: with intent to defraud—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: fails to comply with a requirement imposed on him by an authorized person under this section; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in purported compliance with a requirement imposed on him by an authorized person under this section, furnishes to the authorized person information which is false or misleading in a material particular; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: being an officer or employee of a corporation, with intent to defraud causes or allows the corporation to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: fail to comply with a requirement imposed on it by an authorized person under this section; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in purported compliance with a requirement imposed on it by an authorized person under this section, furnish to the authorized person information which is false or misleading in a material particular,

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 7 years; or

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: authorized person (獲授權人) means a person authorized under subsection (5);
interest (權益) includes an interest of any nature, whether legal, equitable, proprietary or otherwise.

section.name: s182
section.heading: Investigations by Commission

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Commission has reasonable cause to believe that an offence under any of the relevant provisions may have been committed;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the Commission has reasonable cause to believe that a person may have engaged in defalcation, fraud, misfeasance or other misconduct in connection with—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: dealing in any securities or futures contract or trading in any leveraged foreign exchange contract;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the management of investment in any securities, futures contract or leveraged foreign exchange contract;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: offering or making any structured product, leveraged foreign exchange contract or collective investment scheme; (Amended 8 of 2011 s. 9)

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: giving advice in relation to the allotment of securities, or the acquisition or disposal of, or investment in, any securities, structured product, futures contract, leveraged foreign exchange contract, or an interest in any securities, structured product, futures contract, leveraged foreign exchange contract or collective investment scheme; or (Amended 8 of 2011 s. 9)

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: any transaction involving securities margin financing;

content.i: (Addition not yet in operation—see 6 of 2014 s. 18)
(Addition not yet in operation—see 6 of 2014 s. 18)

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: the management of an open-ended fund company or the management or safe keeping of the scheme property of an open-ended fund company; (Added 16 of 2016 s. 8)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Commission has reasonable cause to believe that market misconduct may have taken place;

paragraph.name: ca
paragraph.content: the Commission has reasonable cause to believe that a breach of a disclosure requirement may have taken place under Part XIVA; (Added 9 of 2012 s. 4)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the Commission has reasonable cause to believe that the manner in which a person has engaged or is engaging in any of the activities referred to in paragraph (b) is not in the interest of the investing public or in the public interest; (Amended 17 of 2021 s. 9)

paragraph.name: da
paragraph.content: the Commission has reasonable cause to believe that a prescribed person other than an authorized financial institution or an approved money broker may have contravened the reporting obligation, clearing obligation, trading obligation or record keeping obligation; (Added 6 of 2014 s. 18)

paragraph.name: db
paragraph.content: the Commission has reasonable cause to believe that a registered SIP may have failed to comply with a requirement made under section 101X; (Added 6 of 2014 s. 18)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: the Commission—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: for the purpose of considering whether to exercise any power under section 194 or 196, has reason to inquire whether any person is or was at any time guilty of misconduct, or is not a fit and proper person, as described in section 194(1) or (2) or 196(1) or (2); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: for the purpose of assisting the Monetary Authority to consider whether to exercise any power under section 58A or 71C of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155), has reason to inquire whether any person—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: is or was at any time guilty of misconduct, or is not or has ceased to be a fit and proper person, as described in section 58A(1) of that Ordinance; or

subparagraph.name: B

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the Commission has reason to inquire whether any of the conditions imposed in respect of an authorization under section 104, 104A or 105 are being complied with; (Amended 8 of 2011 s. 9; 16 of 2016 s. 8)

paragraph.name: fa
paragraph.content: the Commission has reason to inquire whether, with respect to an open-ended fund company, any of the requirements for registration specified in section 112E is no longer met; (Added 16 of 2016 s. 8)

paragraph.name: fb
paragraph.content: the Commission has reason to inquire whether any of the conditions imposed in respect of the registration of an open-ended fund company has been or is being complied with; or (Added 16 of 2016 s. 8)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: a matter in respect of the investigation of which the Commission decides to provide assistance under section 186(1) or (2) is, in the opinion of the Commission, of a nature similar to the matter described in paragraph (a), (b), (c), (d), (da), (db), (e), (f), (fa) or (fb) as that which the Commission has reasonable cause to believe or has reason to inquire (as the case may be), (Amended 6 of 2014 s. 18; 19 of 2015 s. 23; 16 of 2016 s. 8)

subsection.continued: the Commission may in writing direct one or more of its employees or, with the consent of the Financial Secretary, appoint one or more other persons, to investigate any of the matters referred to in paragraphs (a) to (g).

subsection.content: The costs and expenses incurred by an investigator, other than an employee of the Commission, are to be paid out of moneys provided by the Legislative Council.

The Commission shall furnish an investigator with a copy of his direction or appointment (as the case may be), and the investigator, before first imposing any requirement on a person under section 183(1), (2) or (3), shall produce a copy of the direction or appointment (as the case may be) to that person for inspection.

subsection.leadIn: Before the Commission directs any of its employees, or appoints any person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to investigate any matter under subsection (1)(e)(i), to the extent that the investigation is for the purpose of considering whether to exercise any power under section 196; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to investigate any matter under subsection (1)(e)(ii),

subsection.continued: the Commission shall consult the Monetary Authority.

editorialNote.text: # The new section 182(1)(da) added by the Securities and Futures (Amendment) Ordinance 2014 (6 of 2014) came into operation on—

paragraph.content: (a)10 July 2015, in so far as it relates to the contravention of the reporting obligation and the record keeping obligation; please see paragraph (f) of the Securities and Futures (Amendment) Ordinance 2014 (Commencement) Notice 2015 (L.N. 95 of 2015); and

(b)1 September 2016, in so far as it relates to the contravention of the clearing obligation; please see paragraph (b) of the Securities and Futures (Amendment) Ordinance 2014 (Commencement) Notice 2016 (L.N. 27 of 2016).

editorialNote.text: @ Not yet in operation.

## The amendment to section 182(1)(g) made by the Securities and Futures (Amendment) Ordinance 2014 (6 of 2014) came into operation on 10 July 2015, except in so far as it relates to the new section 182(1)(db) of the Ordinance. Please see paragraph (g) of the Securities and Futures (Amendment) Ordinance 2014 (Commencement) Notice 2015 (L.N. 95 of 2015).

section.name: s183
section.heading: Conduct of investigations

subsection.leadIn: The person under investigation or a person whom the investigator has reasonable cause to believe has in his possession any record or document which contains, or which is likely to contain, information relevant to an investigation under section 182, or whom the investigator has reasonable cause to believe otherwise has such information in his possession, shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: produce to the investigator, within the time and at the place the investigator reasonably requires in writing, any record or document specified by the investigator which is, or may be, relevant to the investigation and which is in his possession;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if required by the investigator, give the investigator an explanation or further particulars in respect of any record or document produced under paragraph (a);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: attend before the investigator at the time and place the investigator reasonably requires in writing, and answer any question relating to the matters under investigation that the investigator may raise with him; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: give the investigator all assistance in connection with the investigation which he is reasonably able to give, including responding to any written question raised by the investigator.

subsection.content: An investigator may in writing require the person giving or making an explanation, particulars, answer or statement under this section to verify within a reasonable period specified in the requirement the explanation, particulars, answer or statement by statutory declaration, which may be taken by the investigator.

If a person does not give or make an explanation, particulars, answer or statement in accordance with a requirement under this section for the reason that the explanation, particulars, answer or statement was not within his knowledge or in his possession, an investigator may in writing require the person to verify within a reasonable period specified in the requirement by statutory declaration, which may be taken by the investigator, that he was unable to comply or fully comply (as the case may be) with the requirement for that reason.

subsection.leadIn: Neither section 182 nor this section shall be construed as requiring an authorized financial institution to disclose any information or produce any record or document relating to the affairs of a customer to the investigator unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the customer is a person whom the investigator has reasonable cause to believe may be able to give information relevant to the investigation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Commission is satisfied, and certifies in writing that it is satisfied, that the disclosure or production is necessary for the purposes of the investigation.

subsection.content: The investigator may, and if so directed by the Commission shall, make interim reports on his investigation to the Commission, and on the conclusion of his investigation shall make a final report on his investigation to the Commission.
The Commission may, with the consent of the Secretary for Justice, cause a report under this section to be published.

section.name: s184
section.heading: Offences in relation to investigations

subsection.leadIn: A person who, without reasonable excuse—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: fails to produce any record or document required to be produced under section 183(1)(a);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: fails to give an explanation or further particulars required under section 183(1)(b);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: fails to attend before the investigator as required under section 183(1)(c);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: fails to answer a question raised by the investigator under section 183(1)(c);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: fails to comply with section 183(1)(d); or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: fails to comply with a requirement under section 183(2) or (3),

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 1 year; or

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: A person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: who—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in purportedly complying with a requirement imposed by the investigator under section 183(1)(a), produces any record or document which is false or misleading in a material particular;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in purportedly complying with a requirement imposed by the investigator under section 183(1)(b), gives any explanation or further particulars which are false or misleading in a material particular;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: in purportedly answering any question raised by the investigator under section 183(1)(c), says anything which is false or misleading in a material particular; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: in purportedly responding to any written question raised by the investigator under section 183(1)(d), states anything which is false or misleading in a material particular; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: who knows that, or is reckless as to whether, the record or document, the explanation or further particulars, the thing or the statement (as the case may be) is false or misleading in a material particular,

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: A person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: with intent to defraud—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: fails to do anything described in subsection (1)(a), (b), (c), (d), (e) or (f);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in purportedly complying with a requirement imposed by the investigator under section 183(1)(a), produces any record or document which is false or misleading in a material particular;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: in purportedly complying with a requirement imposed by the investigator under section 183(1)(b), gives any explanation or further particulars which are false or misleading in a material particular;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: in purportedly answering any question raised by the investigator under section 183(1)(c), says anything which is false or misleading in a material particular; or

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: in purportedly responding to any written question raised by the investigator under section 183(1)(d), states anything which is false or misleading in a material particular; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: being an officer or employee of a corporation, with intent to defraud causes or allows the corporation to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: fail to do anything described in subsection (1)(a), (b), (c), (d), (e) or (f);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in purportedly complying with a requirement imposed by the investigator under section 183(1)(a), produce any record or document which is false or misleading in a material particular;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: in purportedly complying with a requirement imposed by the investigator under section 183(1)(b), give any explanation or further particulars which are false or misleading in a material particular;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: in purportedly answering any question raised by the investigator under section 183(1)(c), say anything which is false or misleading in a material particular; or

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: in purportedly responding to any written question raised by the investigator under section 183(1)(d), state anything which is false or misleading in a material particular,

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 7 years; or

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (Amended 6 of 2014 s. 19)

subsection.content: A person is not excused from complying with a requirement imposed on the person by an investigator under section 183 only on the ground that to do so might tend to incriminate the person.

Where any person is convicted by a court on a prosecution instituted as a result of an investigation under section 182, the court may order him to pay to the Commission the whole or a part of the costs and expenses of the investigation and the Commission may recover the whole or the part (as the case may be) of the costs and expenses as a civil debt due to it.

Where the Commission receives an amount under an order made under subsection (5) in respect of any of the costs and expenses of an investigation, and all or any of the costs and expenses have been paid out of moneys provided by the Legislative Council, the Commission shall pay to the Financial Secretary the amount received under the order to the extent that it has already been paid out of moneys provided by the Legislative Council.

section.name: s184A
section.heading: Investigations by Monetary Authority

subsection.leadIn: If the Monetary Authority has reasonable cause to believe that an authorized financial institution or an approved money broker may have contravened the reporting obligation, clearing obligation, trading obligation or record keeping obligation, the Monetary Authority may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: direct in writing one or more persons appointed under section 5A(3) of the Exchange Fund Ordinance (Cap. 66) to investigate the matter; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: with the consent of the Financial Secretary, appoint in writing one or more other persons to investigate the matter.

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority must give an MA investigator a copy of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the direction, if the MA investigator is directed under subsection (1)(a); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the appointment, if the MA investigator is appointed under subsection (1)(b).

subsection.content: The MA investigator must, before first imposing a requirement on a person under section 184B(1), (2) or (3), produce a copy of the direction or appointment for inspection by the person.

editorialNote.text: # The new section 184A added by the Securities and Futures (Amendment) Ordinance 2014 (6 of 2014) came into operation on—

paragraph.content: (a)10 July 2015, in so far as it relates to the contravention of the reporting obligation and the record keeping obligation; please see paragraph (i)(i) of the Securities and Futures (Amendment) Ordinance 2014 (Commencement) Notice 2015 (L.N. 95 of 2015); and

(b)1 September 2016, in so far as it relates to the contravention of the clearing obligation; please see paragraph (c) of the Securities and Futures (Amendment) Ordinance 2014 (Commencement) Notice 2016 (L.N. 27 of 2016).

section.name: s184B
section.heading: Conduct of investigations

subsection.leadIn: A person under investigation or a person whom the MA investigator has reasonable cause to believe to be in possession of any record or document that contains, or that is likely to contain, information relevant to an investigation under section 184A, or whom the MA investigator has reasonable cause to believe to be otherwise in possession of such information, must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: produce to the MA investigator, within the time and at a place the MA investigator reasonably requires in writing, a record or document specified by the MA investigator—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that is, or may be, relevant to the investigation; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: that is in the person’s possession;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if required by the MA investigator, give the MA investigator an explanation or further particulars in respect of a record or document produced under paragraph (a);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: attend before the MA investigator at a time and place the MA investigator reasonably requires in writing, and answer any question relating to a matter under investigation raised by the MA investigator; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: give the MA investigator all assistance in connection with the investigation that the person is reasonably able to give, including responding to any written question raised by the MA investigator.

subsection.content: An MA investigator may require, in writing, a person who makes or gives an explanation, particulars, answer or statement under this section to verify, by statutory declaration, within a reasonable period specified in the requirement, the explanation, particulars, answer or statement.

subsection.leadIn: If a person does not make or give an explanation, particulars, answer or statement in accordance with a requirement under this section for the reason that the explanation, particulars, answer or statement was not within the person’s knowledge or in the person’s possession, an MA investigator may require, in writing, the person to verify by statutory declaration—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the person was unable to comply or fully comply (as the case may be) with the requirement for that reason; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: within a reasonable period specified in the requirement.

subsection.content: A statutory declaration under this section may be made before the MA investigator.

section.name: s184C
section.heading: Investigation reports

subsection.leadIn: An MA investigator—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may make interim reports on the investigation conducted under this Division to the Monetary Authority;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must make interim reports on the investigation to the Monetary Authority if directed by the Monetary Authority; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: must, after the completion of the investigation, make a final report on the investigation to the Monetary Authority.

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority may, with the consent of the Secretary for Justice, publish any report made under subsection (1).

section.name: s184D
section.heading: Offences relating to investigations

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person, without reasonable excuse—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: fails to produce a record or document required to be produced under section 184B(1)(a);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: fails to give an explanation or further particulars required under section 184B(1)(b);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: fails to attend before the MA investigator as required under section 184B(1)(c);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: fails to answer a question raised by the MA investigator under section 184B(1)(c);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: fails to comply with section 184B(1)(d); or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: fails to comply with a requirement under section 184B(2) or (3).

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 1 year; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in purportedly complying with a requirement imposed by the MA investigator under section 184B(1)(a), produces a record or document that is false or misleading in a material particular;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in purportedly complying with a requirement imposed by the MA investigator under section 184B(1)(b), gives an explanation or further particulars that are false or misleading in a material particular;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: in purportedly answering a question raised by the MA investigator under section 184B(1)(c), says anything that is false or misleading in a material particular; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: in purportedly responding to a written question raised by the MA investigator under section 184B(1)(d), states anything that is false or misleading in a material particular; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person knows that, or is reckless as to whether, the record or document, the explanation or further particulars, the thing said or statement is false or misleading in a material particular.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (3) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person with intent to defraud—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: fails to do anything described in subsection (1)(a), (b), (c), (d), (e) or (f);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in purportedly complying with a requirement imposed by the MA investigator under section 184B(1)(a), produces a record or document that is false or misleading in a material particular;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in purportedly complying with a requirement imposed by the MA investigator under section 184B(1)(b), gives an explanation or further particulars that are false or misleading in a material particular;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in purportedly answering a question raised by the MA investigator under section 184B(1)(c), says anything that is false or misleading in a material particular; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: in purportedly responding to a written question raised by the MA investigator under section 184B(1)(d), states anything that is false or misleading in a material particular.

subsection.leadIn: An officer or employee of a corporation commits an offence if the officer or employee, with intent to defraud, causes or allows the corporation to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: fail to do anything described in subsection (1)(a), (b), (c), (d), (e) or (f);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in purportedly complying with a requirement imposed by the MA investigator under section 184B(1)(a), produce a record or document that is false or misleading in a material particular;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in purportedly complying with a requirement imposed by the MA investigator under section 184B(1)(b), give an explanation or further particulars that are false or misleading in a material particular;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in purportedly answering a question raised by the MA investigator under section 184B(1)(c), say anything that is false or misleading in a material particular; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: in purportedly responding to a written question raised by the MA investigator under section 184B(1)(d), state anything that is false or misleading in a material particular.

subsection.content: A person is not excused from complying with a requirement imposed under section 184B(1), (2) or (3) only on the ground that to do so might tend to incriminate the person.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (5) or (6) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 7 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s184E
section.heading: Recovery of costs of investigation

subsection.content: If a person is convicted by a court on a prosecution instituted as a result of an investigation under this Division, the court may order the person to pay to the Monetary Authority the whole or a part of the costs and expenses of the investigation.
The Monetary Authority may recover, as a civil debt due to the Monetary Authority, the whole or the part (as the case may be) of the costs and expenses ordered under subsection (1).
The Monetary Authority must pay into the Exchange Fund any costs and expenses recovered under subsection (2).

section.name: s185
section.heading: Application to Court of First Instance relating to non-compliance with requirements under section 179, 180, 181, 183 or 184B

subsection.leadIn: If a person fails to do anything upon being required to do so by an authorized person under section 179, 180 or 181, or to do anything upon being required to do so by an investigator under section 183(1), (2) or (3), the Commission may, by originating summons or originating motion, make an application to the Court of First Instance in respect of the failure, and the Court may inquire into the case and— (Amended 9 of 2012 s. 40)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the Court is satisfied that there is no reasonable excuse for the person not to comply with the requirement, order the person to comply with the requirement within the period specified by the Court; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the Court is satisfied that the failure was without reasonable excuse, punish the person, and any other person knowingly involved in the failure, in the same manner as if he and, where applicable, that other person had been guilty of contempt of court.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: If a person fails to do anything on being required to do so by an MA investigator under section 184B(1), (2) or (3), the Monetary Authority may, by originating summons, make an application to the Court of First Instance in respect of the failure. (Added 6 of 2014 s. 21)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.leadIn: The Court of First Instance may inquire into the case and if satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is no reasonable excuse for the person not to comply with the requirement, order the person to comply with it within the period specified by the Court; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the failure was without reasonable excuse, punish the person, and any other person knowingly involved in the failure, in the same manner as if the person, and (if applicable) that other person, had been guilty of contempt of court. (Added 6 of 2014 s. 21)

subsection.content: An originating summons under subsection (1) or (1A) shall be in Form No. 10 in Appendix A to the Rules of the High Court (Cap. 4 sub. leg. A).

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding anything in this section and any other provisions of this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: no proceedings may be instituted against any person for the purposes of subsection (1)(b) or (1B)(b) in respect of any conduct if— (Amended 6 of 2014 s. 21)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: criminal proceedings have previously been instituted against the person under section 179, 180, 181, 184 or 184D in respect of the same conduct; and

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: those criminal proceedings remain pending; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: by reason of the previous institution of those criminal proceedings, no criminal proceedings may again be lawfully instituted against that person under such section in respect of the same conduct;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: no criminal proceedings may be instituted against any person under section 179, 180, 181, 184 or 184D in respect of any conduct if— (Amended 6 of 2014 s. 21)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: proceedings have previously been instituted against the person for the purposes of subsection (1)(b) or (1B)(b) in respect of the same conduct; and

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: those proceedings remain pending; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: by reason of the previous institution of those proceedings, no proceedings may again be lawfully instituted against that person for the purposes of such subsection in respect of the same conduct.

section.name: s186
section.heading: Commission’s assistance to regulators outside Hong Kong

subsection.leadIn: Where the Commission receives, from an authority or regulatory organization outside Hong Kong which in the opinion of the Commission satisfies the requirements referred to in subsection (5)(a) and (b), a request for assistance to investigate whether a person specified by the authority or regulatory organization has contravened or is contravening legal or regulatory requirements which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the authority or regulatory organization enforces or administers; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: relate to such transactions regarding any securities, futures contract, leveraged foreign exchange contract, OTC derivative product, collective investment scheme or other similar transactions as are regulated by the authority or regulatory organization, (Amended 6 of 2014 s. 22)

subsection.continued: the Commission may, where it is of the opinion that the condition specified in subsection (3) is satisfied, provide the assistance to investigate the matter by directing that any of the powers under sections 179, 181, 182 and 183 be exercised. (Amended 19 of 2015 s. 24)

subsection.content: Where the Commission receives, from a companies inspector outside Hong Kong who in the opinion of the Commission satisfies the requirements referred to in subsection (5)(a) and (b), a request for assistance to investigate whether a person specified by the companies inspector has contravened or is contravening legal or regulatory requirements which relate to transactions regarding any securities, futures contract, leveraged foreign exchange contract, OTC derivative product, collective investment scheme or other similar transactions, the Commission may, where it is of the opinion that the condition specified in subsection (3) is satisfied, provide the assistance to investigate the matter by directing that any of the powers under sections 179, 181, 182 and 183 be exercised. (Amended 6 of 2014 s. 22; 19 of 2015 s. 24)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.leadIn: Where the Commission receives, from an authority or regulatory organization outside Hong Kong, a request for assistance in relation to a licensed corporation, the Commission may provide the assistance by directing that the power under section 180(4A) be exercised if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the opinion of the Commission—

subparagraph.content: the authority or regulatory organization satisfies the requirements referred to in subsection (5)(a) and (b); and
the condition specified in subsection (3) is satisfied; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the authority or regulatory organization has provided to the Commission a written statement that conforms with subsection (2D) and a written undertaking that conforms with subsection (2E). (Added 19 of 2015 s. 24)

subsection.name: 2B
subsection.leadIn: In subsection (2A), a reference to assistance in relation to a licensed corporation is a reference to assistance to ascertain whether a corporation specified in subsection (2C)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: constitutes a risk to, or may affect, the financial stability of the jurisdiction of the authority or regulatory organization; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: is complying or has complied with, or is likely to be able to comply with, legal or regulatory requirements that—

subparagraph.content: are administered by the authority or regulatory organization; and

relate to transactions or activities regarding any securities, futures contract, leveraged foreign exchange contract, OTC derivative product, collective investment scheme, or other similar transactions or activities, that are regulated by the authority or regulatory organization. (Added 19 of 2015 s. 24)

subsection.name: 2C
subsection.leadIn: The corporation specified for the purposes of subsection (2B) is one that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is regulated by the authority or regulatory organization; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is a licensed corporation or a related corporation of a licensed corporation. (Added 19 of 2015 s. 24)

subsection.name: 2D
subsection.leadIn: The written statement referred to in subsection (2A)(b) must be to the effect of confirming that the authority or regulatory organization has not been and will not be able to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: obtain the information referred to in section 180(4A)(a) or (b) by any other reasonable means; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: fully ascertain the matters described in subsection (2B) without the information. (Added 19 of 2015 s. 24)

subsection.name: 2E
subsection.leadIn: The written undertaking referred to in subsection (2A)(b) must be to the effect that the authority or regulatory organization—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: will not use any of the information in any proceedings, in the jurisdiction of the authority or regulatory organization or elsewhere, unless—

subparagraph.content: the authority or regulatory organization has made a separate request under subsection (1) (investigation request), and the Commission has decided to provide assistance under that subsection; and

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.leadIn: will, on receiving a demand legally enforceable under the laws of the jurisdiction of the authority or regulatory organization, for the disclosure of any of the information—

subparagraph.content: inform the Commission as soon as reasonably practicable; and

assist in preserving the confidentiality of the information by taking all appropriate measures as may be available (including but not limited to asserting legal exemptions or privileges under the laws of the jurisdiction of the authority or regulatory organization); and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: will cooperate with the Commission in any action or proceedings, in the jurisdiction of the authority or regulatory organization or elsewhere, that seek to safeguard the confidentiality of any of the information. (Added 19 of 2015 s. 24)

subsection.leadIn: The condition referred to in subsections (1), (2) and (2A)(a)(ii) is that— (Amended 19 of 2015 s. 24)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is desirable or expedient that the assistance requested under subsection (1), (2) or (2A) (as the case may be) should be provided in the interest of the investing public or in the public interest; or (Amended 19 of 2015 s. 24)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the assistance will enable or assist the recipient of the assistance to perform its or his functions and it is not contrary to the interest of the investing public or to the public interest that the assistance should be provided.

subsection.leadIn: In deciding whether the condition specified in subsection (3) is satisfied in a particular case, the Commission shall take into account—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: where the recipient of the assistance is an authority or regulatory organization referred to in subsection (1) or (2A), whether the authority or regulatory organization will— (Amended 19 of 2015 s. 24)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: pay to the Commission any of the costs and expenses incurred in providing the assistance; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: be able and willing to provide reciprocal assistance within its jurisdiction in response to a comparable request for assistance from Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: where the recipient of the assistance is a companies inspector referred to in subsection (2), whether—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the companies inspector will pay to the Commission any of the costs and expenses incurred in providing the assistance; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: under the laws of the country or territory in which the companies inspector is appointed, reciprocal assistance will be provided in response to a comparable request for assistance from Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: Where the Commission is satisfied, for the purposes of subsection (1), (2) or (2A)(a)(i), that an authority, regulatory organization or companies inspector outside Hong Kong— (Amended 19 of 2015 s. 24)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: performs any function similar to a function of the Commission or the Registrar of Companies, or regulates, supervises or investigates banking, insurance or other financial services or the affairs of corporations; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is subject to adequate secrecy provisions,

subsection.continued: the Commission shall as soon as reasonably practicable thereafter cause the name of the authority, regulatory organization or companies inspector (as the case may be) to be published in the Gazette.

subsection.leadIn: If a person is required—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to provide or make an explanation or statement as required by an authorized person within the meaning of section 179 exercising pursuant to subsection (1) or (2) a power under section 179; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to give an explanation or further particulars as required by, or to give an answer to any question as raised by, an investigator exercising pursuant to subsection (1) or (2) a power under section 183,

subsection.continued: and the explanation or statement, the explanation or further particulars, or the answer (as the case may be) might tend to incriminate him and he so claims before providing or making the explanation or statement, giving the explanation or further particulars, or giving the answer (as the case may be), then, without limiting the provisions of section 187, the authorized person or investigator (as the case may be) shall not provide evidence of the requirement and the explanation or statement, the explanation or further particulars, or the question and answer (as the case may be) to an authority, regulatory organization or companies inspector outside Hong Kong for use in criminal proceedings against him in the jurisdiction of the authority, regulatory organization or companies inspector (as the case may be).

subsection.content: Where the Commission receives from an authority, regulatory organization or companies inspector outside Hong Kong an amount paid in respect of any of the costs and expenses incurred in providing assistance under this section, and all or any of the costs and expenses have been paid out of moneys provided by the Legislative Council, the Commission shall pay to the Financial Secretary the amount received to the extent that it has already been paid out of moneys provided by the Legislative Council.
Any matter published under subsection (5) is not subsidiary legislation.

subsection.def: In this section, companies inspector (公司審查員), in relation to a place outside Hong Kong, means a person whose functions under the laws of that place include the investigation of the affairs of a corporation carrying on business in that place.

section.name: s186A
section.heading: Monetary Authority’s assistance to regulators outside Hong Kong

subsection.leadIn: If the Monetary Authority receives from a non-Hong Kong entity a request for assistance described in subsection (2), the Monetary Authority may give the requested assistance by exercising the powers under sections 184A and 184B if, in the opinion of the Monetary Authority— (Amended 31 of 2025 s. 157)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the non-Hong Kong entity satisfies the requirements referred to in subsection (5); and (Amended 31 of 2025 s. 157)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the condition in subsection (7) is satisfied.

subsection.leadIn: A request for assistance referred to in subsection (1) is a request for assistance to investigate whether a person specified by the non-Hong Kong entity has contravened or is contravening legal or regulatory requirements that— (Amended 31 of 2025 s. 157)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the non-Hong Kong entity enforces or administers; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: relate to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: transactions regarding OTC derivative products regulated by the non-Hong Kong entity; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: other similar transactions regulated by the non-Hong Kong entity. (Amended 31 of 2025 s. 157)

subsection.leadIn: If the Monetary Authority receives from a companies inspector outside Hong Kong a request for assistance described in subsection (4), the Monetary Authority may give the requested assistance by exercising the powers under sections 184A and 184B if, in the opinion of the Monetary Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the companies inspector satisfies the requirements referred to in subsection (6); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the condition in subsection (7) is satisfied.

subsection.content: A request for assistance referred to in subsection (3) is a request for assistance to investigate whether a person specified by the companies inspector outside Hong Kong has contravened or is contravening legal or regulatory requirements that relate to transactions regarding OTC derivative products or other similar transactions.

subsection.leadIn: The requirements referred to in subsection (1)(a) are that the non-Hong Kong entity— (Amended 31 of 2025 s. 157)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: performs functions similar to the functions of the Monetary Authority or regulates, supervises or investigates banking, insurance or other financial services; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is subject to adequate secrecy provisions.

subsection.leadIn: The requirements referred to in subsection (3)(a) are that the companies inspector outside Hong Kong—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: performs functions similar to the functions of the Registrar of Companies or regulates, supervises or investigates the affairs of corporations; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is subject to adequate secrecy provisions.

subsection.leadIn: The condition referred to in subsections (1)(b) and (3)(b) is that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is desirable or expedient that the assistance should be given in the interests of the investing public or in the public interest; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the assistance will enable or assist the recipient of the assistance to perform the recipient’s functions and it is not contrary to the interests of the investing public or to the public interest that the assistance should be given.

subsection.leadIn: In deciding whether the condition set out in subsection (7) is satisfied in a particular case, the Monetary Authority must take into account—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the recipient of the assistance is a non-Hong Kong entity, whether the non-Hong Kong entity will— (Amended 31 of 2025 s. 157)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: pay to the Monetary Authority any of the costs and expenses incurred in giving the assistance; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: be able and willing to give reciprocal assistance within its jurisdiction in response to a comparable request for assistance from Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the recipient of the assistance is a companies inspector outside Hong Kong, whether—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the companies inspector will pay to the Monetary Authority any of the costs and expenses incurred in giving the assistance; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: under the laws of the country or territory in which the companies inspector is appointed, reciprocal assistance will be given in response to a comparable request for assistance from Hong Kong.

subsection.content: If the Monetary Authority is satisfied of the matters referred to in subsection (5)(a) and (b) or (6)(a) and (b), the Monetary Authority must, as soon as reasonably practicable after being so satisfied, publish in the Gazette, the name of the non-Hong Kong entity or the companies inspector outside Hong Kong. (Amended 31 of 2025 s. 157)

Subsection (11) applies if a person is required to give an explanation or further particulars as required by, or to give an answer to a question raised by, an MA investigator exercising under subsection (1) or (3), a power under section 184B, and the explanation, further particulars or the answer might tend to incriminate the person and the person so claims before giving it.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting section 187, the MA investigator must not provide to a non-Hong Kong entity or a companies inspector outside Hong Kong for use in criminal proceedings against the person in the jurisdiction of the non-Hong Kong entity or the companies inspector— (Amended 31 of 2025 s. 157)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: evidence of the requirement;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: evidence of the question and answer; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: evidence of the explanation or further particulars.

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority must pay into the Exchange Fund any amount received from a non-Hong Kong entity or a companies inspector outside Hong Kong in respect of costs and expenses incurred by the Monetary Authority in giving assistance under this section. (Amended 31 of 2025 s. 157)
A matter published under subsection (9) is not subsidiary legislation.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: companies inspector (公司審查員), in relation to a place outside Hong Kong, has the meaning given by section 186(9);
non-Hong Kong entity (非香港實體) means an authority or regulatory organization outside Hong Kong. (Amended 31 of 2025 s. 157)

section.name: s187
section.heading: Use of incriminating evidence in proceedings

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an authorized person within the meaning of section 179 requires a person to provide or make an explanation or statement under that section;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an investigator requires a person to give an explanation or further particulars or to give an answer to any question under section 183; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an MA investigator requires a person to give an explanation or further particulars or give an answer to a question under section 184B, (Added 6 of 2014 s. 24)

subsection.continued: the authorized person or the investigator (as the case may be) shall ensure that the person has first been informed or reminded (as the case may be) of the limitations imposed by subsection (2) on the admissibility in evidence of the requirement and of the explanation or statement, the explanation or further particulars, or the question and answer (as the case may be).

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding any other provisions of this Ordinance, where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an authorized person within the meaning of section 179 requires a person to provide or make an explanation or statement under that section;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an investigator requires a person to give an explanation or further particulars or to give an answer to any question under section 183; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an MA investigator requires a person to give an explanation or further particulars or give an answer to a question under section 184B, (Added 6 of 2014 s. 24)

subsection.continued: and the explanation or statement, the explanation or further particulars, or the answer (as the case may be) might tend to incriminate the person and the person so claims before providing or making the explanation or statement, giving the explanation or further particulars, or giving the answer (as the case may be), then the requirement as well as the explanation or statement, the explanation or further particulars, or the question and answer (as the case may be) shall not be admissible in evidence against the person in criminal proceedings in a court of law other than those in which the person is charged with an offence under section 179(13), (14) or (15), 184 or 184D, or under section 219(2)(a), 253(2)(a) or 254(6)(a) or (b), or under Part V of the Crimes Ordinance (Cap. 200), or for perjury, in respect of the explanation or statement, the explanation or further particulars, or the answer (as the case may be).

section.name: s188
section.heading: Lien claimed on records or documents
section.leadIn: Where the person in possession of any record or document required to be produced under this Part claims a lien on the record or document—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the requirement to produce the record or document shall not be affected by the lien;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: no fees shall be payable for or in respect of the production; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the production shall be without prejudice to the lien.

section.name: s189
section.heading: Production of information in information systems, etc.
section.leadIn: Where any information or matter contained in any record or document required to be produced under this Part is recorded otherwise than in a legible form, any power conferred by this Part to require the production of the record or document includes the power to require the production of a reproduction of the recording of the information or matter or of the relevant part of it—

paragraph.name: a
