A notice published under subsection (6) is not subsidiary legislation.

section.name: s210
section.heading: Cases of revocation or suspension of licensed corporations’ licences

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding any other provisions of this Ordinance, but without limiting the generality of section 200(1) (whether having application with or without reference to section 146(11) or 147(9)), the revocation or suspension of the licence of a licensed corporation under any provision of this Ordinance does not affect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the validity of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a prohibition or requirement imposed under section 204, 205 or 206 in respect of or with reference to the corporation;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a prohibition or requirement substituting for another prohibition or requirement under section 208(1)(b); or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a prohibition or requirement as varied under section 208(1)(b),

paragraph.continued: where the imposition, substitution or variation (as the case may be) takes effect at any time before the revocation or suspension (as the case may be) takes effect;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: without limiting the generality of paragraph (a), any power exercisable by the Commission under section 208 in respect of any prohibition or requirement provided for in that paragraph, at the time when, or at any time after, the revocation or suspension (as the case may be) takes effect,

subsection.continued: and references in this Division to a licensed corporation shall be construed accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding section 200(1) (whether having application with or without reference to section 146(11) or 147(9)), where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the licence of a corporation is revoked or suspended under any provision of this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Commission has imposed under section 204, 205 or 206 a prohibition or requirement in respect of or with reference to, or substituted or varied under section 208 a prohibition or requirement imposed in respect of or with reference to, the corporation, whether before or after the revocation or suspension,

subsection.continued: the corporation shall not, by reason of its compliance with the prohibition or requirement in force in respect of it under the circumstances described in paragraph (b), be regarded as having contravened section 114.

subsection.leadIn: For the avoidance of doubt, where the Commission has decided to revoke or suspend the licence of a licensed corporation under any provision of this Ordinance, the Commission may, at any time before the revocation or suspension (as the case may be) takes effect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: impose under section 204, 205 or 206 a prohibition or requirement in respect of or with reference to; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: withdraw, substitute or vary under section 208 a prohibition or requirement imposed in respect of or with reference to,

subsection.continued: the licensed corporation.

subsection.leadIn: For the avoidance of doubt, nothing in this section affects the power of the Commission to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: impose under section 204, 205 or 206 a prohibition or requirement in respect of or with reference to; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: withdraw, substitute or vary under section 208 a prohibition or requirement imposed in respect of or with reference to,

subsection.continued: a licensed corporation the licence of which has been suspended under any provision of this Ordinance.

section.name: s211
section.heading: Application to Court of First Instance relating to non-compliance with prohibitions or requirements under section 204, 205, 206 or 208

subsection.leadIn: If a person fails to comply with a prohibition or requirement in force in respect of him as a result of the exercise of any of the powers under sections 204, 205, 206 and 208, the Commission may, by originating summons or originating motion, make an application to the Court of First Instance in respect of the failure, and the Court may inquire into the case and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the Court is satisfied that there is no reasonable excuse for the person not to comply with the prohibition or requirement (as the case may be), order the person to comply with the prohibition or requirement (as the case may be) within the period specified by the Court; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the Court is satisfied that the failure was without reasonable excuse, punish the person, and any other person knowingly involved in the failure, in the same manner as if he and, where applicable, that other person had been guilty of contempt of court.

subsection.content: If there is a reasonable likelihood that a person will fail to comply with a prohibition or requirement in force in respect of him as a result of the exercise of any of the powers under sections 204, 205, 206 and 208, the Commission may, by originating summons or originating motion, apply to the Court of First Instance for an order that the person, and any other person who the Court is satisfied is able to procure the person to comply with the prohibition or requirement (as the case may be), to take such action or refrain from taking such action as the Court directs.
An originating summons under this section shall be in Form No. 10 in Appendix A to the Rules of the High Court (Cap. 4 sub. leg. A).

section.name: s212
section.heading: Winding-up orders and bankruptcy orders

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a corporation, other than an authorized financial institution, is of a class of corporations which the Court of First Instance has jurisdiction to wind up under the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32); and (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it appears to the Commission that it is desirable in the public interest that the corporation should be wound up,

subsection.continued: the Commission may present a petition for the corporation to be wound up under that Ordinance on the ground that it is just and equitable that the corporation should be so wound up, and that Ordinance shall apply to such petition as it applies in relation to a petition presented under that Ordinance.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: If it appears to the Commission that it is desirable in the public interest that an open-ended fund company should be wound up, the Commission may present a petition for the company to be wound up under the OFC rules on the ground that it is just and equitable that the company should be so wound up, and those rules apply to such a petition as they apply in relation to a petition presented under them. (Added 16 of 2016 s. 11)

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: grounds exist for the presentation of a petition for a bankruptcy order against a licensed representative by his creditor in accordance with the Bankruptcy Ordinance (Cap. 6); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it appears to the Commission that it is desirable in the public interest to present a petition for a bankruptcy order against the licensed representative in accordance with that Ordinance,

subsection.continued: the Commission may present a petition for a bankruptcy order against the licensed representative in accordance with that Ordinance, and that Ordinance shall apply to such petition as it applies in relation to a petition presented by a creditor.

subsection.leadIn: The Commission shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: before presenting a petition under subsection (1) against a corporation that is an exchange participant or a clearing participant, use its best endeavours to inform the recognized exchange company or the recognized clearing house (as the case may be) of the proposed presentation of the petition by notice in writing; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where before the presentation of the petition it has not informed the recognized exchange company or the recognized clearing house (as the case may be) of the proposed presentation of the petition by notice in writing, forthwith after the presentation of the petition inform the recognized exchange company or the recognized clearing house (as the case may be) thereof by notice in writing.

section.name: s213
section.heading: Injunctions and other orders

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a person has—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: contravened—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: any of the relevant provisions;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: any notice or requirement given or made under or pursuant to any of the relevant provisions;

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: any of the terms and conditions of any licence or registration under this Ordinance; or

subparagraph.name: D
subparagraph.content: any other condition imposed under or pursuant to any provision of this Ordinance;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: aided, abetted, or otherwise assisted, counselled or procured a person to commit any such contravention;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: induced, whether by threats, promises or otherwise, a person to commit any such contravention;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: directly or indirectly been in any way knowingly involved in, or a party to, any such contravention; or

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: attempted, or conspired with others, to commit any such contravention; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it appears, whether or not during the course or as a result of the exercise of any power under Part VIII, to the Commission that any of the matters referred to in paragraph (a)(i) to (v) has occurred, is occurring or may occur,

subsection.continued: the Court of First Instance, on the application of the Commission, may, subject to subsection (4), make one or more of the orders specified in subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: The orders specified for the purposes of subsection (1) are—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: where a person has been, or it appears that a person has been, is or may become, involved in any of the matters referred to in subsection (1)(a)(i) to (v), whether knowingly or otherwise, an order requiring the person to take such steps as the Court of First Instance may direct, including steps to restore the parties to any transaction to the position in which they were before the transaction was entered into;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an order restraining or prohibiting a person from acquiring, disposing of, or otherwise dealing in, any property specified in the order;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: an order appointing a person to administer the property of another person;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: an order declaring a contract relating to any securities, structured product, futures contract, leveraged foreign exchange contract, or an interest in any securities, structured product, futures contract, leveraged foreign exchange contract or collective investment scheme to be void or voidable to the extent specified in the order; (Amended 8 of 2011 s. 10)

paragraph.name: f
g
paragraph.content: any ancillary order which the Court of First Instance considers necessary in consequence of the making of any of the orders referred to in paragraphs (a) to (f).

subsection.leadIn: The Commission shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: before making an application pursuant to subsection (1) for an order affecting any person that is an exchange participant or a clearing participant, use its best endeavours to inform the recognized exchange company or the recognized clearing house (as the case may be) of the proposed application by notice in writing; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where before the making of the application it has not informed the recognized exchange company or the recognized clearing house (as the case may be) of the proposed application by notice in writing, forthwith after the making of the application inform the recognized exchange company or the recognized clearing house (as the case may be) thereof by notice in writing.

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.content: If the contravention involved in a case is a contravention by an open-ended fund company or a director, an investment manager, a custodian or a sub-custodian of an open-ended fund company, the Court of First Instance may also, on the application of the Commission, make any of the orders specified in subsection (3C). (Added 16 of 2016 s. 12)

subsection.name: 3B
subsection.content: The power under subsection (3A) may be exercised whether or not the Commission also applies for an order specified in subsection (2). (Added 16 of 2016 s. 12)

subsection.name: 3C
subsection.leadIn: The orders specified for the purposes of subsection (3A) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: for an open-ended fund company without sub-funds—

subparagraph.content: an order removing a director of the company;
an order removing an investment manager of the company;
an order removing a custodian of the company;
an order removing a sub-custodian of the company;

an order requiring a part of the investments of the company to be realized and the funds remaining after the discharge of the liabilities (if any) of the company attributable to the part to be distributed to shareholders of the company in accordance with the OFC rules;

an order requiring all of the investments of the company to be realized and the funds remaining after the discharge of the liabilities (if any) of the company to be distributed to shareholders of the company in accordance with the OFC rules;
an order requiring the company to be wound up under the OFC rules; and
any ancillary order that the Court of First Instance considers necessary as a result of the making of any of the orders referred to in subparagraphs (i), (ii), (iii), (iv), (v), (vi) and (vii); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for an open-ended fund company with sub-funds—

subparagraph.content: any of the orders specified in paragraph (a)(i), (ii), (iii), (iv), (v), (vi) and (vii);

an order requiring the investments made in respect of a part of a sub-fund of the company to be realized and the funds remaining after the discharge of the liabilities (if any) of the company attributable to the part to be distributed to shareholders of the company in accordance with the OFC rules;

an order requiring all of the investments made in respect of a sub-fund of the company to be realized and the funds remaining after the discharge of the liabilities (if any) of the company attributable to the sub-fund to be distributed to shareholders of the company in accordance with the OFC rules;
an order requiring a sub-fund of the company to be wound up under the OFC rules; and

any ancillary order that the Court of First Instance considers necessary as a result of the making of any of the orders referred to in subparagraphs (i), (ii), (iii) and (iv). (Added 16 of 2016 s. 12)

subsection.content: The Court of First Instance shall, before making an order under subsection (1) or (3A), satisfy itself, so far as it can reasonably do so, that it is desirable that the order be made, and that the order will not unfairly prejudice any person. (Amended 16 of 2016 s. 12)

The Court of First Instance may, before making an order under subsection (1) or (3A), direct that a notice of the application made in respect thereof be given to the persons it considers appropriate, or be published in the manner it considers appropriate, or both. (Amended 16 of 2016 s. 12)

Where the Court of First Instance considers it desirable to do so, it may grant such interim order as it considers appropriate pending the determination of an application made pursuant to subsection (1) or (3A). (Amended 16 of 2016 s. 12)

subsection.leadIn: An order may be made under subsection (1) or (3A) whether or not it appears to the Court of First Instance that— (Amended 16 of 2016 s. 12)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the person against whom the order is made has previously engaged in any of such matters;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: there is an imminent danger of damage to any person in the event of the order not being made.

subsection.content: Where the Court of First Instance has power to make an order against a person under subsection (1) or (3A), it may, in addition to or in substitution for such order, make an order requiring the person to pay damages to any other person. (Amended 16 of 2016 s. 12)
The Court of First Instance may reverse, vary or discharge an order made or granted by it under subsection (1), (3A) or (6) or suspend the operation of the order. (Amended 16 of 2016 s. 12)
A notice published under subsection (5) is not subsidiary legislation.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: sub-fund (子基金)—see section 112R. (Added 16 of 2016 s. 12)

section.name: s214
section.heading: Remedies in cases of unfair prejudice, etc. to interests of members of listed corporations, etc.

subsection.leadIn: Where, in relation to a corporation which is or was listed, it appears to the Commission that at any relevant time the business or affairs of the corporation have been conducted in a manner—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: oppressive to its members or any part of its members;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: involving defalcation, fraud, misfeasance or other misconduct towards it or its members or any part of its members;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: resulting in its members or any part of its members not having been given all the information with respect to its business or affairs that they might reasonably expect; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: unfairly prejudicial to its members or any part of its members,

subsection.continued: the Commission may, subject to subsection (3), by petition apply to the Court of First Instance for an order under this section.

subsection.leadIn: If, on an application under this section, the Court of First Instance is of the opinion that the business or affairs of a corporation have been conducted in a manner described in subsection (1)(a), (b), (c) or (d), whether through conduct consisting of an isolated act or a series of acts or any failure to act, the Court may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: make an order restraining the carrying out, or requiring the carrying out, of any act or acts;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: order that the corporation shall bring in its name such proceedings as the Court considers appropriate against such persons, and on such terms, as may be specified in the order;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: unless the corporation is an authorized financial institution, appoint a receiver or manager of the whole or any part of the property or business of the corporation and may specify the powers and duties of the receiver or manager and fix his remuneration;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: order that a person wholly or partly responsible for the business or affairs of the corporation having been so conducted shall not, without the leave of the Court—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: be, or continue to be, a director, liquidator, or receiver or manager of the property or business, of the corporation or any other corporation; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in any way, whether directly or indirectly, be concerned, or take part, in the management of the corporation or any other corporation,

paragraph.continued: for such period (not exceeding 15 years) as may be specified in the order;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: make any other order it considers appropriate, whether for regulating the conduct of the business or affairs of the corporation in future, or for the purchase of the shares of any members of the corporation by other members of the corporation or by the corporation (and, in the case of a purchase by the corporation, for the reduction accordingly of the corporation’s capital), or otherwise.

subsection.leadIn: The Commission shall not make an application under this section unless it has first consulted—

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the corporation in question is an authorized financial institution or a corporation which, to the knowledge of the Commission, is a controller of an authorized financial institution, or has as its controller an authorized financial institution, or has a controller that is also a controller of an authorized financial institution, the Monetary Authority.

subsection.content: Where the Court of First Instance makes an order under subsection (2)(d), the order shall be filed by the Court with the Registrar of Companies, as soon as reasonably practicable after it is made.

Where an order under this section makes an alteration in or addition to the constitution of a company, notwithstanding any other provisions of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622) or the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32) but subject to the provisions of the order, the company shall not have the power, without the leave of the Court of First Instance, to make any further alteration in or addition to the constitution inconsistent with the order. (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

Where any alteration in or addition to the constitution of a company is made by an order under this section, the alteration or addition (as the case may be) has the same effect as if duly made by a resolution of the company, and the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622) and the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32) apply to the constitution as altered or added to accordingly. (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

An office copy of an order of the Court of First Instance altering or adding to, or of the leave of the Court to alter or add to, the constitution of a company shall, within 14 days after the order is made or the leave is given, be delivered by the company to the Registrar of Companies for registration.

A company which contravenes subsection (7) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $300 for every day during which the offence continues.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: controller (控制人) means a person who is an indirect controller or a majority shareholder controller as defined in section 2(1) of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155);

def.name: RelevantTime
def.leadIn: relevant time (有關時間)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a corporation which is listed, means any time since the formation of the corporation; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a corporation which was listed, means any time since the formation of the corporation but before the corporation ceased to remain listed.

section.name: s214A
section.heading: Remedies in cases of unfair prejudice etc. to interests of shareholders of open-ended fund companies

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may by petition apply to the Court of First Instance for an order under this section if it appears to the Commission that at any time since the date of incorporation (or the re-domiciliation date as defined by section 112ZJA(1)) of an open-ended fund company, the business or affairs of the company have been conducted in a manner— (Amended 33 of 2021 s. 10)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: oppressive to its shareholders or any part of its shareholders;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: involving defalcation, fraud, misfeasance or other misconduct towards it or its shareholders or any part of its shareholders;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: resulting in its shareholders or any part of its shareholders not having been given all the information with respect to its business or affairs that they might reasonably expect; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: unfairly prejudicial to its shareholders or any part of its shareholders.

subsection.leadIn: If, on an application under subsection (1), the Court of First Instance is of the opinion that the business or affairs of an open-ended fund company have been conducted in a manner described in subsection (1)(a), (b), (c) or (d), whether through conduct consisting of an isolated act or a series of acts or a failure to act, the Court may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: make an order restraining the carrying out, or requiring the carrying out, of an act;

paragraph.name: b
c
d
paragraph.leadIn: make an order that a person wholly or partly responsible for the business or affairs of the company having been so conducted must not, without the leave of the Court—

subparagraph.content: be, or continue to be, a director, an investment manager, a liquidator, or a receiver or manager of the property or business, of the company or any other corporation; or
in any way, whether directly or indirectly, be concerned, or take part, in the management of the company or any other corporation; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: make any other order the Court considers appropriate, whether for regulating the conduct of the business or affairs of the company in the future, or for the purchase of the shares of any shareholders of the company by other shareholders of the company or by the company, or otherwise.

subsection.leadIn: If the order to be applied for under subsection (1) is an order against—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an authorized financial institution; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a corporation that, to the knowledge of the Commission—

subparagraph.content: is a controller of an authorized financial institution;
has as its controller an authorized financial institution; or
has a controller that is also a controller of an authorized financial institution,

subsection.continued: the Commission must not make the application unless it has first consulted the Monetary Authority.

subsection.content: An order under subsection (2)(d) must specify the period for which it is to have effect and such a period must not exceed 15 years.
The Court of First Instance must, as soon as reasonably practicable after making an order under subsection (2)(d), file the order with the Registrar of Companies.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: controller (控制人) means an indirect controller, or a majority shareholder controller, as defined by section 2(1) of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155).

section.name: s214B
section.heading: Order under section 214A altering open-ended fund company’s instrument of incorporation

subsection.content: If an order made under section 214A alters the instrument of incorporation of an open-ended fund company, despite any other provisions of this Ordinance but subject to the provisions of the order, the company does not have the power, without the leave of the Court of First Instance, to make any further alteration to the instrument that is inconsistent with the order.

subsection.leadIn: If the instrument of incorporation of an open-ended fund company is altered by an order made under section 214A—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the alteration has the same effect as if duly made by a resolution of the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: this Ordinance applies to the instrument as altered accordingly.

subsection.content: An open-ended fund company must, within 14 days after an order altering its instrument of incorporation is made under section 214A, deliver an office copy of the order to the Registrar of Companies for registration under this Ordinance.

An open-ended fund company must, within 14 days after the leave of the Court of First Instance to alter its instrument of incorporation is given, deliver an office copy of the leave to the Registrar of Companies for registration under this Ordinance.

An open-ended fund company that contravenes subsection (3) or (4) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $300 for each day during which the offence continues.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: alter (改動) includes add to.

section.name: s215
section.heading: Interpretation of Part XI
section.leadIn: In this Part, unless the context otherwise requires—
section.def: application for review (覆核申請) means an application made under section 217(1);

def.name: Judge
def.leadIn: judge (法官) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a judge or a deputy judge of the Court of First Instance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a former Justice of Appeal of the Court of Appeal;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a former judge or a former deputy judge of the Court of First Instance;

def.name: Parties
def.leadIn: parties (各方), in relation to a review, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the relevant authority making the specified decision in question; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person making the application for review in question;

def.name: RelevantAuthority
def.leadIn: relevant authority (有關當局)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a specified decision within the meaning of paragraph (a) of the definition of specified decision in this section, means the Commission;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a specified decision within the meaning of paragraph (b) of the definition of specified decision in this section, means the Monetary Authority; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to a specified decision within the meaning of paragraph (c) of the definition of specified decision in this section, means the Commission or the recognized investor compensation company by which the decision is made (as the case may be);

def.name: SpecifiedDecision
def.leadIn: specified decision (指明決定) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a decision of the Commission which—

subparagraph.content: is made under or pursuant to any of the provisions set out in column 2 of Division 1 of Part 2 of Schedule 8; and
is within the description set out, opposite such provisions, in column 3 of Division 1 of Part 2 of Schedule 8;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a decision of the Monetary Authority which—

subparagraph.content: is made under or pursuant to any of the provisions set out in column 2 of Division 2 of Part 2 of Schedule 8; and
is within the description set out, opposite such provisions, in column 3 of Division 2 of Part 2 of Schedule 8; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: a decision of the Commission or a recognized investor compensation company which—

subparagraph.content: is made under or pursuant to any of the provisions set out in column 2 of Division 3 of Part 2 of Schedule 8; and
is within the description set out, opposite such provisions, in column 3 of Division 3 of Part 2 of Schedule 8;

section.def: Tribunal (審裁處) means the Securities and Futures Appeals Tribunal established by section 216.

section.name: s216
section.heading: Securities and Futures Appeals Tribunal

subsection.content: There is established a Tribunal to be known as the Securities and Futures Appeals Tribunal which shall have jurisdiction to review specified decisions, and to hear and determine any question or issue arising out of or in connection with any review, in accordance with this Part and Schedule 8.

subsection.leadIn: Except as otherwise provided in this Part or in Schedule 8, the Tribunal—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall consist of a chairman and 2 other members; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall be presided over by the chairman who shall sit with the 2 other members.

subsection.content: The chairman of the Tribunal shall be a judge and the 2 other members of the Tribunal shall not be public officers.
Part 1 of Schedule 8 shall have effect in relation to the appointment of members of the Tribunal, and to the proceedings and sittings of, and procedural and other matters concerning, the Tribunal.

Where the Chief Executive considers appropriate, additional Tribunals may be established for the purposes of any reviews, whereupon the provisions of this or any other Ordinance shall apply, subject to necessary modifications, to each of such additional Tribunals (including appointment of the chairman and other members of, and all matters concerning, each of such additional Tribunals) as they apply to the Tribunal.

With the exception of the chairman of the Tribunal who is a judge within the meaning of paragraph (a) of the definition of judge in section 215, a member of the Tribunal may be paid, as a fee for his services, such amount as the Financial Secretary considers appropriate, and that amount shall be a charge on the general revenue.

subsection.leadIn: Where a person who is a judge within the meaning of paragraph (a) of the definition of judge in section 215 is appointed as the chairman of the Tribunal, neither the appointment nor the service or removal of the person as the chairman affects—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the tenure of office of, and the exercise of powers by, the person as a judge within the meaning of that paragraph;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person’s rank, title, status, precedence, salary or other rights or privileges as a holder of that office;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the terms and conditions to which the person is subject as a holder of that office.

section.name: s217
section.heading: Applications for review of specified decisions

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), a person aggrieved by a specified decision of the relevant authority made in respect of him may, by notice in writing given to the Tribunal, apply to the Tribunal for a review of the decision.
A notice given to the Tribunal under subsection (1) shall set out the grounds for the application to which the notice relates.

subsection.leadIn: An application for review of a specified decision of the relevant authority shall be made within 21 days after—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: subject to paragraph (b)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: where there is any requirement in this or any other Ordinance for notice in writing in respect of the decision to be served, the notice has been served in accordance with such requirement; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where there is no such requirement, a notice in writing in respect of the decision has been served on the person in respect of whom it is made;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the decision is a specified decision which is described in column 2 of Division 1 of Part 3 of Schedule 8 and to which the provision set out, opposite such description of the specified decision, in column 3 of that Division applies, a notice in respect of the decision has been given to the person in respect of whom it is made.

subsection.content: Notwithstanding subsection (3), the Tribunal, upon application in writing by any person, may, subject to subsection (5), by order extend the time within which an application for review of a specified decision of the relevant authority shall be made under subsection (3), whereupon the time within which such an application shall be made under subsection (3) shall be extended accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: The Tribunal shall not grant an extension under subsection (4) unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person who has applied for the grant of the extension pursuant to that subsection and the relevant authority have been given a reasonable opportunity of being heard; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is satisfied that there is a good cause for granting the extension.

subsection.content: Where the Tribunal receives a notice under subsection (1), it shall as soon as reasonably practicable thereafter serve a copy of the notice on the relevant authority.

section.name: s218
section.heading: Proceedings before Tribunal

subsection.content: After an application for review has been made, the Tribunal shall review the specified decision to which the application relates.

subsection.leadIn: Following the review of a specified decision under subsection (1), the Tribunal may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: confirm, vary or set aside the decision, and, where the decision is set aside, substitute for the decision any other decision which the Tribunal considers appropriate;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: remit the matter in question to the relevant authority with the directions it considers appropriate, which may include a direction to the relevant authority to make a decision afresh in respect of any matter specified by the Tribunal.

subsection.content: Where the Tribunal varies, or substitutes any decision for, a specified decision under subsection (2)(a), the decision as varied or the decision substituting for the specified decision (as the case may be) may be any decision (whether more or less onerous) that the relevant authority had power to make in respect of the person making the application for review in question, whether or not under the same provision as that under which the specified decision has been made.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting the generality of subsections (2)(a) and (3) but subject to subsection (6)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the specified decision in question is a specified decision described in column 2 of Division 2 of Part 3 of Schedule 8, the decision that the Tribunal may substitute under subsection (2)(a) for the specified decision may also include (whether or not in addition to the decision that the Tribunal may, apart from this subsection, substitute under subsection (2)(a) for the specified decision) any decision that the Monetary Authority had power to make in respect of the person making the application for review in question under or pursuant to any of the provisions set out, opposite such description of the specified decision, in column 3 of that Division; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the specified decision in question is a specified decision described in column 2 of Division 3 of Part 3 of Schedule 8, the decision that the Tribunal may substitute under subsection (2)(a) for the specified decision may also include (whether or not in addition to the decision that the Tribunal may, apart from this subsection, substitute under subsection (2)(a) for the specified decision) any decision that the Commission had power to make in respect of the person making the application for review in question under or pursuant to any of the provisions set out, opposite such description of the specified decision, in column 3 of that Division.

subsection.content: Notwithstanding anything in this section, the Tribunal shall not determine a review without first giving the parties to the review a reasonable opportunity of being heard.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting the generality of subsection (5), the Tribunal shall not exercise any power pursuant to subsection (4)(a) or (b) without first giving a reasonable opportunity of being heard to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (4)(a), the Monetary Authority; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (4)(b), the Commission.

subsection.content: Subject to section 221(3), the standard of proof required to determine any question or issue before the Tribunal shall be the standard of proof applicable to civil proceedings in a court of law.

section.name: s219
section.heading: Powers of Tribunal

subsection.leadIn: Subject to the provisions of Part 1 of Schedule 8 and any rules made by the Chief Justice under section 233, the Tribunal, for the purposes of a review, may, on its own motion or on the application of any of the parties to the review—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: receive and consider any material by way of oral evidence, written statements or documents, even if the material would not be admissible in evidence in civil or criminal proceedings in a court of law;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by notice in writing signed by the chairman of the Tribunal require a person to attend before it at any sitting and to give evidence and produce any article, record or document in his possession relating to the subject matter of the review;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: administer oaths;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: examine or cause to be examined on oath or otherwise a person attending before it and require the person to answer truthfully any question which the Tribunal considers appropriate for the purposes of the review;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: order a witness to provide evidence in a truthful manner for the purposes of the review by affidavit;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: order a person not to publish or otherwise disclose any material the Tribunal receives;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: prohibit the publication or disclosure of any material the Tribunal receives at any sitting, or any part of a sitting, which is held in private;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: determine the manner in which any material referred to in paragraph (a) is received;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: stay any of the proceedings in the review on such grounds and on such terms and conditions as it considers appropriate having regard to the interests of justice;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: determine the procedure to be followed in the review;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: exercise such other powers or make such other orders as may be necessary for or ancillary to the conduct of the review or the carrying out of its functions.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if he, without reasonable excuse—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: fails to comply with an order, notice, prohibition or requirement of the Tribunal made or given under or pursuant to subsection (1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: disrupts or otherwise misbehaves during any sitting of the Tribunal;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: having been required by the Tribunal under subsection (1) to attend before the Tribunal, leaves the place where his attendance is so required without the permission of the Tribunal;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: hinders or deters any person from attending before the Tribunal, giving evidence or producing any article, record or document, for the purposes of a review;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: threatens, insults or causes any loss to be suffered by any person who has attended before the Tribunal, on account of such attendance; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: threatens, insults or causes any loss to be suffered by any member of the Tribunal at any time on account of the performance of his functions in that capacity.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (2) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.content: A person is not excused from complying with an order, notice, prohibition or requirement of the Tribunal made or given under or pursuant to subsection (1) only on the ground that to do so might tend to incriminate the person.

section.name: s220
section.heading: Use of incriminating evidence required by Tribunal
section.leadIn: Notwithstanding any other provisions of this Ordinance, where the Tribunal—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: requires a person to give evidence under section 219(1)(b);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: requires a person to answer any question under section 219(1)(d );

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: orders a person to provide evidence under section 219(1)(e); or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: otherwise orders or requires a person to provide any information under section 219(1)(k),

section.continued: and the evidence, answer or information (as the case may be) might tend to incriminate the person, then the requirement or order as well as the evidence, the question and answer, or the information (as the case may be) shall not be admissible in evidence against the person in criminal proceedings in a court of law other than those in which the person is charged with an offence under section 219(2)(a), 253(2)(a) or 254(6)(a) or (b), or under Part V of the Crimes Ordinance (Cap. 200), or for perjury, in respect of the evidence, answer or information (as the case may be).

section.name: s221
section.heading: Contempt dealt with by Tribunal

subsection.content: The Tribunal shall have the same powers as the Court of First Instance to punish for contempt.

Without limiting the generality of the powers of the Tribunal under subsection (1), the Tribunal shall have the same powers as the Court of First Instance to punish for contempt, as if it were contempt of court, a person who, without reasonable excuse, commits any conduct falling within the description of section 219(2)(a), (b), (c), (d), (e) or (f).

The Tribunal shall, in the exercise of its powers to punish for contempt under this section, adopt the same standard of proof as the Court of First Instance in the exercise of the same powers to punish for contempt.

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding anything in this section and any other provisions of this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: no power may be exercised under or pursuant to this section to determine whether to punish any person for contempt in respect of any conduct if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: criminal proceedings have previously been instituted against the person under section 219(2) in respect of the same conduct; and

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: those criminal proceedings remain pending; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: by reason of the previous institution of those criminal proceedings, no criminal proceedings may again be lawfully instituted against that person under such section in respect of the same conduct;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: no criminal proceedings may be instituted against any person under section 219(2) in respect of any conduct if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any power has previously been exercised under or pursuant to this section to determine whether to punish the person for contempt in respect of the same conduct; and

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: proceedings arising from the exercise of such power remain pending; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: by reason of the previous exercise of such power, no power may again be lawfully exercised under or pursuant to this section to determine whether to punish the person for contempt in respect of the same conduct.

section.name: s222
section.heading: Privileged information
section.content: Nothing in this Part and Schedule 8 requires an authorized financial institution, acting as the banker or financial adviser of a person who makes an application for review, to disclose information as to the affairs of any of its customers other than that person.

section.name: s223
section.heading: Costs

subsection.leadIn: The Tribunal may, in relation to a review, by order award to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any person whose attendance, whether as a witness or otherwise, has been necessary or required for the purposes of the review;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any party to the review,

subsection.continued: such sum as it considers appropriate in respect of the costs reasonably incurred by the person or the party (as the case may be) in relation to the review and the application for review in question.

subsection.leadIn: Any costs awarded under subsection (1) shall be paid by and recoverable as a civil debt from—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the costs are awarded to any person under subsection (1)(a), such of the parties to the review in question as the Tribunal considers appropriate; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the costs are awarded to any party to the review under subsection (1)(b), the other party to the review.

subsection.content: Subject to any rules made by the Chief Justice under section 233, Order 62 of the Rules of the High Court (Cap. 4 sub. leg. A) applies to the award of costs, and to the taxation of any costs awarded, by the Tribunal under subsection (1).

section.name: s224
section.heading: Notification of Tribunal determinations

subsection.leadIn: The Tribunal shall, as soon as reasonably practicable after the conclusion of a review, deliver—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: its determination in respect of the review, and the reasons for making the determination; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any order made under section 223 in relation to the review, and the reasons for making the order.

subsection.content: Where any sitting of the Tribunal relating to a review, or any part thereof, is held in private, the Tribunal may by order prohibit the publication or disclosure of any determination or order, or any reasons for any determination or order, referred to in subsection (1)(a) or (b), or any part thereof.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if he, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with an order of the Tribunal made pursuant to subsection (2) and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s225
section.heading: Form and proof of orders of Tribunal

subsection.content: An order made by the Tribunal shall be recorded in writing and signed by the chairman of the Tribunal.

A document purporting to be an order of the Tribunal and to be signed by the chairman of the Tribunal shall, in the absence of proof to the contrary, be regarded as an order of the Tribunal duly made, without proof of its making, or proof of signature, or proof that the person signing the order was in fact the chairman.

section.name: s226
section.heading: Orders of Tribunal may be registered in Court of First Instance
section.content: The Court of First Instance may, on notice in writing given by the Tribunal in the manner prescribed by rules made by the Chief Justice under section 233, register an order of the Tribunal in the Court of First Instance and the order shall, on registration, become for all purposes an order of the Court of First Instance made within the jurisdiction of the Court of First Instance.

section.name: s227
section.heading: Applications for stay of execution of specified decisions

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), the making of an application for review does not by itself operate as a stay of execution of the specified decision to which the application relates.

A person who has made an application for review or an application pursuant to section 217(4) may, at any time before the review or the application (as the case may be) is determined by the Tribunal, apply to the Tribunal for a stay of execution of the specified decision to which the application relates.

On an application made under subsection (2), the Tribunal shall as soon as reasonably practicable conduct a hearing to determine the application, and may, where it considers appropriate, by order grant a stay of execution of the specified decision to which the application relates, subject to such conditions as to costs, payment of money into the Tribunal or otherwise as the Tribunal considers appropriate.

section.name: s228
section.heading: Applications for stay of execution of decisions of Tribunal
section.content: A party to a review may, at any time after the determination of the review, apply to the Tribunal for a stay of execution of a decision of the Tribunal relating to the review, whereupon the Tribunal may, where it considers appropriate, by order grant the stay, subject to such conditions as to costs, payment of money into the Tribunal or otherwise as the Tribunal considers appropriate.

section.name: s229
section.heading: Appeal to Court of Appeal

subsection.content: A party to a review who is dissatisfied with a decision of the Tribunal relating to the review may appeal to the Court of Appeal against the decision on a point of law.

subsection.leadIn: In an appeal under subsection (1), the Court of Appeal may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: allow the appeal;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: dismiss the appeal;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: vary or set aside the decision in question, and, where the decision is set aside, substitute for the decision any other decision it considers appropriate;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: remit the matter in question to the Tribunal with the directions it considers appropriate, which may include a direction to the Tribunal to conduct the review in question afresh for the purpose of determining any question specified by the Court of Appeal.

subsection.content: Where the Court of Appeal varies, or substitutes any other decision for, a decision under subsection (2)(c), the decision as varied or the other decision substituting for the decision (as the case may be) may be any decision (whether more or less onerous) that the Tribunal had power to make in respect of the review in question, whether or not under the same provision as that under which the decision has been made.
In an appeal under subsection (1), the Court of Appeal may make such order as to costs as it considers appropriate.

section.name: s230
section.heading: No stay of execution on appeal
section.content: Without prejudice to section 228, the lodging of an appeal under section 229 does not by itself operate as a stay of execution of a decision of the Tribunal unless the Court of Appeal otherwise orders, and any stay of execution may be subject to such conditions as to costs, payment of money into the Tribunal or otherwise as the Court of Appeal considers appropriate.

section.name: s231
section.heading: No other right of appeal
section.content: Subject to section 229 and section 50 of the High Court Ordinance (Cap. 4), any decision of the Tribunal shall be final and shall not be subject to appeal.

section.name: s232
section.heading: Time when specified decisions to take effect

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding subsections (2) and (3) and any other provisions of this or any other Ordinance, no specified decision, other than a specified decision which is described in column 2 of Division 4 of Part 3 of Schedule 8 and to which the provision set out, opposite such description of the specified decision, in column 3 of that Division applies, takes effect at any time before—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where there is any requirement in this or any other Ordinance for notice in writing in respect of the decision to be served, the notice has been served in accordance with such requirement; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where there is no such requirement, a notice in writing in respect of the decision has been served on the person in respect of whom it is made.

subsection.leadIn: A specified decision, other than a specified decision which is described in column 2 of Division 5 of Part 3 of Schedule 8 and to which the provision set out, opposite such description of the specified decision, in column 3 of that Division applies, takes effect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where, prior to the expiration of the period of 21 days specified in section 217(3), the person in respect of whom the decision is made notifies the relevant authority that he will not make an application for review of the decision, at the time when he so notifies the relevant authority;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (a), where the person does not make an application for review of the decision within the period of 21 days specified in section 217(3), at the time when the period so specified expires; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: where the person makes an application for review of the decision within the period of 21 days specified in section 217(3)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: where the decision is confirmed by the Tribunal, at the time when the decision is so confirmed;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where the decision is varied, or substituted by another decision, by the Tribunal, at the time when the decision is so varied or substituted, subject however to the terms of the variation or substitution; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: where the application is withdrawn, at the time when it is so withdrawn.

subsection.content: Notwithstanding subsection (2) and any other provisions of this or any other Ordinance, but subject to subsection (1), the relevant authority may, where it considers appropriate in the interest of the investing public or in the public interest to do so, specify in the notice served in respect of a specified decision any time, other than that at which the decision is apart from this subsection to take effect, as the time at which the decision is to take effect, in which case the decision takes effect at the time so specified.
Nothing in this section affects the power of the Tribunal to grant a stay of execution of a specified decision under section 227.

section.name: s233
section.heading: Rules by Chief Justice
section.leadIn: The Chief Justice may make rules—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: providing for the award of costs under section 223 and the taxation of those costs;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: prescribing the manner in which the Tribunal is to give notice to the Court of First Instance in respect of orders of the Tribunal pursuant to section 226;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: regulating the procedure for the hearing of appeals under section 229;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: requiring the payment of the fees specified in the rules for any matter relating to applications for review;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: providing for matters of procedure or other matters relating to applications for review or reviews, which are not provided for in this Part or in Part 1 of Schedule 8;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: providing for the issue or service of any document (however described) for the purposes of this Part or Part 1 of Schedule 8;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: prescribing any matter which this Part provides is, or may be, prescribed by rules made by the Chief Justice.

section.name: s234
section.heading: Amendment of Parts 2 and 3 of Schedule 8
section.content: The Chief Executive in Council may, by order published in the Gazette, amend Parts 2 and 3 of Schedule 8.

section.name: s235
section.heading: Interpretation of Part XII
section.leadIn: In this Part, unless the context otherwise requires—
section.def: Futures Exchange Compensation Fund (期交所賠償基金) means the compensation fund established under Part VIII of the repealed Commodities Trading Ordinance;
Unified Exchange Compensation Fund (聯交所賠償基金) means the compensation fund established under Part X of the repealed Securities Ordinance.

section.name: s236
section.heading: Establishment of compensation fund

subsection.content: The Commission shall establish and maintain a compensation fund, to be known as the Investor Compensation Fund in English and “投資者賠償基金” in Chinese, for the purpose of providing, in accordance with rules made under section 244, a measure of compensation to clients of a specified person who sustain a loss by reason of a default committed by the specified person or any of his associated persons in connection with specified securities or futures contracts.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: AssociatedPerson
def.leadIn: associated person (相聯者), in relation to a specified person, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person employed or otherwise engaged by the specified person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person (first-mentioned person) who may under section 164 receive or hold client assets of the specified person, or an employee of the first-mentioned person; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: such other persons as may be prescribed by rules made under section 244;

def.name: SpecifiedPerson
def.leadIn: specified person (指明人士) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an intermediary licensed or registered for Type 1 or Type 2 regulated activity;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an intermediary licensed for Type 8 regulated activity; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: such other person as may be prescribed by rules made under section 244;

def.name: SpecifiedSecuritiesOrFuturesContracts
def.leadIn: specified securities or futures contracts (指明證券或期貨合約) means any securities or futures contracts listed or traded or to be listed or traded on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a recognized stock market or recognized futures market; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: such other markets as may be prescribed by rules made under section 244.

section.name: s237
section.heading: Money constituting the compensation fund

subsection.leadIn: The compensation fund shall consist of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: all amounts paid to the Commission or a recognized investor compensation company in accordance with rules made under this Part;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: all amounts paid by the Commission into the compensation fund under subsection (2)(b);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: all amounts paid into the compensation fund under sections 74(2) or (9)(b), 75(2) or (9)(b) and 76(11) of Schedule 10;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: all assets (whether in cash or otherwise) recovered by the Commission or a recognized investor compensation company in exercise of a right of action conferred by section 243 or 87;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: all amounts borrowed under subsection (2)(a);

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: any return or profit received on an investment made under section 241;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: all other amounts lawfully paid into the compensation fund.

subsection.leadIn: With the consent in writing of the Financial Secretary, the Commission may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the purpose of the compensation fund, borrow from any authorized financial institution on such terms and at such rates of interest as it considers acceptable and charge any investments acquired under section 241 by way of security for any such loan;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: pay into the compensation fund from its reserves such amount of money as it considers appropriate.

section.name: s238
section.heading: Management of compensation fund

subsection.content: Subject to this Part, the Commission shall be responsible for the management and administration of the compensation fund, including the determination of a claim for compensation.
The Commission may realize any of the non-cash assets of the compensation fund at such times as it considers appropriate and the proceeds of realization shall become part of the compensation fund.

section.name: s239
section.heading: Money to be kept in account
section.content: The Commission shall open at one or more authorized financial institutions one or more accounts and shall, pending their application in accordance with this Part, pay into or transfer to such account or accounts all amounts forming part of the compensation fund.

section.name: s240
section.heading: Accounts of compensation fund

subsection.content: The Commission shall keep proper accounts of the compensation fund.

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may, if it considers it necessary to do so—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: maintain separate accounts in respect of the amounts that are respectively paid into the compensation fund under sections 74, 75 and 76 of Schedule 10;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: maintain separate accounts in respect of the compensation fund—

subparagraph.leadIn: for different—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: recognized exchange companies;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: markets operated by recognized exchange companies;

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: persons providing automated trading services; or

subparagraph.name: D
subparagraph.content: classes of investors; or
for the better and more effectual management or administration of the fund;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: maintain sub-accounts in respect of the separate accounts referred to in paragraph (a) or (b) in such manner as it considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: The Commission shall in respect of the financial year beginning before and ending after the day on which this section commences, and in respect of each subsequent financial year, prepare—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a financial statement made up to (and including) the last day of that year, in respect of the accounts of the compensation fund; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case where separate accounts are maintained under subsection (2)(a) or (b) or sub-accounts are maintained under subsection (2)(c)—

subparagraph.content: a consolidated financial statement made up to (and including) the last day of that year, in respect of the separate accounts or sub-accounts (as the case may be); and
a separate financial statement made up to (and including) the last day of that year, in respect of each separate account or sub-account (as the case may be).

subsection.content: A financial statement prepared under subsection (3) shall be signed by the chairman and the chief executive officer of the Commission. (Amended 15 of 2006 s. 4)
The Commission shall appoint an auditor to audit the compensation fund.

The auditor so appointed shall annually audit the accounts of the compensation fund and shall audit, and prepare an auditor’s report in respect of, each financial statement prepared under subsection (3) and shall submit the report to the Commission.

An auditor’s report prepared under subsection (6) shall contain a statement made by the auditor as to whether in his opinion the financial statement gives a true and fair view of the matters to which the statement relates.

The auditor appointed under this section may call for and inspect such books and records of the Commission or any recognized investor compensation company as he may require in order to perform his functions under this section.

subsection.leadIn: Not later than 4 months after the end of each financial year the Commission shall cause—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a copy of—

subparagraph.content: each audited financial statement in respect of that financial year; and
the auditor’s report on each such financial statement,

paragraph.continued: to be sent to the Financial Secretary; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a copy of each such audited financial statement to be published in the Gazette.

subsection.content: The Financial Secretary shall cause to be laid on the table of the Legislative Council any financial statement and report sent to him under subsection (9)(a).

def.name: FinancialStatement
def.leadIn: In this section, financial statement (財務報表) means a statement which contains all of the following documents—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a revenue and expenditure account;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a balance sheet; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a cash flow statement.

section.name: s241
section.heading: Investment of moneys

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may invest any money which forms part of the compensation fund and is not immediately required for any other purposes provided for by this Part—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on fixed deposit with an authorized financial institution; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in securities in which trustees are authorized by law to invest trust funds.

subsection.content: Any return or profit on an investment of moneys by the Commission under subsection (1) shall be added to the compensation fund.

A fixed deposit receipt and other document evidencing the investment of moneys under subsection (1) may be kept in the office of the Commission or deposited for safe keeping with an authorized financial institution.

section.name: s242
section.heading: Payments out of the compensation fund

subsection.leadIn: Subject to this Part, there shall from time to time be paid out of the compensation fund as required and in such order as the Commission may determine one or more of the following amounts—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: all legal and other expenses incurred—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in investigating or defending claims for compensation made under rules made under this Part;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in relation to the compensation fund;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: in the exercise by the Commission of the rights, powers, and authorities vested in it by this Part or rules made under this Part in relation to the compensation fund;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: in the performance by a recognized investor compensation company of a function transferred to it under section 80 or provided for under rules made under this Part;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the expenses incurred in the management or administration of the compensation fund;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the expenses incurred in obtaining insurance, surety, guarantee or other security, or in making any financial arrangement, in respect of claims for compensation made under rules made under this Part;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: interest on any sum borrowed under section 237(2)(a);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the amounts of claims for compensation, costs of and incidental to the making and proving of such claims and interest on compensation, as allowed under rules made under this Part;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: all other money payable out of the compensation fund in accordance with rules made under this Part.

subsection.leadIn: Where the Commission considers that the amount at credit in either the Unified Exchange Compensation Fund or the Futures Exchange Compensation Fund is insufficient to enable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the payment of the amounts which the Commission considers to be necessary to meet any claims or likely claims against the Unified Exchange Compensation Fund or the Futures Exchange Compensation Fund (as the case may be); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the repayment of the amounts deposited in cash with the Commission under section 104 of the repealed Securities Ordinance or section 82 of the repealed Commodities Trading Ordinance (as the case may be),

subsection.continued: then the Commission shall, subject to subsection (3), pay into the Unified Exchange Compensation Fund or the Futures Exchange Compensation Fund (as the case may be) out of the compensation fund such amount as it considers appropriate.

subsection.content: The aggregate amounts paid under subsection (2) to the Unified Exchange Compensation Fund or the Futures Exchange Compensation Fund shall not exceed the respective aggregate amounts paid into the compensation fund under section 74(2) or 75(2) of Schedule 10 (as the case may be).

section.name: s243
section.heading: Subrogation of the Commission to rights, etc. of claimant on payment from compensation fund

subsection.leadIn: Where the Commission makes any payment out of the compensation fund in respect of any claim for compensation made under rules made under this Part—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (1A), the Commission shall be subrogated, to the extent which that payment bears to the loss sustained (without taking into account any compensation paid or payable out of the compensation fund for the loss) by the claimant by reason of the default on which the claim was based, to all the rights and remedies of the claimant in relation to the loss; and (Amended 7 of 2004 s. 55)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the respective rights of the claimant and the Commission in bankruptcy or winding up or by legal proceedings or otherwise to receive in respect of the loss—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any sum out of the assets of the person concerned who is in default; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any property held on trust by that person for the claimant,

paragraph.continued: shall rank equally.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: The Commission is not subrogated to any rights and remedies of the claimant in respect of compensation from the Deposit Protection Scheme Fund established by section 14 of the Deposit Protection Scheme Ordinance (Cap. 581). (Added 7 of 2004 s. 55)
All assets (whether in cash or otherwise) recovered by the Commission under subsection (1) shall become part of the compensation fund.

section.name: s244
section.heading: Rules by Chief Executive in Council and Commission

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive in Council may make rules for the following matters—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the means of funding the compensation fund;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the maximum amount of compensation that may be paid to a person making a claim for compensation;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the maintenance of sub-accounts under section 240(2)(c), payments to be made from such sub-accounts and the apportionment between different sub-accounts of expenses incurred in relation to the compensation fund and of interest earned on the fund;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: providing for the better carrying out of the objects and purposes of this Part.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to section 398(7) and (8), the Commission may, subject to subsection (3), make rules which are not inconsistent with rules made by the Chief Executive in Council under subsection (1), for the following matters—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the circumstances in which a person is entitled to claim compensation, including any matter referred to in section 235 or 236(2) which may be prescribed by rules made under this section;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the manner in which the claim for compensation is to be made;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the payment of costs of and incidental to the making and proving of a claim for compensation;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the payment of interest on the amount of compensation;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the information or documents to be supplied to the Commission for the purpose of enabling the Commission to determine the application;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the persons or classes of persons who are not entitled to make a claim for compensation;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the circumstances and manner in which the Commission may call for claims for compensation;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the determination and payment of and the procedures for dealing with a claim for compensation;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.leadIn: enabling the Commission—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to submit a claim for compensation as a proof of debt in any winding-up or bankruptcy proceedings;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to pay compensation in the form of securities and to purchase securities for that purpose; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: to require the assignment of a claimant’s rights of action as a pre-condition for the payment of compensation;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: the functions of a recognized investor compensation company in relation to the management or administration of the compensation fund;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: the formulation of proper accounting and auditing systems with respect to the management or administration of the compensation fund for which a recognized investor compensation company may be responsible upon a transfer of a function to it under section 80;

paragraph.name: l
paragraph.content: arrangements that are to be made when a recognized investor compensation company is wound up;

paragraph.name: m
paragraph.content: the obtaining of such insurance, surety, guarantee or other security or the making of such financial arrangement as may be necessary or appropriate for the better carrying out of the objects and purposes of this Part;

paragraph.name: n
paragraph.content: providing for the better carrying out of the objects and purposes of this Part.

subsection.content: The Commission shall consult the Financial Secretary before making rules under subsection (2) for the matters specified in paragraphs (a) and (f) of that subsection.

In making any rules under subsection (1)(a), the Chief Executive in Council shall ensure that the funds of the compensation fund shall, so far as reasonably practicable, be borne by participants or any particular class of participants in the securities and futures market.

section.name: s245
section.heading: Interpretation of Part XIII

subsection.leadIn: In this Part, unless the context otherwise requires—

def.name: Associate
def.leadIn: associate (有聯繫者), in relation to a person, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person’s spouse or reputed spouse, any person cohabiting with the person as a spouse, the person’s brother, sister, parent, step-parent, child (natural or adopted) or step-child;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any corporation of which the person is a director;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any employee or partner of the person;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: where the person is a corporation, each of its directors and its related corporations and each director or employee of any of its related corporations;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: without limiting the circumstances in which paragraphs (a) to (d) apply, in circumstances concerning the securities of or other interest in a corporation, or rights arising out of the holding of such securities or such interest, any other person with whom the person has an agreement or arrangement—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: with respect to the acquisition, holding or disposal of such securities or such interest; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: under which they undertake to act together in exercising their voting power at general meetings of the corporation;

def.name: Controller
def.leadIn: controller (控制人), in relation to a corporation, means any person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in accordance with whose directions or instructions the directors of the corporation or of another corporation of which it is a subsidiary are accustomed or obliged to act; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: who, either alone or with any of his associates, is entitled to exercise or control the exercise of more than 33% of the voting power at general meetings of the corporation or of another corporation of which it is a subsidiary;

subsection.def: insider dealing (內幕交易) means insider dealing within the meaning of section 270;

def.name: Judge
def.leadIn: judge (法官) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a judge or a deputy judge of the Court of First Instance;

paragraph.name: b
