paragraph.content: a former Justice of Appeal of the Court of Appeal;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a former judge or a former deputy judge of the Court of First Instance;

def.name: MarketMisconduct
def.leadIn: market misconduct (市場失當行為) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: insider dealing;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: false trading within the meaning of section 274;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: price rigging within the meaning of section 275;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: disclosure of information about prohibited transactions within the meaning of section 276;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: disclosure of false or misleading information inducing transactions within the meaning of section 277; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: stock market manipulation within the meaning of section 278,

def.continued: and includes attempting to engage in, or assisting, counselling or procuring another person to engage in, any of the conduct referred to in paragraphs (a) to (f);

subsection.def: Presenting Officer (提控官), in relation to any proceedings instituted under section 252 or any disclosure proceedings, means the person appointed under section 251(4) to conduct the proceedings; (Amended 9 of 2012 s. 5)

def.name: RelevantOverseasMarket
def.leadIn: relevant non-Hong Kong market (有關非香港市場)— (Amended 31 of 2025 s. 158)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to securities, means a stock market outside Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to futures contracts, means a futures market outside Hong Kong;

def.name: RelevantRecognizedMarket
def.leadIn: relevant recognized market (有關認可市場)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to securities, means a recognized stock market; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to futures contracts, means a recognized futures market;

subsection.def: Tribunal (審裁處) means the Market Misconduct Tribunal established by section 251.

subsection.leadIn: In this subsection and sections 246 to 249 and Division 4, unless the context otherwise requires—

def.name: Derivatives
def.leadIn: derivatives (衍生工具), in relation to listed securities, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: rights, options or interests (whether described as units or otherwise) in, or in respect of, the listed securities;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: contracts, the purpose or pretended purpose of which is to secure or increase a profit or avoid or reduce a loss, wholly or partly by reference to the price or value, or a change in the price or value, of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the listed securities; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any rights, options or interests referred to in paragraph (a);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: rights, options or interests (whether described as units or otherwise) in, or in respect of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any rights, options or interests referred to in paragraph (a); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any contracts referred to in paragraph (b);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: instruments or other documents creating, acknowledging or evidencing any rights, options or interests or any contracts referred to in paragraph (a), (b) or (c), including certificates of interest or participation in, temporary or interim certificates for, receipts (including depositary receipts) in respect of, or warrants to subscribe for or purchase—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the listed securities; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the rights, options or interests or the contracts,

paragraph.continued: whether or not the derivatives are listed and regardless of who issued or made them;

def.name: InsideInformation
def.leadIn: inside information (內幕消息), in relation to a corporation, means specific information that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: is about—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the corporation;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a shareholder or officer of the corporation; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the listed securities of the corporation or their derivatives; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is not generally known to the persons who are accustomed or would be likely to deal in the listed securities of the corporation but would if generally known to them be likely to materially affect the price of the listed securities; (Added 9 of 2012 s. 5)

subsection.def: listed (上市) means listed on a recognized stock market, and for the purposes of this definition, securities shall continue to be regarded as listed during a period of suspension of dealings in those securities on the recognized stock market;
listed corporation (上市法團) means a corporation which has issued securities that are, at the time of any insider dealing in relation to the corporation, listed;

def.name: ListedSecurities
def.leadIn: listed securities (上市證券) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: securities which, at the time of any insider dealing in relation to a corporation, have been issued by the corporation and are listed;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: securities which, at the time of any insider dealing in relation to a corporation, have been issued by the corporation and are not listed, but which, at that time, it is reasonably foreseeable will be and which, in fact, are subsequently listed;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: securities which, at the time of any insider dealing in relation to a corporation, have not been issued by the corporation and are not listed, but which, at that time, it is reasonably foreseeable will be and which, in fact, are subsequently so issued and listed;

def.name: Securities
def.leadIn: securities (證券) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shares, stocks, debentures, loan stocks, funds, bonds or notes of, or issued by, or which it is reasonably foreseeable will be issued by, a body, whether incorporated or unincorporated, or a government or municipal government authority;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: rights, options or interests (whether described as units or otherwise) in, or in respect of, such shares, stocks, debentures, loan stocks, funds, bonds or notes;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: certificates of interest or participation in, temporary or interim certificates for, receipts for, or warrants to subscribe for or purchase, such shares, stocks, debentures, loan stocks, funds, bonds or notes;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: interests, rights or property, whether in the form of an instrument or otherwise, commonly known as securities;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: interests, rights or property, whether in the form of an instrument or otherwise, prescribed by notice under section 392 as being regarded as securities in accordance with the terms of the notice.

subsection.def: For the purposes of the definition of controller in subsection (1), where a person is entitled to exercise or control the exercise of more than 33% of the voting power at general meetings of a corporation and the corporation is entitled to exercise or control the exercise of any of the voting power at general meetings of another corporation (the effective voting power), then the effective voting power at general meetings of the other corporation shall be regarded as exercisable by the person.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Part, a person shall not be regarded as a person in accordance with whose directions or instructions the directors of a corporation are accustomed or obliged to act by reason only that the directors of the corporation act on advice given by him in a professional capacity.

section.name: s246
section.heading: Interest in securities (insider dealing)
section.content: For the purposes of sections 245(2) and 247 to 249 and Division 4, a reference to an interest in securities shall be construed as including an interest of any kind whatsoever in the securities, and for that purpose any restraint or restriction to which the exercise of a right attached to the interest may be subject shall be disregarded.

section.name: s247
section.heading: Connected with a corporation (insider dealing)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of Division 4, a person shall be regarded as connected with a corporation if, being an individual—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he is a director or employee of the corporation or a related corporation of the corporation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: he is a substantial shareholder of the corporation or a related corporation of the corporation;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: he occupies a position which may reasonably be expected to give him access to inside information in relation to the corporation by reason of— (Amended 9 of 2012 s. 14)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: a professional or business relationship existing between—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: himself, or his employer, or a corporation of which he is a director, or a firm of which he is a partner; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the corporation, a related corporation of the corporation, or an officer or substantial shareholder of either corporation; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: his being a director, employee or partner of a substantial shareholder of the corporation or a related corporation of the corporation;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: he has access to inside information in relation to the corporation and— (Amended 9 of 2012 s. 14)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: he has such access by reason of his being in such a position that he would be regarded as connected with another corporation by virtue of paragraph (a), (b) or (c); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the inside information relates to a transaction (actual or contemplated) involving both those corporations or involving one of them and the listed securities of the other or their derivatives, or to the fact that the transaction is no longer contemplated; or (Amended 9 of 2012 s. 14)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: he was, at any time within the 6 months preceding any insider dealing in relation to the corporation, a person who would be regarded as connected with the corporation by virtue of paragraph (a), (b), (c) or (d).

subsection.content: For the purposes of Division 4, a corporation shall be regarded as a person connected with another corporation so long as any of its directors or employees is a person who would be regarded as connected with that other corporation by virtue of subsection (1).

subsection.def: In subsection (1), notwithstanding any other provisions of this Ordinance, substantial shareholder (大股東), in relation to a corporation, means a person who has an interest in 5% or more of the total number of shares comprised in the relevant share capital of the corporation. (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

section.name: s248
section.heading: Connected with a corporation—possession of inside information obtained in privileged capacity (insider dealing)

subsection.content: For the purposes of Division 4, where a public officer or a specified person in that capacity receives inside information in relation to a corporation, he shall be regarded as a person connected with the corporation. (Amended 9 of 2012 s. 14)

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1), a reference to a specified person means a person who is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a member of the Executive Council;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a member of the Legislative Council;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: an officer or employee of a recognized exchange company, a recognized clearing house or a recognized exchange controller;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: an exchange participant;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: an officer or employee of an exchange participant;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: an officer or employee of a body corporate incorporated by an Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: an officer or employee of a body corporate specified by the Financial Secretary under subsection (3),

subsection.continued: whether, in the case of paragraph (a), (b), (c), (d), (f), (g) or (h), the person is such a member, officer or employee (as the case may be) on a temporary or permanent basis, and whether he is paid or unpaid.

subsection.content: The Financial Secretary may, by notice published in the Gazette, specify any body corporate for the purposes of subsection (2)(h).

section.name: s249
section.heading: Dealing in listed securities or their derivatives (insider dealing)
section.content: For the purposes of section 245(2) and Division 4, a person shall be regarded as dealing in listed securities or their derivatives if, whether as principal or agent, he sells, purchases, exchanges or subscribes for, or agrees to sell, purchase, exchange or subscribe for, any listed securities or their derivatives or acquires or disposes of, or agrees to acquire or dispose of, the right to sell, purchase, exchange or subscribe for, any listed securities or their derivatives.

section.name: s250
section.heading: Interest in securities and beneficial ownership, etc. (market misconduct other than insider dealing)

subsection.content: For the purposes of Division 5, a person shall be regarded as having an interest in securities if he has authority, whether formal or informal and whether express or implied, to dispose of or to exercise control over the disposal of the securities or, in the case of options in respect of the securities, to exercise the options.

subsection.leadIn: It is immaterial that the authority of a person referred to in subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is, or is capable of being made, subject to restraint or restriction; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is exercisable jointly with another person.

subsection.leadIn: A person shall be regarded as having the authority referred to in subsection (1) where a corporation has the authority referred to in that subsection and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the corporation is, or its directors are, accustomed or under an obligation, whether formal or informal, to act in accordance with the directions or instructions of the person in relation to the securities in question; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person, or an associate of the person, is a controller of the corporation.

subsection.leadIn: Where a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has entered into a contract to purchase securities;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has a right to have securities transferred to him or to his order whether the right is exercisable presently or in the future and whether on the fulfilment of a condition or not; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: has the right to acquire securities, or an interest in securities, under an option, whether the right is exercisable presently or in the future and whether on the fulfilment of a condition or not,

subsection.continued: the person shall, to the extent to which he could do so on completing the contract, enforcing the right or exercising the option, be regarded as having the authority referred to in subsection (1).

subsection.content: Where securities are subject to a trust, and a person who is not a trustee in those securities has an interest in those securities by virtue of subsection (4)(b), the interest of a trustee in those securities shall be disregarded for the purpose of determining whether the person has an interest in securities for the purposes of Division 5.

The Commission may make rules to prescribe that an interest, being an interest of a person or of the persons included in a class of persons, shall be disregarded for the purpose of determining whether the person or the persons has or have an interest in securities for the purposes of Division 5.

For the purposes of Division 5, a sale or purchase of securities does not involve a change in their beneficial ownership if a person who had an interest in the securities before the sale or purchase, or an associate of the person, has an interest in the securities after the sale or purchase.

section.name: s251
section.heading: Market Misconduct Tribunal

subsection.content:
There is established a Tribunal to be known as the Market Misconduct Tribunal which shall have jurisdiction to hear and determine in accordance with this Part and Schedule 9 any question or issue arising out of or in connection with the proceedings instituted under section 252.Note—
The Tribunal also has jurisdiction under Part XIVA—see section 307H.(Amended 9 of 2012 s. 6)

subsection.leadIn: Except as otherwise provided in this Part or in Schedule 9, the Tribunal—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall consist of a chairman and 2 other members; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall be presided over by the chairman who shall sit with the 2 other members.

subsection.content: The chairman of the Tribunal shall be a judge and the 2 other members of the Tribunal shall not be public officers.

The Commission shall, in respect of any proceedings instituted under section 252 or any disclosure proceedings, appoint a person as the Presenting Officer to conduct the proceedings, and may appoint one or more persons to assist the Presenting Officer. (Amended 9 of 2012 ss. 6 & 19)
A Presenting Officer shall be a counsel or solicitor. (Amended 9 of 2012 s. 19)

Schedule 9 shall have effect in relation to the appointment of members of the Tribunal, the appointment and the role of Presenting Officers and of persons appointed to assist Presenting Officers, and to the proceedings and sittings of, and procedural and other matters concerning, the Tribunal.

Where the Chief Executive considers appropriate, additional Tribunals may be established for the purposes of any proceedings instituted under section 252 or any disclosure proceedings, whereupon the provisions of this or any other Ordinance shall apply, subject to necessary modifications, to each of such additional Tribunals (including appointment of the chairman and other members of, and all matters concerning, each of such additional Tribunals) as they apply to the Tribunal. (Amended 9 of 2012 s. 6)

There may be paid to a member of the Tribunal (other than the chairman if he or she is a judge within the meaning of paragraph (a) of the definition of judge in section 245(1)) an amount, as a fee for the member’s services, that the Financial Secretary considers appropriate, and that amount is a charge on the general revenue. (Replaced 9 of 2012 s. 19)

subsection.name: 8A
subsection.content: There may be paid by the Commission to a Presenting Officer and to a person appointed to assist a Presenting Officer an amount, as a fee for his or her services, that the Commission considers appropriate. (Added 9 of 2012 s. 19)

subsection.leadIn: Where a person who is a judge within the meaning of paragraph (a) of the definition of judge in section 245(1) is appointed as the chairman of the Tribunal, neither the appointment nor the service or removal of the person as the chairman affects—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the tenure of office of, and the exercise of powers by, the person as a judge within the meaning of that paragraph;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person’s rank, title, status, precedence, salary or other rights or privileges as a holder of that office;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the terms and conditions to which the person is subject as a holder of that office.

section.name: s252
section.heading: Market misconduct proceedings

subsection.content: Subject to section 252A, if it appears to the Commission that market misconduct has or may have taken place, the Commission may institute proceedings in the Tribunal concerning the matter. (Replaced 9 of 2012 s. 20)
The Commission institutes proceedings under this section by giving the Tribunal a notice in writing containing a statement specifying the matters prescribed in Schedule 9. (Replaced 9 of 2012 s. 20)

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting the generality of section 251(1), the object of the proceedings instituted under this section is for the Tribunal to determine— (Amended 9 of 2012 s. 20)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether any market misconduct has taken place;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the identity of any person who has engaged in the market misconduct; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the amount of any profit gained or loss avoided as a result of the market misconduct.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (5) and (6), the Tribunal may identify a person as having engaged in market misconduct pursuant to subsection (3)(b) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he has perpetrated any conduct which constitutes the market misconduct;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: notwithstanding that he has not perpetrated any conduct which constitutes the market misconduct—

subparagraph.content: the market misconduct occurred with his consent or connivance as an officer of the corporation; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: notwithstanding that he has not perpetrated any conduct which constitutes the market misconduct—

subparagraph.content: the Tribunal identifies any other person as having engaged in market misconduct pursuant to subsection (3)(b); and

he assisted or connived with that other person in the perpetration of any conduct which constitutes the market misconduct, with the knowledge that such conduct constitutes or might constitute market misconduct.

subsection.content: The Tribunal shall not identify a person as having engaged in market misconduct pursuant to subsection (3)(b) if it is provided under any provision of this Part that the person shall not by reason of that market misconduct be regarded as having engaged in market misconduct.
The Tribunal shall not identify a person as having engaged in market misconduct pursuant to subsection (3)(b) without first giving the person a reasonable opportunity of being heard.
Subject to section 261(3), the standard of proof required to determine any question or issue before the Tribunal shall be the standard of proof applicable to civil proceedings in a court of law.

section.name: s252A
section.heading: Consent of Secretary for Justice for market misconduct proceedings

subsection.content: The Commission must not institute proceedings under section 252 unless it has obtained the consent of the Secretary for Justice.

subsection.leadIn: The Secretary for Justice may withhold the giving of consent under subsection (1) to proceedings under section 252 in respect of any conduct only if and so long as—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: proceedings for an offence under Part XIV are contemplated in respect of the same conduct; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: proceedings for an indictable offence (other than an offence under Part XIV) are contemplated, or have been instituted, in respect of the same conduct and the institution of proceedings under section 252 would be likely to cause serious prejudice to the investigation or prosecution of that offence.

subsection.content: To avoid doubt, the consent of the Secretary for Justice under subsection (1) does not preclude proceedings for any offence (other than an offence under Part XIV) in respect of the same conduct.
Nothing in this section derogates from the powers of the Secretary for Justice in respect of the prosecution of criminal offences.

section.name: s253
section.heading: Powers of Tribunal

subsection.leadIn: Subject to the provisions of Schedule 9 and any rules made by the Chief Justice under section 269, the Tribunal, for the purposes of any proceedings instituted under section 252, may, on its own motion or on the application of any party before it—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: receive and consider any material by way of oral evidence, written statements or documents, even if the material would not be admissible in evidence in civil or criminal proceedings in a court of law;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by notice in writing signed by the chairman of the Tribunal require a person to attend before it at any sitting and to give evidence and produce any article, record or document in his possession relating to the subject matter of the proceedings;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: administer oaths;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: examine or cause to be examined on oath or otherwise a person attending before it and require the person to answer truthfully any question which the Tribunal considers appropriate for the purposes of the proceedings;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: order a witness to provide evidence in a truthful manner for the purposes of the proceedings by affidavit;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: order a person not to publish or otherwise disclose any material the Tribunal receives;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: prohibit the publication or disclosure of any material the Tribunal receives at any sitting, or any part of a sitting, which is held in private;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: determine the manner in which any material referred to in paragraph (a) is received;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: stay any of the proceedings on such grounds and on such terms and conditions as it considers appropriate having regard to the interests of justice;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: determine the procedure to be followed in the proceedings;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: exercise such other powers or make such other orders as may be necessary for or ancillary to the conduct of the proceedings or the carrying out of its functions.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if he, without reasonable excuse—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: fails to comply with an order, notice, prohibition or requirement of the Tribunal made or given under or pursuant to subsection (1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: disrupts or otherwise misbehaves during any sitting of the Tribunal;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: having been required by the Tribunal under subsection (1) to attend before the Tribunal, leaves the place where his attendance is so required without the permission of the Tribunal;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: hinders or deters any person from attending before the Tribunal, giving evidence or producing any article, record or document, for the purposes of any proceedings instituted under section 252;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: threatens, insults or causes any loss to be suffered by any person who has attended before the Tribunal, on account of such attendance; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: threatens, insults or causes any loss to be suffered by any member of the Tribunal, any Presenting Officer or any person assisting a Presenting Officer at any time on account of the performance of his functions in that capacity.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (2) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.content: A person is not excused from complying with an order, notice, prohibition or requirement of the Tribunal made or given under or pursuant to subsection (1) only on the ground that to do so might tend to incriminate the person.

section.name: s254
section.heading: Further powers of Tribunal concerning evidence

subsection.content: For the purposes of any proceedings instituted under section 252, the Tribunal may, on its own motion or on the application of the Presenting Officer appointed for the proceedings, authorize the Commission in writing to exercise any of the powers specified in subsection (2) and to provide the Tribunal with any of the records, documents and information obtained as a result of the exercise of the powers.

subsection.leadIn: The powers specified for the purposes of subsection (1) are the powers—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to inspect any record or document of any person where the Tribunal has reasonable grounds to believe or suspect that the record or document may contain information relevant to the proceedings;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to make copies or otherwise record details of any record or document referred to in paragraph (a) and, subject to subsection (3), to take possession of the record or document for the period (not exceeding 2 days) necessary to do so;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to require any person to give, within a specified time, any explanation or particulars in respect of any record or document referred to in paragraph (a) (including, in so far as applicable, a description of the circumstances under which it was prepared or created, details of all instructions given or received in connection with it, and an explanation of the reasons for the making of entries contained in it or the omission of entries from it);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: to require any person to give, within a specified time, information as to whether or not there is on any premises any record or document which may contain information relevant to the proceedings, and particulars as to the premises or the record or document;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: to require that any information, explanation or particulars given pursuant to this section be verified by statutory declaration and to take the declaration;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: to take a statement from a person whom the Tribunal has reasonable grounds to believe or suspect is able to provide information which is relevant for the purposes of the proceedings.

subsection.content: The Commission shall, subject to any reasonable conditions it imposes as to security or otherwise, permit a person who would be entitled to inspect any record or document had the Commission not taken possession of it under subsection (2)(b), to inspect it and to make copies or otherwise record details of it at all reasonable times.
A person shall produce a record or document in his possession to the Commission if the Commission seeks to inspect it, or exercise any other powers in respect of it, under this section.

A person who is required under this section to give or provide any information, explanation or particulars shall comply with the requirement so far as it lies within his power to do so and shall, if requested, verify the information, explanation or particulars (as the case may be) by statutory declaration.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (4) or (5);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: he—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in purported compliance with subsection (4) or (5), makes any statement which is false or misleading in a material particular; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: knows that, or is reckless as to whether, the statement is false or misleading in a material particular;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: he obstructs the Commission in the exercise of any of its powers under this section; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: he, with intent to conceal, from the Tribunal, facts or matters capable of being disclosed by any record or document which is relevant to any proceedings instituted under section 252, destroys, falsifies, conceals or otherwise disposes of, or causes or permits the destruction, falsification, concealment or disposal of, such record or document.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (6) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.content: A person is not excused from complying with subsection (4) or (5) only on the ground that to do so might tend to incriminate him.

section.name: s255
section.heading: Use of evidence received for purposes of market misconduct proceedings

subsection.content: Notwithstanding any other provisions of this Ordinance, evidence given by any person at or for the purposes of any proceedings instituted under section 252 (including any material, record or document received by the Tribunal from the person or produced to the Tribunal by the person under section 253, and any record or document or information given, provided, produced or disclosed to the Tribunal by the person under section 254) shall be admissible in evidence for all the purposes of this Part (including any proceedings (civil or criminal) instituted under or pursuant to this Part) but, subject to subsection (2), shall not be admissible in evidence against that person for any other purposes in any proceedings (civil or criminal) in a court of law brought by or against him.

subsection.leadIn: The evidence given by any person at or for the purposes of any proceedings instituted under section 252 as referred to in subsection (1) shall be admissible in evidence against that person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in civil proceedings instituted under or pursuant to Part XI;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in proceedings instituted under section 305;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in civil proceedings in a court of law arising out of the giving of evidence at or for the purposes of the proceedings instituted under section 252;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in criminal proceedings where the person is charged with an offence under section 219(2)(a), or under Part V of the Crimes Ordinance (Cap. 200), or for perjury, in respect of answers given by that person to questions put to him at or for the purposes of the proceedings instituted under section 252.

section.name: s256
section.heading: Privileged information
section.content: Nothing in this Part and Schedule 9 requires an authorized financial institution, acting as the banker or financial adviser of a person whose conduct is the subject, whether wholly or in part, of any proceedings instituted under section 252, to disclose information as to the affairs of any of its customers other than that person.

section.name: s257
section.heading: Orders, etc. of Tribunal

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), the Tribunal may at the conclusion of any proceedings instituted under section 252 make one or more of the following orders in respect of a person identified as having engaged in market misconduct pursuant to section 252(3)(b)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an order that the person shall not, without the leave of the Court of First Instance, be or continue to be a director, liquidator, or receiver or manager of the property or business, of a listed corporation or any other specified corporation or in any way, whether directly or indirectly, be concerned or take part in the management of a listed corporation or any other specified corporation for the period (not exceeding 5 years) specified in the order;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an order that the person shall not, without the leave of the Court of First Instance, in Hong Kong, directly or indirectly, in any way acquire, dispose of or otherwise deal in any securities, futures contract or leveraged foreign exchange contract, or an interest in any securities, futures contract, leveraged foreign exchange contract or collective investment scheme for the period (not exceeding 5 years) specified in the order;

paragraph.name: c
d
e
paragraph.content: without prejudice to any power of the Tribunal under section 260, an order that the person pay to the Government the sum the Tribunal considers appropriate for the costs and expenses reasonably incurred by the Government in relation or incidental to the proceedings; (Amended 9 of 2012 s. 22)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: without prejudice to any power of the Tribunal under section 260, an order that the person pay to the Commission the sum the Tribunal considers appropriate for the costs and expenses reasonably incurred by the Commission, whether in relation or incidental to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the proceedings;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any investigation of the person’s conduct or affairs carried out before the proceedings were instituted; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: any investigation of the person’s conduct or affairs carried out for the purposes of the proceedings; (Replaced 9 of 2012 s. 22)

paragraph.name: fa
paragraph.content: where the proceedings were instituted as a result of an investigation under the Accounting and Financial Reporting Council Ordinance (Cap. 588), an order that the person pay to the Accounting and Financial Reporting Council continued under section 6 of that Ordinance the sum the Tribunal considers appropriate for the costs and expenses in relation or incidental to the investigation reasonably incurred by the Council; (Added 18 of 2006 s. 85. Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: an order that any body which may take disciplinary action against the person as one of its members or regulatees be recommended to take disciplinary action against the person. (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: In subsection (1)(fa), the reference to an investigation under the Accounting and Financial Reporting Council Ordinance (Cap. 588) includes an investigation under the Financial Reporting Council Ordinance (Cap. 588) as in force from time to time before the day* on which section 3 of the Financial Reporting Council (Amendment) Ordinance 2021 (41 of 2021) comes into operation. (Added L.N. 66 of 2022)

subsection.leadIn: When making any order in respect of a person under subsection (1), the Tribunal may take into account any conduct by the person which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: previously resulted in the person being convicted of an offence in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: previously resulted in the person being identified by the Tribunal—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: under section 252(3)(b) as having engaged in any market misconduct; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: under section 307J(1)(b) as being in breach of a disclosure requirement; or (Replaced 9 of 2012 s. 7)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: at any time before the commencement of this Part resulted in the person being identified as an insider dealer in a determination under section 16(3), or in a written report prepared and issued under section 22(1), of the repealed Securities (Insider Dealing) Ordinance.

subsection.content: The Tribunal shall not make an order in respect of a person under subsection (1) without first giving the person a reasonable opportunity of being heard.
Where the Tribunal makes an order under subsection (1)(a), the Tribunal may specify a corporation by name or by reference to a relationship with any other corporation.

The Tribunal may, in relation to any person, specify any market misconduct in an order under subsection (1)(c), whether or not there is, at the time when the order is made, likelihood that the person would perpetrate any conduct which constitutes the market misconduct.

Where the Tribunal makes an order under subsection (1)(e) or (f) requiring the payment of costs as costs reasonably incurred in relation or incidental to any proceedings instituted under section 252, subject to any rules made by the Chief Justice under section 269, Order 62 of the Rules of the High Court (Cap. 4 sub. leg. A) applies to the taxation of the costs.
The Tribunal shall by notice in writing notify a person of an order made in respect of him under subsection (1).
An order made in respect of a person under subsection (1) takes effect at the time when it is notified to the person or at the time specified in the notice, whichever is the later.
Where the Tribunal makes an order under subsection (1)(b), the Commission may notify any licensed person or registered institution of the order in such manner as it considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if he fails to comply with an order made under subsection (1)(a), (b) or (c) and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s258
section.heading: Further orders in respect of officers of corporation

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (3), where a corporation has been identified as having engaged in market misconduct pursuant to section 252(3)(b) and the market misconduct is directly or indirectly attributable to a breach by any person as an officer of the corporation of the duty imposed on him by section 279, the Tribunal may make one or more of the orders referred to in section 257(1)(a) to (g) in respect of the person even if the person has not been identified as having engaged in market misconduct pursuant to section 252(3)(b).

subsection.leadIn: When making any order in respect of a person under subsection (1), the Tribunal may take into account any conduct by the person which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: previously resulted in the person being convicted of an offence in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: previously resulted in the person being identified by the Tribunal—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: under section 252(3)(b) as having engaged in any market misconduct; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: under section 307J(1)(b) as being in breach of a disclosure requirement; or (Replaced 9 of 2012 s. 8)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: at any time before the commencement of this Part resulted in the person being identified as an insider dealer in a determination under section 16(3), or in a written report prepared and issued under section 22(1), of the repealed Securities (Insider Dealing) Ordinance.

subsection.content: The Tribunal shall not make an order in respect of a person under subsection (1) without first giving the person a reasonable opportunity of being heard.
Where the Tribunal makes under subsection (1) an order referred to in section 257(1)(a), the Tribunal may specify a corporation by name or by reference to a relationship with any other corporation.

Where the Tribunal, in relation to any person, makes under subsection (1) an order referred to in section 257(1)(c), the Tribunal may specify any market misconduct in the order, whether or not there is, at the time when the order is made, likelihood that the person would perpetrate any conduct which constitutes the market misconduct.

Where the Tribunal makes under subsection (1) an order referred to in section 257(1)(e) or (f) requiring the payment of costs as costs reasonably incurred in relation or incidental to any proceedings instituted under section 252, subject to any rules made by the Chief Justice under section 269, Order 62 of the Rules of the High Court (Cap. 4 sub. leg. A) applies to the taxation of the costs.
The Tribunal shall by notice in writing notify a person of an order made in respect of him under subsection (1).
An order made in respect of a person under subsection (1) takes effect at the time when it is notified to the person or at the time specified in the notice, whichever is the later.

Where the Tribunal makes under subsection (1) an order referred to in section 257(1)(b), the Commission may notify any licensed person or registered institution of the order in such manner as it considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: Where an order referred to in section 257(1)(a), (b) or (c) is made in respect of a person under subsection (1), the person commits an offence if he fails to comply with the order and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s259
section.heading: Interest on moneys payable under order referred to in section 257(1)(d)
section.leadIn: Where the Tribunal makes an order referred to in section 257(1)(d), whether under section 257(1) or 258(1), requiring the payment of money by a person, the Tribunal may also order that the payment shall carry compound interest calculated—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: from the date of occurrence of the market misconduct in question; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at the rate from time to time applicable to judgment debts under section 49 of the High Court Ordinance (Cap. 4) and with such rests and in such manner as the Tribunal considers appropriate.

section.name: s260
section.heading: Costs

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (4), at the conclusion of any proceedings instituted under section 252 or as soon as reasonably practicable after the conclusion of the proceedings, the Tribunal may by order award to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any person whose attendance, whether as a witness or otherwise, has been necessary or required for the purposes of the proceedings;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any person whose conduct is the subject, whether wholly or in part, of the proceedings,

subsection.continued: such sum as it considers appropriate in respect of the costs reasonably incurred by the person in relation to the proceedings.

subsection.content: Any costs awarded under this section are a charge on the general revenue.

Subject to any rules made by the Chief Justice under section 269, Order 62 of the Rules of the High Court (Cap. 4 sub. leg. A) applies to the award of costs, and to the taxation of any costs awarded, by the Tribunal under this section.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1)(a) and (b) does not apply to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person who has by virtue of section 252(4)(a), (b) or (c) been identified as having engaged in market misconduct pursuant to section 252(3)(b);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person whose conduct the Tribunal considers has caused, whether wholly or in part, the Tribunal to investigate or consider his conduct during the course of the proceedings in question;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a person whom the Tribunal considers has by his conduct caused, whether wholly or in part, the institution of the proceedings.

section.name: s261
section.heading: Contempt dealt with by Tribunal

subsection.content: The Tribunal shall have the same powers as the Court of First Instance to punish for contempt.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting the generality of the powers of the Tribunal under subsection (1), the Tribunal shall have the same powers as the Court of First Instance to punish for contempt, as if it were contempt of court, a person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: without reasonable excuse, commits any conduct falling within the description of section 253(2)(a), (b), (c), (d), (e) or (f); or (Amended 9 of 2012 s. 23)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: commits any conduct falling within the description of section 254(6)(a), (b), (c) or (d). (Amended 9 of 2012 s. 23)

subsection.content: The Tribunal shall, in the exercise of its powers to punish for contempt under this section, adopt the same standard of proof as the Court of First Instance in the exercise of the same powers to punish for contempt.

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding anything in this section and any other provisions of this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: no power may be exercised under or pursuant to this section to determine whether to punish any person for contempt in respect of any conduct if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: criminal proceedings have previously been instituted against the person under section 253(2) or 254(6) in respect of the same conduct; and (Amended 9 of 2012 s. 23)

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: those criminal proceedings remain pending; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: by reason of the previous institution of those criminal proceedings, no criminal proceedings may again be lawfully instituted against that person under such section in respect of the same conduct;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: no criminal proceedings may be instituted against any person under section 253(2) or 254(6) in respect of any conduct if— (Amended 9 of 2012 s. 23)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any power has previously been exercised under or pursuant to this section to determine whether to punish the person for contempt in respect of the same conduct; and

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: proceedings arising from the exercise of such power remain pending; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: by reason of the previous exercise of such power, no power may again be lawfully exercised under or pursuant to this section to determine whether to punish the person for contempt in respect of the same conduct.

section.name: s262
section.heading: Report of Tribunal

subsection.leadIn: The Tribunal shall, after the conduct of any proceedings instituted under section 252, prepare a written report in respect of the proceedings, which shall contain—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any of its determinations made pursuant to section 252(3) and any order made under section 257 or 258, and the reasons for making such determinations and order; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any order made under section 259 or 260, and the reasons for making such order.

subsection.leadIn: The Tribunal shall issue the report prepared under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by giving a copy of the report to the Commission; and (Replaced 9 of 2012 s. 24)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: except where the Tribunal sat in private for the whole or any part of its proceedings, by— (Amended 9 of 2012 s. 24)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: publishing the report so that copies of the report are available to the public;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: giving a copy of the report, so far as reasonably practicable, to any person whose conduct was directly in question in the proceedings; and (Amended 9 of 2012 s. 24)

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: where the Tribunal considers appropriate, giving a copy of the report to any body which may take disciplinary action against the person identified as having engaged in market misconduct pursuant to section 252(3)(b), as one of its members or regulatees. (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

subsection.content: Where the Tribunal sat in private for the whole or any part of its proceedings, the Commission may, if the Commission is of the opinion that it is in the public interest to do so, cause the whole or any part of the report to be made available to the public or to a particular person or body in the manner it directs. (Amended 9 of 2012 s. 24)

A person is not liable to civil or criminal proceedings for publishing a true and accurate account or a fair and accurate summary of a report of the Tribunal issued or made available under subsection (2)(b) or (3).

section.name: s263
section.heading: Form and proof of orders of Tribunal

subsection.content: An order made by the Tribunal shall be recorded in writing and signed by the chairman of the Tribunal.

A document purporting to be an order of the Tribunal and to be signed by the chairman of the Tribunal shall, in the absence of proof to the contrary, be regarded as an order of the Tribunal duly made, without proof of its making, or proof of signature, or proof that the person signing the order was in fact the chairman.

section.name: s264
section.heading: Orders of Tribunal may be registered in Court of First Instance

subsection.content: The Court of First Instance may, on notice in writing given by the Tribunal in the manner prescribed by rules made by the Chief Justice under section 269, register an order of the Tribunal in the Court of First Instance and the order shall, on registration, become for all purposes an order of the Court of First Instance made within the jurisdiction of the Court of First Instance.

Where an order is made under section 257(1)(a), or an order referred to in section 257(1)(a) is made under section 258(1), the order shall be filed by the Tribunal with the Registrar of Companies, as soon as reasonably practicable after it is made.

section.name: s265
section.heading: Applications for stay of execution of orders of Tribunal under section 257, 258, 259 or 260
section.content: Any person in respect of whom an order has been made under section 257, 258, 259 or 260 may apply to the Tribunal for a stay of execution of the order, whereupon the Tribunal may, where it considers appropriate, by order grant the stay, subject to such conditions as to costs, payment of money into the Tribunal or otherwise as the Tribunal considers appropriate.

section.name: s266
section.heading: Appeal to Court of Appeal

subsection.leadIn: Where the Tribunal has made any finding or determination for the purposes of any proceedings instituted under section 252, and the Commission, or a person identified as having engaged in market misconduct pursuant to section 252(3)(b), is dissatisfied with the finding or determination, the Commission or the person (as the case may be) may, after the Tribunal has made orders (if any) under section 257, 258, 259 or 260 for the purposes of the proceedings, appeal to the Court of Appeal against the finding or determination— (Amended 9 of 2012 s. 25)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on a point of law; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: with the leave of the Court of Appeal, on a question of fact.

subsection.content: A person in respect of whom an order has been made under section 257, 258, 259, 260 or 265 may appeal to the Court of Appeal against the order.

section.name: s267
section.heading: Powers of Court of Appeal on appeal

subsection.leadIn: In an appeal under section 266(1), the Court of Appeal may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: allow the appeal;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: dismiss the appeal;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: vary or set aside the finding or determination, and, where the finding or determination is set aside, substitute for the finding or determination any other finding or determination it considers appropriate;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: remit the matter in question to the Tribunal with the directions it considers appropriate, which may include a direction to the Tribunal to conduct the proceedings in question afresh for the purpose of determining any question specified by the Court of Appeal.

subsection.leadIn: In an appeal under section 266(2), the Court of Appeal may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: confirm, vary or set aside the order appealed against; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the order is set aside, substitute for the order any other order it considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: Where the Court of Appeal varies, or substitutes any other finding, determination or order for, a finding, determination or order under subsection (1)(c) or (2)(a) or (b), the finding, determination or order as varied or the other finding, determination or order substituting for the finding, determination or order (as the case may be) may be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (1)(c), any finding or determination (whether more or less onerous) that the Tribunal had power to make for the purposes of the proceedings in question; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (2)(a) or (b), any order (whether more or less onerous) that the Tribunal had power to make in respect of the appellant,

subsection.continued: whether or not under the same provision as that under which the finding, determination or order has been made.

subsection.content: Where on appeal the Court of Appeal remits any matter to the Tribunal under section 267(1)(d), unless the Court of Appeal otherwise directs, members of the Tribunal disposing of the matter may be the same as, or different from, those of the Tribunal from which the appeal lies.
In an appeal under section 266, the Court of Appeal may make such order as to costs as it considers appropriate.

section.name: s268
section.heading: No stay of execution on appeal
section.content: Without prejudice to section 265, neither the lodging of an appeal nor the filing of an application for leave to appeal under section 266 by itself operates as a stay of execution of a finding or determination or an order (as the case may be) of the Tribunal unless the Court of Appeal otherwise orders, and any stay of execution may be subject to such conditions as to costs, payment of money into the Tribunal or otherwise as the Court of Appeal considers appropriate.

section.name: s269
section.heading: Rules by Chief Justice
section.leadIn: The Chief Justice may make rules—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: providing for the taxation of costs required to be paid under an order referred to in section 257(1)(e) or (f), whether made under section 257(1) or 258(1), and for the award of costs under section 260 and the taxation of those costs;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: prescribing the manner in which the Tribunal is to give notice to the Court of First Instance in respect of orders of the Tribunal pursuant to section 264;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: regulating the procedure for—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: applying for leave to appeal, and the hearing of applications for leave to appeal, under section 266;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the hearing of appeals under that section;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: requiring the payment of the fees specified in the rules for any matter relating to the proceedings instituted under section 252;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: providing for matters of procedure or other matters relating to the proceedings instituted under section 252, which are not provided for in this Part or in Schedule 9;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: providing for the issue or service of any document (however described) for the purposes of this Part or Schedule 9;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: prescribing any matter which this Part provides is, or may be, prescribed by rules made by the Chief Justice.

section.name: s270
section.heading: Insider dealing

subsection.leadIn: Insider dealing in relation to a listed corporation takes place—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: when a person connected with the corporation and having information which he knows is inside information in relation to the corporation— (Amended 9 of 2012 s. 14)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: deals in the listed securities of the corporation or their derivatives, or in the listed securities of a related corporation of the corporation or their derivatives; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: counsels or procures another person to deal in such listed securities or derivatives, knowing or having reasonable cause to believe that the other person will deal in them;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: when a person who is contemplating or has contemplated making, whether with or without another person, a take-over offer for the corporation and who knows that the information that the offer is contemplated or is no longer contemplated is inside information in relation to the corporation— (Amended 9 of 2012 s. 14)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: deals in the listed securities of the corporation or their derivatives, or in the listed securities of a related corporation of the corporation or their derivatives, otherwise than for the purpose of the take-over; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: counsels or procures another person to deal in such listed securities or derivatives, otherwise than for the purpose of the take-over;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: when a person connected with the corporation and knowing that any information is inside information in relation to the corporation, discloses the information, directly or indirectly, to another person, knowing or having reasonable cause to believe that the other person will make use of the information for the purpose of dealing, or of counselling or procuring another person to deal, in the listed securities of the corporation or their derivatives, or in the listed securities of a related corporation of the corporation or their derivatives;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: when a person who is contemplating or has contemplated making, whether with or without another person, a take-over offer for the corporation and who knows that the information that the offer is contemplated or is no longer contemplated is inside information in relation to the corporation, discloses the information, directly or indirectly, to another person, knowing or having reasonable cause to believe that the other person will make use of the information for the purpose of dealing, or of counselling or procuring another person to deal, in the listed securities of the corporation or their derivatives, or in the listed securities of a related corporation of the corporation or their derivatives;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: when a person who has information which he knows is inside information in relation to the corporation and which he received, directly or indirectly, from a person whom he knows is connected with the corporation and whom he knows or has reasonable cause to believe held the information as a result of being connected with the corporation— (Amended 9 of 2012 s. 14)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: deals in the listed securities of the corporation or their derivatives, or in the listed securities of a related corporation of the corporation or their derivatives; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: counsels or procures another person to deal in such listed securities or derivatives; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: when a person having received, directly or indirectly, from a person whom he knows or has reasonable cause to believe is contemplating or is no longer contemplating making a take-over offer for the corporation, information to that effect which he knows is inside information in relation to the corporation— (Amended 9 of 2012 s. 14)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: deals in the listed securities of the corporation or their derivatives, or in the listed securities of a related corporation of the corporation or their derivatives; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: counsels or procures another person to deal in such listed securities or derivatives.

subsection.leadIn: Insider dealing in relation to a listed corporation also takes place when a person who knowingly has inside information in relation to the corporation in any of the circumstances described in subsection (1)— (Amended 9 of 2012 s. 14)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: counsels or procures another person to deal in the listed securities of the corporation or their derivatives, or in the listed securities of a related corporation of the corporation or their derivatives, knowing or having reasonable cause to believe that the other person will deal in such listed securities or derivatives outside Hong Kong on a stock market other than a recognized stock market; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: discloses the inside information to another person knowing or having reasonable cause to believe that the other person or some other person will make use of the inside information for the purpose of dealing, or of counselling or procuring any other person to deal, in the listed securities of the corporation or their derivatives, or in the listed securities of a related corporation of the corporation or their derivatives, outside Hong Kong on a stock market other than a recognized stock market.

section.name: s271
section.heading: Insider dealing—certain persons not to be regarded as having engaged in market misconduct

subsection.leadIn: A person shall not be regarded as having engaged in market misconduct by reason of an insider dealing taking place through his dealing in or counselling or procuring another person to deal in listed securities or derivatives if he establishes that he dealt in or counselled or procured the other person to deal in the listed securities or derivatives in question (as the case may be)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the sole purpose of acquiring shares required for his being qualified as a director or intending director of a corporation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the performance in good faith of an underwriting agreement for the listed securities or derivatives in question; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the performance in good faith of his functions as a liquidator, receiver or trustee in bankruptcy.

subsection.leadIn: A corporation shall not be regarded as having engaged in market misconduct by reason of an insider dealing taking place through its dealing in or counselling or procuring another person to deal in listed securities or derivatives if it establishes that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: although one or more of its directors or employees had the inside information in relation to the corporation the listed securities of which were, or the derivatives of the listed securities of which were, the listed securities or derivatives in question, each person who took the decision for it to deal in or counsel or procure the other person to deal in such listed securities or derivatives (as the case may be) did not have the inside information up to (and including) the time when it dealt in or counselled or procured the other person to deal in such listed securities or derivatives (as the case may be);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: arrangements then existed to secure that—

subparagraph.content: the inside information was, up to (and including) the time when it dealt in or counselled or procured the other person to deal in such listed securities or derivatives (as the case may be), not communicated to any person who took the decision; and

none of its directors or employees who had the inside information gave advice concerning the decision to any person who took the decision at any time before it dealt in or counselled or procured the other person to deal in such listed securities or derivatives (as the case may be); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the inside information was in fact not so communicated to any person who took the decision and none of its directors or employees who had the inside information in fact so gave the advice to any person who took the decision. (Amended 9 of 2012 s. 14)

subsection.content: A person shall not be regarded as having engaged in market misconduct by reason of an insider dealing taking place through his dealing in or counselling or procuring another person to deal in listed securities or derivatives or his disclosure of information if he establishes that the purpose for which he dealt in or counselled or procured the other person to deal in the listed securities or derivatives in question or disclosed the information in question (as the case may be) was not, or, where there was more than one purpose, the purposes for which he dealt in or counselled or procured the other person to deal in the listed securities or derivatives in question or disclosed the information in question (as the case may be) did not include, the purpose of securing or increasing a profit or avoiding or reducing a loss, whether for himself or another, by using inside information. (Amended 9 of 2012 s. 14)

subsection.leadIn: A person shall not be regarded as having engaged in market misconduct by reason of an insider dealing taking place through his dealing in or counselling or procuring another person to deal in listed securities or derivatives if he establishes that—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: he did not select or advise on the selection of such listed securities or derivatives; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: he—

subparagraph.content: did not know that the person for whom he acted as agent was a person connected with the corporation the listed securities of which were, or the derivatives of the listed securities of which were, such listed securities or derivatives; or
did not know that the person for whom he acted as agent had the inside information in question. (Amended 9 of 2012 s. 14)

subsection.leadIn: A person shall not be regarded as having engaged in market misconduct by reason of an insider dealing taking place through his dealing in or counselling or procuring another person to deal in listed securities or derivatives if he establishes that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at the time when he dealt in or counselled or procured the other person to deal in the listed securities or derivatives in question, the dealing in question was not required to be recorded on a recognized stock market or to be notified to a recognized exchange company under its rules; and

subparagraph.leadIn: where the insider dealing took place through his dealing in listed securities or derivatives—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: he and the other party to the dealing in question entered into the dealing directly with each other; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: at the time when he entered into the dealing, the other party to the dealing knew, or ought reasonably to have known, of the inside information in question; or

subparagraph.leadIn: where the insider dealing took place through his counselling or procuring another person to deal in listed securities or derivatives—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: he counselled or procured the other party to the dealing in question to enter into the dealing directly with him; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: at the time when he counselled or procured the other party to enter into the dealing, the other party knew, or ought reasonably to have known, of the inside information in question. (Amended 9 of 2012 s. 14)

subsection.leadIn: A person shall not be regarded as having engaged in market misconduct by reason of an insider dealing taking place through his dealing in listed securities or derivatives if he establishes that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he entered into the dealing in question, otherwise than as a person who has counselled or procured the other party to the dealing to deal in listed securities or their derivatives; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at the time when he entered into the dealing, the other party to the dealing knew, or ought reasonably to have known, that he was a person connected with the corporation the listed securities of which were, or the derivatives of the listed securities of which were, the listed securities or derivatives in question.

subsection.leadIn: A person shall not be regarded as having engaged in market misconduct by reason of an insider dealing taking place through his counselling or procuring another person to deal in listed securities or derivatives if he establishes that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the other person did not counsel or procure the other party to the dealing in question to deal in listed securities or their derivatives; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at the time when he counselled or procured the other person to deal in the listed securities or derivatives in question, the other party to the dealing in question knew, or ought reasonably to have known, that the other person was a person connected with the corporation the listed securities of which were, or the derivatives of the listed securities of which were, such listed securities or derivatives.

subsection.leadIn: A person shall not be regarded as having engaged in market misconduct by reason of an insider dealing taking place through his dealing in or counselling or procuring another person to deal in listed securities or derivatives if he establishes that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: he acted—

subparagraph.content: in connection with any dealing in listed securities or their derivatives (whether by himself or another person) which was under consideration or was the subject of negotiation, or in the course of a series of such dealings; and
with a view to facilitating the accomplishment of the dealing or the series of dealings; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the inside information in question was market information arising directly out of his involvement in the dealing or the series of dealings. (Amended 9 of 2012 s. 14)

subsection.content: A person shall not be regarded as having engaged in market misconduct by reason of an insider dealing taking place through his dealing in or counselling or procuring another person to deal in listed securities or derivatives if he establishes that the dealing in question is a market contract.

def.name: MarketInformation
def.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (8), market information (市場消息) means information consisting of one or more of the following facts—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
d
paragraph.content: the price (or range of prices) at which listed securities or derivatives of listed securities have been or are to be dealt in, or the price (or range of prices) at which listed securities or derivatives of listed securities in which any dealing is under consideration or is the subject of negotiation may be dealt in;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the identity of the persons involved or likely to be involved in any capacity in any dealing in listed securities or derivatives of listed securities.

section.name: s272
section.heading: Insider dealing—certain trustees and personal representatives not to be regarded as having engaged in market misconduct
section.leadIn: A person who is a trustee or personal representative shall not be regarded as having engaged in market misconduct by reason of an insider dealing taking place through his dealing in or counselling or procuring another person to deal in listed securities or derivatives if he establishes that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he acted on advice obtained in good faith from another person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that other person appeared to him to be an appropriate person from whom to seek the advice; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: it did not appear to him that, had that other person dealt in the listed securities or derivatives in question, an insider dealing would take place.

section.name: s273
section.heading: Insider dealing—certain persons exercising right to subscribe for or acquire securities or derivatives not to be regarded as having engaged in market misconduct
section.leadIn: A person shall not be regarded as having engaged in market misconduct by reason of an insider dealing taking place through his dealing in listed securities or derivatives if he establishes that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he dealt in the listed securities or derivatives in question by way of his exercise of a right to subscribe for or otherwise acquire such listed securities or derivatives; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the right was granted to him or was derived from securities or their derivatives that were held by him before he became aware of any inside information in relation to the corporation the listed securities of which were, or the derivatives of the listed securities of which were, such listed securities or derivatives. (Amended 9 of 2012 s. 14)

section.name: s274
section.heading: False trading

subsection.leadIn: False trading takes place when, in Hong Kong or elsewhere, a person does anything or causes anything to be done, with the intention that, or being reckless as to whether, it has, or is likely to have, the effect of creating a false or misleading appearance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: of active trading in securities or futures contracts traded on a relevant recognized market or by means of authorized automated trading services; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: with respect to the market for, or the price for dealings in, securities or futures contracts traded on a relevant recognized market or by means of authorized automated trading services.

subsection.leadIn: False trading takes place when, in Hong Kong, a person does anything or causes anything to be done, with the intention that, or being reckless as to whether, it has, or is likely to have, the effect of creating a false or misleading appearance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: of active trading in securities or futures contracts traded on a relevant non-Hong Kong market; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: with respect to the market for, or the price for dealings in, securities or futures contracts traded on a relevant non-Hong Kong market. (Amended 31 of 2025 s. 159)

subsection.content: False trading takes place when, in Hong Kong or elsewhere, a person takes part in, is concerned in, or carries out, directly or indirectly, one or more transactions (whether or not any of them is a dealing in securities or futures contracts), with the intention that, or being reckless as to whether, it or they has or have, or is or are likely to have, the effect of creating an artificial price, or maintaining at a level that is artificial (whether or not it was previously artificial) a price, for dealings in securities or futures contracts traded on a relevant recognized market or by means of authorized automated trading services.

False trading takes place when, in Hong Kong, a person takes part in, is concerned in, or carries out, directly or indirectly, one or more transactions (whether or not any of them is a dealing in securities or futures contracts), with the intention that, or being reckless as to whether, it or they has or have, or is or are likely to have, the effect of creating an artificial price, or maintaining at a level that is artificial (whether or not it was previously artificial) a price, for dealings in securities or futures contracts traded on a relevant non-Hong Kong market. (Amended 31 of 2025 s. 159)

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting the general nature of the conduct which constitutes false trading under subsection (1) or (2), where a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: enters into or carries out, directly or indirectly, any transaction of sale or purchase, or any transaction which purports to be a transaction of sale or purchase, of securities that does not involve a change in the beneficial ownership of them;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: offers to sell securities at a price that is substantially the same as the price at which he has made or proposes to make, or knows that an associate of his has made or proposes to make, an offer to purchase the same or substantially the same number of them; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: offers to purchase securities at a price that is substantially the same as the price at which he has made or proposes to make, or knows that an associate of his has made or proposes to make, an offer to sell the same or substantially the same number of them,
