subsection.continued: then, unless the transaction in question is an off-market transaction, the person shall, for the purposes of subsections (1) and (2), be regarded as doing something or causing something to be done, with the intention that, or being reckless as to whether, it has, or is likely to have, the effect of creating a false or misleading appearance—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: where the securities are traded on a relevant recognized market or by means of authorized automated trading services, of active trading in securities so traded or with respect to the market for, or the price for dealings in, securities so traded; or

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: where the securities are traded on a relevant non-Hong Kong market, of active trading in securities so traded or with respect to the market for, or the price for dealings in, securities so traded. (Amended 31 of 2025 s. 159)

subsection.content: A person shall not be regarded as having engaged in market misconduct by reason of false trading taking place through the commission of an act referred to in subsection (5)(a), (b) or (c) if he establishes that the purpose for which he committed the act was not, or, where there was more than one purpose, the purposes for which he committed the act did not include, the purpose of creating a false or misleading appearance of active trading in securities, or with respect to the market for, or the price for dealings in, securities, referred to in subsection (1) or (2) (as the case may be).

def.name: OffmarketTransaction
def.leadIn: In subsection (5), off-market transaction (場外交易) means a transaction which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of securities traded on a relevant recognized market, is not required to be recorded on the relevant recognized market, or to be notified, under the rules of the person by whom the relevant recognized market is operated, to such person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of securities traded by means of authorized automated trading services, is not required to be recorded by means of authorized automated trading services, or to be notified, under the rules of the person by whom the authorized automated trading services are operated, to such person; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of securities traded on a relevant non-Hong Kong market, is not required to be recorded on the relevant non-Hong Kong market, or to be notified, under the rules of the person by whom the relevant non-Hong Kong market is operated, to such person. (Amended 31 of 2025 s. 159)

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference to a transaction of sale or purchase, in relation to securities, includes an offer to sell or purchase securities and an invitation (however expressed) that expressly or impliedly invites a person to offer to sell or purchase securities; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a reference to entering into or carrying out a transaction of sale or purchase shall, in the case of an offer or an invitation referred to in paragraph (a), be construed as a reference to making the offer or the invitation (as the case may be).

section.name: s275
section.heading: Price rigging

subsection.leadIn: Price rigging takes place when, in Hong Kong or elsewhere, a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: enters into or carries out, directly or indirectly, any transaction of sale or purchase of securities that does not involve a change in the beneficial ownership of those securities, which has the effect of maintaining, increasing, reducing, stabilizing, or causing fluctuations in, the price of securities traded on a relevant recognized market or by means of authorized automated trading services; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: enters into or carries out, directly or indirectly, any fictitious or artificial transaction or device, with the intention that, or being reckless as to whether, it has the effect of maintaining, increasing, reducing, stabilizing, or causing fluctuations in, the price of securities, or the price for dealings in futures contracts, that are traded on a relevant recognized market or by means of authorized automated trading services.

subsection.leadIn: Price rigging takes place when, in Hong Kong, a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: enters into or carries out, directly or indirectly, any transaction of sale or purchase of securities that does not involve a change in the beneficial ownership of those securities, which has the effect of maintaining, increasing, reducing, stabilizing, or causing fluctuations in, the price of securities traded on a relevant non-Hong Kong market; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: enters into or carries out, directly or indirectly, any fictitious or artificial transaction or device, with the intention that, or being reckless as to whether, it has the effect of maintaining, increasing, reducing, stabilizing, or causing fluctuations in, the price of securities, or the price for dealings in futures contracts, that are traded on a relevant non-Hong Kong market. (Amended 31 of 2025 s. 160)

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsections (1)(b) and (2)(b), the fact that a transaction is, or at any time was, intended to have effect according to its terms is not conclusive in determining whether the transaction is, or was, not fictitious or artificial.

A person shall not be regarded as having engaged in market misconduct by reason of price rigging taking place through any transaction of sale or purchase of securities referred to in subsection (1)(a) or (2)(a) if he establishes that the purpose for which the securities were sold or purchased was not, or, where there was more than one purpose, the purposes for which the securities were sold or purchased did not include, the purpose of creating a false or misleading appearance with respect to the price of securities.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference to a transaction of sale or purchase, in relation to securities, includes an offer to sell or purchase securities and an invitation (however expressed) that expressly or impliedly invites a person to offer to sell or purchase securities; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a reference to entering into or carrying out a transaction of sale or purchase shall, in the case of an offer or an invitation referred to in paragraph (a), be construed as a reference to making the offer or the invitation (as the case may be).

section.name: s276
section.heading: Disclosure of information about prohibited transactions

subsection.leadIn: Disclosure of information about prohibited transactions takes place when a person discloses, circulates or disseminates, or authorizes or is concerned in the disclosure, circulation or dissemination of, information to the effect that the price of securities of a corporation, or the price for dealings in futures contracts, that are traded on a relevant recognized market or by means of authorized automated trading services will be maintained, increased, reduced or stabilized, or is likely to be maintained, increased, reduced or stabilized, because of a prohibited transaction relating to securities of either the corporation or a related corporation of the corporation or to the futures contracts (as the case may be), if he, or an associate of his—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has entered into or carried out, directly or indirectly, the prohibited transaction; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has received, or expects to receive, directly or indirectly, a benefit as a result of the disclosure, circulation or dissemination of the information.

subsection.leadIn: A person shall not be regarded as having engaged in market misconduct by reason of disclosure of information about prohibited transactions on the basis that he, or an associate of his, received, or expected to receive, directly or indirectly, a benefit referred to in subsection (1)(b), if he establishes that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the benefit which he or the associate of his (as the case may be) received, or expected to receive, was not from a person who has entered into or carried out, directly or indirectly, the prohibited transaction in question, or an associate of such person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the benefit which he or the associate of his (as the case may be) received, or expected to receive, was from a person who has entered into or carried out, directly or indirectly, the prohibited transaction in question, or an associate of such person, but up to (and including) the time of the disclosure, circulation or dissemination of the information he has acted in good faith.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference to a prohibited transaction means any conduct or transaction which constitutes market misconduct or a contravention of any of the provisions of Divisions 2 to 4 of Part XIV; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a reference to any person having entered into or carried out the prohibited transaction shall be construed accordingly.

section.name: s277
section.heading: Disclosure of false or misleading information inducing transactions

subsection.leadIn: Disclosure of false or misleading information inducing transactions takes place when, in Hong Kong or elsewhere, a person discloses, circulates or disseminates, or authorizes or is concerned in the disclosure, circulation or dissemination of, information that is likely—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to induce another person to subscribe for securities, or deal in futures contracts, in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to induce the sale or purchase in Hong Kong of securities by another person; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to maintain, increase, reduce or stabilize the price of securities, or the price for dealings in futures contracts, in Hong Kong,

subsection.continued: if—

paragraph.content: the information is false or misleading as to a material fact, or is false or misleading through the omission of a material fact; and
the person knows that, or is reckless or negligent as to whether, the information is false or misleading as to a material fact, or is false or misleading through the omission of a material fact.

subsection.leadIn: A person shall not be regarded as having engaged in market misconduct by reason of disclosure of false or misleading information inducing transactions if the disclosure has taken place by reason only of the issue or reproduction of the information and he establishes that—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: the contents of the information were not, wholly or partly, devised—

subparagraph.content: where the business was carried on by him, by himself or any officer, employee or agent of his; or
where the business was not carried on by him, by himself;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: for the purposes of the issue or reproduction—

subparagraph.content: where the business was carried on by him, he or any officer, employee or agent of his; or
where the business was not carried on by him, he,

paragraph.continued: did not select, add to, modify or otherwise exercise control over the contents of the information; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: at the time of the issue or reproduction, he did not know that the information was false or misleading as to a material fact or was false or misleading through the omission of a material fact.

subsection.leadIn: A person shall not be regarded as having engaged in market misconduct by reason of disclosure of false or misleading information inducing transactions if the disclosure has taken place by reason only of the re-transmission of the information and he establishes that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the re-transmission of the information took place in the ordinary course of a business (whether or not carried on by him), the normal conduct of which involved the re-transmission of information to other persons within an information system or from one information system to another information system (wherever situated), whether directly or by facilitating the establishment of links between such other persons and third parties;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the contents of the information were not, wholly or partly, devised—

subparagraph.content: where the business was carried on by him, by himself or any officer, employee or agent of his; or
where the business was not carried on by him, by himself;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: for the purposes of the re-transmission—

subparagraph.content: where the business was carried on by him, he or any officer, employee or agent of his; or
where the business was not carried on by him, he,

paragraph.continued: did not select, add to, modify or otherwise exercise control over the contents of the information;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: the re-transmission of the information was accompanied by a message to the effect, or was effected following acknowledgment by the persons to whom it was re-transmitted of their understanding, that—

subparagraph.content: where the business was carried on by him, he or any officer, employee or agent of his; or
where the business was not carried on by him, the person who carried on the business or any officer, employee or agent of that person,

paragraph.continued: did not devise the contents of the information, and neither took responsibility for it nor endorsed its accuracy; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: at the time of the re-transmission—

subparagraph.content: he did not know that the information was false or misleading as to a material fact or was false or misleading through the omission of a material fact; or

subparagraph.leadIn: he knew that the information was false or misleading as to a material fact or was false or misleading through the omission of a material fact, but—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: where the business was carried on by him, in the circumstances of the case he could not reasonably be expected to prevent the re-transmission; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: where the business was not carried on by him, in the circumstances of the case he has taken all reasonable steps to bring the fact that the information was so false or misleading to the attention of a person in a position to take steps to cause the re-transmission to be prevented (even if the re-transmission in fact took place).

subsection.leadIn: A person shall not be regarded as having engaged in market misconduct by reason of disclosure of false or misleading information inducing transactions if the disclosure has taken place by reason only of the live broadcast of the information and he establishes that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the broadcast of the information took place in the ordinary course of the business of a broadcaster (whether or not he was such broadcaster);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the contents of the information were not, wholly or partly, devised—

subparagraph.content: where he was the broadcaster, by himself or any officer, employee or agent of his; or
where he was not the broadcaster, by himself;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: for the purposes of the broadcast—

subparagraph.content: where he was the broadcaster, he or any officer, employee or agent of his; or
where he was not the broadcaster, he,

paragraph.continued: did not select, add to, modify or otherwise exercise control over the contents of the information;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to the broadcast—

subparagraph.content: where he was the broadcaster, he; or
where he was not the broadcaster, he believed and had reasonable grounds to believe that the broadcaster,

paragraph.continued: acted in accordance with the terms and conditions of the licence (if any) by which he or the broadcaster (as the case may be) became entitled to broadcast as a broadcaster and with any code of practice or guidelines (however described) issued under or pursuant to the Telecommunications Ordinance (Cap. 106) or the Broadcasting Ordinance (Cap. 562) and applicable to him or the broadcaster (as the case may be) as a broadcaster; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: at the time of the broadcast—

subparagraph.content: he did not know that the information was false or misleading as to a material fact or was false or misleading through the omission of a material fact; or

subparagraph.leadIn: he knew that the information was false or misleading as to a material fact or was false or misleading through the omission of a material fact, but—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: where he was the broadcaster, in the circumstances of the case he could not reasonably be expected to prevent the broadcast; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: where he was not the broadcaster, in the circumstances of the case he has taken all reasonable steps to bring the fact that the information was so false or misleading to the attention of a person in a position to take steps to cause the broadcast to be prevented (even if the broadcast in fact took place).

subsection.def: In this section, issue (發出), in relation to any material (including any information), includes publishing, circulating, distributing or otherwise disseminating the material or the contents thereof, whether(a)by any visit in person;(b)in a newspaper, magazine, journal or other publication;(c)by the display of posters or notices;(d)by means of circulars, brochures, pamphlets or handbills;(e)by an exhibition of photographs or cinematograph films;(f)by way of sound or television broadcasting;(g)by any information system or other electronic device; or(h)by any other means, whether mechanically, electronically, magnetically, optically, manually or by any other medium, or by way of production or transmission of light, image or sound or any other medium, and also includes causing or authorizing the material to be issued.

section.name: s278
section.heading: Stock market manipulation

subsection.leadIn: Stock market manipulation takes place when, in Hong Kong or elsewhere—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person enters into or carries out, directly or indirectly, 2 or more transactions in securities of a corporation that by themselves or in conjunction with any other transaction increase, or are likely to increase, the price of any securities traded on a relevant recognized market or by means of authorized automated trading services, with the intention of inducing another person to purchase or subscribe for, or to refrain from selling, securities of the corporation or of a related corporation of the corporation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person enters into or carries out, directly or indirectly, 2 or more transactions in securities of a corporation that by themselves or in conjunction with any other transaction reduce, or are likely to reduce, the price of any securities traded on a relevant recognized market or by means of authorized automated trading services, with the intention of inducing another person to sell, or to refrain from purchasing, securities of the corporation or of a related corporation of the corporation; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a person enters into or carries out, directly or indirectly, 2 or more transactions in securities of a corporation that by themselves or in conjunction with any other transaction maintain or stabilize, or are likely to maintain or stabilize, the price of any securities traded on a relevant recognized market or by means of authorized automated trading services, with the intention of inducing another person to sell, purchase or subscribe for, or to refrain from selling, purchasing or subscribing for, securities of the corporation or of a related corporation of the corporation.

subsection.leadIn: Stock market manipulation takes place when, in Hong Kong—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person enters into or carries out, directly or indirectly, 2 or more transactions in securities of a corporation that by themselves or in conjunction with any other transaction increase, or are likely to increase, the price of any securities traded on a relevant non-Hong Kong market, with the intention of inducing another person to purchase or subscribe for, or to refrain from selling, securities of the corporation or of a related corporation of the corporation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person enters into or carries out, directly or indirectly, 2 or more transactions in securities of a corporation that by themselves or in conjunction with any other transaction reduce, or are likely to reduce, the price of any securities traded on a relevant non-Hong Kong market, with the intention of inducing another person to sell, or to refrain from purchasing, securities of the corporation or of a related corporation of the corporation; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a person enters into or carries out, directly or indirectly, 2 or more transactions in securities of a corporation that by themselves or in conjunction with any other transaction maintain or stabilize, or are likely to maintain or stabilize, the price of any securities traded on a relevant non-Hong Kong market, with the intention of inducing another person to sell, purchase or subscribe for, or to refrain from selling, purchasing or subscribing for, securities of the corporation or of a related corporation of the corporation. (Amended 31 of 2025 s. 161)

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference to a transaction includes an offer and an invitation (however expressed); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a reference to entering into or carrying out a transaction shall, in the case of an offer or an invitation referred to in paragraph (a), be construed as a reference to making the offer or the invitation (as the case may be).

section.name: s279
section.heading: Duty of officers of corporations
section.content: Every officer of a corporation shall take all reasonable measures from time to time to ensure that proper safeguards exist to prevent the corporation from acting in a way which would result in the corporation perpetrating any conduct which constitutes market misconduct.

section.name: s280
section.heading: Transactions relating to market misconduct not void or voidable
section.content: A transaction is not void or voidable by reason only that any market misconduct has taken place in relation to or as a result of it.

section.name: s281
section.heading: Civil liability for market misconduct

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), a person who has committed a relevant act in relation to market misconduct shall, whether or not he also incurs any other liability (whether under this Part or otherwise), be liable to pay compensation by way of damages to any other person for any pecuniary loss sustained by the other person as a result of the market misconduct, whether or not the loss arises from the other person having entered into a transaction or dealing at a price affected by the market misconduct.
No person shall be liable to pay compensation under subsection (1) unless it is fair, just and reasonable in the circumstances of the case that he should be so liable.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section, a person shall, subject to subsection (4), be regarded as having committed a relevant act in relation to market misconduct if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he has perpetrated any conduct which constitutes market misconduct;

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: another person which is a corporation has committed a relevant act in relation to market misconduct under paragraph (a); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the market misconduct occurred with his consent or connivance as an officer of the corporation; or

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any other person has committed a relevant act in relation to market misconduct under paragraph (a); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: he assisted or connived with that other person in the perpetration of any conduct which constitutes the market misconduct, with the knowledge that such conduct constitutes or might constitute market misconduct.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this section, where it is provided under any provision of this Part that a person shall not by reason of any market misconduct be regarded as having engaged in market misconduct, the person shall not, in relation to that market misconduct, be regarded as having committed a relevant act in relation to market misconduct.

subsection.leadIn: A person may bring an action under subsection (1) even though the person against whom the action is brought—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is not a person whose conduct has been the subject, whether wholly or in part, of any proceedings instituted under section 252 in respect of the market misconduct from which the pecuniary loss of the person bringing the action is alleged to result; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has not been identified by the Tribunal pursuant to section 252(3)(b) as having engaged in the market misconduct.

subsection.content: For the avoidance of doubt, where a court has jurisdiction to determine an action brought under subsection (1), it may, where it is, apart from this section, within its jurisdiction to entertain an application for an injunction, grant an injunction in addition to, or in substitution for, damages, on such terms and conditions as it considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to section 62 of the Evidence Ordinance (Cap. 8), in an action brought under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the fact that there is a determination by the Tribunal pursuant to section 252(3)(a) that market misconduct has taken place;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the fact that there is a determination by the Tribunal pursuant to section 252(3)(b) identifying a person (whether or not a party to the action) as having engaged in market misconduct,

subsection.continued: shall, in so far the determination is still subsisting, be admissible in evidence for the purpose of proving, where to do so is relevant to any issue in the action—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: in the case of a determination referred to in paragraph (a), that the market misconduct has taken place; or

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: in the case of a determination referred to in paragraph (b), that the person has engaged in market misconduct.

subsection.leadIn: In an action brought under subsection (1), where the fact that there is a determination referred to in subsection (7)(a) or (b) is admissible in evidence under subsection (7)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: then—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case of a determination referred to in subsection (7)(a), the market misconduct that is the subject of the determination shall, unless the contrary is proved, be taken to have taken place; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of a determination referred to in subsection (7)(b), the person that is the subject of the determination shall, unless the contrary is proved, be taken to have engaged in market misconduct; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: without prejudice to the reception of any other admissible evidence as evidence of the determination or for the purpose of identifying the facts on which the determination was based, the contents of a report of the Tribunal containing the determination and published under section 262(2)(b)(i), or the contents of a copy of a report of the Tribunal containing the determination and made available under subsection (9), shall also be admissible in evidence for such purpose.

subsection.leadIn: Where in an action brought under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the fact that there is a determination referred to in subsection (7)(a) or (b) is admissible in evidence under subsection (7); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a report of the Tribunal containing the determination has not been published under section 262(2)(b)(i),

subsection.continued: the court having jurisdiction to determine the action may, where it considers appropriate, require that a copy of the report be made available to the court to enable it to be used for the purposes of subsection (8)(b), whereupon—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the Tribunal shall cause a copy of the report to be made available to the court to enable it to be used for the purposes of subsection (8)(b); and

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: the contents of the report shall be admissible for the purpose specified in subsection (8)(b).

subsection.content: In this section, a reference to a transaction includes an offer and an invitation (however expressed).
Nothing in this section affects, limits or diminishes any rights conferred on a person, or any liabilities a person may incur, under the common law or any other enactment.

section.name: s282
section.heading: Conduct not to constitute market misconduct

subsection.content: Notwithstanding anything in this Part, a person shall not be regarded as having engaged in market misconduct by reason of any market misconduct under this Part if he establishes that the conduct in question is, according to the rules made under subsection (2), not to be regarded as constituting market misconduct.

For the purposes of subsection (1), the Commission, after consultation with the Financial Secretary, may, where it considers it is in the public interest to do so, make rules to prescribe the circumstances in which any conduct that would otherwise constitute market misconduct under this Part shall not be regarded as constituting market misconduct.

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding anything in this Part, where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is alleged that a person has engaged in market misconduct under section 274, 275 or 278 by reason of any conduct; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is so alleged on the basis that the conduct was carried out not in respect of securities or futures contracts traded on a relevant recognized market or by means of authorized automated trading services, but in respect of securities or futures contracts traded on a relevant non-Hong Kong market,

subsection.continued: the person shall not be regarded as having engaged in the market misconduct unless it is proved that in any place in which such relevant non-Hong Kong market is situated the conduct would have been unlawful had it been carried out there. (Amended 31 of 2025 s. 162)

section.name: s283
section.heading: No further proceedings after Part XIV criminal proceedings
section.leadIn: Notwithstanding anything in this Part, no proceedings may be instituted against any person under section 252 in respect of any conduct if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: criminal proceedings have previously been instituted against the person under Part XIV in respect of the same conduct; and

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: those criminal proceedings remain pending; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: by reason of the previous institution of those criminal proceedings, no criminal proceedings may again be lawfully instituted against that person under Part XIV in respect of the same conduct.

section.name: s284
section.heading: Market misconduct regarded as contravention of provisions of this Part
section.content: Where a person is by reference to any conduct identified in a determination made pursuant to section 252(3)(b) as having engaged in market misconduct, the person shall be regarded as having, by reason of the conduct, contravened the provisions of this Part, and any reference in this Ordinance to contravention of a provision of this Ordinance (however expressed) shall have application accordingly.

part.name: P14
part.heading: Offences Relating to Dealings in Securities and Futures Contracts, etc.

section.name: s285
section.heading: Interpretation of Part XIV

subsection.leadIn: In this Part, unless the context otherwise requires—

def.name: Associate
def.leadIn: associate (有聯繫者), in relation to a person, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person’s spouse or reputed spouse, any person cohabiting with the person as a spouse, the person’s brother, sister, parent, step-parent, child (natural or adopted) or step-child;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any corporation of which the person is a director;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any employee or partner of the person;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: where the person is a corporation, each of its directors and its related corporations and each director or employee of any of its related corporations;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: without limiting the circumstances in which paragraphs (a) to (d) apply, in circumstances concerning the securities of or other interest in a corporation, or rights arising out of the holding of such securities or such interest, any other person with whom the person has an agreement or arrangement—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: with respect to the acquisition, holding or disposal of such securities or such interest; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: under which they undertake to act together in exercising their voting power at general meetings of the corporation;

def.name: Controller
def.leadIn: controller (控制人), in relation to a corporation, means any person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in accordance with whose directions or instructions the directors of the corporation or of another corporation of which it is a subsidiary are accustomed or obliged to act; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: who, either alone or with any of his associates, is entitled to exercise or control the exercise of more than 33% of the voting power at general meetings of the corporation or of another corporation of which it is a subsidiary;

def.name: RelevantOverseasMarket
def.leadIn: relevant non-Hong Kong market (有關非香港市場)— (Amended 31 of 2025 s. 163)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to securities, means a stock market outside Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to futures contracts, means a futures market outside Hong Kong;

def.name: RelevantRecognizedMarket
def.leadIn: relevant recognized market (有關認可市場)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to securities, means a recognized stock market; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to futures contracts, means a recognized futures market.

subsection.leadIn: In this subsection and sections 286 to 289 and Division 2, unless the context otherwise requires—

def.name: Derivatives
def.leadIn: derivatives (衍生工具), in relation to listed securities, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: rights, options or interests (whether described as units or otherwise) in, or in respect of, the listed securities;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: contracts, the purpose or pretended purpose of which is to secure or increase a profit or avoid or reduce a loss, wholly or partly by reference to the price or value, or a change in the price or value, of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the listed securities; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any rights, options or interests referred to in paragraph (a);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: rights, options or interests (whether described as units or otherwise) in, or in respect of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any rights, options or interests referred to in paragraph (a); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any contracts referred to in paragraph (b);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: instruments or other documents creating, acknowledging or evidencing any rights, options or interests or any contracts referred to in paragraph (a), (b) or (c), including certificates of interest or participation in, temporary or interim certificates for, receipts (including depositary receipts) in respect of, or warrants to subscribe for or purchase—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the listed securities; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the rights, options or interests or the contracts,

paragraph.continued: whether or not the derivatives are listed and regardless of who issued or made them;

def.name: InsideInformation
def.leadIn: inside information (內幕消息), in relation to a corporation, means specific information that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: is about—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the corporation;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a shareholder or officer of the corporation; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the listed securities of the corporation or their derivatives; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is not generally known to the persons who are accustomed or would be likely to deal in the listed securities of the corporation but would if generally known to them be likely to materially affect the price of the listed securities; (Added 9 of 2012 s. 9)

subsection.def: listed (上市) means listed on a recognized stock market, and for the purposes of this definition, securities shall continue to be regarded as listed during a period of suspension of dealings in those securities on the recognized stock market;
listed corporation (上市法團) means a corporation which has issued securities that are, at the time of the relevant contravention in relation to the corporation, listed;

def.name: ListedSecurities
def.leadIn: listed securities (上市證券) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: securities which, at the time of the relevant contravention in relation to a corporation, have been issued by the corporation and are listed;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: securities which, at the time of the relevant contravention in relation to a corporation, have been issued by the corporation and are not listed, but which, at that time, it is reasonably foreseeable will be and which, in fact, are subsequently listed;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: securities which, at the time of the relevant contravention in relation to a corporation, have not been issued by the corporation and are not listed, but which, at that time, it is reasonably foreseeable will be and which, in fact, are subsequently so issued and listed;

subsection.def: relevant contravention (違例事件) means a contravention of any of the provisions of Division 2;

def.name: Securities
def.leadIn: securities (證券) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shares, stocks, debentures, loan stocks, funds, bonds or notes of, or issued by, or which it is reasonably foreseeable will be issued by, a body, whether incorporated or unincorporated, or a government or municipal government authority;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: rights, options or interests (whether described as units or otherwise) in, or in respect of, such shares, stocks, debentures, loan stocks, funds, bonds or notes;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: certificates of interest or participation in, temporary or interim certificates for, receipts for, or warrants to subscribe for or purchase, such shares, stocks, debentures, loan stocks, funds, bonds or notes;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: interests, rights or property, whether in the form of an instrument or otherwise, commonly known as securities;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: interests, rights or property, whether in the form of an instrument or otherwise, prescribed by notice under section 392 as being regarded as securities in accordance with the terms of the notice.

subsection.def: For the purposes of the definition of controller in subsection (1), where a person is entitled to exercise or control the exercise of more than 33% of the voting power at general meetings of a corporation and the corporation is entitled to exercise or control the exercise of any of the voting power at general meetings of another corporation (the effective voting power), then the effective voting power at general meetings of the other corporation shall be regarded as exercisable by the person.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Part, a person shall not be regarded as a person in accordance with whose directions or instructions the directors of a corporation are accustomed or obliged to act by reason only that the directors of the corporation act on advice given by him in a professional capacity.

section.name: s286
section.heading: Interest in securities (insider dealing offence)
section.content: For the purposes of sections 285(2) and 287 to 289 and Division 2, a reference to an interest in securities shall be construed as including an interest of any kind whatsoever in the securities, and for that purpose any restraint or restriction to which the exercise of a right attached to the interest may be subject shall be disregarded.

section.name: s287
section.heading: Connected with a corporation (insider dealing offence)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of Division 2, a person shall be regarded as connected with a corporation if, being an individual—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he is a director or employee of the corporation or a related corporation of the corporation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: he is a substantial shareholder of the corporation or a related corporation of the corporation;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: he occupies a position which may reasonably be expected to give him access to inside information in relation to the corporation by reason of— (Amended 9 of 2012 s. 14)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: a professional or business relationship existing between—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: himself, or his employer, or a corporation of which he is a director, or a firm of which he is a partner; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the corporation, a related corporation of the corporation, or an officer or substantial shareholder of either corporation; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: his being a director, employee or partner of a substantial shareholder of the corporation or a related corporation of the corporation;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: he has access to inside information in relation to the corporation and— (Amended 9 of 2012 s. 14)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: he has such access by reason of his being in such a position that he would be regarded as connected with another corporation by virtue of paragraph (a), (b) or (c); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the inside information relates to a transaction (actual or contemplated) involving both those corporations or involving one of them and the listed securities of the other or their derivatives, or to the fact that the transaction is no longer contemplated; or (Amended 9 of 2012 s. 14)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: he was, at any time within the 6 months preceding the relevant contravention in relation to the corporation, a person who would be regarded as connected with the corporation by virtue of paragraph (a), (b), (c) or (d).

subsection.content: For the purposes of Division 2, a corporation shall be regarded as a person connected with another corporation so long as any of its directors or employees is a person who would be regarded as connected with that other corporation by virtue of subsection (1).

subsection.def: In subsection (1), notwithstanding any other provisions of this Ordinance, substantial shareholder (大股東), in relation to a corporation, means a person who has an interest in 5% or more of the total number of shares comprised in the relevant share capital of the corporation. (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

section.name: s288
section.heading: Connected with a corporation—possession of inside information obtained in privileged capacity (insider dealing offence)

subsection.content: For the purposes of Division 2, where a public officer or a specified person in that capacity receives inside information in relation to a corporation, he shall be regarded as a person connected with the corporation. (Amended 9 of 2012 s. 14)

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1), a reference to a specified person means a person who is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a member of the Executive Council;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a member of the Legislative Council;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: an officer or employee of a recognized exchange company, a recognized clearing house or a recognized exchange controller;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: an exchange participant;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: an officer or employee of an exchange participant;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: an officer or employee of a body corporate incorporated by an Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: an officer or employee of a body corporate specified by the Financial Secretary under subsection (3),

subsection.continued: whether, in the case of paragraph (a), (b), (c), (d), (f), (g) or (h), the person is such a member, officer or employee (as the case may be) on a temporary or permanent basis, and whether he is paid or unpaid.

subsection.content: The Financial Secretary may, by notice published in the Gazette, specify any body corporate for the purposes of subsection (2)(h).

section.name: s289
section.heading: Dealing in listed securities or their derivatives (insider dealing offence)
section.content: For the purposes of section 285(2) and Division 2, a person shall be regarded as dealing in listed securities or their derivatives if, whether as principal or agent, he sells, purchases, exchanges or subscribes for, or agrees to sell, purchase, exchange or subscribe for, any listed securities or their derivatives or acquires or disposes of, or agrees to acquire or dispose of, the right to sell, purchase, exchange or subscribe for, any listed securities or their derivatives.

section.name: s290
section.heading: Interest in securities and beneficial ownership, etc. (market misconduct offences other than insider dealing offence)

subsection.content: For the purposes of Division 3, a person shall be regarded as having an interest in securities if he has authority, whether formal or informal and whether express or implied, to dispose of or to exercise control over the disposal of the securities or, in the case of options in respect of the securities, to exercise the options.

subsection.leadIn: It is immaterial that the authority of a person referred to in subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is, or is capable of being made, subject to restraint or restriction; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is exercisable jointly with another person.

subsection.leadIn: A person shall be regarded as having the authority referred to in subsection (1) where a corporation has the authority referred to in that subsection and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the corporation is, or its directors are, accustomed or under an obligation, whether formal or informal, to act in accordance with the directions or instructions of the person in relation to the securities in question; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person, or an associate of the person, is a controller of the corporation.

subsection.leadIn: Where a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has entered into a contract to purchase securities;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has a right to have securities transferred to him or to his order whether the right is exercisable presently or in the future and whether on the fulfilment of a condition or not; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: has the right to acquire securities, or an interest in securities, under an option, whether the right is exercisable presently or in the future and whether on the fulfilment of a condition or not,

subsection.continued: the person shall, to the extent to which he could do so on completing the contract, enforcing the right or exercising the option, be regarded as having the authority referred to in subsection (1).

subsection.content: Where securities are subject to a trust, and a person who is not a trustee in those securities has an interest in those securities by virtue of subsection (4)(b), the interest of a trustee in those securities shall be disregarded for the purpose of determining whether the person has an interest in securities for the purposes of Division 3.

The Commission may make rules to prescribe that an interest, being an interest of a person or of the persons included in a class of persons, shall be disregarded for the purpose of determining whether the person or the persons has or have an interest in securities for the purposes of Division 3.

For the purposes of Division 3, a sale or purchase of securities does not involve a change in their beneficial ownership if a person who had an interest in the securities before the sale or purchase, or an associate of the person, has an interest in the securities after the sale or purchase.

section.name: s291
section.heading: Offence of insider dealing

subsection.leadIn: A person connected with a listed corporation and having information which he knows is inside information in relation to the corporation shall not— (Amended 9 of 2012 s. 14)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: deal in the listed securities of the corporation or their derivatives, or in the listed securities of a related corporation of the corporation or their derivatives; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: counsel or procure another person to deal in such listed securities or derivatives, knowing or having reasonable cause to believe that the other person will deal in them.

subsection.leadIn: A person who is contemplating or has contemplated making, whether with or without another person, a take-over offer for a listed corporation and who knows that the information that the offer is contemplated or is no longer contemplated is inside information in relation to the corporation shall not— (Amended 9 of 2012 s. 14)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: deal in the listed securities of the corporation or their derivatives, or in the listed securities of a related corporation of the corporation or their derivatives, otherwise than for the purpose of the take-over; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: counsel or procure another person to deal in such listed securities or derivatives, otherwise than for the purpose of the take-over.

subsection.content: A person connected with a listed corporation and knowing that any information is inside information in relation to the corporation shall not disclose the information, directly or indirectly, to another person, knowing or having reasonable cause to believe that the other person will make use of the information for the purpose of dealing, or of counselling or procuring another person to deal, in the listed securities of the corporation or their derivatives, or in the listed securities of a related corporation of the corporation or their derivatives. (Amended 9 of 2012 s. 14)

A person who is contemplating or has contemplated making, whether with or without another person, a take-over offer for a listed corporation and who knows that the information that the offer is contemplated or is no longer contemplated is inside information in relation to the corporation shall not disclose the information, directly or indirectly, to another person, knowing or having reasonable cause to believe that the other person will make use of the information for the purpose of dealing, or of counselling or procuring another person to deal, in the listed securities of the corporation or their derivatives, or in the listed securities of a related corporation of the corporation or their derivatives. (Amended 9 of 2012 s. 14)

subsection.leadIn: A person who has information which he knows is inside information in relation to a listed corporation and which he received, directly or indirectly, from a person whom he knows is connected with the corporation and whom he knows or has reasonable cause to believe held the information as a result of being connected with the corporation shall not— (Amended 9 of 2012 s. 14)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: deal in the listed securities of the corporation or their derivatives, or in the listed securities of a related corporation of the corporation or their derivatives; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: counsel or procure another person to deal in such listed securities or derivatives.

subsection.leadIn: A person who has received, directly or indirectly, from a person whom he knows or has reasonable cause to believe is contemplating or is no longer contemplating making a take-over offer for a listed corporation, information to that effect which he knows is inside information in relation to the corporation shall not— (Amended 9 of 2012 s. 14)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: deal in the listed securities of the corporation or their derivatives, or in the listed securities of a related corporation of the corporation or their derivatives; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: counsel or procure another person to deal in such listed securities or derivatives.

subsection.leadIn: A person who knowingly has inside information in relation to a listed corporation in any of the circumstances described in subsection (1), (2), (3), (4), (5) or (6) shall not— (Amended 9 of 2012 s. 14)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: counsel or procure another person to deal in the listed securities of the corporation or their derivatives, or in the listed securities of a related corporation of the corporation or their derivatives, knowing or having reasonable cause to believe that the other person will deal in such listed securities or derivatives outside Hong Kong on a stock market other than a recognized stock market; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: disclose the inside information to another person knowing or having reasonable cause to believe that the other person or some other person will make use of the inside information for the purpose of dealing, or of counselling or procuring any other person to deal, in the listed securities of the corporation or their derivatives, or in the listed securities of a related corporation of the corporation or their derivatives, outside Hong Kong on a stock market other than a recognized stock market. (Amended 9 of 2012 s. 14)

subsection.content: Subject to sections 292, 293 and 294, a person who contravenes subsection (1), (2), (3), (4), (5), (6) or (7) commits an offence.

section.name: s292
section.heading: Insider dealing offence—general defences

subsection.leadIn: Where a person is charged with an offence under section 291(8) in respect of a contravention of section 291 taking place through his dealing in or counselling or procuring another person to deal in listed securities or derivatives, it is a defence to the charge for the person to prove that he dealt in or counselled or procured the other person to deal in the listed securities or derivatives in question (as the case may be)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the sole purpose of acquiring shares required for his being qualified as a director or intending director of a corporation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the performance in good faith of an underwriting agreement for the listed securities or derivatives in question; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the performance in good faith of his functions as a liquidator, receiver or trustee in bankruptcy.

subsection.leadIn: Where a corporation is charged with an offence under section 291(8) in respect of a contravention of section 291 taking place through its dealing in or counselling or procuring another person to deal in listed securities or derivatives, it is a defence to the charge for the corporation to prove that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: although one or more of its directors or employees had the inside information in relation to the corporation the listed securities of which were, or the derivatives of the listed securities of which were, the listed securities or derivatives in question, each person who took the decision for it to deal in or counsel or procure the other person to deal in such listed securities or derivatives (as the case may be) did not have the inside information up to (and including) the time when it dealt in or counselled or procured the other person to deal in such listed securities or derivatives (as the case may be);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: arrangements then existed to secure that—

subparagraph.content: the inside information was, up to (and including) the time when it dealt in or counselled or procured the other person to deal in such listed securities or derivatives (as the case may be), not communicated to any person who took the decision; and

none of its directors or employees who had the inside information gave advice concerning the decision to any person who took the decision at any time before it dealt in or counselled or procured the other person to deal in such listed securities or derivatives (as the case may be); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the inside information was in fact not so communicated to any person who took the decision and none of its directors or employees who had the inside information in fact so gave the advice to any person who took the decision. (Amended 9 of 2012 s. 14)

subsection.content: Where a person is charged with an offence under section 291(8) in respect of a contravention of section 291 taking place through his dealing in or counselling or procuring another person to deal in listed securities or derivatives or his disclosure of information, it is a defence to the charge for the person to prove that the purpose for which he dealt in or counselled or procured the other person to deal in the listed securities or derivatives in question or disclosed the information in question (as the case may be) was not, or, where there was more than one purpose, the purposes for which he dealt in or counselled or procured the other person to deal in the listed securities or derivatives in question or disclosed the information in question (as the case may be) did not include, the purpose of securing or increasing a profit or avoiding or reducing a loss, whether for himself or another, by using inside information. (Amended 9 of 2012 s. 14)

subsection.leadIn: Where a person is charged with an offence under section 291(8) in respect of a contravention of section 291 taking place through his dealing in or counselling or procuring another person to deal in listed securities or derivatives, it is a defence to the charge for the person to prove that—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: he did not select or advise on the selection of such listed securities or derivatives; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: he—

subparagraph.content: did not know that the person for whom he acted as agent was a person connected with the corporation the listed securities of which were, or the derivatives of the listed securities of which were, such listed securities or derivatives; or
did not know that the person for whom he acted as agent had the inside information in question. (Amended 9 of 2012 s. 14)

subsection.leadIn: Where a person is charged with an offence under section 291(8) in respect of a contravention of section 291 taking place through his dealing in or counselling or procuring another person to deal in listed securities or derivatives, it is a defence to the charge for the person to prove that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at the time when he dealt in or counselled or procured the other person to deal in the listed securities or derivatives in question, the dealing in question was not required to be recorded on a recognized stock market or to be notified to a recognized exchange company under its rules; and

subparagraph.leadIn: where the contravention took place through his dealing in listed securities or derivatives—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: he and the other party to the dealing in question entered into the dealing directly with each other; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: at the time when he entered into the dealing, the other party to the dealing knew, or ought reasonably to have known, of the inside information in question; or

subparagraph.leadIn: where the contravention took place through his counselling or procuring another person to deal in listed securities or derivatives—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: he counselled or procured the other party to the dealing in question to enter into the dealing directly with him; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: at the time when he counselled or procured the other party to enter into the dealing, the other party knew, or ought reasonably to have known, of the inside information in question. (Amended 9 of 2012 s. 14)

subsection.leadIn: Where a person is charged with an offence under section 291(8) in respect of a contravention of section 291 taking place through his dealing in listed securities or derivatives, it is a defence to the charge for the person to prove that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he entered into the dealing in question, otherwise than as a person who has counselled or procured the other party to the dealing to deal in listed securities or their derivatives; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at the time when he entered into the dealing, the other party to the dealing knew, or ought reasonably to have known, that he was a person connected with the corporation the listed securities of which were, or the derivatives of the listed securities of which were, the listed securities or derivatives in question.

subsection.leadIn: Where a person is charged with an offence under section 291(8) in respect of a contravention of section 291 taking place through his counselling or procuring another person to deal in listed securities or derivatives, it is a defence to the charge for the person to prove that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the other person did not counsel or procure the other party to the dealing in question to deal in listed securities or their derivatives; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at the time when he counselled or procured the other person to deal in the listed securities or derivatives in question, the other party to the dealing in question knew, or ought reasonably to have known, that the other person was a person connected with the corporation the listed securities of which were, or the derivatives of the listed securities of which were, such listed securities or derivatives.

subsection.leadIn: Where a person is charged with an offence under section 291(8) in respect of a contravention of section 291 taking place through his dealing in or counselling or procuring another person to deal in listed securities or derivatives, it is a defence to the charge for the person to prove that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: he acted—

subparagraph.content: in connection with any dealing in listed securities or their derivatives (whether by himself or another person) which was under consideration or was the subject of negotiation, or in the course of a series of such dealings; and
with a view to facilitating the accomplishment of the dealing or the series of dealings; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the inside information in question was market information arising directly out of his involvement in the dealing or the series of dealings. (Amended 9 of 2012 s. 14)

subsection.content: Where a person is charged with an offence under section 291(8) in respect of a contravention of section 291 taking place through his dealing in or counselling or procuring another person to deal in listed securities or derivatives, it is a defence to the charge for the person to prove that the dealing in question is a market contract.

def.name: MarketInformation
def.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (8), market information (市場消息) means information consisting of one or more of the following facts—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
d
paragraph.content: the price (or range of prices) at which listed securities or derivatives of listed securities have been or are to be dealt in, or the price (or range of prices) at which listed securities or derivatives of listed securities in which any dealing is under consideration or is the subject of negotiation may be dealt in;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the identity of the persons involved or likely to be involved in any capacity in any dealing in listed securities or derivatives of listed securities.

section.name: s293
section.heading: Insider dealing offence—defences for certain trustees and personal representatives
section.leadIn: Where a person who is a trustee or personal representative is charged with an offence under section 291(8) in respect of a contravention of section 291 taking place through his dealing in or counselling or procuring another person to deal in listed securities or derivatives, it is a defence to the charge for the person to prove that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he acted on advice obtained in good faith from another person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that other person appeared to him to be an appropriate person from whom to seek the advice; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: it did not appear to him that, had that other person dealt in the listed securities or derivatives in question, a contravention of section 291 would take place.

section.name: s294
section.heading: Insider dealing offence—defences for certain persons exercising right to subscribe for or acquire securities or derivatives
section.leadIn: Where a person is charged with an offence under section 291(8) in respect of a contravention of section 291 taking place through his dealing in listed securities or derivatives, it is a defence to the charge for the person to prove that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he dealt in the listed securities or derivatives in question by way of his exercise of a right to subscribe for or otherwise acquire such listed securities or derivatives; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the right was granted to him or was derived from securities or their derivatives that were held by him before he became aware of any inside information in relation to the corporation the listed securities of which were, or the derivatives of the listed securities of which were, such listed securities or derivatives. (Amended 9 of 2012 s. 14)

section.name: s295
section.heading: Offence of false trading

subsection.leadIn: A person shall not, in Hong Kong or elsewhere, do anything or cause anything to be done, with the intention that, or being reckless as to whether, it has, or is likely to have, the effect of creating a false or misleading appearance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: of active trading in securities or futures contracts traded on a relevant recognized market or by means of authorized automated trading services; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: with respect to the market for, or the price for dealings in, securities or futures contracts traded on a relevant recognized market or by means of authorized automated trading services.

subsection.leadIn: A person shall not, in Hong Kong, do anything or cause anything to be done, with the intention that, or being reckless as to whether, it has, or is likely to have, the effect of creating a false or misleading appearance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: of active trading in securities or futures contracts traded on a relevant non-Hong Kong market; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: with respect to the market for, or the price for dealings in, securities or futures contracts traded on a relevant non-Hong Kong market. (Amended 31 of 2025 s. 164)

subsection.content: A person shall not, in Hong Kong or elsewhere, take part in, be concerned in, or carry out, directly or indirectly, one or more transactions (whether or not any of them is a dealing in securities or futures contracts), with the intention that, or being reckless as to whether, it or they has or have, or is or are likely to have, the effect of creating an artificial price, or maintaining at a level that is artificial (whether or not it was previously artificial) a price, for dealings in securities or futures contracts traded on a relevant recognized market or by means of authorized automated trading services.

A person shall not, in Hong Kong, take part in, be concerned in, or carry out, directly or indirectly, one or more transactions (whether or not any of them is a dealing in securities or futures contracts), with the intention that, or being reckless as to whether, it or they has or have, or is or are likely to have, the effect of creating an artificial price, or maintaining at a level that is artificial (whether or not it was previously artificial) a price, for dealings in securities or futures contracts traded on a relevant non-Hong Kong market. (Amended 31 of 2025 s. 164)

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting the generality of subsection (1) or (2), where a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: enters into or carries out, directly or indirectly, any transaction of sale or purchase, or any transaction which purports to be a transaction of sale or purchase, of securities that does not involve a change in the beneficial ownership of them;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: offers to sell securities at a price that is substantially the same as the price at which he has made or proposes to make, or knows that an associate of his has made or proposes to make, an offer to purchase the same or substantially the same number of them; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: offers to purchase securities at a price that is substantially the same as the price at which he has made or proposes to make, or knows that an associate of his has made or proposes to make, an offer to sell the same or substantially the same number of them,

subsection.continued: then, unless the transaction in question is an off-market transaction, the person shall, for the purposes of subsections (1) and (2), be regarded as doing something or causing something to be done, with the intention that, or being reckless as to whether, it has, or is likely to have, the effect of creating a false or misleading appearance—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: where the securities are traded on a relevant recognized market or by means of authorized automated trading services, of active trading in securities so traded or with respect to the market for, or the price for dealings in, securities so traded; or

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: where the securities are traded on a relevant non-Hong Kong market, of active trading in securities so traded or with respect to the market for, or the price for dealings in, securities so traded. (Amended 31 of 2025 s. 164)

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (7), a person who contravenes subsection (1), (2), (3) or (4) commits an offence.

Where a person is charged with an offence under subsection (6) in respect of a contravention of subsection (1) or (2) taking place through the commission of an act referred to in subsection (5)(a), (b) or (c), it is a defence to the charge for the person to prove that the purpose for which he committed the act was not, or, where there was more than one purpose, the purposes for which he committed the act did not include, the purpose of creating a false or misleading appearance of active trading in securities, or with respect to the market for, or the price for dealings in, securities, referred to in subsection (1) or (2) (as the case may be).

def.name: OffmarketTransaction
def.leadIn: In subsection (5), off-market transaction (場外交易) means a transaction which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of securities traded on a relevant recognized market, is not required to be recorded on the relevant recognized market, or to be notified, under the rules of the person by whom the relevant recognized market is operated, to such person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of securities traded by means of authorized automated trading services, is not required to be recorded by means of authorized automated trading services, or to be notified, under the rules of the person by whom the authorized automated trading services are operated, to such person; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of securities traded on a relevant non-Hong Kong market, is not required to be recorded on the relevant non-Hong Kong market, or to be notified, under the rules of the person by whom the relevant non-Hong Kong market is operated, to such person. (Amended 31 of 2025 s. 164)

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference to a transaction of sale or purchase, in relation to securities, includes an offer to sell or purchase securities and an invitation (however expressed) that expressly or impliedly invites a person to offer to sell or purchase securities; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a reference to entering into or carrying out a transaction of sale or purchase shall, in the case of an offer or an invitation referred to in paragraph (a), be construed as a reference to making the offer or the invitation (as the case may be).

section.name: s296
section.heading: Offence of price rigging

subsection.leadIn: A person shall not, in Hong Kong or elsewhere—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: enter into or carry out, directly or indirectly, any transaction of sale or purchase of securities that does not involve a change in the beneficial ownership of those securities, which has the effect of maintaining, increasing, reducing, stabilizing, or causing fluctuations in, the price of securities traded on a relevant recognized market or by means of authorized automated trading services; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: enter into or carry out, directly or indirectly, any fictitious or artificial transaction or device, with the intention that, or being reckless as to whether, it has the effect of maintaining, increasing, reducing, stabilizing, or causing fluctuations in, the price of securities, or the price for dealings in futures contracts, that are traded on a relevant recognized market or by means of authorized automated trading services.

subsection.leadIn: A person shall not, in Hong Kong—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: enter into or carry out, directly or indirectly, any transaction of sale or purchase of securities that does not involve a change in the beneficial ownership of those securities, which has the effect of maintaining, increasing, reducing, stabilizing, or causing fluctuations in, the price of securities traded on a relevant non-Hong Kong market; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: enter into or carry out, directly or indirectly, any fictitious or artificial transaction or device, with the intention that, or being reckless as to whether, it has the effect of maintaining, increasing, reducing, stabilizing, or causing fluctuations in, the price of securities, or the price for dealings in futures contracts, that are traded on a relevant non-Hong Kong market. (Amended 31 of 2025 s. 165)

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsections (1)(b) and (2)(b), the fact that a transaction is, or at any time was, intended to have effect according to its terms is not conclusive in determining whether the transaction is, or was, not fictitious or artificial.
Subject to subsection (5), a person who contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence.

Where a person is charged with an offence under subsection (4) in respect of a contravention of subsection (1)(a) or (2)(a) taking place through any transaction of sale or purchase of securities, it is a defence to the charge for the person to prove that the purpose for which the securities were sold or purchased was not, or, where there was more than one purpose, the purposes for which the securities were sold or purchased did not include, the purpose of creating a false or misleading appearance with respect to the price of securities.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference to a transaction of sale or purchase, in relation to securities, includes an offer to sell or purchase securities and an invitation (however expressed) that expressly or impliedly invites a person to offer to sell or purchase securities; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a reference to entering into or carrying out a transaction of sale or purchase shall, in the case of an offer or an invitation referred to in paragraph (a), be construed as a reference to making the offer or the invitation (as the case may be).

section.name: s297
section.heading: Offence of disclosure of information about prohibited transactions

subsection.leadIn: A person shall not disclose, circulate or disseminate, or authorize or be concerned in the disclosure, circulation or dissemination of, information to the effect that the price of securities of a corporation, or the price for dealings in futures contracts, that are traded on a relevant recognized market or by means of authorized automated trading services will be maintained, increased, reduced or stabilized, or is likely to be maintained, increased, reduced or stabilized, because of a prohibited transaction relating to securities of either the corporation or a related corporation of the corporation or to the futures contracts (as the case may be), if he, or an associate of his—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has entered into or carried out, directly or indirectly, the prohibited transaction; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has received, or expects to receive, directly or indirectly, a benefit as a result of the disclosure, circulation or dissemination of the information.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (3), a person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence.

subsection.leadIn: Where a person is charged with an offence under subsection (2) in respect of a contravention of subsection (1) on the basis that he, or an associate of his, received, or expected to receive, directly or indirectly, a benefit referred to in subsection (1)(b), it is a defence to the charge for the person to prove that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the benefit which he or the associate of his (as the case may be) received, or expected to receive, was not from a person who has entered into or carried out, directly or indirectly, the prohibited transaction in question, or an associate of such person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the benefit which he or the associate of his (as the case may be) received, or expected to receive, was from a person who has entered into or carried out, directly or indirectly, the prohibited transaction in question, or an associate of such person, but up to (and including) the time of the disclosure, circulation or dissemination of the information he has acted in good faith.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference to a prohibited transaction means any conduct or transaction which constitutes market misconduct or a contravention of any of the provisions of Divisions 2 to 4; and

paragraph.name: b
