paragraph.content: a reference to any person having entered into or carried out the prohibited transaction shall be construed accordingly.

section.name: s298
section.heading: Offence of disclosure of false or misleading information inducing transactions

subsection.leadIn: A person shall not, in Hong Kong or elsewhere, disclose, circulate or disseminate, or authorize or be concerned in the disclosure, circulation or dissemination of, information that is likely—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to induce another person to subscribe for securities, or deal in futures contracts, in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to induce the sale or purchase in Hong Kong of securities by another person; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to maintain, increase, reduce or stabilize the price of securities, or the price for dealings in futures contracts, in Hong Kong,

subsection.continued: if—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the information is false or misleading as to a material fact, or is false or misleading through the omission of a material fact; and

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: the person knows that, or is reckless as to whether, the information is false or misleading as to a material fact, or is false or misleading through the omission of a material fact.

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (3) to (5), a person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence.

subsection.leadIn: Where a person is charged with an offence under subsection (2) in respect of a contravention of subsection (1) taking place by reason only of the issue or reproduction of information, it is a defence to the charge for the person to prove that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the issue or reproduction of the information took place in the ordinary course of a business (whether or not carried on by him), the principal purpose of which was issuing or reproducing materials provided by others;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the contents of the information were not, wholly or partly, devised—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: where the business was carried on by him, by himself or any officer, employee or agent of his; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where the business was not carried on by him, by himself;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: for the purposes of the issue or reproduction—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: where the business was carried on by him, he or any officer, employee or agent of his; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where the business was not carried on by him, he,

paragraph.continued: did not select, add to, modify or otherwise exercise control over the contents of the information; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: at the time of the issue or reproduction, he did not know that the information was false or misleading as to a material fact or was false or misleading through the omission of a material fact.

subsection.leadIn: Where a person is charged with an offence under subsection (2) in respect of a contravention of subsection (1) taking place by reason only of the re-transmission of information, it is a defence to the charge for the person to prove that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the re-transmission of the information took place in the ordinary course of a business (whether or not carried on by him), the normal conduct of which involved the re-transmission of information to other persons within an information system or from one information system to another information system (wherever situated), whether directly or by facilitating the establishment of links between such other persons and third parties;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the contents of the information were not, wholly or partly, devised—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: where the business was carried on by him, by himself or any officer, employee or agent of his; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where the business was not carried on by him, by himself;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: for the purposes of the re-transmission—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: where the business was carried on by him, he or any officer, employee or agent of his; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where the business was not carried on by him, he,

paragraph.continued: did not select, add to, modify or otherwise exercise control over the contents of the information;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: the re-transmission of the information was accompanied by a message to the effect, or was effected following acknowledgment by the persons to whom it was re-transmitted of their understanding, that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: where the business was carried on by him, he or any officer, employee or agent of his; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where the business was not carried on by him, the person who carried on the business or any officer, employee or agent of that person,

paragraph.continued: did not devise the contents of the information, and neither took responsibility for it nor endorsed its accuracy; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: at the time of the re-transmission—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: he did not know that the information was false or misleading as to a material fact or was false or misleading through the omission of a material fact; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: he knew that the information was false or misleading as to a material fact or was false or misleading through the omission of a material fact, but—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: where the business was carried on by him, in the circumstances of the case he could not reasonably be expected to prevent the re-transmission; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: where the business was not carried on by him, in the circumstances of the case he has taken all reasonable steps to bring the fact that the information was so false or misleading to the attention of a person in a position to take steps to cause the re-transmission to be prevented (even if the re-transmission in fact took place).

subsection.leadIn: Where a person is charged with an offence under subsection (2) in respect of a contravention of subsection (1) taking place by reason only of the live broadcast of information, it is a defence to the charge for the person to prove that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the broadcast of the information took place in the ordinary course of the business of a broadcaster (whether or not he was such broadcaster);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the contents of the information were not, wholly or partly, devised—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: where he was the broadcaster, by himself or any officer, employee or agent of his; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where he was not the broadcaster, by himself;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: for the purposes of the broadcast—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: where he was the broadcaster, he or any officer, employee or agent of his; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where he was not the broadcaster, he,

paragraph.continued: did not select, add to, modify or otherwise exercise control over the contents of the information;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to the broadcast—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: where he was the broadcaster, he; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where he was not the broadcaster, he believed and had reasonable grounds to believe that the broadcaster,

paragraph.continued: acted in accordance with the terms and conditions of the licence (if any) by which he or the broadcaster (as the case may be) became entitled to broadcast as a broadcaster and with any code of practice or guidelines (however described) issued under or pursuant to the Telecommunications Ordinance (Cap. 106) or the Broadcasting Ordinance (Cap. 562) and applicable to him or the broadcaster (as the case may be) as a broadcaster; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: at the time of the broadcast—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: he did not know that the information was false or misleading as to a material fact or was false or misleading through the omission of a material fact; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: he knew that the information was false or misleading as to a material fact or was false or misleading through the omission of a material fact, but—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: where he was the broadcaster, in the circumstances of the case he could not reasonably be expected to prevent the broadcast; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: where he was not the broadcaster, in the circumstances of the case he has taken all reasonable steps to bring the fact that the information was so false or misleading to the attention of a person in a position to take steps to cause the broadcast to be prevented (even if the broadcast in fact took place).

def.name: Issue
def.leadIn: In this section, issue (發出), in relation to any material (including any information), includes publishing, circulating, distributing or otherwise disseminating the material or the contents thereof, whether—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by any visit in person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in a newspaper, magazine, journal or other publication;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by the display of posters or notices;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: by means of circulars, brochures, pamphlets or handbills;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: by an exhibition of photographs or cinematograph films;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: by way of sound or television broadcasting;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: by any information system or other electronic device; or

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: by any other means, whether mechanically, electronically, magnetically, optically, manually or by any other medium, or by way of production or transmission of light, image or sound or any other medium,

def.continued: and also includes causing or authorizing the material to be issued.

section.name: s299
section.heading: Offence of stock market manipulation

subsection.leadIn: A person shall not, in Hong Kong or elsewhere—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: enter into or carry out, directly or indirectly, 2 or more transactions in securities of a corporation that by themselves or in conjunction with any other transaction increase, or are likely to increase, the price of any securities traded on a relevant recognized market or by means of authorized automated trading services, with the intention of inducing another person to purchase or subscribe for, or to refrain from selling, securities of the corporation or of a related corporation of the corporation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: enter into or carry out, directly or indirectly, 2 or more transactions in securities of a corporation that by themselves or in conjunction with any other transaction reduce, or are likely to reduce, the price of any securities traded on a relevant recognized market or by means of authorized automated trading services, with the intention of inducing another person to sell, or to refrain from purchasing, securities of the corporation or of a related corporation of the corporation; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: enter into or carry out, directly or indirectly, 2 or more transactions in securities of a corporation that by themselves or in conjunction with any other transaction maintain or stabilize, or are likely to maintain or stabilize, the price of any securities traded on a relevant recognized market or by means of authorized automated trading services, with the intention of inducing another person to sell, purchase or subscribe for, or to refrain from selling, purchasing or subscribing for, securities of the corporation or of a related corporation of the corporation.

subsection.leadIn: A person shall not, in Hong Kong—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: enter into or carry out, directly or indirectly, 2 or more transactions in securities of a corporation that by themselves or in conjunction with any other transaction increase, or are likely to increase, the price of any securities traded on a relevant non-Hong Kong market, with the intention of inducing another person to purchase or subscribe for, or to refrain from selling, securities of the corporation or of a related corporation of the corporation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: enter into or carry out, directly or indirectly, 2 or more transactions in securities of a corporation that by themselves or in conjunction with any other transaction reduce, or are likely to reduce, the price of any securities traded on a relevant non-Hong Kong market, with the intention of inducing another person to sell, or to refrain from purchasing, securities of the corporation or of a related corporation of the corporation; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: enter into or carry out, directly or indirectly, 2 or more transactions in securities of a corporation that by themselves or in conjunction with any other transaction maintain or stabilize, or are likely to maintain or stabilize, the price of any securities traded on a relevant non-Hong Kong market, with the intention of inducing another person to sell, purchase or subscribe for, or to refrain from selling, purchasing or subscribing for, securities of the corporation or of a related corporation of the corporation. (Amended 31 of 2025 s. 166)

subsection.content: A person who contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference to a transaction includes an offer and an invitation (however expressed); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a reference to entering into or carrying out a transaction shall, in the case of an offer or an invitation referred to in paragraph (a), be construed as a reference to making the offer or the invitation (as the case may be).

section.name: s300
section.heading: Offence involving fraudulent or deceptive devices, etc. in transactions in securities, futures contracts or leveraged foreign exchange trading

subsection.leadIn: A person shall not, directly or indirectly, in a transaction involving securities, futures contracts or leveraged foreign exchange trading—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: employ any device, scheme or artifice with intent to defraud or deceive; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: engage in any act, practice or course of business which is fraudulent or deceptive, or would operate as a fraud or deception.

subsection.content: A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence.
In this section, a reference to a transaction includes an offer and an invitation (however expressed).

section.name: s301
section.heading: Offence of disclosure of false or misleading information inducing others to enter into leveraged foreign exchange contracts

subsection.leadIn: A person shall not, in Hong Kong or elsewhere, disclose, circulate or disseminate, or authorize or be concerned in the disclosure, circulation or dissemination of, information that is likely to induce another person to enter into a leveraged foreign exchange contract in Hong Kong, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the information is false or misleading as to a material fact, or is false or misleading through the omission of a material fact; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person knows that, or is reckless as to whether, the information is false or misleading as to a material fact, or is false or misleading through the omission of a material fact.

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (3) to (5), a person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence.

subsection.leadIn: Where a person is charged with an offence under subsection (2) in respect of a contravention of subsection (1) taking place by reason only of the issue or reproduction of information, it is a defence to the charge for the person to prove that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the issue or reproduction of the information took place in the ordinary course of a business (whether or not carried on by him), the principal purpose of which was issuing or reproducing materials provided by others;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the contents of the information were not, wholly or partly, devised—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: where the business was carried on by him, by himself or any officer, employee or agent of his; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where the business was not carried on by him, by himself;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: for the purposes of the issue or reproduction—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: where the business was carried on by him, he or any officer, employee or agent of his; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where the business was not carried on by him, he,

paragraph.continued: did not select, add to, modify or otherwise exercise control over the contents of the information; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: at the time of the issue or reproduction, he did not know that the information was false or misleading as to a material fact or was false or misleading through the omission of a material fact.

subsection.leadIn: Where a person is charged with an offence under subsection (2) in respect of a contravention of subsection (1) taking place by reason only of the re-transmission of information, it is a defence to the charge for the person to prove that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the re-transmission of the information took place in the ordinary course of a business (whether or not carried on by him), the normal conduct of which involved the re-transmission of information to other persons within an information system or from one information system to another information system (wherever situated), whether directly or by facilitating the establishment of links between such other persons and third parties;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the contents of the information were not, wholly or partly, devised—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: where the business was carried on by him, by himself or any officer, employee or agent of his; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where the business was not carried on by him, by himself;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: for the purposes of the re-transmission—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: where the business was carried on by him, he or any officer, employee or agent of his; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where the business was not carried on by him, he,

paragraph.continued: did not select, add to, modify or otherwise exercise control over the contents of the information;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: the re-transmission of the information was accompanied by a message to the effect, or was effected following acknowledgment by the persons to whom it was re-transmitted of their understanding, that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: where the business was carried on by him, he or any officer, employee or agent of his; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where the business was not carried on by him, the person who carried on the business or any officer, employee or agent of that person,

paragraph.continued: did not devise the contents of the information, and neither took responsibility for it nor endorsed its accuracy; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: at the time of the re-transmission—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: he did not know that the information was false or misleading as to a material fact or was false or misleading through the omission of a material fact; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: he knew that the information was false or misleading as to a material fact or was false or misleading through the omission of a material fact, but—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: where the business was carried on by him, in the circumstances of the case he could not reasonably be expected to prevent the re-transmission; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: where the business was not carried on by him, in the circumstances of the case he has taken all reasonable steps to bring the fact that the information was so false or misleading to the attention of a person in a position to take steps to cause the re-transmission to be prevented (even if the re-transmission in fact took place).

subsection.leadIn: Where a person is charged with an offence under subsection (2) in respect of a contravention of subsection (1) taking place by reason only of the live broadcast of information, it is a defence to the charge for the person to prove that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the broadcast of the information took place in the ordinary course of the business of a broadcaster (whether or not he was such broadcaster);

paragraph.name: b

subparagraph.name: i

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where he was not the broadcaster, by himself;

subparagraph.name: i

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where he was not the broadcaster, he,

paragraph.continued: did not select, add to, modify or otherwise exercise control over the contents of the information;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to the broadcast—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: where he was the broadcaster, he; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where he was not the broadcaster, he believed and had reasonable grounds to believe that the broadcaster,

paragraph.continued: acted in accordance with the terms and conditions of the licence (if any) by which he or the broadcaster (as the case may be) became entitled to broadcast as a broadcaster and with any code of practice or guidelines (however described) issued under or pursuant to the Telecommunications Ordinance (Cap. 106) or the Broadcasting Ordinance (Cap. 562) and applicable to him or the broadcaster (as the case may be) as a broadcaster; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: at the time of the broadcast—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: he did not know that the information was false or misleading as to a material fact or was false or misleading through the omission of a material fact; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: he knew that the information was false or misleading as to a material fact or was false or misleading through the omission of a material fact, but—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: where he was the broadcaster, in the circumstances of the case he could not reasonably be expected to prevent the broadcast; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: where he was not the broadcaster, in the circumstances of the case he has taken all reasonable steps to bring the fact that the information was so false or misleading to the attention of a person in a position to take steps to cause the broadcast to be prevented (even if the broadcast in fact took place).

def.name: Issue
def.leadIn: In this section, issue (發出), in relation to any material (including any information), includes publishing, circulating, distributing or otherwise disseminating the material or the contents thereof, whether—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by any visit in person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in a newspaper, magazine, journal or other publication;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by the display of posters or notices;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: by means of circulars, brochures, pamphlets or handbills;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: by an exhibition of photographs or cinematograph films;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: by way of sound or television broadcasting;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: by any information system or other electronic device; or

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: by any other means, whether mechanically, electronically, magnetically, optically, manually or by any other medium, or by way of production or transmission of light, image or sound or any other medium,

def.continued: and also includes causing or authorizing the material to be issued.

section.name: s302
section.heading: Offence of falsely representing dealings in futures contracts on behalf of others, etc.

subsection.leadIn: A person shall not represent to another person that he has on behalf of the other person dealt in, or facilitated or arranged for any dealing in, a futures contract traded on a recognized futures market or by means of authorized automated trading services, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in fact he has not so dealt in, or facilitated or arranged for the dealing in, the futures contract; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: he knows that, or is reckless as to whether, in fact he has not so dealt in, or facilitated or arranged for the dealing in, the futures contract.

subsection.leadIn: A person shall not represent to another person that he has dealt in, or facilitated or arranged for any dealing in, a contract or other instrument substantially resembling a futures contract on behalf of the other person in accordance with the rules of a futures market outside Hong Kong, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in fact he has not so dealt in, or facilitated or arranged for the dealing in, the contract or other instrument; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: he knows that, or is reckless as to whether, in fact he has not so dealt in, or facilitated or arranged for the dealing in, the contract or other instrument.

subsection.content: A person who contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence.

section.name: s303
section.heading: Penalties

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under this Part is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $10,000,000 and to imprisonment for 10 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 3 years.

subsection.leadIn: Where a person is convicted of an offence under this Part, the court before which the person is so convicted may, in addition to any penalty specified in subsection (1), make one or more of the following orders in respect of the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an order that the person shall not, without the leave of the court, be or continue to be a director, liquidator, or receiver or manager of the property or business, of a listed corporation or any other specified corporation or in any way, whether directly or indirectly, be concerned or take part in the management of a listed corporation or any other specified corporation for the period (not exceeding 5 years) specified in the order;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an order that the person shall not, without the leave of the court, in Hong Kong, directly or indirectly, in any way acquire, dispose of or otherwise deal in any securities, futures contract or leveraged foreign exchange contract, or an interest in any securities, futures contract, leveraged foreign exchange contract or collective investment scheme for the period (not exceeding 5 years) specified in the order;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an order that any body which may take disciplinary action against the person as one of its members or regulatees be recommended to take disciplinary action against the person; (Amended 6 of 2014 s. 67; L.N. 66 of 2022)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: an order that the person pay to the Government an amount not exceeding the amount of any profit gained or loss avoided by the person as a result of the commission of the offence in question. (Added 6 of 2014 s. 67)

subsection.leadIn: When making any order in respect of a person under subsection (2), the court may take into account any conduct by the person which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: previously resulted in the person being convicted of an offence in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: previously resulted in the person being identified by the Tribunal—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: under section 252(3)(b) as having engaged in any market misconduct; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: under section 307J(1)(b) as being in breach of a disclosure requirement; or (Replaced 9 of 2012 s. 10)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: at any time before the commencement of Part XIII resulted in the person being identified as an insider dealer in a determination under section 16(3), or in a written report prepared and issued under section 22(1), of the repealed Securities (Insider Dealing) Ordinance.

subsection.content: Where the court makes an order under subsection (2)(a), the court may specify a corporation by name or by reference to a relationship with any other corporation.
Where the court makes an order under subsection (2)(a), the order shall be filed by the court with the Registrar of Companies, as soon as reasonably practicable after it is made.
Where the court makes an order under subsection (2)(b), the Commission may notify any licensed person or registered institution of the order in such manner as it considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if he fails to comply with an order made under subsection (2)(a) or (b) and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.content: An order under subsection (2)(d) may be enforced in the same manner as a judgment of the High Court in its civil jurisdiction. (Added 6 of 2014 s. 67)

section.name: s304
section.heading: Transactions relating to contravention of Divisions 2 to 4 not void or voidable
section.content: A transaction is not void or voidable by reason only that a contravention of any of the provisions of Divisions 2 to 4 has taken place in relation to or as a result of it.

section.name: s305
section.heading: Civil liability for contravention of this Part

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), a person who contravenes any of the provisions of Divisions 2 to 4 shall, whether or not he also incurs any other liability (whether under section 303 or otherwise), be liable to pay compensation by way of damages to any other person for any pecuniary loss sustained by the other person as a result of the contravention, whether or not the loss arises from the other person having entered into a transaction or dealing at a price affected by the contravention.
No person shall be liable to pay compensation under subsection (1) unless it is fair, just and reasonable in the circumstances of the case that he should be so liable.

A defence under this Part to a charge for an offence in respect of a contravention of any of the provisions of Divisions 2 to 4 shall also be a defence in an action brought under subsection (1) in respect of the same contravention.

A person may bring an action under subsection (1) in respect of a contravention of any of the provisions of Divisions 2 to 4 even though the person against whom the action is brought has not been charged with or convicted of an offence by reason of the contravention.

For the avoidance of doubt, where a court has jurisdiction to determine an action brought under subsection (1), it may, where it is, apart from this section, within its jurisdiction to entertain an application for an injunction, grant an injunction in addition to, or in substitution for, damages, on such terms and conditions as it considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to section 62 of the Evidence Ordinance (Cap. 8), in an action brought under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the fact that there is a determination by the Market Misconduct Tribunal pursuant to section 252(3)(a) that market misconduct has taken place;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the fact that there is a determination by the Market Misconduct Tribunal pursuant to section 252(3)(b) identifying a person (whether or not a party to the action) as having engaged in market misconduct,

subsection.continued: shall, in so far the determination is still subsisting, be admissible in evidence for the purpose of proving, where to do so is relevant to any issue in the action—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: in the case of a determination referred to in paragraph (a), that the market misconduct has taken place; or

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: in the case of a determination referred to in paragraph (b), that the person has engaged in market misconduct.

subsection.leadIn: In an action brought under subsection (1), where the fact that there is a determination referred to in subsection (6)(a) or (b) is admissible in evidence under subsection (6)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: then—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case of a determination referred to in subsection (6)(a), the market misconduct that is the subject of the determination shall, unless the contrary is proved, be taken to have taken place; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of a determination referred to in subsection (6)(b), the person that is the subject of the determination shall, unless the contrary is proved, be taken to have engaged in market misconduct; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: without prejudice to the reception of any other admissible evidence as evidence of the determination or for the purpose of identifying the facts on which the determination was based, the contents of a report of the Market Misconduct Tribunal containing the determination and published under section 262(2)(b)(i), or the contents of a copy of a report of the Market Misconduct Tribunal containing the determination and made available under subsection (8), shall also be admissible in evidence for such purpose.

subsection.leadIn: Where in an action brought under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the fact that there is a determination referred to in subsection (6)(a) or (b) is admissible in evidence under subsection (6); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a report of the Market Misconduct Tribunal containing the determination has not been published under section 262(2)(b)(i),

subsection.continued: the court having jurisdiction to determine the action may, where it considers appropriate, require that a copy of the report be made available to the court to enable it to be used for the purposes of subsection (7)(b), whereupon—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the Market Misconduct Tribunal shall cause a copy of the report to be made available to the court to enable it to be used for the purposes of subsection (7)(b); and

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: the contents of the report shall be admissible for the purpose specified in subsection (7)(b).

subsection.content: In this section, a reference to a transaction includes an offer and an invitation (however expressed).
Nothing in this section affects, limits or diminishes any rights conferred on a person, or any liabilities a person may incur, under the common law or any other enactment.

section.name: s306
section.heading: Conduct not to constitute offences

subsection.content: Notwithstanding anything in this Part, where a person is charged with an offence under this Part (other than section 300 or 302) by reason of any conduct, it is a defence to the charge for the person to prove that the conduct is, according to the rules made under subsection (2), not to be regarded as constituting an offence.

For the purposes of subsection (1), the Commission, after consultation with the Financial Secretary, may, where it considers it is in the public interest to do so, make rules to prescribe the circumstances in which any conduct that would otherwise constitute an offence under this Part (other than section 300 or 302) shall not be regarded as constituting such an offence.

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding anything in this Part, where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person is charged with an offence under section 295, 296 or 299 by reason of any conduct; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person is charged on the basis that the conduct was carried out not in respect of securities or futures contracts traded on a relevant recognized market or by means of authorized automated trading services, but in respect of securities or futures contracts traded on a relevant non-Hong Kong market,

subsection.continued: the person shall not be convicted of the offence unless the prosecution proves that in any place in which such relevant non-Hong Kong market is situated the conduct would have constituted a criminal offence had it been carried out there. (Amended 31 of 2025 s. 167)

section.name: s307
section.heading: No further proceedings after Part XIII market misconduct proceedings

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding anything in this Part, no criminal proceedings may be instituted against any person under this Part in respect of any conduct if— (Amended 9 of 2012 s. 26)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: proceedings have previously been instituted against the person under section 252 in respect of the same conduct; and

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: those proceedings remain pending; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: by reason of the previous institution of those proceedings, no proceedings may again be lawfully instituted against that person under section 252 in respect of the same conduct.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) does not apply in relation to any proceedings instituted under section 252 without the consent of the Secretary for Justice under section 252A(1). (Added 9 of 2012 s. 26)

section.name: s307A
section.heading: Interpretation of Part XIVA

subsection.leadIn: In this Part—
subsection.def: breach of a disclosure requirement (違反披露規定)—see subsection (2) and section 307G(2);

def.name: Derivatives
def.leadIn: derivatives (衍生工具), in relation to listed securities, means any of the following (whether or not they are listed and regardless of who issued or made them)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: rights, options or interests (whether described as units or otherwise) in, or in respect of, the listed securities;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: contracts, the purpose or pretended purpose of which is to secure or increase a profit or avoid or reduce a loss, wholly or partly by reference to the price or value, or a change in the price or value, of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the listed securities; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any rights, options or interests referred to in paragraph (a);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: rights, options or interests (whether described as units or otherwise) in, or in respect of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any rights, options or interests referred to in paragraph (a); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any contracts referred to in paragraph (b);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: instruments or other documents creating, acknowledging or evidencing any rights, options or interests or any contracts referred to in paragraph (a), (b) or (c), including certificates of interest or participation in, temporary or interim certificates for, receipts (including depositary receipts) in respect of, or warrants to subscribe for or purchase—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the listed securities; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the rights, options or interests or the contracts;

def.name: InsideInformation
def.leadIn: inside information (內幕消息), in relation to a listed corporation, means specific information that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: is about—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the corporation;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a shareholder or officer of the corporation; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the listed securities of the corporation or their derivatives; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is not generally known to the persons who are accustomed or would be likely to deal in the listed securities of the corporation but would if generally known to them be likely to materially affect the price of the listed securities;

subsection.def: listed (上市) means listed on a recognized stock market—see also subsection (3);
listed corporation (上市法團) means a corporation which has issued securities that are, at the time of the breach of a disclosure requirement in relation to the corporation, listed;

def.name: ListedSecurities
def.leadIn: listed securities (上市證券) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: securities which, at the time of a breach of a disclosure requirement in relation to a corporation, have been issued by the corporation and are listed;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: securities which, at the time of a breach of a disclosure requirement in relation to a corporation, have been issued by the corporation and are not listed, but which, at that time, it is reasonably foreseeable will be and which, in fact, are subsequently listed; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: securities which, at the time of a breach of a disclosure requirement in relation to a corporation, have not been issued by the corporation and are not listed, but which, at that time, it is reasonably foreseeable will be and which, in fact, are subsequently so issued and listed;

def.name: Securities
def.leadIn: securities (證券) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shares, stocks, debentures, loan stocks, funds, bonds or notes of, or issued by, or which it is reasonably foreseeable will be issued by, a body, whether incorporated or unincorporated, or a government or municipal government authority;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: rights, options or interests (whether described as units or otherwise) in, or in respect of, such shares, stocks, debentures, loan stocks, funds, bonds or notes;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: certificates of interest or participation in, temporary or interim certificates for, receipts for, or warrants to subscribe for or purchase, such shares, stocks, debentures, loan stocks, funds, bonds or notes;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: interests, rights or property, whether in the form of an instrument or otherwise, commonly known as securities; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: interests, rights or property, whether in the form of an instrument or otherwise, prescribed by notice under section 392 as being regarded as securities in accordance with the terms of the notice;

subsection.def: Tribunal (審裁處) means the Market Misconduct Tribunal established by section 251.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a breach of a disclosure requirement takes place if any of the requirements in section 307B or 307C is contravened in relation to a listed corporation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in those circumstances, the listed corporation is in breach of the disclosure requirement.

subsection.statutoryNote:
Note—
Section 307G(2) provides that, in certain circumstances, an officer of a listed corporation may also be in breach of a disclosure requirement.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Part, securities listed on a recognized stock market are to continue to be regarded as listed during any period of suspension of dealings in those securities on that market.

section.name: s307B
section.heading: Requirement for listed corporations to disclose inside information

subsection.content: A listed corporation must, as soon as reasonably practicable after any inside information has come to its knowledge, disclose the information to the public.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1), inside information has come to the knowledge of a listed corporation if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: information has, or ought reasonably to have, come to the knowledge of an officer of the corporation in the course of performing functions as an officer of the corporation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a reasonable person, acting as an officer of the corporation, would consider that the information is inside information in relation to the corporation.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (1), a listed corporation fails to disclose the inside information required under that subsection if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the information disclosed is false or misleading as to a material fact, or is false or misleading through the omission of a material fact; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an officer of the corporation knows or ought reasonably to have known that, or is reckless or negligent as to whether, the information disclosed is false or misleading as to a material fact, or is false or misleading through the omission of a material fact.

subsection.content: This section is subject to sections 307C, 307D, 307E and 307F.
This section is also subject to sections 150 and 153(2) of the Financial Institutions (Resolution) Ordinance (Cap. 628). (Added 23 of 2016 s. 216. Amended E.R. 2 of 2017)

section.name: s307C
section.heading: Manner of disclosure

subsection.content: A disclosure under section 307B must be made in a manner that can provide for equal, timely and effective access by the public to the inside information disclosed.

Without limiting the manner of disclosure permitted under subsection (1), a listed corporation complies with that subsection if it has disseminated the inside information required to be disclosed under section 307B through an electronic publication system operated by a recognized exchange company for disseminating information to the public.

section.name: s307D
section.heading: Exceptions to disclosure requirement

subsection.content: A listed corporation is not required to disclose any inside information under section 307B if and so long as the disclosure is prohibited under, or would constitute a contravention of a restriction imposed by, an enactment or an order of a court.

subsection.leadIn: A listed corporation is not required to disclose any inside information under section 307B if and so long as—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the corporation takes reasonable precautions for preserving the confidentiality of the information;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the confidentiality of the information is preserved; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: one or more of the following applies—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the information concerns an incomplete proposal or negotiation;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the information is a trade secret;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the information concerns the provision of liquidity support from the Exchange Fund established by the Exchange Fund Ordinance (Cap. 66) or from an institution which performs the functions of a central bank (including such an institution of a place outside Hong Kong) to the corporation or, if the corporation is a member of a group of companies, to any other member of the group;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the disclosure is waived by the Commission under section 307E(1), and any condition imposed under section 307E(2) in relation to the waiver is complied with.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a listed corporation has not failed to take reasonable precautions for preserving the confidentiality of any inside information only because the corporation has, in the ordinary course of business, disclosed the information to any person who—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: requires the information to perform the person’s functions in relation to the corporation; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: by virtue of any enactment, rule of law, contract, or the articles of association of the corporation, is under a duty to the corporation not to disclose the information to any other person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in those circumstances, the confidentiality of the information is to be regarded as having been preserved.

subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (2)(b), a listed corporation is not in breach of a disclosure requirement in respect of inside information the confidentiality of which is not preserved if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the corporation has taken reasonable measures to monitor the confidentiality of the information; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the corporation discloses the information in accordance with section 307C as soon as reasonably practicable after the corporation becomes aware that the confidentiality of the information has not been preserved.

section.name: s307E
section.heading: Waiver

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may, on an application by a listed corporation, grant a waiver in relation to the disclosure of any inside information required to be disclosed under section 307B if the Commission is satisfied that the disclosure—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is prohibited under, or would constitute a contravention of a restriction imposed by, the legislation of a place outside Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is prohibited under, or would constitute a contravention of a restriction imposed by, an order of a court exercising jurisdiction under the law of a place outside Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: would constitute a contravention of a restriction imposed by a law enforcement agency of a place outside Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: would constitute a contravention of a restriction imposed by a government authority of a place outside Hong Kong in the exercise of a power conferred by the legislation of that place.

subsection.content: The Commission may grant a waiver under subsection (1) subject to any condition that it considers appropriate to impose.

section.name: s307F
section.heading: Commission may make rules to prescribe circumstances in which disclosure requirement does not apply

subsection.content: The Commission may, if it considers it is in the public interest to do so, make rules to prescribe the circumstances in which a listed corporation is not required to disclose any inside information under section 307B.
The Commission must consult the Financial Secretary before making rules under subsection (1).

section.name: s307G
section.heading: Duty of officers of listed corporations

subsection.content: Every officer of a listed corporation must take all reasonable measures from time to time to ensure that proper safeguards exist to prevent a breach of a disclosure requirement in relation to the corporation.

subsection.leadIn: If a listed corporation is in breach of a disclosure requirement, an officer of the corporation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whose intentional, reckless or negligent conduct has resulted in the breach; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: who has not taken all reasonable measures from time to time to ensure that proper safeguards exist to prevent the breach,

subsection.continued: is also in breach of the disclosure requirement.

division.name: D3
division.heading: Disclosure Proceedings in Market Misconduct Tribunal

section.name: s307H
section.heading: Jurisdiction of Tribunal under this Part
section.content: The Tribunal has jurisdiction to hear and determine in accordance with this Part, Part XIII and Schedule 9 any question or issue arising out of or in connection with any proceedings instituted under section 307I.

section.name: s307I
section.heading: Institution of disclosure proceedings

subsection.content: If it appears to the Commission that a breach of a disclosure requirement has or may have taken place, the Commission may institute proceedings (disclosure proceedings) in the Tribunal concerning the matter.
The Commission institutes disclosure proceedings by giving the Tribunal a notice in writing containing a statement specifying the matters prescribed in Schedule 9.

section.name: s307J
section.heading: Object and conduct of disclosure proceedings

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting section 307H, the object of disclosure proceedings is for the Tribunal to determine—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether a breach of a disclosure requirement has taken place; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the identity of any person who is in breach of the disclosure requirement.

subsection.content: Subject to section 261(3), the standard of proof required to determine any question or issue before the Tribunal in disclosure proceedings is the standard of proof applicable to civil proceedings in a court of law.
Sections 253 and 254 apply to disclosure proceedings as if a reference in those sections to proceedings instituted under section 252 were a reference to disclosure proceedings.

section.name: s307K
section.heading: Right to be heard
section.leadIn: Before the Tribunal—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: identifies a person under section 307J(1)(b); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: makes an order under section 307N(1) in respect of a person,

section.continued: the Tribunal must give the person a reasonable opportunity of being heard.

section.name: s307L
section.heading: Use of evidence received for purposes of disclosure proceedings

subsection.leadIn: Despite any other provision of this Ordinance, evidence given by any person at or for the purposes of any disclosure proceedings (including any material, record or document received by the Tribunal from the person or produced to the Tribunal by the person under section 253, and any record or document or information given, provided, produced or disclosed to the Tribunal by the person under section 254)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is admissible in evidence for all the purposes of this Part, including in the disclosure proceedings, any proceedings (civil or criminal) arising out of the disclosure proceedings and any action brought under section 307Z(1); but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (2), is not admissible in evidence against the person for any other purposes in any other proceedings (civil or criminal) in a court of law brought by or against the person.

subsection.leadIn: Evidence referred to in subsection (1) is admissible in evidence against the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in civil proceedings instituted under or pursuant to Part XI;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in civil proceedings in a court of law arising out of the giving of evidence at or for the purposes of the disclosure proceedings; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in criminal proceedings where the person is charged with an offence under section 219(2)(a), or under Part V of the Crimes Ordinance (Cap. 200), or for perjury, in respect of answers given by the person to questions put to the person at or for the purposes of the disclosure proceedings.

section.name: s307M
section.heading: Privileged information
section.content: Nothing in this Part, Part XIII or Schedule 9 requires an authorized financial institution, acting as the banker or financial adviser of a person whose conduct is the subject, whether wholly or in part, of any disclosure proceedings, to disclose information as to the affairs of any of its customers other than that person.

section.name: s307N
section.heading: Orders of Tribunal

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 307K, at the conclusion of any disclosure proceedings the Tribunal may make one or more of the following orders in respect of a person identified under section 307J(1)(b) as being in breach of a disclosure requirement—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: an order that, for the period (not exceeding 5 years) specified in the order, the person must not, without the leave of the Court of First Instance—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: be or continue to be a director, liquidator, or receiver or manager of the property or business, of a listed corporation or any other specified corporation; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in any way, whether directly or indirectly, be concerned or take part in the management of a listed corporation or any other specified corporation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an order that, for the period (not exceeding 5 years) specified in the order, the person must not, without the leave of the Court of First Instance, in Hong Kong, directly or indirectly, in any way acquire, dispose of or otherwise deal in any securities, futures contract or leveraged foreign exchange contract, or an interest in any securities, futures contract, leveraged foreign exchange contract or collective investment scheme;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an order that the person must not again perpetrate any conduct that constitutes a breach of a disclosure requirement;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if the person is a listed corporation or is in breach of the disclosure requirement as a director or chief executive of a listed corporation, an order that the person pay to the Government a regulatory fine not exceeding $8,000,000;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: without prejudice to any power of the Tribunal under section 307P, an order that the person pay to the Government the sum the Tribunal considers appropriate for the costs and expenses reasonably incurred by the Government in relation or incidental to the proceedings;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: without prejudice to any power of the Tribunal under section 307P, an order that the person pay to the Commission the sum the Tribunal considers appropriate for the costs and expenses reasonably incurred by the Commission, whether in relation or incidental to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the proceedings;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any investigation of the person’s conduct or affairs carried out before the proceedings were instituted; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: any investigation of the person’s conduct or affairs carried out for the purposes of the proceedings;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: an order that any body which may take disciplinary action against the person as one of its members or regulatees be recommended to take disciplinary action against the person; (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: if the person is a listed corporation, any order that the Tribunal considers necessary to ensure that a breach of a disclosure requirement does not again take place in respect of the corporation including, but not limited to, an order that the corporation appoint an independent professional adviser approved by the Commission to review the corporation’s procedure for compliance with this Part or to advise the corporation on matters relating to compliance with this Part;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: if the person is an officer of a listed corporation, any order that the Tribunal considers necessary to ensure that the officer does not again perpetrate any conduct that constitutes a breach of a disclosure requirement including, but not limited to, an order that the officer undergo a training program approved by the Commission on compliance with this Part, directors’ duties and corporate governance.

subsection.leadIn: When making an order in respect of a person under subsection (1), the Tribunal may take into account any conduct by the person which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: previously resulted in the person being convicted of an offence in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: previously resulted in the person being identified by the Tribunal—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: under section 252(3)(b) as having engaged in any market misconduct; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: under section 307J(1)(b) as being in breach of a disclosure requirement; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: at any time before the commencement# of Part XIII resulted in the person being identified as an insider dealer in a determination under section 16(3), or in a written report prepared and issued under section 22(1), of the repealed Securities (Insider Dealing) Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: The Tribunal must not impose a regulatory fine on a person under subsection (1)(d) unless, in all the circumstances of the case, the fine is proportionate and reasonable in relation to the breach of the disclosure requirement. For that purpose, the Tribunal may take into account, in addition to any conduct referred to in subsection (2), any of the following matters—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the seriousness of the conduct that resulted in the person being in breach of the disclosure requirement;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether or not that conduct was intentional, reckless or negligent;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: whether that conduct may have damaged the integrity of the securities and futures market;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: whether that conduct may have damaged the interest of the investing public;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: whether that conduct resulted in any benefit to the person or any other person, including any profit gained or loss avoided;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the person’s financial resources.

subsection.content: An order made under subsection (1)(a) may specify a corporation by name or by reference to a relationship with any other corporation.

Subject to any rules made by the Chief Justice under section 307X, Order 62 of the Rules of the High Court (Cap. 4 sub. leg. A) applies to the taxation of any sum ordered under subsection (1)(e) or (f) for costs reasonably incurred in relation or incidental to the proceedings.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: chief executive (最高行政人員) has the meaning given by section 308(1).

section.name: s307O
section.heading: Notice and effect of orders of Tribunal

subsection.content: The Tribunal must by notice in writing notify a person of an order made in respect of the person under section 307N(1).
The order takes effect at the time when it is notified to the person or at the time specified in the notice, whichever is the later.
If the Tribunal makes an order under section 307N(1)(b), the Commission may notify any licensed person or registered institution of the order in any manner the Commission considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: A person who fails to comply with an order made under section 307N(1)(a), (b) or (c) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s307P
section.heading: Costs

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (4), at the conclusion of any disclosure proceedings, or as soon as reasonably practicable after the conclusion of the proceedings, the Tribunal may by order award to any of the following persons a sum it considers appropriate in respect of the costs reasonably incurred by the person in relation to the proceedings—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person whose attendance, whether as a witness or otherwise, has been necessary or required for the purposes of the proceedings;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person whose conduct is the subject, whether wholly or in part, of the proceedings.

subsection.content: Any costs awarded under this section are a charge on the general revenue.

Subject to any rules made by the Chief Justice under section 307X, Order 62 of the Rules of the High Court (Cap. 4 sub. leg. A) applies to the award of costs, and to the taxation of any costs awarded, by the Tribunal under this section.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1)(a) and (b) does not apply to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person who has been identified under section 307J(1)(b) as being in breach of a disclosure requirement;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person whose conduct the Tribunal considers has caused, whether wholly or in part, the Tribunal to investigate or consider the person’s conduct during the course of the disclosure proceedings; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a person whom the Tribunal considers has by the person’s conduct caused, whether wholly or in part, the institution of the disclosure proceedings.

section.name: s307Q
section.heading: Report of Tribunal

subsection.leadIn: After the conduct of any disclosure proceedings, the Tribunal must prepare a written report of the proceedings, which must contain—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any determinations under section 307J(1) and orders under section 307N, and the reasons for making the determinations and orders; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any order under section 307P and the reasons for making the order.

subsection.leadIn: The Tribunal must issue the report prepared under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by giving a copy of the report to the Commission; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: except where the Tribunal sat in private for the whole or any part of its proceedings, by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: publishing the report so that copies of the report are available to the public;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: giving a copy of the report, so far as reasonably practicable, to any person whose conduct was directly in question in the proceedings;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: where the Tribunal considers appropriate, giving a copy of the report to any body which may take disciplinary action against a person who is a member or regulatee of the body and who is identified under section 307J(1)(b) as being in breach of a disclosure requirement. (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

subsection.content: Where the Tribunal sat in private for the whole or any part of its proceedings, the Commission may, if the Commission is of the opinion that it is in the public interest to do so, cause the whole or any part of the report to be made available to the public or to a particular person or body in the manner the Commission directs.

A person is not liable to civil or criminal proceedings for publishing a true and accurate account or a fair and accurate summary of a report of the Tribunal issued or made available under subsection (2)(b) or (3).

section.name: s307R
section.heading: Form and proof of orders of Tribunal
section.content: Section 263 applies to an order of the Tribunal in disclosure proceedings.

section.name: s307S
section.heading: Registration and filing of orders of Tribunal

subsection.content: Section 264(1) applies to an order of the Tribunal in disclosure proceedings.
The Tribunal must file an order made under section 307N(1)(a) with the Registrar of Companies as soon as reasonably practicable after it is made.

section.name: s307T
section.heading: Stay of execution of orders of Tribunal
section.content: On application by a person in respect of whom an order has been made under section 307N or 307P, the Tribunal may by order grant a stay of execution of the order, subject to any conditions as to costs, payment of money into the Tribunal or otherwise, as the Tribunal considers appropriate.

section.name: s307U
section.heading: Appeal to Court of Appeal

subsection.leadIn: If the Tribunal has made any finding or determination for the purposes of any disclosure proceedings and the Commission, or a person identified under section 307J(1)(b) as being in breach of a disclosure requirement, is dissatisfied with the finding or determination, the Commission or the person may, after the Tribunal has made orders (if any) under section 307N or 307P for the purposes of the proceedings, appeal to the Court of Appeal against the finding or determination—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on a point of law; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: with the leave of the Court of Appeal, on a question of fact.

subsection.content: A person in respect of whom an order has been made under section 307N or 307P may appeal to the Court of Appeal against the order.

section.name: s307V
section.heading: Powers of Court of Appeal on appeal

subsection.leadIn: In an appeal under section 307U(1), the Court of Appeal may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: allow the appeal;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: dismiss the appeal;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: vary or set aside the finding or determination and, if the finding or determination is set aside, substitute for the finding or determination any other finding or determination it considers appropriate; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: remit the matter in question to the Tribunal with the directions it considers appropriate, which may include a direction to the Tribunal to conduct the proceedings afresh for the purpose of determining any question specified by the Court of Appeal.

subsection.leadIn: In an appeal under section 307U(2), the Court of Appeal may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: confirm, vary or set aside the order appealed against; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the order is set aside, substitute for the order any other order it considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: If the Court of Appeal varies, or substitutes any other finding, determination or order for a finding, determination or order under subsection (1)(c) or (2)(a) or (b), the finding, determination or order as varied or the other finding, determination or order substituting for the finding, determination or order may be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (1)(c), any finding or determination (whether more or less onerous) that the Tribunal had power to make for the purposes of the proceedings in question; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (2)(a) or (b), any order (whether more or less onerous) that the Tribunal had power to make in respect of the appellant,

subsection.continued: whether or not under the same provision as that under which the finding, determination or order has been made.

subsection.content: If the Court of Appeal remits a matter to the Tribunal under subsection (1)(d), the Tribunal may be constituted by the same members as, or different members from, those that originally dealt with the matter, unless the Court of Appeal otherwise directs.
In an appeal under section 307U, the Court of Appeal may make any order as to costs that it considers appropriate.

section.name: s307W
section.heading: No stay of execution on appeal

subsection.content: Without prejudice to section 307T, neither the lodging of an appeal nor the filing of an application for leave to appeal under section 307U by itself operates as a stay of execution of a finding, determination or order of the Tribunal unless the Court of Appeal otherwise orders.
A stay of execution ordered under subsection (1) may be subject to any conditions as to costs, payment of money into the Tribunal or otherwise, as the Court of Appeal considers appropriate.

section.name: s307X
section.heading: Rules by Chief Justice
section.leadIn: The Chief Justice may make rules—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: providing for the taxation of costs required to be paid under an order referred to in section 307N(1)(e) or (f) and for the award of costs under section 307P and the taxation of those costs;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: regulating the procedure for—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: applying for leave to appeal, and the hearing of applications for leave to appeal, under section 307U; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the hearing of appeals under that section;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: requiring the payment of the fees specified in the rules for any matter relating to disclosure proceedings;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: providing for matters of procedure or other matters relating to disclosure proceedings which are not provided for in this Part, Part XIII or Schedule 9;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: providing for the issue or service of any document (however described) for the purposes of this Part or Schedule 9; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: prescribing any matter which this Part provides is, or may be, prescribed by rules made by the Chief Justice.

division.name: D4
division.heading: Civil Liability for Breach of a Disclosure Requirement

section.name: s307Y
section.heading: Interpretation and application

subsection.leadIn: In this Division—
subsection.def: transaction (交易) includes an offer and an invitation (however expressed).

subsection.content: Nothing in this Division affects, limits or diminishes any rights conferred on a person, or any liabilities a person may incur, under the common law or any other enactment.

section.name: s307Z
section.heading: Civil liability for breach of a disclosure requirement

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), a person who is in breach of a disclosure requirement is liable to pay compensation by way of damages to any other person for any pecuniary loss sustained by the other person as a result of the breach.
A person is not liable to pay compensation under subsection (1) unless it is fair, just and reasonable in the circumstances of the case that the person should be so liable.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) applies—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether or not the loss arises from the other person having entered into a transaction or dealing at a price affected by the breach of the disclosure requirement; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether or not the person who is in breach of the disclosure requirement incurs any other liability (under this Part or otherwise).

subsection.content: To avoid doubt, a court that has jurisdiction to determine an action brought under subsection (1) may grant an injunction in addition to, or in substitution for, damages, on any terms and conditions that it considers appropriate, if apart from this section the court has jurisdiction to grant an injunction.

section.name: s307ZA
section.heading: Evidentiary provisions

subsection.leadIn: In an action brought under section 307Z(1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the fact that there is a determination by the Tribunal under section 307J(1)(a) that a breach of a disclosure requirement has taken place is admissible in evidence for the purpose of proving that a breach of a disclosure requirement has taken place; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the fact that there is a determination by the Tribunal under section 307J(1)(b) identifying a person as being in breach of a disclosure requirement is admissible in evidence for the purpose of proving that the person is in breach of a disclosure requirement.

subsection.leadIn: In an action brought under section 307Z(1), if the fact that there is a determination referred to in subsection (1) is admissible in evidence under that subsection—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: then—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case of a determination referred to in subsection (1)(a), the breach that is the subject of the determination is to be taken, unless the contrary is proved, to have taken place; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of a determination referred to in subsection (1)(b), the person who is the subject of the determination is to be taken, unless the contrary is proved, to be in breach of the disclosure requirement; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the contents of either of the following are admissible in evidence for the purpose of identifying the facts on which the determination was based—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a report of the Tribunal containing the determination and published under section 307Q(2)(b)(i); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a copy of a report of the Tribunal containing the determination and made available under subsection (4).

subsection.content: Subsection (2)(b) is without prejudice to the reception of any other admissible evidence as evidence of the determination or for the purpose of identifying the facts on which the determination was based.

subsection.leadIn: If, in an action brought under section 307Z(1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the fact that there is a determination referred to in subsection (1) is admissible in evidence under that subsection; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a report of the Tribunal containing the determination has not been published under section 307Q(2)(b)(i),

subsection.continued: the court may require that a copy of the report be made available to the court to enable it to be used for the purposes of subsection (2)(b) and the Tribunal must cause a copy of the report to be made available to the court accordingly.

subsection.content: Nothing in this section limits section 62 of the Evidence Ordinance (Cap. 8).

section.name: s308
section.heading: Interpretation of Part XV

subsection.leadIn: In this Part, unless the context otherwise requires—

def.name: AssociatedCorporation
def.leadIn: associated corporation (相聯法團), in relation to a listed corporation, means a corporation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: which is a subsidiary or holding company of the listed corporation or a subsidiary of the listed corporation’s holding company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (not being a subsidiary of the listed corporation) in which the listed corporation has an interest in the shares of a class comprised in its share capital exceeding in number one-fifth of the number of the issued shares of that class; (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920 and L.N. 162 of 2013)

subsection.def: cash settled equity derivatives (現金結算股本衍生工具) means equity derivatives other than physically settled equity derivatives;

chief executive (最高行政人員) means the person employed or otherwise engaged by a corporation who, either alone or together with one or more persons, is or will be responsible under the immediate authority of the board of directors for the conduct of the business of the corporation;

contract multiplier (合約乘數), in relation to a stock futures contract, means the number specified by the recognized exchange company operating the futures market on which the stock futures contract is traded to be the contract multiplier for that stock futures contract under the rules of the recognized exchange company;
custodian (保管人) means a corporation the principal business of which is to act as a custodian of securities or other property for another person, whether on trust or by contract;

deliver (交付), in relation to any shares or debentures, means deliver the shares or debentures either physically or by electronic means and, in the case of unissued shares, means deliver the shares after they are issued; and take delivery (提取) shall be construed accordingly;

def.name: DutyOfDisclosure
def.leadIn: duty of disclosure (披露責任)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the purposes of, and otherwise in relation to, Divisions 2 to 6, means the duty of disclosure arising under section 310 which has to be performed in accordance with section 324; or

paragraph.name: b
