paragraph.leadIn: where he acquires or disposes of the interest referred to in paragraph (f)(i)(A)—

subparagraph.content: through an on-exchange transaction, the highest price and the average price paid or received per share for the interest he acquires or disposes of (or, in the case that no price is paid or received, that fact); or

through an off-exchange transaction, the nature of the consideration given or received, and the highest amount and the average amount of the consideration given or received per share, for the interest he acquires or disposes of (or, in the case that no consideration is given or received, that fact);

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.leadIn: where he acquires or disposes of the interest referred to in paragraph (f)(ii)(A)—

subparagraph.content: through an on-exchange transaction, the highest price and the average price paid or received per unit for the interest he acquires or disposes of (or, in the case that no price is paid or received, that fact); or

through an off-exchange transaction, the nature of the consideration given or received, and the highest amount and the average amount of the consideration given or received per unit, for the interest he acquires or disposes of (or, in the case that no consideration is given or received, that fact);

paragraph.content: subject to subsection (3), the capacity in which the interest in shares in or debentures of, or the short position in shares in, the listed corporation or any associated corporation of the listed corporation is held immediately after the relevant time and, if the interest in the shares or debentures, or the short position in the shares, is held in more than one capacity, the number of shares or amount of debentures held in each capacity;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (3), where the duty of disclosure arises on the occurrence of an event in consequence of which the nature of his interest in shares in or debentures of the listed corporation or any associated corporation of the listed corporation changes, the nature of his interest immediately before and immediately after the relevant time;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.leadIn: subject to subsection (3), where he is taken to be interested in shares in or debentures of, or have a short position in shares in, the listed corporation or any associated corporation of the listed corporation under section 344(1), 344(2), 344(3) or 345(14)—

subparagraph.content: the number and class of the shares or amount of the debentures; and
the name and address of, and his relationship with, each of the other persons having an interest in the shares or debentures or having a short position in the shares,

paragraph.continued: in which he is so taken to be interested or have a short position under each of those sections taken separately;

paragraph.content: where he no longer has an interest in shares in or debentures of, or a short position in shares in, the listed corporation or any associated corporation of the listed corporation, the fact that he no longer has such an interest or short position; and

paragraph.name: m
paragraph.content: such other information as may be required in the form specified for the purpose.

subsection.leadIn: Where any shares the particulars of which have to be specified in a notification by a person under subsection (1)(b), (d), (f), (j) or (k) are the underlying shares of equity derivatives, the person shall also specify, subject to subsection (3), separately in the notification—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the total number of shares which are the underlying shares of any of the following categories of equity derivatives that are listed or traded on a recognized stock market or traded on a recognized futures market, in which he was interested, or had a short position, immediately before the relevant time—

subparagraph.content: cash settled equity derivatives (specifying separately if they are futures or options); or
physically settled equity derivatives (specifying separately if they are futures or options);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the total number of shares which are the underlying shares of any of the following categories of equity derivatives that are neither listed or traded on a recognized stock market nor traded on a recognized futures market, in which he was interested, or had a short position, immediately before the relevant time—

subparagraph.content: cash settled equity derivatives (specifying separately if they are futures or options); or
physically settled equity derivatives (specifying separately if they are futures or options);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the total number of shares which are the underlying shares of any of the equity derivatives referred to in paragraph (a) in which he is interested, or has a short position, immediately after the relevant time;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the total number of shares which are the underlying shares of any of the equity derivatives referred to in paragraph (b) in which he is interested, or has a short position, immediately after the relevant time;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the period within which rights under each of the equity derivatives may be exercised (exercise period); and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the expiry date of the exercise period.

subsection.leadIn: Where a duty of disclosure arises under section 341(1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: subsection (1)(b), (c) and (d) shall apply in relation to a person as if a reference to the listed corporation and any associated corporation of the listed corporation in that subsection was a reference to the corporation—

subparagraph.content: in the shares in or debentures of which he has acquired an interest, or ceased to have an interest, at the relevant time;
in the shares in or debentures of which he has come to have, or ceased to have, a short position at the relevant time; or
the nature of his interest in the shares in or debentures of which changes at the relevant time;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the particulars required to be specified under subsection (1)(i), (j) or (k) or (2) shall relate only to—

subparagraph.leadIn: the shares in which—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: he has (or is taken to have) acquired an interest, or ceased to have an interest, at the relevant time;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: he has (or is taken to have) come to have, or ceased to have, a short position at the relevant time; or

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: the nature of his interest changes (or is taken to change) at the relevant time; and

subparagraph.leadIn: the debentures in which—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: he has (or is taken to have) acquired an interest, or ceased to have an interest, at the relevant time; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the nature of his interest changes (or is taken to change) at the relevant time.

subsection.leadIn: Where a duty of disclosure arises under section 341(2)(a)(i), (b)(i), (c)(i) or (d)(i), a person shall, in performing the duty of disclosure, also specify in the notification—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in respect of his interest in the shares which are the subject of the disclosure acquired—

subparagraph.content: through an on-exchange transaction, the highest price and the average price paid per share for the interest acquired within 4 months immediately before the day on which the relevant event occurred; or

through an off-exchange transaction, the nature of the consideration given, and the highest amount and the average amount of the consideration given per share, for the interest acquired within 4 months immediately before the day on which the relevant event occurred; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in respect of his interest in the debentures which are the subject of the disclosure acquired—

subparagraph.content: through an on-exchange transaction, the highest price and the average price paid per unit for the interest acquired within 4 months immediately before the day on which the relevant event occurred; or

through an off-exchange transaction, the nature of the consideration given, and the highest amount and the average amount of the consideration given per unit, for the interest acquired within 4 months immediately before the day on which the relevant event occurred.

subsection.def: For the purposes of subsection (1)(b), percentage figure (百分率數字), subject to subsections (6) and (7), means the percentage figure found by expressing the number of all the shares in the listed corporation concerned or the associated corporation of the listed corporation in which the person is interested immediately before or immediately after (as the case may be) the relevant time as a percentage of the number of the issued shares in the listed corporation or associated corporation (as the case may be).

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (5), where the listed corporation concerned or the associated corporation of the listed corporation grants to the person rights to subscribe for, or offers to the person, its shares, as part of a rights issue, the number of the issued shares in the listed corporation or associated corporation (as the case may be) at all times from the grant or offer (as the case may be) up to the completion or termination of the rights issue (whichever is the earlier) is taken to be the aggregate of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the number of the issued shares in the listed corporation or associated corporation (as the case may be) immediately before the grant or offer (as the case may be); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the number of the new shares to be issued upon the completion of the rights issue.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (5)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in determining the number of shares in which a person is interested, there shall be disregarded any short position which that person has in the shares which, if included in the calculation of the number of shares in which the person is interested, would reduce the number of shares in which the person is interested; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the particulars of the shares in which that person has a short position, or has ceased to have a short position, shall be specified separately in the notification.

subsection.def: For the purposes of subsection (1)(d), percentage figure (百分率數字) means the percentage figure found by expressing the number of all the shares in the listed corporation concerned or the associated corporation of the listed corporation in which the person has a short position immediately before or immediately after (as the case may be) the relevant time as a percentage of the number of the issued shares in the listed corporation or associated corporation (as the case may be).

subsection.leadIn: Where the share capital of the listed corporation or the associated corporation of the listed corporation is divided into different classes of shares—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference in this section to the number of shares in the listed corporation or associated corporation (as the case may be) in which the person is interested or has a short position shall be construed as a reference to the number of the shares in each of the classes taken separately; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a reference in this section to a percentage of the number of the issued shares in the listed corporation or associated corporation (as the case may be) shall be construed as a reference to a percentage of the number of the issued shares in each of the classes taken separately.

subsection.def: In subsection (6), completion (完成), in relation to a rights issue, means the issue of shares in the listed corporation or the associated corporation of the listed corporation pursuant to the rights issue.

subsection.leadIn: Where an event on the occurrence of which a director or chief executive comes under a duty of disclosure under section 341 arises from the grant by the listed corporation, or any associated corporation of the listed corporation, of debentures or rights to subscribe for debentures, or the exercise or assignment of those rights so granted, the notification shall also specify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the—

subparagraph.leadIn: price paid or received—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: for the grant of those debentures or those rights; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: on the exercise or assignment of those rights,

subparagraph.continued: (or, in the case that no price is paid or received, that fact); or

subparagraph.leadIn: consideration given or received—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: for the grant of those debentures or those rights; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: on the exercise or assignment of those rights,

subparagraph.continued: (or, in the case that no consideration is given or received, that fact),

paragraph.continued: (as the case may be);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the period within which those rights may be exercised (exercise period); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the expiry date of the exercise period.

subsection.leadIn: Where an event on the occurrence of which a director or chief executive comes under a duty of disclosure under section 341 arises from the grant by the listed corporation, or any associated corporation of the listed corporation, of equity derivatives or rights under any equity derivatives, or the exercise or assignment of those rights so granted, the notification shall also specify the—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: price paid or received—

subparagraph.content: for the grant of those equity derivatives or those rights; or
on the exercise or assignment of those rights,

paragraph.continued: (or, in the case that no price is paid or received, that fact); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: consideration given or received—

subparagraph.content: for the grant of those equity derivatives or those rights; or
on the exercise or assignment of those rights,

paragraph.continued: (or, in the case that no consideration is given or received, that fact),

subsection.continued: (as the case may be);

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (12), nothing in this section shall require details of the price that has been paid or may be payable, or the consideration that has been given or may be given, for or under equity derivatives (where the underlying shares of the equity derivatives are shares which are the subject of the disclosure) to be specified in the notification.

section.name: s350
section.heading: Duty to publish and notify Monetary Authority of information given under Division 9

subsection.content: Upon receipt of any information under any provision of this Division or any regulations made, or rules made by the Commission, for the purposes of this Division, the relevant exchange company shall forthwith publish such information in such manner and for such period as may be approved by the Commission.

Whenever a listed corporation that is, or is the holding company of, an authorized financial institution receives information from a director or chief executive under any provision of this Division, the listed corporation is under a duty to notify the Monetary Authority of that information.

If a listed corporation is under a duty to give any notification required by subsection (2), the notification shall be given before the end of the business day after the day on which that duty arises.

If default is made in complying with subsection (2) or (3), the listed corporation concerned and every officer of it who is in default commit an offence and each is liable on conviction to a fine at level 1.

section.name: s351
section.heading: Offences for non-compliance with notification requirements by director and chief executive
section.leadIn: A person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: who, without reasonable excuse, fails to perform, within the period specified in section 348(1)(a) or (b) or (2)(a) or (b) (as the case may be), a duty of disclosure arising under Division 7 in accordance with the provisions of this Part applicable to that duty; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: who—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in purported performance of any such duty makes to a listed corporation or to the relevant exchange company a statement which is false or misleading in a material particular; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: knows that, or is reckless as to whether, the statement is false or misleading in a material particular,

section.continued: commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

division.name: D10
division.heading: Keeping of register of directors’ and chief executives’ interests and short positions

section.name: s352
section.heading: Register of directors’ and chief executives’ interests and short positions

subsection.content: Every listed corporation shall keep a register of directors’ and chief executives’ interests and short positions.

Whenever a listed corporation receives information from a director or chief executive given in performance of a duty of disclosure imposed on him by any provision of Divisions 7 to 9, the listed corporation is under a duty to record in the register, against the director’s name or the chief executive’s name (as the case may be), the information received and the date of the entry.

subsection.leadIn: The listed corporation is also under a duty, whenever it grants to a director or chief executive a right to subscribe for shares in or debentures of the listed corporation, to record in the register against his name—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date on which the right is granted;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the period during which, or the time at which, the right is exercisable;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the consideration for the grant (or, if there is no consideration, that fact); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the description of the shares or debentures involved, the number of those shares or amount of those debentures, and the price to be paid for them (or the consideration, if otherwise than in money).

subsection.leadIn: Whenever the right referred to in subsection (3) is exercised by a director or chief executive, the listed corporation is under a duty to record in the register against his name—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that fact (identifying the right);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the number of shares or amount of debentures in respect of which it is exercised; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: they were registered in his name, that fact; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: they were not registered in his name, the name or names of the person or persons in whose name or names they were registered, together (if they were registered in the names of 2 persons or more) with the number of the shares or amount of the debentures registered in the name of each of them.

subsection.content: A duty imposed by subsection (2), (3) or (4) shall be performed within 3 business days after the day on which that duty arises.

A listed corporation is not, by virtue of anything done for the purposes of this section, affected with notice of, or put upon enquiry as to, the rights of any person in relation to any shares or debentures or equity derivatives.
The register must be so made up that the entries against the several names recorded in it appear in chronological order.

Unless the register is in such form as to constitute in itself an index, the listed corporation shall keep an index of the names recorded in the register which shall in respect of each name contain a sufficient indication to enable the information recorded against it to be readily found.
The listed corporation shall, within 10 business days after the day on which a name is recorded in the register, make any necessary alteration in the index.

If a listed corporation that is not an open-ended fund company ceases to be a listed corporation, it must, subject to section 283 of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32), continue to keep the register and any index until the end of the period of 6 years beginning with the day next following that on which it ceases to be a listed corporation. (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920; 16 of 2016 s. 15)

subsection.leadIn: The register and any index—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall be kept at the place where the corporation’s register of interests in shares and short positions is kept; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: shall, for the purposes of Divisions 7 to 9 and for the purposes of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: enabling members of the public to ascertain—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the identities and the particulars of directors and chief executives (as well as their spouses and minor children) who have or had any interest or short position in shares in, or any interest in debentures of, the listed corporation or any associated corporation of the listed corporation;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the nature and the particulars of the interest or short position; and

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: the capacity in which a person holds or held the interest or short position; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: providing the investing public with information to enable them to make informed investment decisions,

paragraph.continued: be made available for inspection in accordance with section 355. (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

subsection.leadIn: The corporation shall send notice in the form specified by the Commission for the purposes of this section to the Registrar of Companies of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the place where the register is kept; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any change in that place,

subsection.continued: unless the register has at all times been kept at the corporation’s registered office.

subsection.content: The duty imposed by subsection (13) shall be performed within 10 business days after the day on which the register is so kept or the change takes place (as the case may be).

The register shall be produced at the commencement of the corporation’s annual general meeting and remain open and accessible during the continuance of the meeting to any person attending the meeting.

If default is made in complying with any provision of this section, the listed corporation concerned and every officer of it who is in default commit an offence and each is liable on conviction to a fine at level 1 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $200 for every day during which the offence continues.

For the purposes of this section, a reference to books and papers in section 283 of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32) shall be construed as including a reference to the register and index required to be kept by a corporation under this section. (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

section.name: s353
section.heading: Removal of entries from register of directors’ and chief executives’ interests and short positions

subsection.leadIn: A corporation may remove an entry against a person’s name from its register of directors’ and chief executives’ interests and short positions if more than 6 years have expired since the date of the entry being made, and either—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that entry recorded the fact that the person in question had ceased to have an interest notifiable under any provision of this Division or Divisions 7 to 9 in shares in or debentures of the corporation or any associated corporation of the corporation; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it has been superseded by a later entry made under section 352 against the same person’s name,

subsection.continued: and, in a case under paragraph (a), the corporation may also remove that person’s name from the register.

subsection.leadIn: If a person in pursuance of a duty imposed on him by any provision of this Division or Divisions 7 to 9 gives to a listed corporation the name and address of another person as being interested in shares in or debentures of, or having a short position in shares in, the corporation or any associated corporation of the corporation, the corporation shall, within 10 business days after the day on which it was given that information, notify the other person that he has been so named and shall include in that notification—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: particulars of any entry relating to him made, in consequence of its being given that information, by the corporation in its register of directors’ and chief executives’ interests and short positions; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a statement informing him of his right to apply to have the entry removed in accordance with the following provisions of this section.

subsection.content: A person who has been notified by a listed corporation under subsection (2) that an entry relating to him has been made in the corporation’s register of directors’ and chief executives’ interests and short positions may apply in writing to the corporation for the removal of that entry from the register; and the corporation shall remove the entry if satisfied that the information in pursuance of which the entry was made was incorrect.

If an application under subsection (3) is refused, the applicant may apply to the Court of First Instance for an order directing the corporation to remove the entry in question from the register; and the Court of First Instance may, if it considers appropriate, make such an order.

Where a name or an entry is removed from a corporation’s register of directors’ and chief executives’ interests and short positions in pursuance of subsection (1) or (3) or an order under subsection (4), the corporation shall within 10 business days after the date of that removal make any necessary alteration in any index.

If default is made in complying with subsection (2) or (5), the corporation concerned and every officer of it who is in default commit an offence and each is liable on conviction to a fine at level 1 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $200 for every day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s354
section.heading: Otherwise, entries not to be removed from register of directors’ and chief executives’ interests and short positions

subsection.content: Entries in a corporation’s register of directors’ and chief executives’ interests and short positions shall not be removed except in accordance with section 353.

If an entry is removed from a corporation’s register of directors’ and chief executives’ interests and short positions in contravention of subsection (1), the corporation shall restore that entry to the register as soon as reasonably practicable.

If default is made in complying with subsection (1) or (2), the corporation concerned and every officer of it who is in default commit an offence and each is liable on conviction to a fine at level 1 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $200 for every day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s355
section.heading: Inspection of register of directors’ and chief executives’ interests and short positions

subsection.content: Any register of directors’ and chief executives’ interests and short positions shall, during business hours (subject to such reasonable restrictions as the corporation concerned may in general meeting impose, but so that not less than 2 hours in each day are allowed for inspection), be open to inspection by any member of the corporation without charge or by any other person on payment of $10, or such less sum as the corporation may determine, for each inspection.

Any member of the corporation or any other person may require a copy of any such register, or any part of it, on payment of $2, or such less sum as the corporation may determine, for each page required to be copied; and the corporation shall cause any copy so required by a member or person to be sent to him within 10 business days after the day on which the requirement is received by the corporation.

If an inspection of the register required under this section is refused or a copy so required is not sent within the period specified in subsection (2), the corporation and every officer of it who is in default commit an offence and each is liable on conviction to a fine at level 1 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $200 for every day during which the offence continues.
In the case of a refusal of an inspection of the register required under this section, the Court of First Instance may by order compel an immediate inspection of it.

In the case of a failure to send within the period specified in subsection (2) a copy required under this section, the Court of First Instance may by order direct that the copy required shall be sent to the person requiring it.
The Commission may by rules amend the sum specified in subsection (1) or (2).

division.name: D11
division.heading: Power to investigate listed corporation’s ownership

section.name: s356
section.heading: Power to investigate ownership of listed corporation

subsection.leadIn: If it appears to the Financial Secretary that there are reasonable grounds to conduct an investigation for the purposes of determining the true persons who are or have been financially interested in the success or failure (real or apparent) of a listed corporation or able to control or materially influence its policy, he may appoint one or more inspectors to investigate and report for such purposes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the ownership of shares in or debentures of the listed corporation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on persons who have or had an interest or short position in the shares in, or an interest in the debentures of, the listed corporation;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: where the shares in the listed corporation are the underlying shares of any equity derivatives, on persons who have or had an interest in those equity derivatives; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: otherwise with respect to the listed corporation.

subsection.content: The Financial Secretary may, on appointing an inspector under this section, define the scope of the investigation (whether with respect to the matter or the period to which it is to extend or otherwise) and, in particular, may limit the investigation to matters connected with particular shares or debentures or equity derivatives.

subsection.leadIn: If application for an investigation under this section with respect to particular shares in or debentures of a listed corporation, or particular equity derivatives the underlying shares of which are shares in a listed corporation, is made to the Financial Secretary by members of the listed corporation, and the number of applicants or the number of shares held by them is not less than the number required for an application for the appointment of inspectors under section 840(2) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622)— (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Financial Secretary may appoint an inspector to conduct the investigation if he is satisfied that there are reasonable grounds for conducting the investigation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Financial Secretary shall not, on appointing an inspector, exclude from the scope of the investigation any matter which the application seeks to have included, except in so far as the Financial Secretary is satisfied that it is unreasonable for that matter to be investigated.

subsection.content: Subject to the terms of his appointment, an inspector’s powers extend to the investigation of any circumstances suggesting the existence of an arrangement or understanding which, though not legally binding, is or was observed or likely to be observed in practice and which is relevant to the purposes of the investigation.

subsection.leadIn: Before appointing an inspector upon application under subsection (3), the Financial Secretary—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall give the applicants an estimate of the amount of the costs and expenses that may be incurred in connection with the investigation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may require the applicants to give security in such amount as he may specify, which shall not be greater than the amount of the estimated costs and expenses, for payment of the costs and expenses of the investigation.

subsection.leadIn: Sections 316 to 318 and 322 (with the omission of the reference in section 322 to section 323) apply, in relation to any person who is subject to the requirements of Divisions 2 to 4—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: for the purposes of construing—

subparagraph.content: references in this Division and Division 12 to a person having a short position in shares and to a short position in shares respectively,

paragraph.continued: as they apply for the purposes of Divisions 2 to 4; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the purposes of this Division and Division 12 as if, in those sections, a reference to an interest in shares includes, where those shares are the underlying shares of any equity derivatives, an interest in those equity derivatives.

subsection.leadIn: Sections 344 and 345 (with the omission of the reference in section 345 to section 346) apply, in relation to any person who is subject to the requirements of Divisions 7 to 9—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: for the purposes of construing—

subparagraph.content: references in this Division and Division 12 to a person interested in shares or debentures and to an interest in shares or debentures respectively; and
references in this Division and Division 12 to a person having a short position in shares and to a short position in shares respectively,

paragraph.continued: as they apply for the purposes of Divisions 7 to 9; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the purposes of this Division and Division 12 as if, in those sections, a reference to an interest in shares includes, where those shares are the underlying shares of any equity derivatives, an interest in those equity derivatives.

section.name: s357
section.heading: Investigation of contraventions of sections 341 to 349

subsection.content: If it appears to the Financial Secretary that there are circumstances suggesting that contraventions of any provision of sections 341 to 349 may have occurred in relation to the shares in or debentures of a listed corporation or, where the shares in a listed corporation are the underlying shares of any equity derivatives, to those equity derivatives, he may appoint one or more inspectors to carry out such investigations as are requisite to establish whether or not such contraventions have occurred and to report the result of the investigations to him.

The Financial Secretary may, on appointing an inspector under this section, limit the period to which the investigation is to extend or confine it to shares or debentures or equity derivatives of a particular class, or both.

section.name: s358
section.heading: Inspector’s powers during investigation

subsection.leadIn: If an inspector considers it necessary for the purposes of his investigation to investigate also—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the ownership of shares in or debentures of any other corporation which is or has been an associated corporation of the listed corporation concerned;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: persons who have or had an interest or short position in the shares in, or an interest in the debentures of, the other corporation; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: where the shares in the other corporation are the underlying shares of any equity derivatives, persons who have or had an interest in those equity derivatives,

subsection.continued: he shall have power to do so, and shall report on the ownership of those shares or debentures and persons who have or had an interest in those shares or debentures or equity derivatives or a short position in those shares, so far as he considers that the results of his investigation with respect to those shares or debentures or equity derivatives are relevant to the investigation of—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the ownership of shares in or debentures of the listed corporation;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: persons who have or had an interest or short position in the shares in, or an interest in the debentures of, the listed corporation; or

paragraph.name: iii
paragraph.content: where the shares in the listed corporation are the underlying shares of any equity derivatives, persons who have or had an interest in those equity derivatives.

subsection.content: An inspector may at any time in the course of his investigation, without the necessity of making an interim report, inform the Financial Secretary of matters coming to his knowledge as a result of the investigation tending to show that an offence has been committed.

section.name: s359
section.heading: Production of records and evidence to inspectors

subsection.leadIn: When an inspector has been appointed under section 356 or 357, it is the duty of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: all officers and agents of the listed corporation concerned; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: all officers and agents of any other corporation, if—

subparagraph.content: the ownership of shares in or debentures of the other corporation;
persons who have or had an interest or short position in the shares in, or an interest in the debentures of, the other corporation; or
where the shares in the other corporation are the underlying shares of any equity derivatives, persons who have or had an interest in those equity derivatives,

paragraph.continued: are investigated under section 358,

subsection.continued: to—

paragraph.content: attend before the inspector when required to do so; and
otherwise give the inspector all assistance in connection with the investigation which they are reasonably able to give.

subsection.leadIn: If an inspector considers that a person other than an officer or agent of the listed corporation or the other corporation is or may be in possession of information concerning the shares in or debentures of the listed corporation or the other corporation, or the equity derivatives the underlying shares of which are shares in the listed corporation or the other corporation, he may require that person to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: produce to him any records of or relating to the listed corporation or the other corporation (as the case may be) which are in that person’s possession;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: attend before him; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: otherwise give him all assistance in connection with the investigation which that person is reasonably able to give,

subsection.continued: and it shall be the duty of that person to comply with the requirement.

subsection.leadIn: An inspector may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: examine on oath the officers and agents of the listed corporation or the other corporation, and any such person referred to in subsection (2), with respect to the shares in or debentures of the listed corporation or the other corporation, or the equity derivatives the underlying shares of which are shares in the listed corporation or the other corporation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: administer an oath accordingly.

subsection.content: A person is not excused from answering a question put to him under this section by an inspector only on the ground that the answer might tend to incriminate the person, but if the answer might tend to incriminate him and he so claims before giving the answer, the question and answer shall not be admissible in evidence against him in criminal proceedings in a court of law other than those in which he is charged with an offence under Part V of the Crimes Ordinance (Cap. 200), or for perjury, in respect of the answer.

Where an inspector requires a person to answer a question put to him under this section, the inspector shall ensure that the person has first been informed or reminded (as the case may be) of the limitations imposed by subsection (4) on the admissibility in evidence of the requirement and of the question and answer.

subsection.leadIn: In this section and sections 360 and 361—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference to officers or to agents includes a reference to past, as well as present, officers or agents (as the case may be); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.def: agents (代理人), in relation to a corporation, includes its bankers and solicitors and persons employed or otherwise engaged by it as auditors, whether those persons are or are not officers of the corporation.

section.name: s360
section.heading: Delegation of powers by inspectors

subsection.content: An inspector may, by instrument in writing, delegate to any person the powers conferred by section 359 to require the production of any records and to put questions to officers and agents otherwise than on oath, or either of those powers.
Where 2 or more inspectors are appointed in respect of the same investigation, the power conferred by this section may be exercised by any of them.

section.name: s361
section.heading: Obstruction of inspectors

subsection.leadIn: When an inspector is appointed under section 356 or 357, this section applies in relation to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any officer or agent of the listed corporation concerned;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: any officer or agent of any other corporation, if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the ownership of shares in or debentures of the other corporation;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: persons who have or had an interest or short position in the shares in, or an interest in the debentures of, the other corporation; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: where the shares in the other corporation are the underlying shares of any equity derivatives, persons who have or had an interest in those equity derivatives,

paragraph.continued: are investigated under section 358; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any such person referred to in section 359(2).

subsection.leadIn: If that officer, agent or person (as the case may be) refuses to comply with an inspector’s requirement to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: produce to the inspector any records which it is his duty under section 359 to produce;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: attend before the inspector; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: answer any question put to him by an inspector with respect to the shares in or debentures of the listed corporation or the other corporation, or the equity derivatives the underlying shares of which are the shares in the listed corporation or the other corporation,

subsection.continued: the inspector may, by originating summons or originating motion, make an application to the Court of First Instance in respect of the refusal.

subsection.leadIn: The Court of First Instance may then inquire into the case and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the Court is satisfied that there is no reasonable excuse for the officer, agent or person (as the case may be) not to comply with the requirement under subsection (2), order the officer, agent or person (as the case may be) to comply with the requirement within the period specified by the Court; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the Court is satisfied that the refusal was without reasonable excuse, punish the officer, agent or person (as the case may be), and any other person knowingly involved in the refusal, in the same manner as if he and, where applicable, that other person had been guilty of contempt of court.

subsection.content: In this section, a reference to an inspector includes a reference to any person to whom the powers of an inspector are delegated under section 360.

section.name: s362
section.heading: Inspector’s reports

subsection.content: An inspector may, and if so directed by the Financial Secretary shall, make interim reports to the Financial Secretary, and on the conclusion of an investigation shall make a final report to the Financial Secretary.
Any such report shall be made within such time and in such manner as the Financial Secretary may direct.

subsection.leadIn: The Financial Secretary may, if he considers appropriate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: forward a copy of any report made by an inspector to the registered office or principal place of business in Hong Kong of the listed corporation or the other corporation (as the case may be) which is the subject of the report;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on request and on payment of such fee as is prescribed by regulations for the purposes of this section, furnish a copy of any such report to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any member of the listed corporation or the other corporation (as the case may be) which is the subject of the report;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any person whose conduct is referred to in the report;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the auditors of the listed corporation or the other corporation (as the case may be);

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the applicants for the investigation; or

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: any other person whose financial interests appear to the Financial Secretary to be affected by the matters dealt with in the report, whether as a creditor of the listed corporation or the other corporation (as the case may be) or otherwise; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: cause any such report to be published.

section.name: s363
section.heading: Expenses of investigation of affairs of corporation

subsection.leadIn: The expenses of and incidental to an investigation by an inspector shall be defrayed in the first instance out of the general revenue, but the following persons shall, to the following extent, be liable to repay such expenses to the Government—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any person who is convicted by a court on a prosecution instituted as a result of the investigation shall be liable to such extent (if any) as may be ordered by such court;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the listed corporation or the other corporation (as the case may be) dealt with by the investigation shall be liable to such extent (if any) as the Financial Secretary may direct;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the director and the chief executive of the listed corporation or the other corporation (as the case may be) dealt with by the investigation shall be liable to such extent (if any) as the Financial Secretary may direct;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any person who has an interest or short position notifiable under any provision of Divisions 2 to 5 in voting shares in the listed corporation or the other corporation (as the case may be) dealt with by the investigation shall be liable to such extent (if any) as the Financial Secretary may direct; and (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920 and L.N. 162 of 2013)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the applicants for the investigation, where the inspector was appointed under section 356(3), shall be liable to such extent (if any), subject to the limit of the estimate given under section 356(5), as the Financial Secretary may direct.

subsection.content: An inspector appointed under section 356(3) may, if he considers appropriate, and shall if the Financial Secretary so directs, include in a report made by him a recommendation as to the directions (if any) he considers appropriate, in the light of his investigation, to be given under subsection (1)(b), (c), (d) or (e).
A person to whom a direction is given under subsection (1)(b), (c), (d) or (e) may appeal against the direction to the Court of First Instance.

Notwithstanding rule 3(3) of Order 55 of the Rules of the High Court (Cap. 4 sub. leg. A), a direction under subsection (1)(b), (c), (d) or (e) shall not take effect, if an appeal against the direction is made under subsection (3), until the appeal is withdrawn, abandoned or determined.

Any person liable under paragraph (a), (b), (c), (d) or (e) of subsection (1) shall be entitled to contribution from any other person liable under the same paragraph, according to the amount of their respective liabilities thereunder or, if an appeal is made, according to the amount of their respective liabilities as determined by the Court of First Instance.

section.name: s364
section.heading: Power to obtain information as to those interested in shares, etc.

subsection.leadIn: If it appears to the Financial Secretary that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: there are reasonable grounds to investigate—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the ownership of shares in or debentures of a listed corporation;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: persons who have or had an interest or short position in the shares in, or an interest in the debentures of, a listed corporation; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: where the shares in the listed corporation are the underlying shares of any equity derivatives, persons who have or had an interest in those equity derivatives; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is unnecessary to appoint an inspector for the purpose,

subsection.continued: the Financial Secretary may require any person whom he has reasonable cause to believe to have, or to be able to obtain, any information as to—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the present and past interests in those shares or debentures or equity derivatives;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: the names and addresses of the persons interested and of any persons who act or have acted on their behalf in relation to those shares or debentures or equity derivatives;

paragraph.name: iii
paragraph.content: the present and past short positions in those shares; or

paragraph.name: iv
paragraph.content: the names and addresses of the persons having those short positions and of any persons who act or have acted on their behalf in relation to those short positions,

subsection.continued: to give any such information to the Financial Secretary.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1), a person shall be deemed to have an interest in shares or debentures if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: he has any right—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to acquire or dispose of the shares or debentures or any interest in them; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to vote in respect of them;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: his consent is necessary for the exercise of any right referred to in paragraph (a) of any other person; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other person having any right referred to in paragraph (a) can be required, or is accustomed or obliged, to exercise the other person’s right in accordance with his directions or instructions.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1), a person shall be deemed to have an interest in equity derivatives if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he has any right to acquire or dispose of the equity derivatives or any interest in them;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: his consent is necessary for the exercise of the right referred to in paragraph (a) of any other person; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other person having the right referred to in paragraph (a) can be required, or is accustomed or obliged, to exercise the other person’s right in accordance with his directions or instructions.

subsection.leadIn: A person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: who, without reasonable excuse, fails to give information required of him under this section; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: who—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in giving such information makes any statement which is false or misleading in a material particular; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: knows that, or is reckless as to whether, the statement is false or misleading in a material particular,

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s365
section.heading: Privileged information
section.content: Nothing in sections 356 to 364 shall require disclosure to the Financial Secretary, or to an inspector appointed by him, by an authorized financial institution acting as a corporation’s banker or financial adviser of information as to the affairs of any of its customers other than the corporation concerned.

division.name: D12
division.heading: Orders imposing restrictions on shares, etc.

section.name: s366
section.heading: Power of Court of First Instance to impose restrictions on voting shares, etc. in case of failure to provide information required by listed corporation

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a notification is given by a listed corporation under section 329 to a person who is or was interested in voting shares in the corporation that are registered on the Hong Kong register; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that person fails to give the corporation any information required by the notification within the time specified in it,

subsection.continued: the listed corporation may apply to the Court of First Instance for an order directing that the voting shares in question be subject to the restrictions under this Division. (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920 and L.N. 162 of 2013; 19 of 2015 s. 2)

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: that person fails to give the corporation any information required by the notification within the time specified in it,

subsection.continued: the listed corporation may apply to the Court of First Instance for an order directing that the equity derivatives in question be subject to the restrictions under this Division.

subsection.content: An order under subsection (1) or (2) (as the case may be) may be made notwithstanding any power contained in the applicant corporation’s constitution enabling the listed corporation itself to impose similar restrictions on the voting shares or equity derivatives in question. (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920; 19 of 2015 s. 2)

section.name: s367
section.heading: Power of Financial Secretary to impose restrictions on shares, etc. in case of conviction of offences for non-compliance of notification requirements

subsection.leadIn: Where a person is convicted of an offence under section 328 or 351, the Financial Secretary may by order direct that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the shares in relation to which the offence was committed that are registered on the Hong Kong register; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the shares in relation to which the offence was committed are unissued shares, those unissued shares which on issue are to be registered on the Hong Kong register,

subsection.continued: shall, until further order, be subject to the restrictions under this Division.

subsection.content: Without prejudice to subsection (1), where a person is convicted of an offence under section 328 or 351 and the shares in relation to which the offence was committed are the underlying shares of any equity derivatives, the Financial Secretary may by order direct that the equity derivatives shall, until further order, be subject to the restrictions under this Division.

An order under subsection (1) or (2) (as the case may be) may be made notwithstanding any power contained in a corporation’s constitution enabling the corporation itself to impose similar restrictions on the shares or equity derivatives in question. (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

section.name: s368
section.heading: Power of Financial Secretary to impose restrictions on shares, etc. in connection with investigation

subsection.leadIn: If, in connection with an investigation under section 356, 357 or 358, it appears to the Financial Secretary that there is difficulty in finding out the relevant facts about any shares (whether issued or unissued), he may by order direct that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the shares registered on the Hong Kong register; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the unissued shares which on issue are to be registered on the Hong Kong register,

subsection.continued: shall, until further order, be subject to the restrictions under this Division.

subsection.content: If, in connection with an investigation under section 356, 357 or 358, it appears to the Financial Secretary that there is difficulty in finding out the relevant facts about any equity derivatives, he may by order direct that the equity derivatives shall, until further order, be subject to the restrictions under this Division.

section.name: s369
section.heading: Consequence of order imposing restrictions

subsection.leadIn: So long as any shares are directed to be subject to the restrictions under this Division—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any transfer of those shares;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of unissued shares—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any transfer of the right to be issued with those shares; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any issue of those shares;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any cancellation of those shares or of the relevant certificates for those rights; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any removal of the registration of those shares to a register of members other than the Hong Kong register,

subsection.continued: are void.

subsection.leadIn: Where shares are subject to the restrictions of subsection (1), any agreement to transfer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: those shares; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of unissued shares, the right to be issued with those shares,

subsection.continued: is void (except an agreement to sell those shares on the making of an order under section 371(4)).

subsection.leadIn: So long as any equity derivatives are directed to be subject to the restrictions under this Division—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: any transfer or assignment of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: those equity derivatives; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any rights under those equity derivatives;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the exercise of any rights under those equity derivatives; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any removal of the registration of those equity derivatives to a register of holders of equity derivatives other than a register maintained in Hong Kong,

subsection.continued: are void.

subsection.leadIn: Where equity derivatives are subject to the restrictions of subsection (3), any agreement to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: transfer or assign—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: those equity derivatives; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any rights under those equity derivatives; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: exercise any rights under those equity derivatives,

subsection.continued: is void (except an agreement to sell those equity derivatives on the making of an order under section 371(4)).

section.name: s370
section.heading: Offences for attempted evasion of restrictions

subsection.leadIn: A person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: exercises or purports to exercise any right to dispose of—

subparagraph.content: any shares or equity derivatives; or
any right to be issued with any shares or any right under any equity derivatives,

paragraph.continued: knowing that such shares or equity derivatives are for the time being subject to the restrictions under this Division; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: having an interest in any shares or equity derivatives which, to his knowledge, are for the time being subject to the restrictions under this Division, or being entitled to any right to be issued with other shares or under other equity derivatives in right of them, enters into any agreement which is void under section 369(2) or (4),

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any shares in a corporation are registered as transferred;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any shares in a corporation are issued;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any shares in a corporation are cancelled; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the registration of any shares in a corporation is removed to a register of members other than the Hong Kong register,

subsection.continued: in contravention of the restrictions under this Division, the corporation and every officer of it who is in default commit an offence and each is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any equity derivatives, or any rights under any equity derivatives, are registered as transferred or assigned;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any rights under any equity derivatives are registered as having been exercised; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the registration of any equity derivatives is removed to a register of holders of equity derivatives other than a register maintained in Hong Kong,

subsection.continued: in contravention of the restrictions under this Division, the corporation maintaining such register and every officer of it who is in default commit an offence and each is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s371
section.heading: Relaxation and removal of restrictions

subsection.content: Where shares or equity derivatives are by order made subject to the restrictions under this Division, application may be made to the Court of First Instance (in any case) or the Financial Secretary (if the order applying the restrictions was made by the Financial Secretary under section 367 or 368) for an order directing that the shares or equity derivatives (as the case may be) shall cease to be so subject.

subsection.leadIn: If the order applying the restrictions was made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by the Court of First Instance under section 366 or subsection (14)(a), the application under subsection (1) may be made by any person aggrieved or by the corporation concerned; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by the Financial Secretary under section 367 or 368, the application under subsection (1) may be made by any person aggrieved.

subsection.content: The Financial Secretary has a right to be heard, and to call evidence, at the hearing of the application to the Court of First Instance under subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: Subject to this section, an order of the Court of First Instance or the Financial Secretary directing that shares or equity derivatives (as the case may be) shall cease to be subject to the restrictions may be made only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the Court of First Instance or the Financial Secretary (as the case may be) is satisfied that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: all relevant facts about the interests in the shares or equity derivatives have been disclosed to the corporation concerned or an inspector (as the case may be); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: no unfair advantage has accrued to any person as a result of the earlier failure to make that disclosure; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the shares or equity derivatives are to be sold and the Court of First Instance (in any case) or the Financial Secretary (if the order applying the restrictions was made by the Financial Secretary under section 367 or 368) approves the sale.

subsection.content: Where shares or equity derivatives are by order made subject to the restrictions under this Division, the Court of First Instance may on application order that the shares or equity derivatives shall be sold, subject to the Court’s approval as to the sale, and may further order that the shares or equity derivatives shall cease to be subject to the restrictions.

subsection.leadIn: An application to the Court of First Instance under subsection (5) may be made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by the Financial Secretary (unless the restrictions were imposed by court order under section 366 or subsection (14)(a)); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by the corporation concerned.

subsection.content: The Financial Secretary has a right to be heard, and to call evidence, at the hearing of the application under subsection (5).

Where an order has been made under subsection (5), the Court of First Instance may on application make such further order relating to the sale of the shares or equity derivatives as it considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: An application to the Court of First Instance under subsection (8) may be made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by the Financial Secretary (unless the restrictions were imposed by court order under section 366 or subsection (14)(a));

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by the corporation concerned;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by the person appointed by, or in pursuance of, the order to effect the sale; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: by any person interested in the shares or equity derivatives.

subsection.content: The Financial Secretary has a right to be heard, and to call evidence, at the hearing of the application under subsection (8).

Where equity derivatives are by order made subject to the restrictions under this Division, the Court of First Instance may on application order that rights under the equity derivatives shall be exercised, subject to the Court’s approval as to the manner in which, and the time at which, those rights are to be exercised, and may further order that the equity derivatives shall cease to be subject to the restrictions.

subsection.leadIn: An application to the Court of First Instance under subsection (11) may be made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by the Financial Secretary (unless the restrictions were imposed by court order under section 366 or subsection (14)(a));

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by the corporation concerned; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by any person interested in the equity derivatives.

subsection.content: The Financial Secretary has a right to be heard, and to call evidence, at the hearing of the application under subsection (11).

subsection.leadIn: Where an order has been made under subsection (11), the Court of First Instance may further order, in the case of the exercise of a right under the equity derivatives to call for delivery of shares, or to require another person to take delivery of shares, that the shares due to be delivered on the exercise of the right shall, upon delivery, be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to the restrictions under this Division; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: sold.

def.name: TheCorporationConcerned
def.leadIn: In this section, the corporation concerned (有關法團)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to shares in a corporation that are subject to the restrictions under this Division, means that corporation; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to equity derivatives that are subject to the restrictions under this Division, where the underlying shares of those equity derivatives are shares in a corporation, means that corporation.

section.name: s372
section.heading: Further provisions on sale by court order of restricted shares, etc.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), where shares or equity derivatives are sold in pursuance of an order of the Court of First Instance, or with the approval of the Court of First Instance or the Financial Secretary, under section 371, the proceeds of the sale, less the costs of the sale, shall be paid into court.

subsection.leadIn: Where a right under equity derivatives is exercised in pursuance of an order of the Court of First Instance under section 371(11) and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an amount is received on settlement of the equity derivatives, the proceeds, less the costs incurred in exercising the right; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shares are sold in pursuance of an order of the Court of First Instance under section 371(14)(b), the proceeds of the sale, less the costs of the sale and the costs incurred in exercising the right,

subsection.continued: shall be paid into court.

subsection.content: Any person who had an interest in the shares or equity derivatives from which the proceeds, which have been paid into court under subsection (1) or (2), were derived may apply to the Court of First Instance for an order that the whole or a part of those proceeds be paid to him.
The Financial Secretary has a right to be heard, and to call evidence, at the hearing of an application under subsection (3).

subsection.leadIn: The Court of First Instance may on application under subsection (3)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if it is satisfied that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the applicant was interested in the shares or equity derivatives at the time of the sale or (in the case of the exercise of any right under equity derivatives) at the time of the exercise of the right, and no other person had an interest in the shares or equity derivatives at that time; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: all relevant facts about the applicant’s interest in the shares or equity derivatives have been disclosed to the corporation concerned or an inspector (as the case may be),

paragraph.continued: order the payment to the applicant, subject to subsection (6), of the whole of the proceeds, together with any interest thereon;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if it is satisfied that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the applicant was interested in the shares or equity derivatives at the time of the sale or (in the case of the exercise of any right under equity derivatives) at the time of the exercise of the right, and another person also had an interest in the shares or equity derivatives at that time; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: all relevant facts about the applicant’s interest in the shares or equity derivatives have been disclosed to the corporation concerned or an inspector (as the case may be) by the applicant,

paragraph.continued: order the payment to the applicant, subject to subsection (6), of such part of the proceeds as is equal to the proportion which the value of the applicant’s interest in the shares or equity derivatives bears to the total value of the shares or equity derivatives, together with any interest thereon; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: make such other order as it considers appropriate.

subsection.content: On making an order under subsection (5) or section 371(5), (8), (11) or (14)(b), the Court of First Instance may further order that the costs of the applicant, and the costs of the Financial Secretary (where appropriate), be paid out of the proceeds.

section.name: s373
section.heading: Liability of members for offences by corporations
section.content: Where the affairs of a corporation are managed by its members, section 390(1) applies in relation to the acts and defaults of a member in connection with his functions of management as if he were a director of the corporation.

section.name: s374
section.heading: Mandatory electronic filing of notifications and reports

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to the following documents (specified documents)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a notification required by section 324;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a notification required by section 327(2);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a notification required by section 330(1) or (3);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a report required to be delivered by section 333(1) or (3);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a notification required by section 347;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a notification required by section 350(2).

subsection.leadIn: Despite section 400, a specified document that is required to be given or delivered to a person specified in column 1 of the following table is to be regarded as duly given or delivered only if it is sent to the person specified opposite that person in column 2 of the table—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by means of an electronic transmission system approved under subsection (4); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in accordance with the directions and instructions for the use of that system published under subsection (5).

subsection.leadIn: As soon as practicable after receiving a specified document under subsection (2), the relevant exchange company must send a copy of it to the Commission and (except for a notification under section 330(1) or a report under section 333(1)) to the listed corporation concerned—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by means of an electronic transmission system approved under subsection (4); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in accordance with the directions and instructions for the use of that system published under subsection (5).

subsection.content: The Commission may from time to time approve one or more electronic transmission systems for the purposes of subsections (2) and (3).

As soon as practicable after approving an electronic transmission system under subsection (4), the Commission must publish, in the manner it considers appropriate, directions and instructions for the use of that system.

To avoid doubt, a document (other than a specified document) that is to be given, delivered, issued or sent for the purposes of this Part is to be regarded as duly given, delivered, issued or sent if it is sent in the manner (as appropriate) specified in section 400.

section.name: s375
section.heading: Form of registers and indices

subsection.content: Any register or index required by this Part to be kept by a corporation may be kept either by making entries in a bound book or by recording the matters in question in any other manner.
For the purposes of subsection (1), the corporation may record the matters in question otherwise than in a legible form so long as the recording is capable of being reproduced in a legible form.

If any register or index required by this Part to be kept by a corporation is kept by the corporation by recording the matters in question otherwise than in a legible form, any duty imposed on the corporation by this Part to allow inspection of, or to furnish a copy of, the register or index or any part of it shall be deemed to be a duty to allow inspection of, or to furnish, a reproduction of the recording or of the relevant part of it in a legible form.

If any such register or index is not kept by making entries in a bound book, but by some other means, adequate precautions shall be taken for guarding against falsification and facilitating its discovery.

If default is made in complying with subsection (4), the corporation concerned and every officer of it who is in default commit an offence and each is liable on conviction to a fine at level 1 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $200 for every day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s376
section.heading: Regulations by Chief Executive in Council

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive in Council may make regulations to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: prescribe anything required or permitted by any provision of this Part to be prescribed by regulations;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provide for exclusions from the requirement to give notification under any provision of this Part;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: provide for any other matters for the better carrying out of the objects and purposes of this Part.

subsection.content: Without limiting the generality of the regulations which may be made under subsection (1), such regulations may include any savings, transitional, incidental, supplemental, evidential and consequential provisions (whether involving the provisions of any principal legislation or provisions of any subsidiary legislation).

section.name: s377
section.heading: Rules by Commission
section.leadIn: The Commission may, after consultation with the Financial Secretary, make rules which are not inconsistent with regulations made by the Chief Executive in Council under section 376, to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: prescribe interests and short positions in voting shares in a listed corporation, that are or are to be dealt with pursuant to the provisions of a securities borrowing and lending agreement, to be disregarded for the purposes of section 323 subject to such conditions as may be specified in the rules;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: prescribe circumstances of change in the nature of interests for the purposes of section 313(13);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: provide for exclusions, subject to such conditions as may be specified in the rules, from the requirement to give notification under any provision of this Part in respect of interests, or short positions, in voting shares in a listed corporation that are or are to be dealt with pursuant to the provisions of a securities borrowing and lending agreement.

division.name: D1
division.heading: Secrecy(general), conflict of interests, and immunity

section.name: s378
section.heading: Preservation of secrecy, etc.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (13A), except in the performance of a function under, or for the purpose of carrying into effect or doing anything required or authorized under, any of the relevant provisions, a specified person— (Amended 6 of 2014 s. 39)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall preserve and aid in preserving secrecy with regard to any matter coming to his knowledge by virtue of his appointment under any of the relevant provisions, or in the performance of any function under or in carrying into effect any of the relevant provisions, or in the course of assisting any other person in the performance of any function under or in carrying into effect any of the relevant provisions;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall not communicate any such matter to any other person; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: shall not suffer or permit any other person to have access to any record or document which is in his possession by virtue of the appointment, or the performance of any such function under or the carrying into effect of any such provisions, or the assistance to the other person in the performance of any such function under or in carrying into effect any such provisions.
