subsection.leadIn: Nothing in subsection (1) applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the disclosure of information which has already been made available to the public;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the disclosure of information with a view to the institution of, or otherwise for the purposes of, any criminal proceedings, or any investigation carried out under the relevant provisions or otherwise, in Hong Kong; (Amended 6 of 2014 s. 39)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the disclosure of information for the purpose of seeking advice from, or giving advice by, counsel or a solicitor or other professional adviser acting or proposing to act in a professional capacity in connection with any matter arising under any of the relevant provisions;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the disclosure of information by a person in connection with any judicial or other proceedings to which the person is a party;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the disclosure of information in accordance with an order of a court, or in accordance with a law or a requirement made under a law;

paragraph.name: ea
paragraph.content: the disclosure of information to the Hong Kong Deposit Protection Board established by section 3 of the Deposit Protection Scheme Ordinance (Cap. 581) for the purpose of enabling or assisting the Board to perform its functions under section 5(a), (d) and (e) of that Ordinance; (Added 7 of 2004 s. 55)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: the communication of any information or opinion to which section 381(1) applies (whether with or without reference to section 381(2))—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to the Commission in the manner described in section 381(1);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where section 381(4) applies, to the Insurance Authority or the Monetary Authority (as the case may be) in the manner described in section 381(4).

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding subsection (1), the Commission may disclose information—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the form of a summary compiled from any information in the possession of the Commission, including information provided by persons under any of the relevant provisions, if the summary is so compiled as to prevent particulars relating to the business or identity, or the trading particulars, of any person from being ascertained from it;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to a person who is a liquidator appointed under the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32); (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

paragraph.name: ba
paragraph.content: to a person who is a liquidator appointed under the OFC rules; (Added 16 of 2016 s. 16)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to the Market Misconduct Tribunal;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: to the Securities and Futures Appeals Tribunal;

paragraph.name: ea
paragraph.content: to the Anti-Money Laundering and Counter-Terrorist Financing Review Tribunal established under section 55 of the Anti-Money Laundering and Counter-Terrorist Financing Ordinance (Cap. 615); (Added 15 of 2011 s. 90. Amended 4 of 2018 s. 45)

paragraph.name: eb
paragraph.content: to the Resolution Compensation Tribunal; (Added 23 of 2016 s. 219)

paragraph.name: ec
paragraph.content: to the Resolvability Review Tribunal; (Added 23 of 2016 s. 219)

paragraph.name: ed
paragraph.content: to a resolution authority, for the purpose of enabling or assisting the resolution authority to perform its functions under the Financial Institutions (Resolution) Ordinance (Cap. 628); (Added 23 of 2016 s. 219. Amended E.R. 2 of 2017)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: to the Monetary Authority, if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: the information relates to—

subparagraph.name: A
B
subparagraph.content: any business of an associated entity that is an authorized financial institution, which is that of receiving or holding client assets of the intermediary of which the associated entity is an associated entity; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the opinion of the Commission the condition specified in subsection (5) is satisfied;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: if in the opinion of the Commission the condition specified in subsection (5) is satisfied, to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Chief Executive;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the Financial Secretary;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the Secretary for Justice;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: (Repealed L.N. 106 of 2002);

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: the Insurance Authority;

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: the Registrar of Companies;

subparagraph.name: vii
subparagraph.content: the Official Receiver;
the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes Authority;

subparagraph.name: ix
subparagraph.content: the Privacy Commissioner for Personal Data;

subparagraph.name: x
subparagraph.content: the Ombudsman;

subparagraph.name: xi
subparagraph.content: a public officer authorized by the Financial Secretary under subsection (12);

subparagraph.name: xia
subparagraph.content: the Accounting and Financial Reporting Council continued under section 6 of the Accounting and Financial Reporting Council Ordinance (Cap. 588); (Added 18 of 2006 s. 86. Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

subparagraph.name: xii
subparagraph.content: an inspector appointed by the Financial Secretary to investigate the affairs of a corporation;
a recognized exchange company;

subparagraph.name: xiv
subparagraph.content: a recognized clearing house;

subparagraph.name: xv
subparagraph.content: a recognized exchange controller;

subparagraph.name: xvi
subparagraph.content: a recognized investor compensation company;
a person authorized to provide authorized automated trading services under section 95(2);
the Commissioner of Customs and Excise; (Added 15 of 2022 s. 34)
the Estate Agents Authority; (Added 15 of 2022 s. 34)
The Law Society of Hong Kong; (Added 15 of 2022 s. 34)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: if in the opinion of the Commission the condition specified in subsection (5) is satisfied—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to an authority or regulatory organization outside Hong Kong which, or to a companies inspector outside Hong Kong who, in the opinion of the Commission satisfies the requirements referred to in subsection (6)(a) and (b);

to any body prescribed by rules made under section 397 for the purposes of this subparagraph, with a view to its taking of, or otherwise for the purposes of, any disciplinary action against any of its members or regulatees; (Replaced L.N. 66 of 2022)

paragraph.name: ga
paragraph.leadIn: to an authority in a place outside Hong Kong, if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that authority performs functions in that place broadly comparable to those of a resolution authority in Hong Kong; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: in the opinion of the Commission—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: that authority is subject to adequate secrecy provisions in that place; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the information is necessary to enable or assist that authority to perform functions in that place broadly comparable to those of a resolution authority in Hong Kong; (Added 23 of 2016 s. 219)

paragraph.name: h
i
paragraph.leadIn: where the information is obtained by an investigator under section 183, to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Financial Secretary;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the Secretary for Justice;

subparagraph.name: iia
subparagraph.content: the Resolution Compensation Tribunal; (Added 23 of 2016 s. 219)

subparagraph.name: iib
subparagraph.content: the Resolvability Review Tribunal; (Added 23 of 2016 s. 219)

subparagraph.name: iic
subparagraph.content: a resolution authority, for the purpose of enabling or assisting the resolution authority to perform its functions under the Financial Institutions (Resolution) Ordinance (Cap. 628); (Added 23 of 2016 s. 219. Amended E.R. 2 of 2017)

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the Commissioner of Police;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the Commissioner of the Independent Commission Against Corruption;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: the Market Misconduct Tribunal;

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: the Securities and Futures Appeals Tribunal;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: for the purpose of, or otherwise in connection with, an audit required by section 16;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: with the consent of the person from whom the information was obtained or received and, if the information relates to a different person, also with the consent of the person to whom the information relates.

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding subsection (1), a person who is or was an auditor appointed in relation to a licensed corporation or an associated entity of a licensed corporation under section 159 or 160, and a person who is or was an employee or agent of such auditor, may disclose information obtained or received by him in the course of performing his duties as such auditor or as an employee or agent of such auditor (as the case may be)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the purposes of any judicial or other proceedings arising out of the performance of his duties as such auditor or as an employee or agent of such auditor (as the case may be);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a person who is or was an employee or agent of an auditor, to the auditor.

subsection.leadIn: The condition referred to in subsection (3)(e), (f) and (g) is that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is desirable or expedient that the information should be disclosed pursuant to subsection (3)(e), (f) or (g) (as the case may be) in the interest of the investing public or in the public interest; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the disclosure will enable or assist the recipient of the information to perform its or his functions and it is not contrary to the interest of the investing public or to the public interest that the information should be so disclosed.

subsection.leadIn: Where the Commission is satisfied, for the purposes of subsection (3)(g)(i), that an authority, regulatory organization or companies inspector outside Hong Kong—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: performs any function similar to a function of the Commission or the Registrar of Companies, or regulates, supervises or investigates banking, insurance or other financial services or the affairs of corporations; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is subject to adequate secrecy provisions,

subsection.continued: the Commission shall as soon as reasonably practicable thereafter cause the name of the authority, regulatory organization or companies inspector (as the case may be) to be published in the Gazette.

subsection.leadIn: Where information is disclosed by a specified person pursuant to subsection (1), or in any of the circumstances described in subsection (2), (3) or (4) (other than subsections (2)(a), (3)(a), (g)(i), (ga) and (k) and (4)(b))— (Amended 19 of 2015 s. 27; 23 of 2016 s. 219)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person to whom that information is so disclosed; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other person obtaining or receiving the information, whether directly or indirectly, from the person referred to in paragraph (a),

subsection.continued: shall not disclose the information, or any part thereof, to any other person, unless—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the Commission consents to the disclosure;

paragraph.name: ia
paragraph.content: if the specified person is a recognized exchange company, the Commission or the recognized exchange company consents to the disclosure; (Added 19 of 2015 s. 27)

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: the information or the part thereof (as the case may be) has already been made available to the public;

paragraph.name: iii
paragraph.content: the disclosure is for the purpose of seeking advice from, or giving advice by, counsel or a solicitor or other professional adviser acting or proposing to act in a professional capacity in connection with any matter arising under any of the relevant provisions;

paragraph.name: iv
paragraph.content: the disclosure is in connection with any judicial or other proceedings to which the person or the other person referred to in paragraph (a) or (b) (as the case may be) is a party; or

paragraph.name: v
paragraph.content: the disclosure is in accordance with an order of a court, or in accordance with a law or a requirement made under a law.

subsection.leadIn: Where information is disclosed to an auditor in the circumstances described in subsection (4)(b)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the auditor; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other person obtaining or receiving the information, whether directly or indirectly, from the auditor,

subsection.continued: shall not disclose the information, or any part thereof, to any other person, unless—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: in the case of the auditor, the disclosure is for the purpose described in subsection (4)(a);

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: the Commission consents to the disclosure;

paragraph.name: iii
paragraph.content: the information or the part thereof (as the case may be) has already been made available to the public;

paragraph.name: iv
paragraph.content: the disclosure is for the purpose of seeking advice from, or giving advice by, counsel or a solicitor or other professional adviser acting or proposing to act in a professional capacity in connection with any matter arising under any of the relevant provisions;

paragraph.name: v
paragraph.content: the disclosure is in connection with any judicial or other proceedings to which the auditor or the other person referred to in paragraph (a) or (b) (as the case may be) is a party; or

paragraph.name: vi
paragraph.content: the disclosure is in accordance with an order of a court, or in accordance with a law or a requirement made under a law.

subsection.content: The Commission, in disclosing any information in any of the circumstances described in subsection (3) or in granting any consent pursuant to subsection (7)(i) or (ia) or (8)(ii), may impose such conditions as it considers appropriate. (Amended 19 of 2015 s. 27)

subsection.name: 9A
subsection.content: A recognized exchange company, in granting a consent pursuant to subsection (7)(ia), may impose any condition that it considers appropriate. (Added 19 of 2015 s. 27)

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: Where a person discloses any information in contravention of subsection (7) or (8) and, at the time of disclosure— (Amended 6 of 2014 s. 39 and E.R. 2 of 2015)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a contravention of subsection (7), the person knew or ought reasonably to have known that the information was previously disclosed to the person or to any other person (as the case may be) pursuant to subsection (1) or in any of the circumstances described in subsection (2), (3) or (4) (other than subsections (2)(a), (3)(a), (g)(i), (ga) and (k) and (4)(b)), unless the person proves that the person had reasonable grounds to believe that subsection (7)(i), (ia), (ii), (iii), (iv) or (v) applied to the disclosure of the information by the person; or (Amended 19 of 2015 s. 27; 23 of 2016 s. 219)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a contravention of subsection (8), the person knew or ought reasonably to have known that the information was previously disclosed to the person or an auditor (as the case may be) in the circumstances described in subsection (4)(b), unless the person proves that the person had reasonable grounds to believe that subsection (8)(i), (ii), (iii), (iv), (v) or (vi) applied to the disclosure of the information by the person,

subsection.continued: the person commits an offence and is liable— (Amended 6 of 2014 s. 39 and E.R. 2 of 2015)

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.content: The Financial Secretary may authorize any public officer as a person to whom information may be disclosed under subsection (3)(f)(xi).
Any matter published under subsection (6) is not subsidiary legislation.

subsection.name: 13A
subsection.leadIn: This section does not apply to a person referred to in section 381A(1) in respect of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a matter that comes to the person’s knowledge—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: because of a reason referred to in section 381A(2)(a)(i); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: as described in section 381A(2)(a)(ii) or (iii); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a record or document that is in the person’s possession because of a reason referred to in section 381A(2)(c)(i), (ii) or (iii). (Added 6 of 2014 s. 39)

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: companies inspector (公司審查員), in relation to a place outside Hong Kong, means a person whose functions under the laws of that place include the investigation of the affairs of a corporation carrying on business in that place;

def.name: SpecifiedPerson
def.leadIn: specified person (指明人士) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Commission;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any person who is or was a member, an employee, or a consultant, agent or adviser, of the Commission; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: any person who is or was—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a person appointed under any of the relevant provisions;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a person performing any function under or carrying into effect any of the relevant provisions; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a person assisting any other person in the performance of any function under or in carrying into effect any of the relevant provisions.

section.name: s379
section.heading: Avoidance of conflict of interests

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), any member of the Commission or any person performing any function under any of the relevant provisions shall not directly or indirectly effect or cause to be effected, on his own account or for the benefit of any other person, a transaction regarding any securities, structured product, futures contract, leveraged foreign exchange contract, or an interest in any securities, structured product, futures contract, leveraged foreign exchange contract or collective investment scheme— (Amended 8 of 2011 s. 11)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: which transaction he knows is or is connected with a transaction or a person that is the subject of any investigation or proceedings by the Commission under any of the relevant provisions or the subject of other proceedings under any provision of this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: which transaction he knows is otherwise being considered by the Commission.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply to any transaction which a holder of securities or a structured product effects or causes to be effected by reference to any of his rights as such holder— (Amended 8 of 2011 s. 11)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to exchange the securities or structured product or to convert the securities or structured product to another form of securities or structured product; (Replaced 8 of 2011 s. 11)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to participate in a scheme of arrangement sanctioned by the Court of First Instance under the OFC rules, the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622) or the relevant Ordinance; (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920; 16 of 2016 s. 17)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to subscribe for other securities or another structured product or dispose of a right to subscribe for other securities or another structured product;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: to charge or pledge the securities or structured product to secure the repayment of money;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: to realize the securities or structured product for the purpose of repaying money secured under paragraph (d); or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: to realize the securities or structured product in the course of performing a duty imposed by law. (Amended 8 of 2011 s. 11)

subsection.leadIn: Any member of the Commission or any person performing any function under any of the relevant provisions shall forthwith inform the Commission if, in the course of performing any function under any such provisions, he is required to consider any matter relating to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: any securities, futures contract, leveraged foreign exchange contract, structured product, or an interest in any securities, futures contract, leveraged foreign exchange contract, collective investment scheme or structured product— (Amended 8 of 2011 s. 11)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in which he has an interest;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in which a corporation, in the shares of which he has an interest, has an interest; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.leadIn: which—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: in the case of securities, is of or issued by the same issuer, and of the same class, as those in which he has an interest; (Amended 8 of 2011 s. 11)

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: in the case of a futures contract, is interests, rights or property based upon securities of or issued by the same issuer, and of the same class, as those in which he has an interest; or

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: in the case of a structured product, is interests, rights or property based on a structured product of or issued by the same issuer, and of the same class, as that in which he has an interest; or (Added 8 of 2011 s. 11)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: by whom he is or was employed;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: of whom he is or was a client;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: who is or was his associate; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: whom he knows is or was a client of a person with whom he is or was employed or who is or was his associate.

subsection.leadIn: A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) or (3) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s380
section.heading: Immunity

subsection.leadIn: A person shall not incur any civil liability, whether arising in contract, tort, defamation, equity or otherwise, in respect of any act done or any omission made by reason only of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: his performance or purported performance in good faith of any function (including that under each of the paragraphs of section 5(1)) under any of the relevant provisions; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: his furtherance or purported furtherance in good faith of any regulatory objective, or performance or purported performance in good faith of any function, pursuant to or consequent upon any written direction given by the Chief Executive under section 11.

subsection.content: Nothing in subsection (1) applies to a person appointed as an auditor under section 153.

A person who complies with a requirement made under any provision of this Ordinance shall not incur any civil liability, whether arising in contract, tort, defamation, equity or otherwise, to any person by reason only of that compliance.
Subject to subsection (5), nothing in this Ordinance affects any claims, rights or entitlements which would, apart from this Ordinance, arise on the ground of legal professional privilege.

Nothing in subsection (4) affects any requirement under this Ordinance to disclose the name and address of a client of a legal practitioner (whether or not the legal practitioner is qualified in Hong Kong to practise as counsel or to act as a solicitor).

section.name: s381
section.heading: Immunity in respect of communication with Commission by auditors of listed corporations, etc.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to section 380, a person who is or was an auditor of a corporation which is listed, or of any associated corporation of the corporation, does not incur any civil liability, whether arising in contract, tort, defamation, equity or otherwise, by reason only of the person’s communicating in good faith to the Commission any information or opinion on a matter of which the person becomes or became aware in the person’s capacity as such auditor, being a matter which in the person’s opinion suggests— (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 247)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: that at any time since the formation of the corporation the business of the corporation has been conducted—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: with intent to defraud its creditors, or the creditors of any other person;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: for any fraudulent or unlawful purpose; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: in a manner oppressive to its members or any part of its members;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the corporation was formed for any fraudulent or unlawful purpose;

paragraph.name: ba
paragraph.content: that a registration under section 820C(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622) in relation to the corporation was sought or obtained for any fraudulent or unlawful purpose; (Added 14 of 2025 s. 247)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that persons concerned in the process by which the corporation became listed (including that for making the securities of the corporation available to the public in the course of such process) have engaged, in relation to such process, in defalcation, fraud, misfeasance or other misconduct;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: that at any time since the formation of the corporation persons involved in the management of the affairs of the corporation have engaged, in relation to such management, in defalcation, fraud, misfeasance or other misconduct towards it or its members or any part of its members; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: that at any time since the formation of the corporation members of the corporation or any part of its members have not been given all the information with respect to its affairs that they might reasonably expect.

subsection.leadIn: In addition to applying to a person who is or was an auditor of a corporation which is listed, or of any associated corporation of the corporation, subsection (1) also applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a person who is or was an auditor of a corporation which was formerly listed, or of any associated corporation of that corporation, in which case a reference to matter in that subsection shall be construed on the basis that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: it includes any matter occurring at any time whether before or after the corporation first referred to in this paragraph ceased to remain listed;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the circumstances required to be suggested by the matter under paragraph (a), (b), (c), (d) or (e) of that subsection relate, instead of to the corporation referred to in such paragraph, to the corporation first referred to in this paragraph; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the circumstances required to be suggested by the matter under paragraph (a), (d) or (e) of that subsection occurred at any time since the formation of the corporation but before the corporation ceased to remain listed; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a person who is or was an auditor of a corporation which was formerly an associated corporation of a corporation which is listed, in which case a reference to matter in that subsection shall be construed on the basis that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: it includes any matter occurring at any time whether before or after the corporation first referred to in this paragraph ceased to remain an associated corporation of the corporation which is listed; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the circumstances required to be suggested by the matter under paragraph (a), (b), (c), (d) or (e) of that subsection relate, instead of to the corporation referred to in such paragraph, to the corporation of which the corporation first referred to in this paragraph was formerly an associated corporation.

subsection.content: The application of subsection (1) to any person (whether with or without reference to subsection (2)) is not affected by the fact that the person has, before communicating in the manner described in subsection (1) any information or opinion to which subsection (1) applies (whether with or without reference to subsection (2)), previously communicated such information or opinion to any other person.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to subsection (1), where a person communicates in the manner described in that subsection any information or opinion to which that subsection applies (whether with or without reference to subsection (2)), he shall at the same time communicate the information or opinion to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the corporation of which he is or was an auditor is or was an insurer authorized under the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41), the Insurance Authority; or (Amended 12 of 2015 s. 143)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the corporation of which he is or was an auditor is or was an authorized financial institution, the Monetary Authority.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: AssociatedCorporation
def.leadIn: associated corporation (相聯法團), in relation to a corporation, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a subsidiary of that corporation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a corporation in which that corporation has an interest (whether held by that corporation directly or indirectly through any other corporation or corporations), which is properly accounted for by that corporation in its accounts using the method generally known as equity accounting; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a corporation a substantial shareholder of which is also a substantial shareholder of that corporation;

def.name: Auditor
def.leadIn: auditor (核數師), in relation to a corporation, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person appointed to be an auditor of the corporation for the purposes of any Ordinance, or otherwise for the purposes of auditing the accounts of the corporation (whether or not the person is prohibited under section 20AAZZR of the Accounting and Financial Reporting Council Ordinance (Cap. 588) from holding the appointment or is otherwise qualified for the appointment); or (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person appointed to be an auditor of the corporation for the purposes of any enactment of a place outside Hong Kong which imposes on such person responsibilities comparable to those imposed on an auditor by the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622). (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

division.name: D1A
division.heading: Secrecy, etc. Relating to Monetary Authority’s Functions under Specified Provisions

section.name: s381A
section.heading: Preservation of secrecy

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Monetary Authority and a person who was the Monetary Authority; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a person who is or was—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a consultant, agent or adviser of the Monetary Authority;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a person appointed under section 5A(3) of the Exchange Fund Ordinance (Cap. 66);

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a person appointed by the Monetary Authority under a specified provision; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: a person assisting the Monetary Authority in the performance of a function under a specified provision or in carrying into effect a specified provision.

subsection.leadIn: Except in the performance of a function under a specified provision, or for the purpose of carrying into effect or doing anything required or authorized under a specified provision, a person to whom this section applies—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: must preserve and aid in preserving secrecy with regard to any matter that comes to the person’s knowledge—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: because of the person’s appointment under a specified provision;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the performance of a function under a specified provision or in carrying into effect a specified provision; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: in the course of assisting another person in the performance of a function under a specified provision or in carrying into effect a specified provision;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must not communicate any matter referred to in paragraph (a) to another person; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: must not suffer or permit another person to have access to any record or document that is in the person’s possession because of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the person’s appointment under a specified provision;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the performance of a function under a specified provision or the carrying into effect of a specified provision; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the assistance to the other person in the performance of a function under a specified provision or in carrying into effect a specified provision.

subsection.content: Subsection (2) does not apply to disclosure of information that has already been made available to the public.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2) does not apply to disclosure of information—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: with a view to the institution of, or otherwise for the purposes of, any criminal proceedings in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: with a view to the commencement of, or otherwise for the purposes of, an investigation carried out in Hong Kong under a specified provision or otherwise;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for the purpose of seeking advice from, or giving advice by, counsel or a solicitor or other professional adviser acting or proposing to act in a professional capacity in connection with a matter arising under a specified provision;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in connection with any judicial or other proceedings to which the person is a party;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: in accordance with an order of a court, or in accordance with a law or a requirement made under a law;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: to a person appointed under section 5A(3) of the Exchange Fund Ordinance (Cap. 66), if the disclosure will enable or assist the person to assist the Monetary Authority in performing a function referred to in that section; or

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: to the Hong Kong Deposit Protection Board established by section 3 of the Deposit Protection Scheme Ordinance (Cap. 581) for the purpose of enabling or assisting the Board to perform its functions under that Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: information (資料) means a matter referred to in subsection (2)(a) or a record or document referred to in subsection (2)(c).

section.name: s381B
section.heading: Disclosure by Monetary Authority

subsection.leadIn: Despite section 381A(2), the Monetary Authority may disclose information—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: to the Securities and Futures Appeals Tribunal;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: to the Market Misconduct Tribunal;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: to the Banking Review Tribunal established under section 101A of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155);

paragraph.name: ea
paragraph.content: to the Resolution Compensation Tribunal; (Added 23 of 2016 s. 220)

paragraph.name: eb
paragraph.content: to the Resolvability Review Tribunal; (Added 23 of 2016 s. 220)

paragraph.name: ec
f
paragraph.content: to the Anti-Money Laundering and Counter-Terrorist Financing Review Tribunal established under section 55 of the Anti-Money Laundering and Counter-Terrorist Financing Ordinance (Cap. 615); or (Amended 4 of 2018 s. 46)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: for the purpose of enabling or assisting the Monetary Authority to perform the Monetary Authority’s functions under a specified provision, to an auditor or a former auditor of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an authorized financial institution or a former authorized financial institution; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an approved money broker or a former approved money broker.

subsection.leadIn: Despite section 381A(2), the Monetary Authority may disclose information obtained by an MA investigator under section 184B to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Financial Secretary; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Secretary for Justice.

subsection.leadIn: Despite section 381A(2), but subject to section 381E(1), the Monetary Authority may disclose to the Commission—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: information relating to a person other than an authorized financial institution or an approved money broker; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: information relating to an authorized financial institution or an approved money broker if the Monetary Authority is of the opinion that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: it is desirable or expedient that the information should be disclosed to the Commission in the interests of the investing public or in the public interest; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the disclosure will enable or assist the Commission to perform its functions and it is not contrary to the interests of the investing public or to the public interest.

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.leadIn: Despite section 381A(2), the Monetary Authority may disclose information to an authority in a place outside Hong Kong if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that authority performs functions in that place broadly comparable to those of a resolution authority in Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the opinion of the Monetary Authority—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that authority is subject to adequate secrecy provisions in that place; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the information is necessary to enable or assist that authority to perform functions in that place broadly comparable to those of a resolution authority in Hong Kong. (Added 23 of 2016 s. 220)

subsection.content: Despite section 381A(2), the Monetary Authority may disclose information in the form of a summary compiled from any information in the Monetary Authority’s possession, including information provided by a person under a specified provision, if the summary is so compiled as to prevent particulars relating to the business or identity of any person from being ascertained from it.

Despite section 381A(2), the Monetary Authority may disclose information with the consent of the person from whom the information was obtained or received, and if the information relates to a different person, with the consent also of that person.
The Monetary Authority may, in disclosing information under this section, impose any condition that the Monetary Authority considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: information (資料) means a matter referred to in section 381A(2)(a) or a record or document referred to in section 381A(2)(c).

section.name: s381C
section.heading: Disclosure if Monetary Authority considers condition satisfied

subsection.leadIn: Despite section 381A(2), if in the opinion of the Monetary Authority, the condition in subsection (3) is satisfied, the Monetary Authority may disclose information—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to the Chief Executive;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to the Financial Secretary;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to the Secretary for Justice;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: to the Commissioner of Police;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: to the Commissioner of the Independent Commission Against Corruption;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: to the Insurance Authority;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: to the Registrar of Companies;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: to the Official Receiver;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: to the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes Authority;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: to the Privacy Commissioner for Personal Data;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: to the Ombudsman;

paragraph.name: l
paragraph.content: to a public officer authorized under subsection (8);

paragraph.name: m
paragraph.content: to the Accounting and Financial Reporting Council continued under section 6 of the Accounting and Financial Reporting Council Ordinance (Cap. 588); (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

paragraph.name: n
paragraph.content: to an inspector appointed by the Financial Secretary to investigate the affairs of a corporation;

paragraph.name: o
paragraph.content: to a recognized exchange company;

paragraph.name: p
paragraph.content: to a recognized clearing house;

paragraph.name: q
paragraph.content: to a recognized exchange controller;

paragraph.name: r
paragraph.content: to a recognized investor compensation company;

paragraph.name: s
paragraph.content: to a person authorized under section 95(2) to provide authorized automated trading services; or

paragraph.name: t
paragraph.content: with a view to the institution of, or otherwise for the purposes of, any disciplinary proceedings relating to the performance of professional duties by an auditor or a former auditor of an authorized financial institution or a former authorized financial institution.

subsection.leadIn: Despite section 381A(2), if in the opinion of the Monetary Authority, the condition in subsection (3) is satisfied, the Monetary Authority may also disclose information to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an authority or regulatory organization outside Hong Kong which, in the opinion of the Monetary Authority, satisfies the requirements referred to in subsection (4); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a companies inspector outside Hong Kong who, in the opinion of the Monetary Authority, satisfies the requirements referred to in subsection (5).

subsection.leadIn: The condition referred to in subsections (1) and (2) is that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is desirable or expedient that the information should be disclosed in the interests of the investing public or in the public interest; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the disclosure of the information will enable or assist the recipient of the information to perform the recipient’s functions and it is not contrary to the interests of the investing public or to the public interest.

subsection.leadIn: The requirements referred to in subsection (2)(a) are that the authority or regulatory organization outside Hong Kong—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: performs functions similar to the functions of the Monetary Authority or regulates, supervises or investigates banking, insurance or other financial services; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is subject to adequate secrecy provisions.

subsection.leadIn: The requirements referred to in subsection (2)(b) are that the companies inspector outside Hong Kong—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: performs functions similar to the functions of the Registrar of Companies or regulates, supervises or investigates the affairs of corporations; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is subject to adequate secrecy provisions.

subsection.content: If the Monetary Authority is satisfied of the matters referred to in subsection (4)(a) and (b) or (5)(a) and (b), the Monetary Authority must, as soon as reasonably practicable after being so satisfied, publish in the Gazette, the name of the authority, regulatory organization or companies inspector.
The Monetary Authority may, in disclosing information under this section, impose any condition that the Monetary Authority considers appropriate.
The Financial Secretary may authorize a public officer as a person to whom information may be disclosed under subsection (1)(l).
A matter published under subsection (6) is not subsidiary legislation.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: companies inspector (公司審查員), in relation to a place outside Hong Kong, has the meaning given by section 378(15);
information (資料) has the meaning given by section 381B(7).

section.name: s381D
section.heading: Restrictions on disclosure by persons to whom information is disclosed

subsection.leadIn: If information is disclosed pursuant to section 381A(2) or in any of the circumstances described in section 381A(4), 381B(1) or (2) or 381C(1), unless subsection (2) applies—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person to whom the information is disclosed; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other person obtaining or receiving the information from the person to whom the information is disclosed, either directly or indirectly,

subsection.continued: must not disclose the information or any part of it to any other person.

subsection.leadIn: Information disclosed as described in subsection (1) may be disclosed to any other person if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Monetary Authority consents to the disclosure;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the information has already been made available to the public;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the disclosure is of a part that has already been made available to the public;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the disclosure is for the purpose of seeking advice from, or giving advice by, counsel or a solicitor or other professional adviser acting or proposing to act in a professional capacity in connection with a matter arising under a specified provision;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the disclosure is in connection with any judicial or other proceedings to which the person or other person referred to in subsection (1)(a) or (b) is a party; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the disclosure is in accordance with an order of a court, or in accordance with a law or a requirement made under a law.

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority may, in giving any consent under subsection (2)(a), impose any condition that the Monetary Authority considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: A person referred to in subsection (1)(a) to whom information is disclosed commits an offence if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: discloses information in contravention of that subsection; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at the time of the disclosure knew or ought reasonably to have known that the information was previously disclosed to the person pursuant to section 381A(2) or in any of the circumstances described in section 381A(4), 381B(1) or (2) or 381C(1),

subsection.continued: unless the person proves that the person had reasonable grounds to believe that subsection (2) applied to the disclosure by the person.

subsection.leadIn: A person referred to in subsection (1)(b) who obtains or receives information commits an offence if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: discloses information in contravention of that subsection; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at the time of the disclosure knew or ought reasonably to have known that the information was previously disclosed to the person referred to in subsection (1)(a) under section 381A(2) or in any of the circumstances described in section 381A(4), 381B(1) or (2) or 381C(1),

subsection.continued: unless the person proves that the person had reasonable grounds to believe that subsection (2) applied to the disclosure by the person.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (4) or (5) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: To avoid doubt—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: this section does not apply to information disclosed to the Commission under this Division; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 378 applies to information disclosed to the Commission under this Division.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: information (資料) has the meaning given by section 381B(7).

section.name: s381E
section.heading: Certain information to be given to Commission

subsection.leadIn: Despite section 381A(2), if requested by the Commission, the Monetary Authority must give to the Commission any information received or obtained by the Monetary Authority that relates to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an OTC derivative transaction that is reported (whether directly or indirectly) under section 101B(1) by a prescribed person that is not an authorized financial institution or an approved money broker;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: an OTC derivative transaction that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is reported (whether directly or indirectly) under section 101B(1) or (3) by an authorized financial institution or an approved money broker; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is a transaction to which a prescribed person other than an authorized financial institution or an approved money broker is a counterparty; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: an OTC derivative transaction that is reported (whether directly or indirectly) under section 101B(1) or (3) by an authorized financial institution or an approved money broker and is a transaction—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in an OTC derivative product of which the underlying subject matter includes securities, futures contracts, indices of securities or futures contracts or any combination of those; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in an OTC derivative product that falls within subsection (1)(a)(iii) of section 1A of Part 1 of Schedule 1 and the underlying subject matter is a credit event.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: CreditEvent
def.leadIn: credit event (信用事件), in relation to a transaction in an OTC derivative product that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: falls within subsection (1)(a)(iii) of section 1A of Part 1 of Schedule 1; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: transfers credit risk in relation to a reference obligation from one party to the other party,

def.continued: means an event, which, if it occurs, obliges one party to make payment to the other party;

subsection.def: credit risk (信用風險) means the risk of loss from default by a party in a contract of indebtedness;

reference obligation (參照義務), in relation to an OTC derivative transaction, means the obligation specified in the transaction of an entity specified in the transaction, pursuant to which the basis for the settlement of the transaction is determined.

section.name: s381F
section.heading: Disclosure of information to persons outside Hong Kong with similar functions

subsection.def: Despite section 381A(2), the Monetary Authority may disclose information received or obtained by the Monetary Authority because of the reporting obligation to a person in a place outside Hong Kong (person outside Hong Kong) who, in the opinion of the Monetary Authority, satisfies the requirements specified in subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: The requirements are that the person outside Hong Kong— (Amended 31 of 2025 s. 170)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: performs a function similar to that of the Monetary Authority in collecting and maintaining records for the purposes of the reporting obligation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is subject to adequate regulation and supervision (including adequate requirements to preserve secrecy) under the law of the place in which the person outside Hong Kong operates; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: operates in accordance with international standards that are acceptable to the Monetary Authority.

subsection.content: When disclosing any information to a person outside Hong Kong, the Monetary Authority may consent to the information being disclosed by the person outside Hong Kong to any other person subject to conditions imposed by the Monetary Authority.

If the Monetary Authority is satisfied of the matters referred to in subsection (2) regarding a person outside Hong Kong, the Monetary Authority must, as soon as reasonably practicable, publish in the Gazette the name of the person outside Hong Kong.
A matter published under subsection (4) is not subsidiary legislation.

division.name: D2
division.heading: General provisions regarding proceedings and offences

section.name: s382
section.heading: Obstruction

subsection.leadIn: A person who, without reasonable excuse, obstructs any specified person in the performance of a function under or in carrying into effect any provision of this Ordinance commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

def.name: SpecifiedPerson
def.leadIn: In this section, specified person (指明人士) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Commission;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any member, employee, or consultant, agent or adviser, of the Commission; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any person appointed to investigate any matter under section 182(1).

section.name: s383
section.heading: False or misleading representations in applications to Commission

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he, in support of any application made to the Commission under or pursuant to any provision of this Ordinance, whether for himself or for another person, makes a representation, whether in writing, orally or otherwise, that is false or misleading in a material particular; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: he knows that, or is reckless as to whether, the representation is false or misleading in a material particular.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

def.name: Representation
def.leadIn: In this section, representation (陳述) means a representation or statement—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: of a matter of fact, either present or past;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: about a future event; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: about an existing intention, opinion, belief, knowledge or other state of mind.

section.name: s384
section.heading: Provision of false or misleading information

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), a person commits an offence if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he, in purported compliance with a requirement to provide information imposed by or under any of the relevant provisions, provides to a specified recipient any information which is false or misleading in a material particular; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: he knows that, or is reckless as to whether, the information is false or misleading in a material particular.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) does not apply to the provision of information which is false or misleading in a material particular if the provision of such information in purported compliance with a requirement imposed by or under any of the relevant provisions would, apart from subsection (1), also constitute an offence under any of the relevant provisions.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (4), a person commits an offence if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he, otherwise than in purported compliance with a requirement to provide information imposed by or under any of the relevant provisions but in connection with the performance by a specified recipient of a function under any of the relevant provisions, provides to the specified recipient any record or document which is false or misleading in a material particular; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: he—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: knows that, or is reckless as to whether, the record or document is false or misleading in a material particular; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: has, in relation to the provision of the record or document, received prior written warning from the specified recipient to the effect that the provision of any record or document which is false or misleading in a material particular in the circumstances of the case would constitute an offence under this subsection.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (5), no person shall be convicted of an offence under subsection (3) unless the prosecution proves that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the specified recipient to which the record or document in question has been provided has reasonably relied on the record or document; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person intended that the specified recipient would rely on the record or document.

subsection.leadIn: Nothing in subsection (4)(a) requires it to be proved that the specified recipient who has reasonably relied on any record or document—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: was misled;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: suffered any detriment; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: incurred any loss,

subsection.continued: as a result of such reliance.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 1 year.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (3) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 6 months; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

def.name: SpecifiedRecipient
def.leadIn: In this section, specified recipient (指明收受者) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Commission;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a recognized exchange company;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a recognized clearing house; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a recognized exchange controller.

section.name: s385
section.heading: Power of Commission to intervene in proceedings

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there are any judicial or other proceedings (other than criminal proceedings) which concern a matter provided for in any of the relevant provisions, or in which the Commission has an interest by virtue of its functions under any of the relevant provisions; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Commission is satisfied that it is in the public interest for the Commission to intervene and be heard in the proceedings,

subsection.continued: the Commission, after consultation with the Financial Secretary, may, by an application made in accordance with subsection (2) to the court hearing or otherwise having competent authority to hear the proceedings, apply to intervene and be heard in the proceedings.

subsection.leadIn: An application made for the purposes of subsection (1) shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: made in writing; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: supported by an affidavit showing that the conditions set out in subsection (1)(a) and (b) are satisfied.

subsection.content: A copy of the application made for the purposes of subsection (1) shall be served on each of the parties to the proceedings to which the application relates as soon as reasonably practicable after the application is made.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (5), the court to which an application is made for the purposes of subsection (1) may by order—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: allow the application, subject to such terms as it considers just; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: refuse the application.

subsection.content: The court to which an application is made for the purposes of subsection (1) shall not make an order pursuant to subsection (4)(a) or (b) without first giving the Commission, and each of the parties to the proceedings to which the application relates, a reasonable opportunity of being heard.

subsection.leadIn: Where an application made for the purposes of subsection (1) is allowed under subsection (4)(a), the Commission, subject to the terms referred to in subsection (4)(a)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may intervene and be heard in the proceedings to which the application relates; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall be regarded for all purposes as a party to the proceedings and shall have the rights, duties and liabilities of such a party.

subsection.content: Nothing in this section prejudices Order 15, rule 6 of the Rules of the High Court (Cap. 4 sub. leg. A).

subsection.def: In this section, court (法院) includes a magistrate and a tribunal, other than the Market Misconduct Tribunal and the Securities and Futures Appeals Tribunal.

section.name: s385A
section.heading: Power of Monetary Authority to intervene in proceedings

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may, after consultation with the Financial Secretary, make an application to intervene in and be heard in any judicial or other proceedings, other than criminal proceedings, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the proceedings concern a matter provided for in a specified provision or the Monetary Authority has an interest in the proceedings because of the Monetary Authority’s functions under a specified provision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Monetary Authority is satisfied that it is in the public interest for the Monetary Authority to intervene in and be heard in the proceedings.

subsection.leadIn: The following applies in respect of an application made for the purposes of subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the application must be made to the court hearing the proceedings or which otherwise has jurisdiction to hear the proceedings;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the application must—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: be made in writing; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: be supported by an affidavit showing that the conditions set out in subsection (1)(a) and (b) are satisfied; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a copy of the application must be served on each party to the proceedings as soon as reasonably practicable after the application is made.

subsection.leadIn: The court to which the application is made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: may by order—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: allow the application subject to any terms that it considers just; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: refuse the application; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may not make an order under paragraph (a) without first giving the Monetary Authority, and each party to the proceedings, a reasonable opportunity of being heard.

subsection.leadIn: If the application is allowed, the Monetary Authority, subject to the terms referred to in subsection (3)(a)(i)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may intervene in and be heard in the proceedings;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is to be regarded for all purposes as a party to the proceedings; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: has all the rights, duties and liabilities of a party to the proceedings.

subsection.content: This section does not affect Order 15, rule 6 of the Rules of the High Court (Cap. 4 sub. leg. A).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: court (法院) includes a magistrate and a tribunal other than the Market Misconduct Tribunal and the Securities and Futures Appeals Tribunal.

section.name: s386
section.heading: Proceedings not to be stayed

subsection.content: The existence of any judicial or other proceedings, or circumstances that disclose the commission of an offence, shall not by itself constitute justification for any other proceedings or action under this Ordinance being stayed or deferred.

subsection.leadIn: For the avoidance of doubt, nothing in subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: affects any other law requiring or providing for a stay of any proceedings or action under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: prevents a court of competent jurisdiction from ordering that any proceedings or action under this Ordinance shall be stayed or deferred.

section.name: s387
section.heading: Standard of proof
section.leadIn: Where it is necessary for the Commission to establish or to be satisfied, for the purposes of any of the relevant provisions (other than provisions relating to criminal proceedings or to an offence), that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a person has contravened—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any provision of any Ordinance;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any notice or requirement given or made under or pursuant to any provision of any Ordinance;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: any of the terms and conditions of any licence or registration under this Ordinance; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: any other condition imposed under or pursuant to any provision of this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person has been responsible for an unlawful act or omission;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a person has assisted, counselled, procured or induced any other person to do anything which results in the occurrence of any of the matters referred to in paragraph (a) or (b);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a person has been concerned in, or a party to, anything which results in the occurrence of any of the matters referred to in paragraph (a) or (b);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a person has attempted, or conspired with any other person, to commit anything which results in the occurrence of any of the matters referred to in paragraph (a) or (b); or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: any of the matters referred to in paragraphs (a) to (e) might occur,

section.continued: it is sufficient for the Commission to establish, or to be satisfied as to, the matter referred to in paragraph (a), (b), (c), (d), (e) or (f) (as the case may be) on the standard of proof applicable to civil proceedings in a court of law.

section.name: s387A
section.heading: Civil proceedings by Commission
section.content: The Commission may begin or carry on any civil proceedings by a solicitor or otherwise.

section.name: s388
section.heading: Prosecution of certain offences by Commission

subsection.content: An offence under any of the relevant provisions, and an offence of conspiracy to commit such an offence, may be prosecuted by the Commission in its own name but, where under this subsection the Commission prosecutes an offence, the offence shall be tried before a magistrate as an offence which is triable summarily.

For, and only for, the purpose of the prosecution of an offence referred to in subsection (1), an employee of the Commission who apart from this subsection is not qualified to practise as a barrister or to act as a solicitor under the Legal Practitioners Ordinance (Cap. 159) may appear and plead before a magistrate any case of which he has charge and shall, in relation to the prosecution, have all the other rights of a person qualified to practise as a barrister or to act as a solicitor under that Ordinance.
Nothing in this section derogates from the powers of the Secretary for Justice in respect of the prosecution of criminal offences.
This section does not apply to an offence referred to in section 388A(1) or conspiracy to commit such an offence. (Added 6 of 2014 s. 42)

section.name: s388A
section.heading: Prosecution of offences by Monetary Authority

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to an offence committed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: under section 184D;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: under section 191(6) in relation to the execution of a warrant issued on information on oath laid by an MA investigator; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: under section 381D.

subsection.content: The Monetary Authority may prosecute an offence to which this section applies or an offence of conspiracy to commit such an offence, in the name of the Monetary Authority.
Any offence prosecuted under subsection (2) must be tried before a magistrate as an offence that is triable summarily.

subsection.leadIn: For prosecuting an offence referred to in subsection (1) or (2) only, a person appointed under section 5A(3) of the Exchange Fund Ordinance (Cap. 66), even if he or she is not qualified to practise as a barrister or to act as a solicitor under the Legal Practitioners Ordinance (Cap. 159)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may appear and plead before a magistrate in any case of which that person has charge; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has, in relation to the prosecution, all the other rights of a person qualified to practise as a barrister or to act as a solicitor under that Ordinance.

subsection.content: This section does not derogate from the powers of the Secretary for Justice in respect of the prosecution of criminal offences.

section.name: s389
section.heading: Limitation on commencement of proceedings

subsection.content: Notwithstanding section 26 of the Magistrates Ordinance (Cap. 227), any information or complaint relating to an offence under this Ordinance, other than an indictable offence, may be tried if it is laid or made (as the case may be) at any time within 3 years after the commission of the offence.
Nothing in section 388(1) or 388A(3) affects or limits the meaning of indictable offence referred to in subsection (1). (Amended 6 of 2014 s. 44)

section.name: s390
section.heading: Liability of officers of corporations for offences by corporations, and of partners for offences by other partners

subsection.content: Where the commission of an offence under this Ordinance by a corporation is proved to have been aided, abetted, counselled, procured or induced by, or committed with the consent or connivance of, or attributable to any recklessness on the part of, any officer of the corporation, or any person who was purporting to act in any such capacity, that person, as well as the corporation, is guilty of the offence and is liable to be proceeded against and punished accordingly.

Where the commission of an offence under this Ordinance by a partner in a partnership is proved to have been aided, abetted, counselled, procured or induced by, or committed with the consent or connivance of, or attributable to any recklessness on the part of, any other partner of the partnership, that other partner, as well as the first-mentioned partner, is guilty of the offence and is liable to be proceeded against and punished accordingly.

section.name: s391
section.heading: Civil liability for false or misleading public communications concerning securities and futures contracts

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (3) to (7), where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person is responsible for a relevant communication being made or issued to the public, or to a group of persons comprising members of the public (including the shareholders of a listed corporation or the holders of listed securities);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the relevant communication concerns securities or futures contracts, or may affect the price of securities or the price for dealings in futures contracts;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the relevant communication is false or misleading in a material particular; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the person knows that, or is reckless or negligent as to whether, the relevant communication is false or misleading in a material particular,

subsection.continued: that person shall, whether or not he also incurs any other liability, be liable to pay compensation by way of damages to any other person for any pecuniary loss sustained by the other person as a result of his acting, or refraining from acting in a manner in which he would otherwise have acted, in reliance on the relevant communication.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1), a person responsible for a relevant communication being made or issued includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any person making or issuing it; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any person who in a material manner participated in, or approved, the making or issuing of it.

subsection.content: No person shall be liable to pay compensation under subsection (1) to any other person in respect of a relevant communication unless it is fair, just and reasonable in the circumstances of the case that he should be so liable.

subsection.leadIn: No person shall be liable to pay compensation under subsection (1) to any other person by reason only of the issue or reproduction of a relevant communication if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the issue or reproduction of the relevant communication took place in the ordinary course of a business (whether or not carried on by him), the principal purpose of which was issuing or reproducing materials provided by others;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the contents of the relevant communication were not, wholly or partly, devised—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: where the business was carried on by him, by himself or any officer, employee or agent of his; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where the business was not carried on by him, by himself;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: for the purposes of the issue or reproduction—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: where the business was carried on by him, he or any officer, employee or agent of his; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where the business was not carried on by him, he,

paragraph.continued: did not select, add to, modify or otherwise exercise control over the contents of the relevant communication; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: at the time of the issue or reproduction, he did not know that the relevant communication was false or misleading in a material particular.

subsection.leadIn: No person shall be liable to pay compensation under subsection (1) to any other person by reason only of the re-transmission of a relevant communication if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the re-transmission of the relevant communication took place in the ordinary course of a business (whether or not carried on by him), the normal conduct of which involved the re-transmission of information to other persons within an information system or from one information system to another information system (wherever situated), whether directly or by facilitating the establishment of links between such other persons and third parties;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the contents of the relevant communication were not, wholly or partly, devised—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: where the business was carried on by him, by himself or any officer, employee or agent of his; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where the business was not carried on by him, by himself;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: for the purposes of the re-transmission—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: where the business was carried on by him, he or any officer, employee or agent of his; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where the business was not carried on by him, he,

paragraph.continued: did not select, add to, modify or otherwise exercise control over the contents of the relevant communication;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: the re-transmission of the relevant communication was accompanied by a message to the effect, or was effected following acknowledgment by the persons to whom it was re-transmitted of their understanding, that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: where the business was carried on by him, he or any officer, employee or agent of his; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where the business was not carried on by him, the person who carried on the business or any officer, employee or agent of that person,

paragraph.continued: did not devise the contents of the relevant communication, and neither took responsibility for it nor endorsed its accuracy; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: at the time of the re-transmission—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: he did not know that the relevant communication was false or misleading in a material particular; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: he knew that the relevant communication was false or misleading in a material particular, but—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: where the business was carried on by him, in the circumstances of the case he could not reasonably be expected to prevent the re-transmission; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: where the business was not carried on by him, in the circumstances of the case he has taken all reasonable steps to bring the fact that the relevant communication was so false or misleading to the attention of a person in a position to take steps to cause the re-transmission to be prevented (even if the re-transmission in fact took place).

subsection.leadIn: No person shall be liable to pay compensation under subsection (1) to any other person by reason only of the live broadcast of a relevant communication if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the broadcast of the relevant communication took place in the ordinary course of the business of a broadcaster (whether or not he was such broadcaster);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the contents of the relevant communication were not, wholly or partly, devised—

subparagraph.name: i
