subparagraph.content: where he was the broadcaster, by himself or any officer, employee or agent of his; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where he was not the broadcaster, by himself;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: for the purposes of the broadcast—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: where he was the broadcaster, he or any officer, employee or agent of his; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where he was not the broadcaster, he,

paragraph.continued: did not select, add to, modify or otherwise exercise control over the contents of the relevant communication;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to the broadcast—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: where he was the broadcaster, he; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where he was not the broadcaster, he believed and had reasonable grounds to believe that the broadcaster,

paragraph.continued: acted in accordance with the terms and conditions of the licence (if any) by which he or the broadcaster (as the case may be) became entitled to broadcast as a broadcaster and with any code of practice or guidelines (however described) issued under or pursuant to the Telecommunications Ordinance (Cap. 106) or the Broadcasting Ordinance (Cap. 562) and applicable to him or the broadcaster (as the case may be) as a broadcaster; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: at the time of the broadcast—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: he did not know that the relevant communication was false or misleading in a material particular; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: he knew that the relevant communication was false or misleading in a material particular, but—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: where he was the broadcaster, in the circumstances of the case he could not reasonably be expected to prevent the broadcast; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: where he was not the broadcaster, in the circumstances of the case he has taken all reasonable steps to bring the fact that the relevant communication was so false or misleading to the attention of a person in a position to take steps to cause the broadcast to be prevented (even if the broadcast in fact took place).

subsection.leadIn: Where an action is brought against a person under subsection (1) by reference to subsection (2)(b) in respect of a relevant communication, it is a defence for the person to prove—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that he only participated in, or approved, the making or issuing of a part of the relevant communication and that the part was not false or misleading in a material particular; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the action is brought on the basis that he participated in the making or issuing of the relevant communication, that at the time when it was made or issued, he opposed the making or issuing of it because it was false or misleading in a material particular.

subsection.content: For the avoidance of doubt, where a court has jurisdiction to determine an action brought under subsection (1), it may, where it is, apart from this section, within its jurisdiction to entertain an application for an injunction, grant an injunction in addition to, or in substitution for, damages, on such terms and conditions as it considers appropriate.

This section does not confer a right of action in any case to which section 40 of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32) (whether with or without reference to section 342E of that Ordinance) or section 108 applies. (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)
Nothing in this section affects, limits or diminishes any rights conferred on a person, or any liabilities a person may incur, under the common law or any other enactment.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: Issue
def.leadIn: issue (發出), in relation to any material (including any relevant communication), includes publishing, circulating, distributing or otherwise disseminating the material or the contents thereof, whether—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by any visit in person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in a newspaper, magazine, journal or other publication;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by the display of posters or notices;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: by means of circulars, brochures, pamphlets or handbills;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: by an exhibition of photographs or cinematograph films;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: by way of sound or television broadcasting;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: by any information system or other electronic device; or

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: by any other means, whether mechanically, electronically, magnetically, optically, manually or by any other medium, or by way of production or transmission of light, image or sound or any other medium,

def.continued: and also includes causing or authorizing the material to be issued;

subsection.def: relevant communication (有關通訊) means any communication, including any announcement, disclosure and statement, and any combination thereof.

division.name: D3
division.heading: Power to make rules, and codes or guidelines, etc.

section.name: s392
section.heading: Financial Secretary to prescribe interests, etc. as securities, etc.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance, the Financial Secretary may, by notice published in the Gazette, prescribe, either generally or in a particular case, that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: any interests, rights or property, whether in the form of an instrument or otherwise, or any class or description of any such interests, rights or property, are to be regarded as—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: currency-linked instruments;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: currency and interest rate-linked instruments;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: futures contracts;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: interest rate-linked instruments;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: securities;

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: structured products; or

subparagraph.name: vii
subparagraph.content: OTC derivative products; or (Added 6 of 2014 s. 45)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: any interests, rights or property, whether in the form of an instrument or otherwise, or any class or description of any such interests, rights or property, are not to be regarded as—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: currency-linked instruments;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: currency and interest rate-linked instruments;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: futures contracts;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: interest rate-linked instruments;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: securities;

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: structured products; or

subparagraph.name: vii
subparagraph.content: OTC derivative products. (Added 6 of 2014 s. 45)

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (1), a notice under that subsection may prescribe the circumstances under which or the purposes for which any interests, rights or property, or any class or description of any interests, rights or property, referred to in the notice are to be regarded, or not to be regarded, as—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: currency-linked instruments;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: currency and interest rate-linked instruments;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: futures contracts;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: interest rate-linked instruments;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: securities;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: structured products; or

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: OTC derivative products. (Added 6 of 2014 s. 45)

section.name: s392A
section.heading: Financial Secretary to prescribe markets, instruments etc.
section.leadIn: The Financial Secretary may, by notice published in the Gazette, prescribe—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any stock market, futures market, or clearing house for the purpose of section 1B(2)(c) of Part 1 of Schedule 1; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any type of instrument for the purpose of section 1B(2)(f)(i) of Part 1 of Schedule 1.

section.name: s393
section.heading: Financial Secretary to prescribe arrangements as collective investment schemes

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance, the Financial Secretary may by notice published in the Gazette prescribe, either generally or in a particular case, that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: any arrangements, or any class or description of arrangements, is to be regarded as collective investment schemes, where the arrangements—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: are made available in the course of business and have the purpose or effect, or pretended purpose or effect, of enabling the participating persons—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: to acquire any right, interest, title or benefit in any property for valuable consideration;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: to defer taking possession of the property; and

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: to transfer or retransfer any right, interest, title or benefit in the property to a person who is a party to, or is referred to in, the arrangements; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: have the purpose or effect, or pretended purpose or effect, of enabling the participating persons, whether by acquiring any right, interest, title or benefit in any property or any part of the property or otherwise, to participate in or receive—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: profits, income or other returns represented to arise or to be likely to arise from the acquisition, holding, management or disposal of the property or any part of the property, or sums represented to be paid or to be likely to be paid out of any such profits, income or other returns; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: a payment or other returns arising from the acquisition, holding or disposal of, the exercise of any right in, the redemption of, or the expiry of, any right, interest, title or benefit in the property or any part of the property;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any arrangements, or any class or description of arrangements, is not to be regarded as collective investment schemes.

subsection.content: Without limiting the generality of subsection (1), a notice under that subsection may prescribe the circumstances under which or the purposes for which any arrangements, or any class or description of arrangements, referred to in the notice is to be regarded, or not to be regarded, as collective investment schemes.

section.name: s394
section.heading: Orders by Chief Executive in Council for levies

subsection.leadIn: A levy (if any) at the rate specified by the Chief Executive in Council by order published in the Gazette shall be payable to the Commission by the person or persons so specified by the Chief Executive in Council for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: every sale and purchase of any securities which is recorded on a recognized stock market or notified to a recognized exchange company under its rules;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: every sale and purchase of any futures contract traded on a recognized futures market; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: every sale and purchase of any securities or futures contracts traded by means of authorized automated trading services.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1), the Chief Executive in Council may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: specify the rate or amount of the levy payable under that subsection for any sale and purchase—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: as a percentage of the consideration for the sale and purchase;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: as a fixed amount;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: as a nil rate, nil percentage or nil amount; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: as to be calculated in any other manner specified in the order;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify different rates for different classes of securities or futures contracts.

subsection.content: Each recognized exchange company, and each person authorized to provide authorized automated trading services, shall collect, account for, and pay to the Commission, the levy (if any) payable under subsection (1).
The Commission may recover the amount of any levy payable under this section as a civil debt due to it.

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive in Council may make rules for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the payment of levies under this section;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the imposition of charges or penalties for late payment of such levies;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the keeping, examination and audit of the accounts of recognized exchange companies, and of persons authorized to provide authorized automated trading services, relating to the collection and payment to the Commission of such levies.

subsection.content: Nothing in subsection (1) requires the Chief Executive in Council to specify a rate or amount of levy in any particular sale and purchase to which that subsection applies or in any particular class of sales and purchases to which that subsection applies.

section.name: s395
section.heading: Rules by Chief Executive in Council for payment of fees

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive in Council may, after consultation with the Commission, make rules to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: require and provide for the payment to the Commission of, and prescribe, fees—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: for an application to the Commission under or pursuant to any of the relevant provisions;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: for anything done by the Commission or a committee established under section 8 in the performance of a function relating to takeovers and mergers or to share buy-backs; (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: for anything done by the Commission or a committee established under section 8 or the Monetary Authority in the performance of a function under any of the relevant provisions (other than the function referred to in subparagraph (ii));

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: for any other matter with regard to which provision is made by or under any of the relevant provisions;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provide for the payment to the Commission of, and prescribe, fees (however described) which this Ordinance provides are, or may be, prescribed, specified or provided for by rules made under this section.

subsection.content: Without prejudice to subsection (3), fees prescribed by rules made under this section may be fixed at levels sufficient to recover expenditure incurred, or likely to be incurred, by the Commission or a committee established under section 8 or the Monetary Authority in providing the services or performing the functions to which the fees relate, but in fixing the level of the fees appropriations under section 14 shall not be taken into account.

Fees prescribed by rules made under this section shall not be limited by reference to the amount of the administrative or other costs incurred, or likely to be incurred, by the Commission or a committee established under section 8 or the Monetary Authority in providing the services or performing the functions to which the fees relate.

subsection.leadIn: Rules made under this section may provide—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the amount of any fee shall be fixed by reference to a scale set out in the rules;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the payment of different fees by or in relation to persons or cases of different classes or descriptions;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that the payment of any fee shall be waived, either generally or in a particular case, whether or not it is otherwise specified as being payable under any provision of this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: for the payment of fees annually or at other intervals.

subsection.content: The Commission may pay to the Monetary Authority such of the fees paid to it in accordance with the rules made under this section that in the opinion of the Commission represent the expenditure or costs incurred, or likely to be incurred, by the Monetary Authority in providing the services or performing the functions to which the fees relate.
The Commission may recover the amount of any fees payable under the rules made under this section as a civil debt due to it.
This section is in addition to and not in derogation of sections 29 and 29A of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1).

section.name: s396
section.heading: Reduction of levy

subsection.leadIn: If during a financial year of the Commission—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the reserves of the Commission, after deducting depreciation and all provisions, are more than twice its estimated operating expenses for the financial year; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Commission has no outstanding borrowings,

subsection.continued: the Commission shall consult the Financial Secretary with a view to recommending to the Chief Executive in Council that the rate or amount of a levy be reduced under section 394.

subsection.content: The Commission may, after consultation with the Financial Secretary under subsection (1), recommend to the Chief Executive in Council that the rate or amount of a levy be reduced under section 394.

section.name: s397
section.heading: Rules by Commission

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may make rules to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: provide for applications for licence and registration, the issue of printed licences and certificates of registration, and incidental matters; (Amended 19 of 2015 s. 11)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: require the display of printed licences and certificates of registration in the specified manner and circumstances and at specified places, and require that printed licences and certificates of registration are in specified circumstances, other than those specified in any provision of this Ordinance, to be returned to the Commission for any specified purpose; (Amended 19 of 2015 s. 11)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: require intermediaries to carry on business in relation to a specified class of persons, and in the specified manner and circumstances;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: prescribe the qualifications, experience and training required of any persons employed or engaged by intermediaries, and provide for the obligations imposed on the persons and the intermediaries in relation to such requirements, the examinations that applicants for licence or registration are required to take, and the circumstances in which they may be exempted from such requirements;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: provide for the correction of errors in the register maintained by the Commission under section 136;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: provide for the admissibility in evidence in judicial or other proceedings of specified records, and extracts from specified records, kept by the Commission;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: require documents and information required to be lodged, filed, submitted or retained for the purposes of any provision of this Ordinance to be so lodged, filed, submitted or retained in the specified manner, whether by electronic or other means;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: require documents and information lodged, filed, submitted or retained for the purposes of any provision of this Ordinance in any specified manner to be completed, signed, executed and authenticated in the specified form and manner;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: specify whether, when and the circumstances in which records compiled in any specified form or manner, or documents or information completed, signed, executed or authenticated in any specified form or manner, are acceptable or required for the purposes of any provision of this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: require the payment of remuneration to any auditor appointed, and the costs of an audit carried out, under any provision of this Ordinance, and provide for matters relating to such remuneration and costs;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: require a person of a specified description, when selling securities at or through a recognized stock market where his right to vest the securities in the purchaser (or, where he is acting as agent, his principal’s right to do so) is derived from an arrangement of a specified kind, to notify the exchange participant through whom the sale is being effected of the fact that the right to vest the securities in the purchaser is derived from such an arrangement, and require the person who, having sold such securities pursuant to such an arrangement, purchases securities at or through a recognized stock market in satisfaction, in whole or in part, of his obligations under the arrangement to notify the exchange participant through whom the purchase or purchases is or are being effected of that fact;

paragraph.name: l
paragraph.leadIn: require a lender under a securities borrowing and lending agreement to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: keep specified records or documents in the specified form and manner; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: give copies of such records or documents to the Commission at its request in the specified form and manner and within the specified time;

paragraph.name: m
paragraph.content: require intermediaries to make returns at specified times (whether at regular intervals or otherwise) to the Commission, and provide for the particulars, or the nature of particulars, to be contained therein, the person by whom, and the manner and circumstances in which they are to be made, and other matters related to such returns;

paragraph.name: n
paragraph.content: require a form or return required to be submitted under any provision of this Ordinance to be received by the Commission by or within the specified time;

paragraph.name: o
paragraph.content: prescribe, specify or provide for any matter which this Ordinance provides is, or may be, prescribed, specified or provided for by rules made under this section;

paragraph.name: p
paragraph.content: provide for any other matters for the better carrying out of the objects and purposes of this Ordinance.

subsection.content: In addition to the power to make rules under subsection (1), the Commission may, after consultation with the Financial Secretary, make such other rules as are necessary for the furtherance of any of its regulatory objectives and the performance of any of its functions.

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding anything in this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the power of the Commission to make rules under this section in respect of any persons as intermediaries shall, where the intermediaries are registered institutions, be regarded as the power to make rules in respect of the intermediaries only in relation to the businesses which constitute any regulated activities for which they are registered;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the power of the Commission to make rules under this section in respect of any persons as associated entities shall, where the associated entities are authorized financial institutions, be regarded as the power to make rules in respect of the associated entities only in relation to their businesses of receiving or holding client assets of intermediaries of which they are associated entities.

subsection.content: For the avoidance of doubt, the powers of the Commission to make rules under this section are in addition to and not in derogation of any other power of the Commission to make rules under any provision of this or any other Ordinance.

section.name: s398
section.heading: General provisions for rules by Commission

subsection.content: Notwithstanding any other provisions of this Ordinance but subject to subsection (3), where the Commission proposes to make rules under any provision of this Ordinance, it shall publish a draft of the proposed rules, in such manner as it considers appropriate, for the purpose of inviting representations on the proposed rules by the public.

subsection.leadIn: Where the Commission makes any rules under any provision of this Ordinance after a draft is published under subsection (1) in relation to the rules, it shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: publish, in such manner as it considers appropriate, an account setting out in general terms—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the representations made on the draft; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the response of the Commission to the representations; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the rules are made with modifications which in the opinion of the Commission result in the rules being significantly different from the draft, publish, in such manner as it considers appropriate, details of the difference.

subsection.leadIn: Subsections (1) and (2) do not apply if the Commission considers, in the circumstances of the case, that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is inappropriate or unnecessary that such subsections should apply; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: any delay involved in complying with such subsections would not be—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the interest of the investing public; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the public interest.

subsection.content: Notwithstanding any other provisions of this Ordinance, the Commission shall consult the Monetary Authority regarding rules it proposes to make under any provision of this Ordinance, other than a provision that requires the consent of the Monetary Authority, in so far as such rules apply to authorized financial institutions by reason of their being registered institutions, or associated entities of intermediaries. (Amended 6 of 2014 s. 47)

For the avoidance of doubt, nothing in subsections (1) to (4) affects any other requirements which, apart from such subsections, apply to the making of any rules under any provision of this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: Where rules are made by the Commission under any provision of this Ordinance and it has not been provided in this Ordinance that the rules may provide that a contravention of any specified provision of the rules constitutes an offence, the Chief Executive in Council may make regulations to provide that a person who contravenes any specified provision of the rules that applies to him commits an offence and is liable to a specified penalty not exceeding—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment a fine of $500,000 and a term of imprisonment of 2 years;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction a fine at level 6 and a term of imprisonment of 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: Except as otherwise provided in this Ordinance, rules made by the Commission under any provision of this Ordinance may provide that, subject to the terms and conditions specified in the rules, the provisions of this Ordinance specified in the rules—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: shall not have effect, or shall only have effect to a specified extent, in relation to any specified person or to members of a specified class of persons—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: who is or are or may be required to be licensed by reason only of his or their doing anything that is incidental to another business;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: who does not or do not, on behalf of any other person, deal in securities or futures contracts or trade in interests in collective investment schemes or leveraged foreign exchange contracts; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: who is or are or may be required to be licensed by reason only of his or their entering into a specified class of transactions;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall not have effect in relation to any specified transaction or class of transactions entered into by any specified person or class of persons;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: shall, where they require any application, statement, notice or other document (however described) to be lodged or filed with or submitted to the Commission, be regarded as having been complied with if the application, statement, notice or other document (as the case may be) is lodged or filed with or submitted to any other specified person.

subsection.leadIn: Except as otherwise provided in this Ordinance, rules made by the Commission under any provision of this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may be of general or special application and may be made so as to apply only in specified circumstances;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may make different provisions for different circumstances and provide for different cases or classes of cases;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: may authorize any matter or thing to be determined, applied or regulated by any specified person;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: may provide for the exercise of discretion in specified cases;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: may, for the better and more effectual carrying into effect of any provision of this Ordinance or the rules, include any savings, transitional, incidental, supplemental, evidential and consequential provisions (whether involving the provisions of any principal legislation or the provisions of any subsidiary legislation).

section.name: s399
section.heading: Codes or guidelines by Commission

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may publish, in the Gazette and in any other manner it considers appropriate, such codes and guidelines as it considers appropriate for providing guidance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the furtherance of any of its regulatory objectives;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to any matter relating to any of the functions of the Commission under any of the relevant provisions;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to the operation of any provision of this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting the generality of subsection (1), the Commission may publish under that subsection—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a code to provide for matters concerning takeovers and mergers and matters incidental thereto;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a code to provide for matters concerning share buy-backs and matters incidental thereto. (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding anything in this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the power of the Commission to publish codes or guidelines under this section in respect of any persons as intermediaries shall, where the intermediaries are registered institutions, be regarded as the power to publish codes or guidelines in respect of the intermediaries only in relation to the businesses which constitute any regulated activities for which they are registered;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the power of the Commission to publish codes or guidelines under this section in respect of any persons as associated entities shall, where the associated entities are authorized financial institutions, be regarded as the power to publish codes or guidelines in respect of the associated entities only in relation to their businesses of receiving or holding client assets of intermediaries of which they are associated entities.

subsection.content: For the avoidance of doubt, the power of the Commission to publish codes or guidelines under this section is in addition to and not in derogation of any other power of the Commission to publish codes or guidelines under any provision of this or any other Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may from time to time amend the whole or any part of any code or guideline published under this section or any other provision of this Ordinance in a manner consistent with the power to publish the code or guideline under this section or that other provision, and— (Amended 6 of 2014 s. 48)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the other provisions of this section or the provision concerned apply, with necessary modifications, to such amendments to the code or guideline as they apply to the code or guideline; and (Amended 6 of 2014 s. 48)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any reference in this or any other Ordinance to the code or guideline (however expressed) shall, unless the context otherwise requires, be construed as a reference to the code or guideline as so amended.

subsection.content: A failure on the part of any person to comply with the provisions set out in any code or guideline published under this section or any other provision of this Ordinance that apply to him shall not by itself render him liable to any judicial or other proceedings, but in any proceedings under this Ordinance before any court the code or guideline shall be admissible in evidence, and if any provision set out in the code or guideline appears to the court to be relevant to any question arising in the proceedings it shall be taken into account in determining that question. (Amended 6 of 2014 s. 48)

subsection.leadIn: Any code or guideline published under this section or any other provision of this Ordinance— (Amended 6 of 2014 s. 48)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may be of general or special application and may be made so as to apply only in specified circumstances;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may make different provisions for different circumstances and provide for different cases or classes of cases.

subsection.content: Any code or guideline published under this section is not subsidiary legislation.

Notwithstanding any other provisions of this Ordinance, the Commission shall consult the Monetary Authority regarding codes or guidelines it proposes to publish under this section or any other provision of this Ordinance, or amendments it proposes to make to codes or guidelines published under this section or any other provision of this Ordinance, in so far as such codes or guidelines or such amendments (as the case may be) apply to authorized financial institutions by reason of their being registered institutions, or associated entities of intermediaries.

section.name: s400
section.heading: Service of notices, etc.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to sections 111, 141 and 374 and any rules made under section 233 or 269, any written notice or direction or other document (however described) to be, or required to be, issued or served (however described) to or on any person, other than the Commission, for the purposes of this Ordinance shall for all purposes be regarded as duly issued or served if— (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of an individual, it is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: delivered to him by hand;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: left at, or sent by post to, his last known business or residential address;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: sent by facsimile transmission to his last known facsimile number; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: sent by electronic mail transmission to his last known electronic mail address;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a company, it is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: delivered to any officer of the company by hand;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: left at, or sent by post to, the company’s registered office in Hong Kong; (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: sent by facsimile transmission to its last known facsimile number; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: sent by electronic mail transmission to its last known electronic mail address;

paragraph.name: ba
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of an open-ended fund company, it is—

subparagraph.content: delivered to any officer of the company by hand;
left at, or sent by post to, the company’s registered office in Hong Kong;
sent by facsimile transmission to its last known facsimile number; or
sent by electronic mail transmission to its last known electronic mail address; (Added 16 of 2016 s. 18)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a registered non-Hong Kong company as defined by section 2(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622), it is— (Amended 30 of 2004 s. 3; 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: delivered by hand to, or sent by post to, the authorized representative at the representative’s address as shown in the Companies Register; (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: sent by facsimile transmission to the last known facsimile number of the person; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: sent by electronic mail transmission to the last known electronic mail address of the person;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a partnership, it is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: delivered to any partner of the partnership by hand;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: left at, or sent by post to, the last known principal place of business of the partnership;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: sent by facsimile transmission to the last known facsimile number of the partnership; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: sent by electronic mail transmission to the last known electronic mail address of the partnership; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a body corporate (other than a company, an open-ended fund company, a registered non-Hong Kong company as defined by section 2(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622) or the Commission) or an unincorporated body (other than a partnership), or a tribunal, it is— (Amended 30 of 2004 s. 3; 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920; 16 of 2016 s. 18)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: delivered to any officer of the body or the tribunal (as the case may be) by hand;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: left at, or sent by post to, the last known principal place of business of the body or the tribunal (as the case may be);

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: in the case of the body, sent by facsimile transmission to the last known facsimile number of the body; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: in the case of the body, sent by electronic mail transmission to the last known electronic mail address of the body.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: authorized representative (獲授權代表) means an authorized representative as defined by section 774(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622);
Companies Register (公司登記冊) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622). (Added 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

section.name: s401
section.heading: Evidence regarding Commission’s records or documents
section.content: A record or document purporting to be a record or document, or a copy of a record or document, signed, executed or issued by or on behalf of the Commission and purporting to be signed or initialled by any member of the Commission or any person performing any function under any of the relevant provisions shall in any proceedings be admissible as evidence of the facts stated in it, without proof of the signature or initials of the person purporting to sign or initial the record or document.

section.name: s402
section.heading: General requirements for documents lodged with Commission

subsection.leadIn: Except as otherwise provided in sections 324 and 347, the Commission may, by notice published in the Gazette, specify any form in respect of any application, statement, notice, return or other document (however described) required to be lodged, filed or submitted with or to the Commission for the purposes of any provision of this Ordinance, either generally or in any particular case, and, without limiting the generality of the foregoing, may in the form—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: include directions and instructions relating to the compilation of the application, statement, notice, return or other document (as the case may be);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: include directions and instructions relating to the inclusion of statutory declarations made in respect of the particulars in it; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: specify documents by which it is to be accompanied.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1), the Commission may specify any form by referring in a notice published in the Gazette to the form as separately published by such electronic means as the Commission considers appropriate, instead of setting out the form in a notice published in the Gazette, whereupon the Commission shall for all purposes be regarded as having duly specified the form under subsection (1).
For the purposes of subsection (1), the Commission may specify that different forms are to be used in different circumstances.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (5) and (6), where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is any requirement for any application, statement, notice, return or other document (however described) to be lodged, filed or submitted with or to the Commission for the purposes of any provision of this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Commission has specified any form in respect of it under subsection (1),

subsection.continued: the requirement shall not be regarded as having been complied with unless it—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: is in the form specified;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: is compiled in accordance with such directions and instructions as are included in the form;

paragraph.name: iii
paragraph.content: contains statutory declarations in accordance with such directions and instructions as are included in the form; and

paragraph.name: iv
paragraph.content: is accompanied by such documents as are specified in the form.

subsection.content: An application, statement, notice, return or other document shall not by reason of any deviation from a form specified in respect of it under subsection (1) cease to be regarded as being in that form, if the deviation does not affect the substance of the form.

Where the Commission is satisfied that a person has substantial practical difficulties in complying with any of the requirements referred to in subsection (4)(i), (ii), (iii) or (iv), it may in its discretion dispense with the requirements in the case of the person to such extent as it considers necessary.
A notice published pursuant to subsection (1) is not subsidiary legislation.

section.name: s403
section.heading: General provisions for approvals by Commission
section.leadIn: Where under any provision of this Ordinance, an act cannot be done, or an omission cannot be made, except with the approval, whether in writing or otherwise, of the Commission—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: without prejudice to any express provisions in this Ordinance relating to imposition of conditions, the approval may be given subject to such conditions (if any) as the Commission may specify in giving the approval (including conditions which provide that failure to comply with the conditions causes the approval to lapse); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the purposes of any pecuniary, custodial or other sanction which may be imposed under any provision of this Ordinance in relation to any such act done or omission made without such approval, the approval shall have no effect to the extent that the act is done or the omission is made (as the case may be) otherwise than in accordance with any such conditions.

section.name: s404
section.heading: Exclusions of provisions of Gambling Ordinance

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), the Gambling Ordinance (Cap. 148) shall not apply to any transaction or activity which is regulated by or under, or which is carried out in compliance with, this Ordinance.

The Commission may make rules to prescribe any class of transactions or activities (being transactions or activities to which the Gambling Ordinance (Cap. 148) would apart from this section apply), whether by reference to the nature of the transactions or activities or all or any of the parties to or persons involved in the transactions or activities or otherwise, as a class of transactions or activities to which that Ordinance shall apply, whereupon that Ordinance shall have application accordingly.

section.name: s405
section.heading: Inland Revenue Ordinance not affected
section.content: Nothing in this Ordinance affects section 4 of the Inland Revenue Ordinance (Cap. 112).

section.name: s406
section.heading: Repeals

subsection.leadIn: Each of the following shall be repealed from a day appointed by the Secretary for Financial Services and the Treasury by notice published in the Gazette— (Amended L.N. 106 of 2002)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Securities and Futures Commission Ordinance (Cap. 24);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Commodities Trading Ordinance (Cap. 250);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Securities Ordinance (Cap. 333);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the Protection of Investors Ordinance (Cap. 335);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the Stock Exchanges Unification Ordinance (Cap. 361);

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the Securities (Insider Dealing) Ordinance (Cap. 395);

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the Securities (Disclosure of Interests) Ordinance (Cap. 396);

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the Securities and Futures (Clearing Houses) Ordinance (Cap. 420);
the Leveraged Foreign Exchange Trading Ordinance (Cap. 451);

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: the Exchanges and Clearing Houses (Merger) Ordinance (Cap. 555).

subsection.leadIn: Any repeal under this section is subject to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the other provisions of this Part; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Schedule 10.

subsection.content: Without limiting the generality to section 12 of Part 1 of Schedule 1, a reference to any Ordinance in this section includes any subsidiary legislation made under such Ordinance.

editorialNote.text: # 1 April 2003 was the day appointed under this subsection — see L.N. 13 of 2003.

section.name: s407
section.heading: Savings, transitional, consequential and related provisions, etc.

subsection.content: Part 1 of Schedule 10 provides for the savings, transitional and supplemental arrangements that apply on, or relate to, the commencement of this Ordinance or any part thereof.

Part 2 of Schedule 10 provides for the consequential and supplemental amendments that apply on, or relate to, the commencement of this Ordinance or any part thereof, and the enactments specified in column 2 of that Part are amended in the manner set out in column 3 of that Part.

Part 3 of Schedule 10 provides for the savings and transitional arrangements that apply on, or relate to, the commencement# of the Securities and Futures and Companies Legislation (Structured Products Amendment) Ordinance 2011 (8 of 2011). (Added 8 of 2011 s. 13)

Part 4 of Schedule 10 provides for the savings and transitional arrangements that apply on, or relate to, the commencement of the Securities and Futures (Amendment) Ordinance 2012 (9 of 2012) or any part of that Ordinance. (Added 9 of 2012 s. 46)

Part 5 of Schedule 10 provides for the savings and transitional arrangements that apply on, or relate to, the commencement@ of section 78 of Schedule 11 to the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622). (Added 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

subsection.name: 5A
subsection.content: Part 6 of Schedule 10 provides for the savings and transitional arrangements that apply on, or relate to, the commencement of Part 4 of the Securities and Futures (Amendment) Ordinance 2014 (6 of 2014) or any provision in Part 4 of that Ordinance. (Added 17 of 2021 s. 86)

section.name: s408
section.heading: Provisions of Part XVII, etc. not to derogate from section 23 of Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance
section.content: Except as otherwise provided in this Part or Schedule 10, the provisions of this Part and of Schedule 10 are in addition to and not in derogation of section 23 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1).

section.name: s409
section.heading: Amendment of Schedule 10
section.content: The Chief Executive in Council may, by order published in the Gazette, amend Schedule 10.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation of this Ordinance
section.leadIn: In this Ordinance, unless otherwise defined or excluded or the context otherwise requires—
section.def: accredited (隸屬) means accredited to a licensed corporation with the Commission’s approval under section 122 of this Ordinance;
Advisory Committee (諮詢委員會) means the Advisory Committee referred to in section 7 of this Ordinance;
affiliated operational entity (相聯營運實體) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Financial Institutions (Resolution) Ordinance (Cap. 628); (Added 23 of 2016 s. 221. Amended E.R. 2 of 2017)
approved money broker (核准貨幣經紀) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155); (Added 6 of 2014 s. 52)

def.name: Associate
def.leadIn: associate (有聯繫者), in relation to a person, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the spouse, or any minor child (natural or adopted) or minor step-child, of the person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any corporation of which the person is a director;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any employee or partner of the person;

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.content: another person in accordance with whose directions or instructions the person is accustomed or obliged to act;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: another person accustomed or obliged to act in accordance with the directions or instructions of the person;

paragraph.name: g
h
i
j
paragraph.content: a corporation of which the person controls the composition of the board of directors;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.leadIn: where the person is a corporation—

subparagraph.name: i
ii

paragraph.name: l
paragraph.leadIn: without limiting the circumstances in which paragraphs (a) to (k) apply, in circumstances concerning the securities of or other interest in a corporation, or rights arising out of the holding of such securities or such interest, any other person with whom the person has an agreement or arrangement—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: with respect to the acquisition, holding or disposal of such securities or such interest; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: under which they undertake to act together in exercising their voting power at general meetings of the corporation;

def.name: AssociatedEntity
def.leadIn: associated entity (有聯繫實體), in relation to an intermediary, means a company, or a registered non-Hong Kong company as defined by section 2(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622), which— (Amended 30 of 2004 s. 3; 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is in a controlling entity relationship with the intermediary; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: receives or holds in Hong Kong client assets of the intermediary;

section.def: auditor (核數師) means a certified public accountant (practising) as defined by section 2(1) of the Accounting and Financial Reporting Council Ordinance (Cap. 588), or such other person as is prescribed by rules made under section 397 of this Ordinance for the purposes of this definition; (Amended 23 of 2004 s. 56; L.N. 66 of 2022)
authorized automated trading services (認可自動化交易服務) means automated trading services which a person is authorized to provide under section 95(2) of this Ordinance;
authorized financial institution (認可財務機構) means an authorized institution as defined in section 2(1) of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155);
automated trading services (自動化交易服務) has the meaning assigned to it by Part 2 of Schedule 5 to this Ordinance;

def.name: Bank
def.leadIn: bank (銀行) means any institution carrying on business similar to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the banking business within the meaning of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155) as carried on by an authorized financial institution; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the business of taking deposits within the meaning of that Ordinance as carried on by an authorized financial institution,

def.continued: whether it is an authorized financial institution or not, and banker (銀行) shall be construed accordingly;

section.def: bank incorporated outside Hong Kong (在香港以外地方成立為法團的銀行) means a bank incorporated outside Hong Kong that is not an authorized financial institution and is not a re-domiciled entity as defined by section 2(1) of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155); (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 248)

def.name: BankersBooks
def.leadIn: banker’s books (銀行簿冊) includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: books of a banker;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: cheques, orders for the payment of money, bills of exchange and promissory notes in the possession of a banker;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: securities in the possession of a banker, whether as a pledge or otherwise; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any material in which information is recorded (however compiled or stored, and whether recorded in a legible form or recorded otherwise than in a legible form but is capable of being reproduced in a legible form) and which is used in the ordinary course of business of a bank;

def.name: Books
def.leadIn: books (簿冊) includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: accounts and any accounting information; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a banker, any banker’s books,

section.def: broadcast (廣播), in relation to any material (however described), includes having the information contained in the material broadcast;

def.name: Broadcaster
def.leadIn: broadcaster (廣播業者) means a person who lawfully—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: establishes and maintains a broadcasting service within the meaning of Part 3A of the Telecommunications Ordinance (Cap. 106); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provides a broadcasting service as defined in section 2(1) of the Broadcasting Ordinance (Cap. 562);

def.name: BusinessDay
def.leadIn: business day (營業日) means a day other than—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a public holiday; (Amended 9 of 2012 s. 53)

paragraph.name: ab
paragraph.content: a Saturday; and (Added 9 of 2012 s. 53)

paragraph.name: b

section.def: certificate of deposit (存款證) means a document relating to money, in any currency, which has been deposited with the issuer or some other person, being a document which recognizes an obligation to pay a stated amount to bearer or to order, with or without interest, and being a document by the delivery of which, with or without endorsement, the right to receive that stated amount, with or without interest, is transferable (and, in the case of any such document which is a prescribed instrument by virtue of paragraph (a) of the definition of prescribed instrument in section 137B(1) of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155), such document includes any right or interest referred to in paragraph (b) of that definition in respect of such document);
certified public accountant (會計師) means a certified public accountant as defined in section 2 of the Professional Accountants Ordinance (Cap. 50); (Replaced 23 of 2004 s. 56)
charge (押記) includes any form of security, including a mortgage;

def.name: ClearingHouse
def.leadIn: clearing house (結算所) means a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whose activities or objects include the provision of services for the clearing and settlement of transactions in securities effected on a recognized stock market or subject to the rules of a recognized exchange company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: whose activities or objects include the provision of services for—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the clearing and settlement of transactions in futures contracts; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the day-to-day adjustment of the financial position of futures contracts,

paragraph.continued: effected on a recognized futures market or subject to the rules of a recognized exchange company; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: who guarantees the settlement of any such transactions as are referred to in paragraph (a) or (b),

def.continued: but does not include a corporation operated by or on behalf of the Government;

section.def: clearing obligation (結算責任) has the meaning given by section 101A of this Ordinance; (Added 6 of 2014 s. 52)

def.name: ClearingParticipant
def.leadIn: clearing participant (結算所參與者) means a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: who, in accordance with the rules of a recognized clearing house, may participate in one or more of the services provided by the clearing house in its capacity as a clearing house; and

paragraph.name: b

def.name: Client
def.leadIn: client (客戶), in relation to an intermediary, means a person for whom the intermediary provides a service the provision of which constitutes a regulated activity, and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: includes another intermediary that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: deposits securities;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: deposits money; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: deposits any property as collateral,

paragraph.continued: with the first-mentioned intermediary;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in connection with a leveraged foreign exchange contract, does not include a recognized counterparty;

def.name: ClientAssets
def.leadIn: client assets (客戶資產) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: client securities and collateral; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: client money;

def.name: ClientCollateral
def.leadIn: client collateral (客戶抵押品) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: securities collateral; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: other collateral;

def.name: ClientMoney
def.leadIn: client money (客戶款項)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a licensed corporation, means any money—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: received or held by or on behalf of the licensed corporation; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: received or held by or on behalf of any corporation which is in a controlling entity relationship with the licensed corporation,

paragraph.continued: which is so received or held on behalf of a client of the licensed corporation or in which a client of the licensed corporation has a legal or equitable interest, and includes any accretions thereto whether as capital or income; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a registered institution, means any money—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: received or held by or on behalf of the registered institution, in the course of the conduct of any regulated activity for which the registered institution is registered; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: received or held by or on behalf of any corporation which is in a controlling entity relationship with the registered institution, in relation to such conduct of the regulated activity,

paragraph.continued: which is so received or held on behalf of a client of the registered institution or in which a client of the registered institution has a legal or equitable interest, and includes any accretions thereto whether as capital or income;

def.name: ClientSecurities
def.leadIn: client securities (客戶證券)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a licensed corporation, means any securities (other than securities collateral)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: received or held by or on behalf of the licensed corporation; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: received or held by or on behalf of any corporation which is in a controlling entity relationship with the licensed corporation,

paragraph.continued: which are so received or held on behalf of a client of the licensed corporation or in which a client of the licensed corporation has a legal or equitable interest; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a registered institution, means any securities (other than securities collateral)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: received or held by or on behalf of the registered institution, in the course of the conduct of any regulated activity for which the registered institution is registered; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: received or held by or on behalf of any corporation which is in a controlling entity relationship with the registered institution, in relation to such conduct of the regulated activity,

def.name: ClientSecuritiesAndCollateral
def.leadIn: client securities and collateral (客戶證券及抵押品) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: client securities; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: client collateral;

def.name: CollectiveInvestmentScheme
def.leadIn: collective investment scheme (集體投資計劃) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: arrangements in respect of any property—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: under which the participating persons do not have day-to-day control over the management of the property, whether or not they have the right to be consulted or to give directions in respect of such management;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: under which—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the property is managed as a whole by or on behalf of the person operating the arrangements;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the contributions of the participating persons and the profits or income from which payments are made to them are pooled; or

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: the property is managed as a whole by or on behalf of the person operating the arrangements, and the contributions of the participating persons and the profits or income from which payments are made to them are pooled; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.leadIn: the purpose or effect, or pretended purpose or effect, of which is to enable the participating persons, whether by acquiring any right, interest, title or benefit in the property or any part of the property or otherwise, to participate in or receive—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: profits, income or other returns represented to arise or to be likely to arise from the acquisition, holding, management or disposal of the property or any part of the property, or sums represented to be paid or to be likely to be paid out of any such profits, income or other returns; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: a payment or other returns arising from the acquisition, holding or disposal of, the exercise of any right in, the redemption of, or the expiry of, any right, interest, title or benefit in the property or any part of the property; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: arrangements which are arrangements, or are of a class or description of arrangements, prescribed by notice under section 393 of this Ordinance as being regarded as collective investment schemes in accordance with the terms of the notice,

def.continued: but does not include—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: arrangements operated by a person otherwise than by way of business;

paragraph.name: ii
iii
paragraph.content: arrangements under which each of the participating persons is a bona fide employee or former employee of a corporation in the same group of companies as the person operating the arrangements, or a spouse, widow, widower, minor child (natural or adopted) or minor step-child of such employee or former employee;

paragraph.name: iv
paragraph.content: franchise arrangements under which the franchisor or franchisee earns profits or income by exploiting a right conferred by the arrangements to use a trade name or design or other intellectual property or the goodwill attached to it;

paragraph.name: v
vi
paragraph.content: arrangements made for the purposes of any fund or scheme maintained by the Commission, or by a recognized exchange company, recognized clearing house, recognized exchange controller or recognized investor compensation company, under any provision of this Ordinance for the purpose of providing compensation in the event of default by an exchange participant or a clearing participant;

paragraph.name: vii
paragraph.content: arrangements made by any credit union in accordance with the objects thereof;

paragraph.name: viii
paragraph.content: arrangements made for the purposes of any chit-fund permitted to operate under the Chit-Fund Businesses (Prohibition) Ordinance (Cap. 262);

paragraph.name: ix
x
paragraph.content: arrangements which are arrangements, or are of a class or description of arrangements, prescribed by notice under section 393 of this Ordinance as not being regarded as collective investment schemes in accordance with the terms of the notice;

section.def: Commission (證監會) means the Securities and Futures Commission referred to in section 3(1) of this Ordinance;

Commissioner of the Independent Commission Against Corruption (廉政專員) means the person who holds the office of the Commissioner of the Independent Commission Against Corruption pursuant to section 5 of the Independent Commission Against Corruption Ordinance (Cap. 204); (Amended 14 of 2003 s. 24)
company (公司) means a company as defined in section 2(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622); (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)
compensation fund (賠償基金) means the Investor Compensation Fund established under section 236 of this Ordinance;
conduct (行為) includes any act or omission, and any series of acts or omissions;

def.name: Constitution
def.leadIn: constitution (章程), in relation to a corporation, including a recognized exchange company, recognized clearing house, recognized exchange controller or recognized investor compensation company, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the corporation is a company, the articles of association of the corporation; or (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case, any other instrument providing for the constitution of the corporation;

def.name: ControllingEntity
def.leadIn: controlling entity (控權實體), in relation to a corporation, means a person who, either alone or with any of his associates—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: is entitled to exercise or control the exercise of not less than—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: subject to subparagraph (ii), 20%; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where any other percentage is prescribed by rules made under section 397 of this Ordinance for the purposes of this definition, such other percentage,

paragraph.continued: of the voting power at general meetings of the corporation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has the right to nominate any of the directors of the corporation; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: has an interest in shares carrying the right to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: veto any resolution; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: amend, modify, limit or add conditions to any resolution,

paragraph.continued: at general meetings of the corporation;

def.name: ControllingEntityRelationship
def.leadIn: controlling entity relationship (控權實體關係), in relation to a corporation, means its relationship with an intermediary by virtue of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the intermediary being a controlling entity of the corporation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the corporation being a controlling entity of the intermediary; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: another person, who is a controlling entity of the corporation, being also a controlling entity of the intermediary;

section.def: corporation (法團) means a company or other body corporate incorporated either in Hong Kong or elsewhere, but does not include a company or other body corporate which is prescribed by rules made under section 397 of this Ordinance for the purposes of this definition as being exempted from the provisions of this Ordinance, or to the extent that it is prescribed by rules so made as being exempted from any provision of this Ordinance;
court (法庭、法院) includes a magistrate and a tribunal;
credit union (儲蓄互助社) means a credit union registered under the Credit Unions Ordinance (Cap. 119);

def.name: CurrencyAndInterestRatelinkedInstrument
def.leadIn: currency and interest rate-linked instrument (貨幣及利率掛鈎票據) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: an instrument that is a structured product only because some or all of the return or amount due (or both the return and the amount due) or the method of settlement is determined by reference to a combination of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: changes in the value or level (or a range within the value or level) of any one or more currency exchange rates or currency exchange rate indices or the occurrence or non-occurrence of any specified event or events relating to any one or more currency exchange rates or currency exchange rate indices; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: changes in the value or level (or a range within the value or level) of any one or more interest rates or interest rate indices or the occurrence or non-occurrence of any specified event or events relating to any one or more interest rates or interest rate indices; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any interests, rights or property prescribed, or of a class or description prescribed, by notice under section 392 of this Ordinance as being regarded as currency and interest rate-linked instruments in accordance with the notice,

def.continued: but does not include any interests, rights or property prescribed, or of a class or description prescribed, by notice under section 392 of this Ordinance as not being regarded as currency and interest rate-linked instruments in accordance with the notice; (Added 8 of 2011 s. 14)

def.name: CurrencylinkedInstrument
def.leadIn: currency-linked instrument (貨幣掛鈎票據) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: an instrument that is a structured product only because some or all of the return or amount due (or both the return and the amount due) or the method of settlement is determined by reference to one or more of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: changes in the value or level (or a range within the value or level) of any one or more currency exchange rates or currency exchange rate indices; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the occurrence or non-occurrence of any specified event or events relating to any one or more currency exchange rates or currency exchange rate indices; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any interests, rights or property prescribed, or of a class or description prescribed, by notice under section 392 of this Ordinance as being regarded as currency-linked instruments in accordance with the notice,

def.continued: but does not include any interests, rights or property prescribed, or of a class or description prescribed, by notice under section 392 of this Ordinance as not being regarded as currency-linked instruments in accordance with the notice; (Added 8 of 2011 s. 14)

section.def: data material (數據材料) means a document or other material used with or produced by any information system;

def.name: Dealing
def.leadIn: dealing (交易)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to securities, means, whether as principal or agent, making or offering to make an agreement with another person, or inducing or attempting to induce another person, to enter into or to offer to enter into an agreement—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: for or with a view to acquiring, disposing of, subscribing for or underwriting securities; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the purpose or pretended purpose of which is to secure a profit to any of the parties from the yield of securities or by reference to fluctuations in the value of securities; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to futures contracts, means, whether as principal or agent—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: inducing or attempting to induce another person to enter into, or to offer to enter into, a futures contract; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: inducing or attempting to induce another person to acquire or dispose of a futures contract;

section.def: debenture (債權證) includes debenture stocks, bonds, and other debt securities of a corporation, whether constituting a charge on the assets of the corporation or not; (Amended 8 of 2011 s. 14)
defalcation (虧空) means misapplication, including misappropriation, of any property;
disclosure proceedings (關於披露的研訊程序) has the meaning given by section 307I(1) of this Ordinance; (Added 9 of 2012 s. 11)

document (文件) includes any register and books, any tape recording and any form of input or output into or from an information system, and any other document or similar material (whether produced mechanically, electronically, magnetically, optically, manually or by any other means);

def.name: ExchangeParticipant
def.leadIn: exchange participant (交易所參與者) means a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: who, in accordance with the rules of a recognized exchange company, may trade through that exchange company or on a recognized stock market or a recognized futures market operated by that exchange company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whose name is entered in a list, roll or register kept by that recognized exchange company as a person who may trade through that exchange company or on a recognized stock market or a recognized futures market operated by that exchange company;

section.def: executive director (執行董事), in relation to the Commission, means the chief executive officer of the Commission or any other person who is appointed as an executive director of the Commission under section 1 of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to this Ordinance (whether or not acting in any other capacity under that Part); (Amended 15 of 2006 s. 5)

def.name: ExecutiveOfficer
def.leadIn: executive officer (主管人員)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a licensed corporation, means a responsible officer of the licensed corporation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a registered institution, means a person who is an executive officer of the registered institution under the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to an associated entity of an intermediary, means any director of the associated entity who is responsible for directly supervising the receiving or holding by the associated entity of client assets of the intermediary;

section.def: fee (費用) includes a charge;

financial accommodation (財務通融) means a loan or other arrangement under which a person is or is to be provided with credit, whether directly or through a third party, and in particular includes an overdraft, a discounted negotiable instrument, a guarantee, a forbearance from enforcing any debt that in substance is a loan, and also includes an agreement to secure the payment or repayment of any such accommodation;

def.name: FinancialProduct
def.leadIn: financial product (金融產品) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any securities;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any futures contract;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any collective investment scheme;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any leveraged foreign exchange contract;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any structured product; (Added 8 of 2011 s. 14)

section.def: financial resources rules (財政資源規則) means rules made under section 145 of this Ordinance;

def.name: FinancialYear
def.leadIn: financial year (財政年度)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to the Commission, means the financial year referred to in section 13(1) of this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to an intermediary, or an associated entity of an intermediary, means—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the financial year in respect of which notification is given to the Commission under section 155(1) of this Ordinance or, where an approval is granted under section 155(3)(a) of this Ordinance, the financial year in respect of which the approval is granted;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the financial year in respect of which notification is given to the Monetary Authority under section 59B(1) of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155) or, where an approval is granted under section 59B(3)(a) of that Ordinance, the financial year in respect of which the approval is granted; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: in any other case, a period of 12 consecutive months ending on 31 March in a calendar year;

section.def: function (職能) includes power and duty;

def.name: FuturesContract
def.leadIn: futures contract (期貨合約) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a contract or an option on a contract made under the rules or conventions of a futures market;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: interests, rights or property which is interests, rights or property, or is of a class or description of interests, rights or property, prescribed by notice under section 392 of this Ordinance as being regarded as futures contracts in accordance with the terms of the notice,

def.continued: but does not include interests, rights or property which is interests, rights or property, or is of a class or description of interests, rights or property, prescribed by notice under section 392 of this Ordinance as not being regarded as futures contracts in accordance with the terms of the notice;

section.def: Futures Exchange Company (期交所) means the company incorporated, and registered by the name Hong Kong Futures Exchange Limited, under the relevant Ordinance; (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

def.name: FuturesMarket
def.leadIn: futures market (期貨市場) means a place at which facilities are provided for persons to negotiate or conclude sales and purchases of, or for bringing together on a regular basis sellers and purchasers of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: contracts the effect of which is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that one party agrees to deliver to the other party at an agreed future time an agreed property, or an agreed quantity of a property, at an agreed price; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: that the parties will make an adjustment between them at an agreed future time according to whether at that time an agreed property is worth more or less or an index or other factor stands at a higher or lower level than a value or level agreed at the time of making of the contract; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: options on contracts of the kind described in paragraph (a),

def.continued: where—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the contracts or options of the kind described in paragraph (a) or (b) are novated or guaranteed by a central counterparty under the rules or conventions of the market on which they are traded; or

paragraph.name: ii
