paragraph.content: the contractual obligations under the contracts or options of the kind described in paragraph (a) or (b) are normally discharged before the contractual expiry date under the rules or conventions of the market on which they are traded,

def.continued: but does not include the office of a recognized clearing house;

section.def: group of companies (公司集團) means any 2 or more corporations one of which is the holding company of the other or others (as the case may be);

def.name: Hold
def.leadIn: hold (持有), in relation to any property, includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: possession of the property;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: being registered or otherwise recorded, as having title to or being entitled to receive the property, in any register or other record (however compiled or stored) which is established or created for the purpose of identifying persons having title to or being entitled to receive any property; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a person carrying on business, the person being in a position to transfer the property to himself or otherwise receive the benefit of the property—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: where another person has a legal or equitable interest in the property;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where there is a connection between the property and the business which is carried on by the person; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: regardless of whether it would be lawful or unlawful for the person to transfer the property to himself or otherwise receive the benefit of the property,

paragraph.continued: but does not include, in the case of a cheque or other order made payable to any person, the possession of the cheque or other order during the course of dispatching or delivering it to that person or any other person on behalf of that person;

section.def: holding company (控權公司) means, in relation to a corporation, any other corporation of which it is a subsidiary; (Replaced 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)
incorporated (成立、成立為法團) includes formed or established, by whatever means;
information (資訊、資料、消息) includes data, text, images, sound codes, computer programmes, software and databases, and any combination thereof;
information system (資訊系統) means an information system as defined in section 2(1) of the Electronic Transactions Ordinance (Cap. 553);
Insurance Authority (保監局) means the Insurance Authority established under section 4AAA of the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41); (Replaced 12 of 2015 s. 144)
insurer (保險人) means an insurer as defined in section 2(1) of the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41); (Amended 12 of 2015 s. 144)

def.name: InterestRatelinkedInstrument
def.leadIn: interest rate-linked instrument (利率掛鈎票據) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: an instrument that is a structured product only because some or all of the return or amount due (or both the return and the amount due) or the method of settlement is determined by reference to one or more of—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: the occurrence or non-occurrence of any specified event or events relating to any one or more interest rates or interest rate indices; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any interests, rights or property prescribed, or of a class or description prescribed, by notice under section 392 of this Ordinance as being regarded as interest rate-linked instruments in accordance with the notice,

def.continued: but does not include any interests, rights or property prescribed, or of a class or description prescribed, by notice under section 392 of this Ordinance as not being regarded as interest rate-linked instruments in accordance with the notice; (Added 8 of 2011 s. 14)

section.def: intermediary (中介人) means a licensed corporation or a registered institution;
legal officer (律政人員) means a legal officer as defined in section 2 of the Legal Officers Ordinance (Cap. 87);
leveraged foreign exchange contract (槓桿式外匯交易合約) has the meaning assigned to it by Part 2 of Schedule 5 to this Ordinance;
licence (牌、牌照) means a licence granted under section 116, 117, 120 or 121 of this Ordinance, and licensed (獲發牌、持牌) shall be construed accordingly;
licensed corporation (持牌法團) means a corporation which is granted a licence under section 116 or 117 of this Ordinance;
licensed person (持牌人) means a licensed corporation or a licensed representative;
licensed representative (持牌代表) means an individual who is granted a licence under section 120 or 121 of this Ordinance;
liquidator (清盤人) includes a provisional liquidator;

def.name: Listed
def.leadIn: listed (上市) means listed on a recognized stock market, and for the purposes of this definition—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a corporation shall be regarded as listed if any of its securities are listed;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: securities shall be regarded as listed when a recognized exchange company has, on the application of the corporation which issued them, or on the application of a holder of them, agreed to allow, subject to the requirements of this Ordinance, dealings in those securities to take place on a recognized stock market, and shall continue to be so regarded during a period of suspension of dealings in those securities on the recognized stock market;

section.def: live broadcast (直播), in relation to any material (however described), means having the material broadcast without its being recorded in advance;
MA investigator (金管局調查員) has the meaning given by section 178 of this Ordinance; (Added 6 of 2014 s. 52)
Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes Authority (積金局) means the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes Authority established under section 6 of the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes Ordinance (Cap. 485);

def.name: MarketContract
def.leadIn: market contract (市場合約) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a contract that is subject to the rules of a recognized clearing house and entered into by the clearing house with a clearing participant, whether or not pursuant to a novation, for the purpose of the clearing and settlement of a transaction in securities or futures contracts that is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: effected on a recognized stock market or a recognized futures market; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: subject to the rules of a recognized exchange company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a contract that is subject to the rules of a recognized clearing house and entered into by the clearing house with a clearing participant, whether or not pursuant to a novation, for the purpose of the clearing and settlement of an OTC derivative transaction; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: a contract that is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: subject to the rules of a designated CCP (as defined by section 101A of this Ordinance) that is a provider of authorized automated trading services and specified by the Commission by notice published in the Gazette under section 1C; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: entered into by the designated CCP with any one of its members, whether or not pursuant to a novation, for the purpose of the clearing and settlement of an OTC derivative transaction; (Replaced 6 of 2014 s. 52)

section.def: market misconduct (市場失當行為) has the meaning assigned to it by section 245(1) of this Ordinance;
Market Misconduct Tribunal (市場失當行為審裁處) means the Market Misconduct Tribunal established by section 251 of this Ordinance;

def.name: Member
def.leadIn: member (成員), in relation to the Commission, means— (Amended 15 of 2006 s. 5)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the chairman of the Commission; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the chief executive officer or any other executive director or non-executive director of the Commission (whether or not acting in any other capacity under Part 1 of Schedule 2 to this Ordinance); (Amended 15 of 2006 s. 5)

section.def: minor (未成年), in relation to a person, means not having attained the age of 18 years;
misfeasance (不當行為) means the performance of an otherwise lawful act in a wrongful manner;
Monetary Authority (金融管理專員) means the Monetary Authority appointed under section 5A of the Exchange Fund Ordinance (Cap. 66);

def.name: MoneyLaunderingActivities
def.leadIn: money laundering activities (洗錢活動) means activities intended to have the effect of making any property—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: which is the proceeds obtained from the commission of an offence under the laws of Hong Kong, or of any conduct which if occurred in Hong Kong would constitute an offence under the laws of Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: which in whole or in part, directly or indirectly, represents such proceeds,

def.continued: not to appear to be or so represent such proceeds;

section.def: multilateral agency (多邊機構) means a body specified in Part 4;

non-executive director (非執行董事), in relation to the Commission, means a person who is appointed as a non-executive director of the Commission under section 1 of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to this Ordinance (whether or not acting in any other capacity under that Part); (Amended 15 of 2006 s. 5)
non-Hong Kong company (非香港公司) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622); (Added 30 of 2004 s. 3. Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)
OFC rules (《開放式基金型公司規則》) has the meaning given by section 112A of this Ordinance; (Added 16 of 2016 s. 19)

def.name: Officer
def.leadIn: officer (高級人員)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a corporation, means a director, manager or secretary of, or any other person involved in the management of, the corporation; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to an unincorporated body, means any member of the governing body of the unincorporated body;

section.def: Official Receiver (破產管理署署長) means the Official Receiver appointed under section 75 of the Bankruptcy Ordinance (Cap. 6);
Ombudsman (申訴專員) means The Ombudsman referred to in section 3(1) of The Ombudsman Ordinance (Cap. 397);
open-ended fund company (開放式基金型公司) has the meaning given by section 112A of this Ordinance; (Added 16 of 2016 s. 19)
OTC derivative product (場外衍生工具產品) has the meaning given by section 1B; (Added 6 of 2014 s. 52)
OTC derivative transaction (場外衍生工具交易) means a transaction in an OTC derivative product; (Added 6 of 2014 s. 52)

def.name: OtherCollateral
def.leadIn: other collateral (其他抵押品)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a licensed corporation, means any property (other than securities or money)—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: deposited with, or otherwise provided by or on behalf of a client of the licensed corporation to, any other intermediary or person,

paragraph.continued: which is so deposited or provided—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: as security for the provision by the licensed corporation of financial accommodation; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: to facilitate the provision by the licensed corporation of financial accommodation under an arrangement that confers on the licensed corporation a collateral interest in the property; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a registered institution, means any property (other than securities or money)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: deposited with, or otherwise provided by or on behalf of a client of the registered institution to, the registered institution, in the course of the conduct of any regulated activity for which the registered institution is registered; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: deposited with, or otherwise provided by or on behalf of a client of the registered institution to, any other intermediary or person, in relation to such conduct of the regulated activity,

paragraph.continued: which is so deposited or provided—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: as security for the provision by the registered institution of financial accommodation; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: to facilitate the provision by the registered institution of financial accommodation under an arrangement that confers on the registered institution a collateral interest in the property;

section.def: performance (執行), in relation to a function, includes discharge and exercise;
possession (管有), in relation to any matter, includes custody, control and power of or over the matter;
prescribed person (訂明人士) has the meaning given by section 101A of this Ordinance; (Added 6 of 2014 s. 52)

printed licence (印刷本牌照) means a certificate printed on paper or in any other physical form certifying the grant of a licence (whether issued before, on or after the commencement date§ of Part 2 of the Securities and Futures (Amendment) Ordinance 2015 (19 of 2015)); (Added 19 of 2015 s. 12)
Privacy Commissioner for Personal Data (私隱專員) means the Privacy Commissioner for Personal Data established under section 5(1) of the Personal Data (Privacy) Ordinance (Cap. 486);

def.name: ProfessionalInvestor
def.leadIn: professional investor (專業投資者) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any recognized exchange company, recognized clearing house, recognized exchange controller or recognized investor compensation company, or any person authorized to provide automated trading services under section 95(2) of this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
c
d
paragraph.content: any insurer authorized under the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41), or any other person carrying on insurance business and regulated under the law of any place outside Hong Kong; (Amended 12 of 2015 s. 144)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: any scheme which—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is a collective investment scheme authorized under section 104 of this Ordinance; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is similarly constituted under the law of any place outside Hong Kong and, if it is regulated under the law of such place, is permitted to be operated under the law of such place,

paragraph.continued: or any person by whom any such scheme is operated;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: any registered scheme as defined in section 2(1) of the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes Ordinance (Cap. 485), or its constituent fund as defined in section 2 of the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes (General) Regulation (Cap. 485 sub. leg. A), or any person who, in relation to any such registered scheme, is an approved trustee or service provider as defined in section 2(1) of that Ordinance or who is an investment manager of any such registered scheme or constituent fund;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: any scheme which—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is a registered scheme as defined in section 2(1) of the Occupational Retirement Schemes Ordinance (Cap. 426); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is an offshore scheme as defined in section 2(1) of that Ordinance and, if it is regulated under the law of the place in which it is domiciled, is permitted to be operated under the law of such place,

paragraph.name: h
i
paragraph.leadIn: except for the purposes of Schedule 5 to this Ordinance, any corporation which is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: a wholly owned subsidiary of—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: an intermediary, or any other person carrying on the business of the provision of investment services and regulated under the law of any place outside Hong Kong; or

subparagraph.name: B
ii
subparagraph.leadIn: a holding company which holds all the issued share capital of—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: an intermediary, or any other person carrying on the business of the provision of investment services and regulated under the law of any place outside Hong Kong; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: an authorized financial institution, or any bank which is not an authorized financial institution but is regulated under the law of any place outside Hong Kong; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: any other wholly owned subsidiary of a holding company referred to in subparagraph (ii); or

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: any person of a class which is prescribed by rules made under section 397 of this Ordinance for the purposes of this paragraph as within the meaning of this definition for the purposes of the provisions of this Ordinance, or to the extent that it is prescribed by rules so made as within the meaning of this definition for the purposes of any provision of this Ordinance;

def.name: Property
def.leadIn: property (財產) includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: money, goods, choses in action and land, whether in Hong Kong or elsewhere; and

paragraph.name: b

section.def: prospectus (招股章程) means prospectus as defined in section 2(1) of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32); (Replaced 30 of 2004 s. 3. Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)
public (公眾、大眾) means the public of Hong Kong, and includes any class of that public;

def.name: QualifyingCreditRating
def.leadIn: qualifying credit rating (合資格信貸評級) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a credit rating specified in Part 5; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any credit rating which, in the opinion of the Commission, is equivalent to a credit rating specified in Part 5;

section.def: recognized clearing house (認可結算所) means a company recognized as a clearing house under section 37(1) of this Ordinance;

def.name: RecognizedCounterparty
def.leadIn: recognized counterparty (認可對手方) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an authorized financial institution;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a particular transaction conducted by a corporation licensed for Type 3 regulated activity, another corporation which is also so licensed; or

paragraph.name: c

section.def: recognized futures market (認可期貨市場) means a futures market operated by a recognized exchange company;
recognized investor compensation company (認可投資者賠償公司) means a company recognized as an investor compensation company under section 79(1) of this Ordinance;
recognized stock market (認可證券市場) means a stock market operated by a recognized exchange company;

def.name: Record
def.leadIn: record (紀錄) means any record of information (however compiled or stored) and includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any books, deeds, contract or agreement, voucher, receipt or data material, or information which is recorded otherwise than in a legible form but is capable of being reproduced in a legible form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any document, disc, tape, sound track or other device in which sounds or other data (not being visual images) are embodied so as to be capable (with or without the aid of other equipment) of being reproduced, and any film (including a microfilm), tape or other device in which visual images are embodied so as to be capable (with or without the aid of other equipment) of being reproduced;

section.def: record keeping obligation (備存紀錄責任) has the meaning given by section 101A of this Ordinance; (Added 6 of 2014 s. 52)
re-domiciled company (經遷冊公司) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622); (Added 14 of 2025 s. 248)
registered (註冊) means registered under section 119 of this Ordinance, and registration (註冊) shall be construed accordingly;
registered institution (註冊機構) means an authorized financial institution which is registered under section 119 of this Ordinance;
Registrar of Companies (公司註冊處處長) means the Registrar of Companies appointed under section 21(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622); (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

regulated activity (受規管活動) means any of the regulated activities specified in Part 1 of Schedule 5 to this Ordinance, and a reference to a type of regulated activity by number shall be construed as a reference to the type of regulated activity of that number as specified in that Part;

regulated investment agreement (受規管投資協議) means an agreement the purpose or effect, or pretended purpose or effect, of which is to provide, whether conditionally or unconditionally, to any party to the agreement a profit, income or other returns calculated by reference to changes in the value of any property, but does not include an interest in a collective investment scheme;

relevant Ordinance (《有關條例》) means the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 32) as in force from time to time before the commencement date## of section 2 of Schedule 9 to the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622); (Added 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

def.name: RelevantProvisions
def.leadIn: relevant provisions (有關條文) means the provisions of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Parts II and XII of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32), so far as those Parts relate, directly or indirectly, to the performance of functions relating to prospectuses, whether or not such functions have been made the subject of a transfer order under section 25 or 68 of this Ordinance; ( Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

paragraph.name: ba
paragraph.leadIn: Part 5 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622), so far as that Part relates, directly or indirectly, to the performance of functions relating to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the buy-back by a corporation of its own shares; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a corporation giving financial assistance for the acquisition of its own shares,

paragraph.continued: whether or not such functions have been made the subject of a transfer order under section 25 or 68 of this Ordinance; (Added 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: Parts II and XII of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32), for the purposes only of section 213 of this Ordinance, and so far as those Parts relate, directly or indirectly, to an advertisement mentioned in section 38B(1) of that Ordinance; (Added 30 of 2004 s. 3. Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: Part 2 (except section 6) of the Anti-Money Laundering and Counter-Terrorist Financing Ordinance (Cap. 615); (Added 15 of 2011 s. 91. Amended 4 of 2018 s. 47)

section.def: remuneration (報酬) includes money, any consideration, financial accommodation or benefit, whether paid, provided or supplied directly or indirectly;
repealed Exchanges and Clearing Houses (Merger) Ordinance (已廢除的《交易所及結算所(合併)條例》) means the Exchanges and Clearing Houses (Merger) Ordinance (Cap. 555) repealed under section 406 of this Ordinance;
repealed Leveraged Foreign Exchange Trading Ordinance (已廢除的《槓桿式外匯買賣條例》) means the Leveraged Foreign Exchange Trading Ordinance (Cap. 451) repealed under section 406 of this Ordinance;
repealed Protection of Investors Ordinance (已廢除的《保障投資者條例》) means the Protection of Investors Ordinance (Cap. 335) repealed under section 406 of this Ordinance;
repealed Securities and Futures (Clearing Houses) Ordinance (已廢除的《證券及期貨(結算所)條例》) means the Securities and Futures (Clearing Houses) Ordinance (Cap. 420) repealed under section 406 of this Ordinance;
repealed Securities and Futures Commission Ordinance (已廢除的《證券及期貨事務監察委員會條例》) means the Securities and Futures Commission Ordinance (Cap. 24) repealed under section 406 of this Ordinance;
repealed Securities (Disclosure of Interests) Ordinance (已廢除的《證券(披露權益)條例》) means the Securities (Disclosure of Interests) Ordinance (Cap. 396) repealed under section 406 of this Ordinance;
repealed Securities (Insider Dealing) Ordinance (已廢除的《證券(內幕交易)條例》) means the Securities (Insider Dealing) Ordinance (Cap. 395) repealed under section 406 of this Ordinance;
repealed Stock Exchanges Unification Ordinance (已廢除的《證券交易所合併條例》) means the Stock Exchanges Unification Ordinance (Cap. 361) repealed under section 406 of this Ordinance;
reporting obligation (匯報責任) has the meaning given by section 101A of this Ordinance; (Added 6 of 2014 s. 52)
resolution authority (處置機制當局) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Financial Institutions (Resolution) Ordinance (Cap. 628); (Added 23 of 2016 s. 221. Amended E.R. 2 of 2017)

Resolution Compensation Tribunal (處置補償審裁處) means—(a)the Tribunal established by section 127(1) of the Financial Institutions (Resolution) Ordinance (Cap. 628); or (Amended E.R. 2 of 2017)(b)an additional tribunal established under section 128(1) of that Ordinance; (Added 23 of 2016 s. 221)

Resolvability Review Tribunal (處置可行性覆檢審裁處) means—(a)the Tribunal established by section 110(1) of the Financial Institutions (Resolution) Ordinance (Cap. 628); or (Amended E.R. 2 of 2017)(b)an additional tribunal established under section 111(1) of that Ordinance; (Added 23 of 2016 s. 221)

def.name: Rules
def.leadIn: rules (規章)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a recognized exchange company, means the rules, regulations and directions, by whatever name they may be called and wherever contained, governing—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: its exchange participants;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the persons who may participate in any of the services it provides;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the setting and levying of fees;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the listing of securities;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: the trading of securities or futures contracts;

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: the provision of other services; or

subparagraph.name: vii
subparagraph.content: generally, its management, operations or procedures,

paragraph.continued: and includes, in respect of sections 24 and 92 of this Ordinance, its constitution;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a recognized clearing house, means the rules, regulations and directions, by whatever name they may be called and wherever contained, governing—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: its clearing participants;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the persons who may participate in any of the services it provides;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the setting and levying of fees;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the provision of clearing and settlement services, and the suspension or withdrawal of such services;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: the provision of other services; or

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: generally, its management, operations or procedures,

paragraph.continued: and includes, in respect of sections 41 and 92 of this Ordinance, its constitution;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a recognized exchange controller, means—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: its constitution; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: the rules, regulations and directions, by whatever name they may be called and wherever contained, governing the conduct or procedures of—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the recognized exchange controller;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the Risk Management Committee; or

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: any person or body of persons declared in a notice under section 66(2) of this Ordinance to be a person or body of persons (as the case may be) to which this sub-subparagraph shall apply; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a recognized investor compensation company, means—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: its constitution; or

subparagraph.name: ii

section.def: scheme property (計劃財產) has the meaning given by section 112A of this Ordinance; (Added 16 of 2016 s. 19)

def.name: Securities
def.leadIn: securities (證券) means—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: certificates of interest or participation in, temporary or interim certificates for, receipts for, or warrants to subscribe for or purchase, such shares, stocks, debentures, loan stocks, funds, bonds or notes;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: interests in any collective investment scheme;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: interests, rights or property, whether in the form of an instrument or otherwise, commonly known as securities;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: interests, rights or property which is interests, rights or property, or is of a class or description of interests, rights or property, prescribed by notice under section 392 of this Ordinance as being regarded as securities in accordance with the terms of the notice; (Amended 8 of 2011 s. 14)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: a structured product that does not come within any of paragraphs (a) to (f) but in respect of which the issue of any advertisement, invitation or document that is or contains an invitation to the public to do any act referred to in section 103(1)(a) of this Ordinance is authorized, or required to be authorized, under section 105(1) of this Ordinance, (Added 8 of 2011 s. 14)

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: shares or debentures of a company that is a private company within the meaning of section 11 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622); (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.leadIn: any interest in any collective investment scheme that is—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: a registered scheme as defined in section 2(1) of the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes Ordinance (Cap. 485), or its constituent fund as defined in section 2 of the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes (General) Regulation (Cap. 485 sub. leg. A);

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: an occupational retirement scheme as defined in section 2(1) of the Occupational Retirement Schemes Ordinance (Cap. 426); or

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: a contract of insurance in relation to any class of insurance business specified in Schedule 1 to the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41); (Amended 12 of 2015 s. 144)

paragraph.name: iii
paragraph.content: any interest arising under a general partnership agreement or proposed general partnership agreement unless the agreement or proposed agreement relates to an undertaking, scheme, enterprise or investment contract promoted by or on behalf of a person whose ordinary business is or includes the promotion of similar undertakings, schemes, enterprises or investment contracts (whether or not that person is, or is to become, a party to the agreement or proposed agreement);

paragraph.name: iv
paragraph.content: any negotiable receipt or other negotiable certificate or document evidencing the deposit of a sum of money, or any rights or interest arising under the receipt, certificate or document;

paragraph.name: v
paragraph.content: any bill of exchange within the meaning of section 3 of the Bills of Exchange Ordinance (Cap. 19) and any promissory note within the meaning of section 89 of that Ordinance;

paragraph.name: vi
paragraph.content: any debenture that specifically provides that it is not negotiable or transferable (excluding a debenture that is a structured product in respect of which the issue of any advertisement, invitation or document that is or contains an invitation to the public to do any act referred to in section 103(1)(a) of this Ordinance is authorized, or required to be authorized, under section 105(1) of this Ordinance); (Amended 8 of 2011 s. 14)

paragraph.name: vii
paragraph.content: interests, rights or property which is interests, rights or property, or is of a class or description of interests, rights or property, prescribed by notice under section 392 of this Ordinance as not being regarded as securities in accordance with the terms of the notice;

section.def: Securities and Futures Appeals Tribunal (上訴審裁處) means the Securities and Futures Appeals Tribunal established by section 216 of this Ordinance;

securities and futures industry (證券期貨業) means the securities and futures market and participants (other than investors) therein (including recognized exchange companies, recognized clearing houses, recognized exchange controllers, recognized investor compensation companies and persons carrying on any regulated activity), and any activities related to financial products that are carried on in such securities and futures market or by such participants;

securities and futures market (證券期貨市場) means any market, exchange, place or service which facilitates the bringing together on a regular basis persons who are parties to transactions related to financial products;

securities borrowing and lending agreement (證券借貸協議) means an agreement whereby a person borrows or lends securities pursuant to an arrangement where the borrower undertakes to return securities of the same description, or pay the equivalent value of the securities, to the lender, and includes a stock borrowing within the meaning of section 19(16) of the Stamp Duty Ordinance (Cap. 117);

def.name: SecuritiesCollateral
def.leadIn: securities collateral (證券抵押品)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a licensed corporation, means any securities—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: deposited with, or otherwise provided by or on behalf of a client of the licensed corporation to, any other intermediary or person,

paragraph.continued: which are so deposited or provided—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: as security for the provision by the licensed corporation of financial accommodation; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: to facilitate the provision by the licensed corporation of financial accommodation under an arrangement that confers on the licensed corporation a collateral interest in the securities; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a registered institution, means any securities—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: deposited with, or otherwise provided by or on behalf of a client of the registered institution to, the registered institution, in the course of the conduct of any regulated activity for which the registered institution is registered; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: deposited with, or otherwise provided by or on behalf of a client of the registered institution to, any other intermediary or person, in relation to such conduct of the regulated activity,

paragraph.continued: which are so deposited or provided—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: as security for the provision by the registered institution of financial accommodation; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: to facilitate the provision by the registered institution of financial accommodation under an arrangement that confers on the registered institution a collateral interest in the securities;

section.def: served (送達) includes given;

shadow director (幕後董事) means a person in accordance with whose directions or instructions the directors of a corporation are accustomed or obliged to act, but a person shall not be regarded as a shadow director by reason only of the fact that the directors act on advice given by him in a professional capacity;

def.name: ShortSellingOrder
def.leadIn: short selling order (賣空指示)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: subject to paragraph (b), means an order to sell securities in respect of which the seller, or the person for whose benefit or on whose behalf the order is made, has a presently exercisable and unconditional right to vest the securities in the purchaser of them by virtue of having—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: under a securities borrowing and lending agreement—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: borrowed the securities; or

subparagraph.name: B
ii
iii
subparagraph.content: an option to acquire the securities to which the order relates;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: rights or warrants to subscribe for and to receive the securities to which the order relates; or

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: entered into with any other person an agreement or arrangement of a description prescribed by rules made under section 397 of this Ordinance for the purposes of this subparagraph;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to paragraph (a)(ii), (iii), (iv) or (v), does not include an order where the seller, or the person for whose benefit or on whose behalf the order is made, has, at the time of placing the order, issued unconditional instructions to obtain the securities to which the order relates;

def.name: SpecifiedDebtSecurities
def.leadIn: specified debt securities (指明債務證券) means debenture stocks, loan stocks, debentures, bonds, notes, indexed bonds, convertible debt securities, bonds with warrants, non-interest bearing debt securities and other securities or instruments acknowledging, evidencing or creating indebtedness—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: which are issued or guaranteed by the Government;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: which are issued by an issuer that has a qualifying credit rating for any of its debt instruments; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: which are issued by any other issuer as may be approved by the Commission in writing in a particular case;

section.def: specified futures exchange (指明期貨交易所) means a futures exchange specified in Part 2;

def.name: SpecifiedProvision
def.leadIn: specified provision (指明條文) means each of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Part IIIA of this Ordinance and subsidiary legislation made under it;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Division 3A of Part VIII of this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: sections 185, 187, 190 and 191 of this Ordinance to the extent to which they relate to an investigation of any matter under section 184A of this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: sections 186A, 385A and 388A of this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: Divisions 4 and 5 of Part IX of this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: f

section.def: specified stock exchange (指明證券交易所) means a stock exchange specified in Part 3;
stabilization option (穩定措施) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Financial Institutions (Resolution) Ordinance (Cap. 628); (Added 23 of 2016 s. 221. Amended E.R. 2 of 2017)
Stock Exchange Company (聯交所) means the company incorporated, and registered by the name The Stock Exchange of Hong Kong Limited, under the relevant Ordinance; (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

def.name: StockMarket
def.leadIn: stock market (證券市場) means a place where persons regularly meet together to negotiate sales and purchases of securities (including prices), or a place at which facilities are provided for bringing together sellers and purchasers of securities; but does not include the office of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an exchange participant of a recognized exchange company which may operate a stock market; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a recognized clearing house;

section.def: structured product (結構性產品) has the meaning given by section 1A of this Part; (Added 8 of 2011 s. 14)

take-over offer (收購要約), in relation to a corporation, means an offer made to all the holders (or all the holders other than the person making the offer and his nominees) of the shares in the corporation to acquire the shares or a specified proportion of them, or to all the holders (or all the holders other than the person making the offer and his nominees) of a particular class of the shares to acquire the shares of the class or a specified proportion of them;
title (稱銜) includes name or description;

trading right (交易權), in relation to a recognized exchange company, means a right to be eligible to trade through that exchange company or on a recognized stock market or a recognized futures market operated by that exchange company and entered as such a right in a list, roll or register kept by that exchange company.
within scope financial institution (受涵蓋金融機構) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Financial Institutions (Resolution) Ordinance (Cap. 628). (Added 23 of 2016 s. 221. Amended E.R. 2 of 2017)

section.name: s1A
section.heading: Meaning of structured product

def.name: StructuredProduct
def.leadIn: In this Ordinance, subject to subsection (2), structured product (結構性產品) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: an instrument under which some or all of the return or amount due (or both the return and the amount due) or the method of settlement is determined by reference to one or more of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: changes in the price, value or level (or a range within the price, value or level) of any type or combination of types of securities, commodity, index, property, interest rate, currency exchange rate or futures contract;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: changes in the price, value or level (or a range within the price, value or level) of any basket of more than one type, or any combination of types, of securities, commodity, index, property, interest rate, currency exchange rate or futures contract; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the occurrence or non-occurrence of any specified event or events (excluding an event or events relating only to the issuer or guarantor of the instrument or to both the issuer and the guarantor);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a regulated investment agreement; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any interests, rights or property prescribed, or of a class or description prescribed, by notice under section 392 of this Ordinance as being regarded as structured products in accordance with the notice.

subsection.leadIn: A structured product does not include—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a debenture issued for capital fund raising purposes that is convertible into or exchangeable for shares (whether issued or unissued) of the issuer of the debenture or of a related corporation of the issuer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a subscription warrant issued for capital fund raising purposes that entitles the holder to subscribe for shares (whether issued or unissued) of the issuer of the warrant or of a related corporation of the issuer;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a collective investment scheme;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a depositary receipt;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a debenture that would come within subsection (1)(a) only because it has a variable interest rate that is reset periodically to equate to a money market or interbank reference interest rate that is widely quoted (whether or not subject to a predetermined maximum or minimum rate) plus or minus a specified rate (if any);

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: a product under which some or all of the return or amount due (or both the return and the amount due) or the method of settlement is determined by reference to securities of a corporation, or of a related corporation of the corporation, and that is issued by the corporation only to a person who is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a bona fide employee or former employee of the corporation or of a related corporation of the corporation; or

subparagraph.name: ii

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: a product that may be possessed, promoted, offered, sold, printed or published only—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: under a licence, permission or other authorization under the Betting Duty Ordinance (Cap. 108) or the Gambling Ordinance (Cap. 148); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: under the Government Lotteries Ordinance (Cap. 334);

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.leadIn: an instrument issued in relation to—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: a contest included in a service licensed under Part 3A of the Telecommunications Ordinance (Cap. 106);

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: a contract of insurance in relation to any class of insurance business specified in Schedule 1 to the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41); or (Amended 12 of 2015 s. 144)

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: any interests, rights or property prescribed, or of a class or description prescribed, by notice under section 392 of this Ordinance as not being regarded as structured products in accordance with the notice.

section.name: s1B
section.heading: Meaning of OTC derivative product

subsection.leadIn: In this Ordinance, subject to subsections (2) and (3)—
subsection.def: OTC derivative product (場外衍生工具產品) means a structured product.

subsection.leadIn: An OTC derivative product does not include—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: securities that are traded on a recognized stock market;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a futures contract that is traded on a recognized futures market;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: a securities or futures contract that is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: traded on a stock market or futures market prescribed under section 392A of this Ordinance; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: cleared through a clearing house prescribed under that section;

paragraph.name: d
e
f
paragraph.leadIn: an instrument that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is in the form of shares, stocks, debentures, loan stocks, funds, bonds, notes, deposits or certificates of deposits or in the form of any other type of instrument prescribed under section 392A of this Ordinance; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: has an embedded feature that makes it a structured product;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: a spot contract;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.leadIn: a structured product that is offered—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: within an offer period that is not more than 2 weeks; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to multiple persons on identical terms, other than the consideration to be paid for the product; or

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: a structured product, or a structured product of a class or description, prescribed under section 392(1)(b)(vii) of this Ordinance as a product that is not to be regarded as an OTC derivative product in accordance with the notice.

subsection.content: An OTC derivative product also includes a product prescribed by notice under section 392(1)(a)(vii) of this Ordinance as a product that is to be regarded as an OTC derivative product in accordance with the notice.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: SpotContract
def.leadIn: spot contract (現貨合約) means a contract for the sale of any type or combination of types of securities, commodity, index, property, interest rate or currency exchange rate under the terms of which the settlement of the contract is scheduled to be made within the longest of the following periods—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the contract is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: entered into in Hong Kong, 2 business days after the date of entering into the contract; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: settled outside Hong Kong, 2 days on which each settlement facility necessary to settle the transaction is open for business, after the date of entering into the contract;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the period generally accepted in the market for that type or combination of types of securities, commodity, index, property, interest rate or currency exchange rate as the standard delivery period.

section.name: s2
section.heading: References to subsidiary

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance, a corporation shall be regarded as a subsidiary of another corporation if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the other corporation—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: controls the composition of its board of directors;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: controls more than half of its voting power at general meetings; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: holds more than half of its issued share capital (which issued share capital, for the purposes of this subparagraph, excludes any part thereof which carries no right to participate beyond a specified amount on a distribution of either profits or capital); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is a subsidiary of a corporation which is the other corporation’s subsidiary.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1), in determining whether a corporation is a subsidiary of another corporation—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: subject to paragraphs (c) and (d), any shares held or power exercisable—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: by a nominee for the other corporation (except where the other corporation is concerned only in a fiduciary capacity); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: by, or by a nominee for, a subsidiary of the other corporation, not being a subsidiary which is concerned only in a fiduciary capacity,

paragraph.continued: shall be regarded as held or exercisable by the other corporation;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any shares held or power exercisable by a person under a debenture of the corporation or under a trust deed for securing the issue of the debenture shall be disregarded; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any shares held or power exercisable by, or by a nominee for, the other corporation or its subsidiary, not being held or exercisable as mentioned in paragraph (c), shall be regarded as not held or exercisable by the other corporation if the ordinary business of the other corporation or its subsidiary (as the case may be) includes the lending of money and the shares are held or power is exercisable by way of security only for a transaction entered into in the ordinary course of that business.

section.name: s3
section.heading: References to related corporation
section.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: 2 or more corporations shall be regarded as related corporations of each other if one of them is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the holding company of the other;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a subsidiary of the other; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a subsidiary of the holding company of the other;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: when an individual—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: controls the composition of the board of directors of one or more corporations;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: controls more than half of the voting power at general meetings of one or more corporations; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: holds more than half of the issued share capital (which issued share capital, for the purposes of this subparagraph, excludes any part thereof which carries no right to participate beyond a specified amount on a distribution of either profits or capital) of one or more corporations,

paragraph.continued: each of the corporations referred to in subparagraph (i), (ii) or (iii), and each of their subsidiaries, shall be regarded as related corporations of each other.

section.name: s4
section.heading: References to controlling the composition of a corporation’s board of directors

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Ordinance, the composition of a corporation’s board of directors shall be regarded as controlled by another corporation if the other corporation, by the exercise of some power exercisable by it, can, without the consent or concurrence of any other person, appoint or remove all or a majority of the directors of the corporation.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1), a corporation shall be regarded as being able to appoint or remove a director of another corporation if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the appointment or removal cannot occur without the corporation exercising a power; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the appointment of a person as a director of the other corporation follows necessarily from his being a director or other officer of the corporation.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Ordinance, the composition of a corporation’s board of directors shall be regarded as controlled by an individual if the individual, by the exercise of some power exercisable by him, can, without the consent or concurrence of any other person, appoint or remove all or a majority of the directors of the corporation.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (3), an individual shall be regarded as being able to appoint or remove a director of a corporation if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the appointment or removal cannot occur without the individual exercising a power; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the appointment of a person as a director of the corporation follows necessarily from his being a director or other officer of another corporation and his appointment as a director or other officer of the other corporation cannot occur without the individual exercising a power.

section.name: s5
section.heading: References to wholly owned subsidiary
section.content: For the purposes of this Ordinance, a body corporate shall be regarded as the wholly owned subsidiary of another body corporate if it has no members except that other, that other’s nominee, that other’s wholly owned subsidiary (as construed in accordance with this section), such wholly owned subsidiary’s nominee, or any combination thereof.

section.name: s6
section.heading: References to substantial shareholder

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance, a person shall, in relation to a corporation, be regarded as a substantial shareholder of the corporation if he, either alone or with any of his associates—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: has an interest in shares in the corporation—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the aggregate number of which shares is equal to more than 10% of the total number of issued shares of the corporation; or (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: which entitles the person, either alone or with any of his associates and either directly or indirectly, to exercise or control the exercise of more than 10% of the voting power at general meetings of the corporation; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: holds shares in any other corporation which entitles him, either alone or with any of his associates and either directly or indirectly, to exercise or control the exercise of 35% or more of the voting power at general meetings of the other corporation, or of a further corporation, which is itself entitled, either alone or with any of its associates and either directly or indirectly, to exercise or control the exercise of more than 10% of the voting power at general meetings of the corporation.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1), a person shall be regarded as being entitled to exercise or control the exercise of 35% or more of the voting power at general meetings of a corporation indirectly if he, either alone or with any of his associates, has an interest in shares in a further corporation which entitles him, either alone or with any of his associates, to exercise or control the exercise of 35% or more of the voting power at general meetings of the further corporation which is itself entitled, either alone or with any of its associates, to exercise or control the exercise of 35% or more of the voting power at general meetings of the first-mentioned corporation.

section.name: s7
section.heading: References to securities of a corporation
section.leadIn: In this Ordinance, a reference to securities (however described) as those of a corporation shall, unless the context otherwise requires, be construed as a reference to securities (having the applicable meaning, whether under section 1 or otherwise) which are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: issued, made available or granted by the corporation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: proposed to be issued, made available or granted by the corporation; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: proposed to be issued, made available or granted by the corporation when it is incorporated.

section.name: s8
section.heading: References to interest of investing public
section.content: In this Ordinance, a reference to the interest of the investing public does not include any interest the taking into consideration of which is or is likely to be contrary to the public interest.

section.name: s9
section.heading: References to conditions
section.content: In this Ordinance, unless the context otherwise requires, a reference to any condition imposed under or pursuant to any provision of this Ordinance shall, in any case where the condition has been amended (however described) under or pursuant to any provision of this Ordinance, be construed as a reference to the condition as so amended.

section.name: s10
section.heading: References relating to regulated activity
section.leadIn: In this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: unless otherwise defined or excluded or the context otherwise requires, a person shall be regarded as carrying on a regulated activity if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: he carries on a business in a regulated activity; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: he performs for or on behalf of or by arrangement with a person carrying on a business in a regulated activity, any regulated function (as defined in section 113(1) of this Ordinance) in relation to the regulated activity;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person shall be regarded as carrying on a regulated activity for an intermediary if he performs for or on behalf of or by arrangement with the intermediary any regulated function (as defined in section 113(1) of this Ordinance) in relation to the regulated activity;

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a corporation licensed under section 116 or 117 of this Ordinance to carry on a regulated activity shall be regarded as being licensed for that regulated activity;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an individual licensed under section 120 or 121 of this Ordinance to carry on a regulated activity for a licensed corporation shall be regarded as being licensed for that regulated activity.

section.name: s11
section.heading: References to contravention, etc.
section.leadIn: In this Ordinance, unless the context otherwise requires—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a reference to contravention shall—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: be construed as including a reference to failure to comply; and

subparagraph.name: ii

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a reference to failure to comply shall—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: be construed as including a reference to contravention; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in relation to any provision of any Ordinance, be construed as including a reference to the commission of an offence under the provision.

section.name: s12
section.heading: References to Ordinance
section.content: For the avoidance of doubt, in this Ordinance, a reference to this or any other Ordinance, whether generally or specifically and whether by reference to the short title of the Ordinance or otherwise, shall, unless the context otherwise requires, be construed as including any subsidiary legislation made under this or that other Ordinance (as the case may be).

section.name: s13
section.heading: Notes in Ordinance
section.content: A note located in the text of this Ordinance is provided for information only and has no legislative effect.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Commencement of subsidiary legislation
section.leadIn: Without limiting section 28(5) of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1), if any subsidiary legislation made under this Ordinance is to come into operation on a day to be notified in the Gazette—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the notice may fix different days for a provision of the subsidiary legislation to come into operation for different purposes; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: different notices may fix different days for the provision to come into operation for different purposes.

part.name: P1
part.heading: Constitution and Proceedings of Commission, etc.
part.crossHeading: Chairman, chief executive officer and other members of Commission

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: The Commission shall consist of a chairman, a chief executive officer and such number of other executive directors and non-executive directors as is determined by the Chief Executive, all of whom shall be appointed by the Chief Executive as follows— (Amended 15 of 2006 s. 6)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the number of members of the Commission shall not be less than 8; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the number of non-executive directors of the Commission shall exceed the number of executive directors of the Commission. (Replaced 15 of 2006 s. 6)

section.name: s3
section.content: When the membership of the Commission ceases to comply with the requirements of section 1, the Chief Executive shall as soon as reasonably practicable thereafter make the necessary appointment to ensure that the requirements are complied with.

part.crossHeading: Deputy chairman and vacancies in office of chairman or deputy chairman

section.name: s4
section.content: The Chief Executive may appoint an executive director or non-executive director of the Commission to be the deputy chairman of the Commission. (Amended 15 of 2006 s. 6)

section.name: s5
section.content: If the office of chairman of the Commission is vacant or the chairman of the Commission is unable to act as chairman due to illness, absence from Hong Kong or any other cause, the deputy chairman appointed under section 4 shall act as chairman in his place.

section.name: s6
section.content: Notwithstanding that a deputy chairman has been appointed under section 4, the chairman of the Commission may, where there is no designation under section 7, designate an executive director or non-executive director of the Commission to act as chairman of the Commission for any period during which both he and the deputy chairman are unable to act as chairman due to illness, absence from Hong Kong or any other cause, and may at any time revoke any such designation. (Amended 15 of 2006 s. 6)

section.name: s7
section.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: no deputy chairman has been appointed under section 4 or the office of deputy chairman of the Commission is vacant; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the deputy chairman appointed under section 4 is unable to act as chairman due to illness, absence from Hong Kong or any other cause, and there is no designation under section 6,

section.continued: the Financial Secretary may designate an executive director or non-executive director of the Commission to act as chairman of the Commission for any period during which the chairman of the Commission is unable to act as chairman due to illness, absence from Hong Kong or any other cause. (Amended 15 of 2006 s. 6)

section.name: s8
section.leadIn: A designation under section 7 ceases to have effect when—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is revoked by the Financial Secretary;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the designation is under section 7(a), an appointment is made under section 4; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: where the designation is under section 7(b), the deputy chairman appointed under section 4 is able to act as chairman,

section.continued: whichever is the earlier.

section.name: s9
section.content: A deputy chairman of the Commission who acts as chairman of the Commission under section 5, or an executive director or non-executive director of the Commission who acts as chairman of the Commission in accordance with a designation under section 6 or 7, shall be deemed for all purposes to be the chairman of the Commission. (Replaced 15 of 2006 s. 6)

section.name: s9A
section.leadIn: Notwithstanding section 9—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: a non-executive director of the Commission shall not cease to be regarded as such only because of his acting as chairman of the Commission. (Added 15 of 2006 s. 6)

section.crossHeading: Vacancy in office of chief executive officer

section.name: s9B
section.content: The Chief Executive may designate an executive director of the Commission to act as chief executive officer of the Commission for any period during which the chief executive officer of the Commission is unable to act as chief executive officer due to illness, absence from Hong Kong or any other cause, and may at any time revoke any such designation. (Added 15 of 2006 s. 6)

section.name: s9C
section.content: An executive director of the Commission who acts as chief executive officer of the Commission shall be deemed for all purposes to be the chief executive officer of the Commission. (Added 15 of 2006 s. 6)

part.crossHeading: Functions and office of members, etc.

section.name: s9D
section.content: Subject to the other provisions of this Ordinance, the chairman, deputy chairman and chief executive officer of the Commission shall have such functions as are assigned to them by the Commission. (Added 15 of 2006 s. 6)

section.name: s10
section.content: The terms and conditions of the office of a member of the Commission (whether as the chairman, deputy chairman, chief executive officer or otherwise) shall be determined by the Chief Executive. (Amended 15 of 2006 s. 6)

section.name: s11
section.content: A member of the Commission (whether as the chairman, deputy chairman, chief executive officer or otherwise) may at any time resign his office by notice in writing to the Chief Executive. (Amended 15 of 2006 s. 6)

section.name: s12
section.content: A member of the Commission (whether as the chairman, deputy chairman, chief executive officer or otherwise) shall be paid by the Commission such remuneration, allowances or expenses as the Chief Executive may determine. (Amended 15 of 2006 s. 6)

section.name: s13
section.content: The Chief Executive may by notice in writing remove from office any member of the Commission (whether as the chairman, deputy chairman, chief executive officer or otherwise) whose removal appears to him to be desirable for the effective performance by the Commission of its functions. (Amended 15 of 2006 s. 6)

part.crossHeading: Meetings

section.name: s14
section.content: Meetings of the Commission shall be held as often as may be necessary for the performance of its functions, and may be convened by the chairman, deputy chairman, chief executive officer, or any 2 other members, of the Commission. (Amended 15 of 2006 s. 6)

section.name: s15
section.leadIn: At a meeting of the Commission—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the chairman of the Commission is present, he shall be the chairman of the meeting;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the chairman of the Commission is not present but the deputy chairman of the Commission is present, the deputy chairman shall be the chairman of the meeting; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if neither the chairman nor the deputy chairman of the Commission is present, the members of the Commission present shall choose one of their number to be the chairman of the meeting.

section.name: s16
section.content: The quorum for a meeting of the Commission is not less than one third of the executive directors of the Commission and not less than one third of the non-executive directors of the Commission.

section.name: s16A
section.leadIn: For the purpose of forming a quorum under section 16—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (b), the chairman of the Commission shall be counted as a non-executive director of the Commission; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: notwithstanding sections 9 and 9A—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an executive director of the Commission who acts as chairman of the Commission shall only be counted as an executive director of the Commission; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a non-executive director of the Commission who acts as chairman of the Commission shall only be counted as a non-executive director of the Commission. (Added 15 of 2006 s. 6)

section.name: s17
section.content: A member of the Commission shall be regarded as being present at a meeting of the Commission if he participates in the meeting by telephone, video conferencing or other electronic means, provided he is able to hear the other members present at the meeting and they are able to hear him.

section.name: s18
section.content: Each member of the Commission present at a meeting of the Commission has one vote.

section.name: s19
section.content: Every question for decision at a meeting of the Commission shall be determined by a majority of votes of its members present and, in the event that voting is equally divided, the chairman of the meeting shall, subject to section 20, have a casting vote.

section.name: s20
section.content: The chairman of a meeting of the Commission shall not exercise a casting vote in respect of any question for decision at the meeting until after he has consulted the Financial Secretary on the question.

part.crossHeading: Written resolution

section.name: s21
section.leadIn: Where a resolution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is in writing; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: is signed by such number of members of the Commission as—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: would include all of the members of the Commission who are, at any time when the resolution is made available for signature, present in Hong Kong and capable of signing the resolution; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is also not less than one third of the executive directors of the Commission and not less than one third of the non-executive directors of the Commission,

section.continued: the resolution shall be as valid and effectual as if it had been passed at a meeting of the Commission convened and conducted in accordance with this Ordinance.

section.name: s22
section.leadIn: For the purposes of section 21, a resolution to which that section applies may be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the form of one document; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the form of more than one document, each in the like form and signed by one or more members of the Commission.

section.name: s23
section.content: Where a resolution is in the form of more than one document as described in section 22(b), the requirement under section 21(b) shall be regarded as having been satisfied if the documents together bear the signatures of such number of members of the Commission as is specified in section 21(b)(i) and (ii).

section.name: s24
section.leadIn: For the purposes of sections 21 to 23—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a document shall be regarded as having been signed by a member of the Commission if a telex, cable, facsimile or electronic transmission of a document bears the signature of the member; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a resolution to which section 21 applies shall be regarded as made on the date on which the resolution is signed by the last person signing as a member of the Commission for the purposes of that section.

part.crossHeading: Seal, and regulation of administration, etc.

section.name: s25
section.content: The Commission shall have a seal, the affixing of which shall be authenticated by the signature of the chairman or the deputy chairman of the Commission, or by the signature of such other member of the Commission as is authorized by it to act in that behalf.

section.name: s26
section.content: The Commission shall organize and regulate its administration, procedure and business in such manner as it considers will, subject to the requirements of this Ordinance, best ensure the performance of its functions.

part.crossHeading: Advisory Committee

section.name: s27
section.leadIn: The Advisory Committee shall consist of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the chairman of the Commission;

paragraph.name: aa
b
paragraph.content: not more than 2 other executive directors of the Commission who shall be appointed by the Commission;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: not less than 8 (but not more than 12) other members who shall be appointed by the Chief Executive after consultation with the Commission.

section.name: s28
section.leadIn: A meeting of the Advisory Committee may be convened by—

paragraph.name: a
aa
paragraph.content: the chief executive officer of the Commission; or (Added 15 of 2006 s. 6)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any 3 other members of the Advisory Committee.

section.name: s29
section.leadIn: At a meeting of the Advisory Committee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the chairman of the Commission is present, he shall be the chairman of the meeting; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the chairman of the Commission is not present, the members of the Advisory Committee present shall choose one of their number to be the chairman of the meeting.

section.name: s30
section.content: Where a member of the Advisory Committee appointed under section 27(b) ceases to be an executive director of the Commission, he ceases to be a member of the Advisory Committee.

section.name: s31
section.leadIn: A member of the Advisory Committee appointed under section 27(b) or (c) may at any time resign his office by notice in writing to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where he has been appointed under section 27(b), the Commission; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where he has been appointed under section 27(c), the Chief Executive.

section.name: s32
section.content: The Chief Executive may by notice in writing remove from office any member of the Advisory Committee appointed under section 27(c).

section.name: s1
section.content: Any function of the Commission to make subsidiary legislation under or pursuant to any Ordinance.

section.name: s2
section.leadIn: The following functions of the Commission—

subsection.content: to borrow money, under section 5(4)(d) of this Ordinance;

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: to establish a wholly owned subsidiary, under section 5(4)(da) of this Ordinance; (Added 9 of 2012 s. 33)
to establish any committee, under section 8(1) of this Ordinance;
to refer any matter to a committee, under section 8(2) of this Ordinance;
to appoint a person to be a member or chairman of a committee, under section 8(3) of this Ordinance;
to submit to the Chief Executive estimates, under section 13(2) of this Ordinance;
to prepare any financial statements, under section 15(2) of this Ordinance;
to prepare any report, under section 15(3) of this Ordinance;
to appoint auditors, under section 16(1) of this Ordinance;
to amend or revoke conditions, or impose new conditions, under section 19(3) of this Ordinance;
to give a company a reasonable opportunity of being heard, under section 19(7) of this Ordinance;
