part.name: P3
part.heading: Functions of Commission Delegable for Resolution

schedule.name: sch3
schedule.heading: Exchange Companies, Clearing Houses and Exchange Controllers

section.name: s1
section.def: In this Schedule, unless the context otherwise requires, associated person (相聯者), controller (控制人), default rules (違責處理規則), indirect controller (間接控制人), market charge (市場押記), market collateral (市場抵押品) and shareholder controller (股東控制人) have the meanings respectively assigned to them in section 18 of this Ordinance.

part.name: P2
part.heading: Specification of Persons Who are Associated Persons

part.name: P3
part.heading: Specification of Persons Who are not Associated Persons

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: A person (first person) is not an associated person of another person (second person) for the purposes of all the provisions of Division 4 of Part III of this Ordinance in so far as—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the first person or the second person is a recognized clearing house (or its nominee) acting in its capacity as such;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the first person is the chairman of a general meeting of a corporation entitled to exercise voting rights in the corporation due to his appointment as a proxy by the second person where the appointment—

subparagraph.content: is for that meeting only; and
does not involve any valuable consideration; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the first person and the second person are persons who have appointed the chairman of a general meeting of a corporation as a proxy to exercise voting rights in the corporation where each appointment—

subparagraph.content: is for that meeting only; and
does not involve any valuable consideration.

section.name: s2
section.leadIn: A person is not an associated person of another person for the purposes of section 61 of this Ordinance by reason only of each person having appointed the same person as a proxy to exercise voting rights in a corporation at a general meeting of the corporation where each appointment—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is for that meeting only; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: does not involve any valuable consideration.

part.name: P4
part.heading: Specification of Persons Who are not Indirect Controllers

section.name: s1
section.content: A person is not an indirect controller for all the provisions of Division 4 of Part III of this Ordinance in so far as the person is a person in accordance with whose directions or instructions the directors of a corporation or of another corporation of which it is a subsidiary are accustomed or obliged to act by reason only that they act on advice given by the person in the person’s professional capacity.

part.name: P5
part.heading: Requirements for Default Rules of Recognized Clearing Houses

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: The rules of a recognized clearing house which provide for the taking of proceedings or other action if a clearing participant appears to be unable, or likely to become unable, to meet his obligations in respect of all unsettled or open market contracts to which he is a party, shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: enable the settlement, or closing-out by offset, of all of the contracts;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the purpose of paragraph (a), provide for there to be payable by or to the clearing participant a sum of money in relation to each contract if this is required after taking into account all the rights and liabilities of the clearing participant under or in respect of the contract concerned;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: enable all sums of money payable by or to the clearing participant as determined in accordance with paragraph (b) to be aggregated or set-off so as to produce a net sum (if any) payable by or to the clearing participant;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if any net sum referred to in paragraph (c) is payable by the clearing participant, provide for that net sum to be set-off against all property of the clearing participant which is either subject to a market charge or which has been provided as market collateral (or set-off against the proceeds of the realization of such property) so as to produce a further net sum (if any) payable by or to the clearing participant;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: if any net sum referred to in paragraph (c) is payable to the clearing participant, provide that all property of the clearing participant which is either subject to a market charge or which has been provided as market collateral shall cease to be subject to the market charge (but without prejudice to any other form of charge to which it may be subject) or to be market collateral (but without prejudice to its provision as any other form of collateral) (as the case may be); and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: provide for the certification by the clearing house of any net sum referred to in paragraph (c) payable to the clearing participant, or of any further net sum referred to in paragraph (d) payable by or to the clearing participant (as the case may be) or, if there is no such sum, the certification by the clearing house of that fact.

section.name: s2
section.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the recognized clearing house operates in such a manner that paragraphs (a), (b), (c), (d), (e) and (f) of section 1 may be complied with separately in respect of each of the capacities,

section.continued: paragraphs (a), (b), (c), (d), (e) and (f) of section 1 must be complied with separately in respect of each capacity.

section.name: s3
section.leadIn: For the purposes of section 2—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a clearing participant will be regarded as recording market contracts in a separate capacity in respect of its house accounts and each of its client accounts if—

subparagraph.content: for house accounts—transactions that are required or permitted by the RCH rules to be recorded in any of the clearing participant’s house accounts with the recognized clearing house have been so recorded; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any net sum payable to the clearing participant in respect of transactions recorded in a client account, as calculated under section 1(c), must not be set-off against any net sum payable by the clearing participant in respect of transactions recorded in any house account, as calculated under that section, regardless of any provision to the contrary in the RCH rules;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any net sum payable to the clearing participant in respect of transactions recorded in house accounts, as calculated under section 1(c), may be set-off against any net sum payable by the clearing participant in respect of transactions recorded in any client account, as calculated under that section, if the RCH rules so provide or permit;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any net sum payable to the clearing participant in respect of transactions recorded in a client account, as calculated under section 1(c), may not be set-off against any net sum payable by the clearing participant in respect of transactions recorded in any other client account, as calculated under that section, if the RCH rules so provide.

section.name: s4
section.leadIn: To avoid doubt—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a transfer of a defaulting participant’s positions under an unsettled market contract and collateral in a client account to one or more other clearing participants of the recognized clearing house in accordance with the RCH rules constitutes settlement of that contract for the purposes of section 1(a); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: without limiting section 1(b), the reference in that section to the rights and liabilities of the clearing participant under or in respect of the contract concerned includes the rights and liabilities that arise as a result of action taken under the RCH rules authorizing or permitting the transfer of the clearing participant’s positions under the contract and collateral in a client account to one or more other clearing participants of the recognized clearing house.

section.name: s5
section.content: Sections 1, 2, 3 and 4 apply despite section 55 of this Ordinance.

section.name: s6
section.content: In this Part, a reference to a set-off or offset includes a netting arrangement.

section.name: s7
section.content: For the purposes of this Part, a sum of money payable by, or payable to, a person includes a value to be taken into account under a netting arrangement to which the person is a party.

section.name: s8
section.leadIn: In this Part—

def.name: HouseAccount
def.leadIn: house account (結算所帳户), in relation to a clearing participant, means an account—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: which is held with a recognized clearing house in the name of the clearing participant; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in which the following are recorded—

subparagraph.content: the clearing participant’s own positions or collateral;

section.def: netting (淨額計算) means the determination of a net balance by taking account of the values (whether positive or negative) attributed to an accelerated or terminated payment, or to a delivery obligation or entitlement;
RCH rules (《認可結算所規章》), in relation to a recognized clearing house, means the rules of the clearing house referred to in section 1.

part.name: P6
part.heading:
Provisions Applicable Where there is Failure to Comply with Notice under Section 59(9)(c), 61(9)(b)
or 72(1) of this Ordinance

section.name: s1
section.heading: Restrictions on and sale of securities

subsection.content: The powers conferred by this section shall be exercisable where a person has failed to comply with a notice under section 59(9)(c), 61(9)(b) or 72(1) of this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may, by notice in writing served on the person concerned, direct that any specified securities to which this section applies shall, until further notice, be subject to one or more of the following restrictions—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: no voting rights shall be exercisable in respect of the securities;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: no further securities shall be issued in right of them or pursuant to any offer made to their holder;

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.content: that the holder of the securities shall cause them to be transferred to a nominee of the Commission specified in the notice and within the period specified in the notice.

subsection.content: Where securities are subject to the restrictions under subsection (2)(a), any agreement to transfer them or, in the case of unissued securities, the right to be issued with them, shall be void.

Where securities are subject to the restrictions under subsection (2)(c) or (d), any agreement to transfer any right to be issued with other securities in right of those securities, or to receive any payment on them (otherwise than in a liquidation), shall be void.

subsection.leadIn: Where securities are subject to any restrictions under subsection (2), any person affected by any of those restrictions may request the Commission to make an application referred to in subsection (6)(a) in respect of those securities and, where such a request is made, the Commission shall, not later than 30 days after that request has been made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: comply with that request; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: serve a notice in writing on that person stating that it does not propose to comply with that request.

subsection.leadIn: The Court of First Instance may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the application of the Commission, order the sale of any specified securities to which this section applies and, if they are for the time being subject to any restrictions under subsection (2), that they shall cease to be subject to those restrictions;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on the application of a person who has made a request under subsection (5) where he has been served with a notice under paragraph (b) of that subsection in respect of that request, order the sale of any specified securities to which that request relates and that they shall cease to be subject to any restrictions under subsection (2).

subsection.content: Where an order has been made under subsection (6), the Court of First Instance may, on the application of the Commission, make such further order relating to the sale or transfer of the securities as it considers appropriate.

Where securities are sold pursuant to an order under this section, the proceeds of the sale, less the costs of the sale, shall, unless otherwise specified by the Court of First Instance, be paid into court for the benefit of the persons beneficially interested in them, and any such person may apply to the Court of First Instance for an order that the whole or part of the proceeds be paid to him.

subsection.leadIn: This section shall apply—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to all the securities of the corporation concerned by virtue of which the person concerned is a shareholder controller, or minority controller within the meaning of section 61 of this Ordinance, of the corporation which are held by him or any associated person of his and were not so held immediately before he became such a controller; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the person concerned became a shareholder controller, or minority controller within the meaning of section 61 of this Ordinance, of the corporation concerned by virtue of the acquisition by him or any associated person of his of securities of another corporation, to all the securities of that corporation which are held by him or any associated person of his and were not so held immediately before he became such a controller.

subsection.content: A copy of a notice served under subsection (2) on the person concerned shall be served on the corporation to whose securities it relates and, if it relates to securities held by any associated person of that person, on that associated person.
The Chief Justice may make rules regulating the practice and procedure in connection with applications (including any class of applications) made under subsection (6).
It is hereby declared that the operation of subsection (2)(b) or (e) shall not by itself cause any person to contravene section 59(1) or 61(1) of this Ordinance.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Punishment for attempted evasion of restrictions

subsection.leadIn: Any person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: exercises or purports to exercise any right to dispose of any securities, or of any right to be issued with any such securities, knowing that to do so contravenes any restrictions under section 1(2) to which the securities are subject;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: votes in respect of any such securities as a holder or as a proxy knowing that to do so contravenes any such restrictions;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: being the holder of any such securities, fails to notify of their being subject to those restrictions any person whom he does not know to be aware of that fact but does know to be entitled (apart from the restrictions) to vote in respect of those securities whether as a holder or as a proxy;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: being the holder of any such securities, or being entitled to any right to be issued with other securities in right of them, or to receive any payment on them (otherwise than in a liquidation), enters into any agreement which is void under section 1(3) or (4); or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with a restriction under section 1(2)(e) to which any such securities are subject,

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: Where securities of a corporation are issued in contravention of restrictions under section 1(2) or payments are made by a corporation in contravention of such restrictions, every director and every manager of the corporation who knowingly and wilfully permits such an issue of securities or the making of such a payment (as the case may be) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Prohibition on certain person acting as indirect controllers

subsection.def: In this section, prohibited person (受禁制人士), in relation to a corporation, means any person who has failed to comply with a notice under section 59(9)(c) or 72(1) of this Ordinance in relation to the corporation in so far as the notice relates to a controller who is an indirect controller.

subsection.content: Where a person is or may become a prohibited person in respect of a corporation, the Commission shall serve on the corporation a copy of the notice concerned under section 59(9)(c) or 72(1) of this Ordinance.

No person who is a prohibited person in respect of a corporation shall act or continue to act (as the case may be) as an indirect controller of the corporation and, accordingly, as such a controller shall not give or shall cease to give (as the case may be) any directions or instructions to the directors of the corporation or of another corporation of which it is a subsidiary.

subsection.leadIn: Where any director of a corporation or of another corporation of which it is a subsidiary is given (whether directly or indirectly) any directions or instructions—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: which are, or might reasonably be construed as being, prohibited from being so given by virtue of subsection (3),

subsection.continued: the director shall forthwith notify the Commission of those directions or instructions and the circumstances in which they were so given.

subsection.leadIn: Any prohibited person who contravenes subsection (3) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

subsection.leadIn: Any director who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (4) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

subsection.content: In this section, a reference to a continuing offence means an offence consisting of a person’s continued default, refusal or other contravention of subsection (3) or (4), and notwithstanding that any period (however expressed) specified in that subsection for complying with it has expired.

part.name: P7
part.heading: Specification of Persons Who are not Minority Controllers

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: A person is not a minority controller for the purposes of Division 4 of Part III of this Ordinance in so far as the person is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a recognized clearing house (or its nominee) acting in its capacity as such; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the chairman of a general meeting of a corporation entitled to exercise voting rights in the corporation due to his appointment as a proxy where the appointment—

subparagraph.content: is for that meeting only; and
does not involve any valuable consideration.

section.name: s2
section.leadIn: A person is not a minority controller for all the provisions of Division 4 of Part III of this Ordinance by reason only of being entitled to exercise voting rights in a corporation due to his appointment as a proxy where the appointment—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is for only one general meeting of the corporation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: does not involve any valuable consideration.

part.name: P8
part.heading: Exemption from Section 59(1) of this Ordinance

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: A person is exempt from section 59(1) of this Ordinance in so far as the person is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a recognized clearing house (or its nominee) acting in its capacity as such; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the controller of a corporation by reason only of being the chairman of a general meeting of the corporation entitled to exercise voting rights in the corporation due to his appointment as a proxy where the appointment—

subparagraph.content: is for that meeting only; and
does not involve any valuable consideration.

part.name: P2

def.name: AdvisingOnCorporateFinance
def.leadIn: advising on corporate finance (就機構融資提供意見) means giving advice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: concerning compliance with or in respect of rules made under section 23 or 36 of this Ordinance governing the listing of securities and the code published under section 399(2)(a) or (b) of this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: concerning—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any offer to dispose of securities to the public;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any offer to acquire securities from the public; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: acceptance of any offer referred to in subparagraph (i) or (ii), but only in so far as the advice is given generally to holders of securities or a class of securities; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to a listed corporation or public company or a subsidiary of the corporation or company, or to its officers or shareholders, concerning corporate restructuring in respect of securities (including the issue, cancellation or variation of any rights attaching to any securities),

def.continued: but does not include such advice given by—

paragraph.name: i
ii
iii
iv
paragraph.leadIn: an individual—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: whose name is entered in the register maintained by the Monetary Authority under section 20 of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155) as engaged in respect of Type 1 regulated activity by an authorized financial institution registered for that regulated activity; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: who gives such advice wholly incidental to the carrying on of that regulated activity;

paragraph.name: v
vi
paragraph.content: counsel who gives such advice wholly incidental to his practice as such;

paragraph.name: vii
paragraph.content: a certified public accountant who gives such advice wholly incidental to his practice as such in a practice unit as defined by section 2(1) of the Accounting and Financial Reporting Council Ordinance (Cap. 588); (Amended 23 of 2004 s. 56; L.N. 66 of 2022)
a trust company registered under Part 8 of the Trustee Ordinance (Cap. 29) which gives such advice wholly incidental to the discharge of its duty as such; or

paragraph.name: ix
paragraph.leadIn: a person through—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: a newspaper, magazine, book or other publication which is made generally available to the public; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: television broadcast or radio broadcast for reception by the public, whether on subscription or otherwise;

def.name: AdvisingOnFuturesContracts
def.leadIn: advising on futures contracts (就期貨合約提供意見) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: giving advice on—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: whether;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: which;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the time at which; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the terms or conditions on which,

paragraph.continued: futures contracts should be entered into; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: issuing analyses or reports, for the purposes of facilitating the recipients of the analyses or reports to make decisions on—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: whether;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: which;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the time at which; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the terms or conditions on which,

paragraph.continued: futures contracts are to be entered into,

def.continued: otherwise than by—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: a corporation which gives such advice or issues such analyses or reports solely to any of its wholly owned subsidiaries, its holding company which holds all its issued shares, or other wholly owned subsidiaries of that holding company;

paragraph.name: ii
iii
paragraph.content: an authorized financial institution which is registered for Type 2 regulated activity which gives such advice or issues such analyses or reports wholly incidental to the carrying on of that regulated activity;

paragraph.name: iv
paragraph.leadIn: an individual—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: whose name is entered in the register maintained by the Monetary Authority under section 20 of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155) as engaged in respect of Type 2 regulated activity by an authorized financial institution registered for that regulated activity; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: who gives such advice or issues such analyses or reports wholly incidental to the carrying on of that regulated activity;

paragraph.name: 4a
paragraph.leadIn: a person—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: who is licensed or registered for Type 9 regulated activity;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: who provides a service of managing a portfolio of futures contracts under a collective investment scheme for another person that the person is permitted to provide under that licence or registration; and (Amended 6 of 2014 s. 53)

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: who gives such advice or issues such analyses or reports solely for the purposes of providing the service described in subparagraph (B); (Added L.N. 197 of 2005)

paragraph.name: v
paragraph.content: a solicitor who gives such advice, or issues such analyses or reports as part of an advice given, wholly incidental to his practice as a solicitor in a Hong Kong firm or foreign firm within the meaning of the Legal Practitioners Ordinance (Cap. 159);

paragraph.name: vi
vii
paragraph.content: a certified public accountant who gives such advice, or issues such analyses or reports as part of an advice given, wholly incidental to his practice as a certified public accountant in a practice unit as defined by section 2(1) of the Accounting and Financial Reporting Council Ordinance (Cap. 588); (Amended 23 of 2004 s. 56; L.N. 66 of 2022)
a trust company registered under Part 8 of the Trustee Ordinance (Cap. 29) which gives such advice or issues such analyses or reports wholly incidental to the discharge of its duty as such; or

paragraph.name: ix
paragraph.leadIn: a person who gives such advice or issues such analyses or reports through—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: a newspaper, magazine, book or other publication which is made generally available to the public; or

subparagraph.name: B

def.name: AdvisingOnSecurities
def.leadIn: advising on securities (就證券提供意見) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: giving advice on—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: whether;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: which;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the time at which; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the terms or conditions on which,

paragraph.continued: securities should be acquired or disposed of; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: issuing analyses or reports, for the purposes of facilitating the recipients of the analyses or reports to make decisions on—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: whether;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: which;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the time at which; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the terms or conditions on which,

paragraph.continued: securities are to be acquired or disposed of,

def.continued: otherwise than by—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: a corporation which gives such advice or issues such analyses or reports solely to any of its wholly owned subsidiaries, its holding company which holds all its issued shares, or other wholly owned subsidiaries of that holding company;

paragraph.name: ii
iii
paragraph.content: an authorized financial institution which is registered for Type 1 regulated activity which gives such advice or issues such analyses or reports wholly incidental to the carrying on of that regulated activity;

paragraph.name: iv
paragraph.leadIn: an individual—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: whose name is entered in the register maintained by the Monetary Authority under section 20 of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155) as engaged in respect of Type 1 regulated activity by an authorized financial institution registered for that regulated activity; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: who gives such advice or issues such analyses or reports wholly incidental to the carrying on of that regulated activity;

paragraph.name: 4a
paragraph.leadIn: a person—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: who is licensed or registered for Type 9 regulated activity;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: who provides a service of managing a portfolio of securities under a collective investment scheme for another person that the person is permitted to provide under that licence or registration; and (Amended 6 of 2014 s. 53)

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: who gives such advice or issues such analyses or reports solely for the purposes of providing the service described in subparagraph (B); (Added L.N. 197 of 2005)

paragraph.name: v
paragraph.content: a solicitor who gives such advice, or issues such analyses or reports as part of an advice given, wholly incidental to his practice as a solicitor in a Hong Kong firm or foreign firm within the meaning of the Legal Practitioners Ordinance (Cap. 159);

paragraph.name: vi
vii
paragraph.content: a certified public accountant who gives such advice, or issues such analyses or reports as part of an advice given, wholly incidental to his practice as a certified public accountant in a practice unit as defined by section 2(1) of the Accounting and Financial Reporting Council Ordinance (Cap. 588); (Amended 23 of 2004 s. 56; L.N. 66 of 2022)
a trust company registered under Part 8 of the Trustee Ordinance (Cap. 29) which gives such advice or issues such analyses or reports wholly incidental to the discharge of its duty as such; or

paragraph.name: ix
paragraph.leadIn: a person who gives such advice or issues such analyses or reports through—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: a newspaper, magazine, book or other publication which is made generally available to the public; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: television broadcast or radio broadcast for reception by the public, whether on subscription or otherwise,

def.continued: but does not include the giving of such advice or issuing of such analyses or reports that falls within the meaning of advising on corporate finance or providing credit rating services; (Amended L.N. 28 of 2011; 6 of 2014 s. 53)

def.name: AssetManagement
def.leadIn: asset management (資產管理) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: real estate investment scheme management; or

paragraph.name: b

def.name: AutomatedTradingServices
def.leadIn: automated trading services (自動化交易服務) means services provided by means of electronic facilities, not being facilities provided by a recognized exchange company or a recognized clearing house, whereby—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: offers to sell or purchase securities or futures contracts are regularly made or accepted in a way that forms or results in a binding transaction in accordance with established methods, including any method commonly used by a stock market or futures market;

paragraph.name: ab
paragraph.content: offers to enter into OTC derivative transactions are regularly made or accepted in a way that forms or results in a binding transaction in accordance with established methods; (Added 6 of 2014 s. 53)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: persons are regularly introduced, or identified to other persons in order that they may negotiate or conclude, or with the reasonable expectation that they will negotiate or conclude sales or purchases of securities or futures contracts in a way that forms or results in a binding transaction in accordance with established methods, including any method commonly used by a stock market or futures market; (Amended 6 of 2014 s. 53)

paragraph.name: ba
paragraph.leadIn: persons are regularly introduced, or identified to other persons—

subparagraph.content: in order that they may negotiate or conclude OTC derivative transactions in a way that forms or results in a binding transaction in accordance with established methods; or
with the reasonable expectation that they will negotiate or conclude OTC derivative transactions in such a way; (Added 6 of 2014 s. 53)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: transactions—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: referred to in paragraph (a);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: resulting from the activities referred to in paragraph (b); or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: effected on, or subject to the rules of, a stock market or futures market,

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: transactions—

subparagraph.content: referred to in paragraph (ab); or
resulting from the activities referred to in paragraph (ba),

paragraph.continued: may be novated, cleared, settled or guaranteed, (Added 6 of 2014 s. 53)

def.continued: but does not include such services provided by a corporation operated by or on behalf of the Government or any excluded services; (Amended 6 of 2014 s. 53)

def.name: c
def.leadIn: credit ratings (信貸評級) means opinions, expressed using a defined ranking system, primarily regarding the creditworthiness of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person other than an individual;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: debt securities;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: preferred securities; or

paragraph.name: d

def.name: DealingInFuturesContracts
def.leadIn: dealing in futures contracts (期貨合約交易), in relation to a person, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: making or offering to make an agreement with another person to enter into, or to acquire or dispose of, a futures contract;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: inducing or attempting to induce another person to enter into, or to offer to enter into, a futures contract; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: inducing or attempting to induce another person to acquire or dispose of a futures contract,

def.continued: by the person, except where the person—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: is carrying out his functions as a recognized clearing house;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.leadIn: performs the act referred to in paragraph (a), (b) or (c) through another person (the futures dealer)—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: who is licensed or registered for Type 2 regulated activity; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: whose name is entered in the register maintained by the Monetary Authority under section 20 of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155) as engaged in respect of Type 2 regulated activity by an authorized financial institution registered for that regulated activity,

paragraph.continued: but the person shall be regarded as dealing in futures contracts if, in return for a commission, rebate or other remuneration, the person—

subparagraph.name: I
II
subparagraph.content: effects an introduction between the futures dealer or his representative and a third person, so that the third person may enter into, or offer or invite to enter into, a futures contract with the futures dealer;
effects an acquisition or disposal of a futures contract for a third person through the futures dealer;

subparagraph.name: V
subparagraph.content: accepts for the futures dealer an offer by a third person to acquire or dispose of a futures contract;

paragraph.name: iii
paragraph.content: performs the act referred to in paragraph (a), (b) or (c) only on a market referred to in section 3(a), (b) or (c) of the Commodity Exchanges (Prohibition) Ordinance (Cap. 82);

paragraph.name: iv
v
paragraph.content: enters into a market contract;

paragraph.name: vi
paragraph.content: is licensed or registered for Type 9 regulated activity and performs the act referred to in paragraph (a), (b) or (c) solely for the purposes of carrying on that regulated activity; or

paragraph.name: vii
paragraph.text: as principal performs the act referred to in paragraph (a), (b) or (c) in relation to a futures contract traded otherwise than on a recognized futures market by way of dealing with a person who is a professional investor (whether acting as principal or agent);

def.name: DealingInSecurities
def.leadIn: dealing in securities (證券交易), in relation to a person, means making or offering to make an agreement with another person, or inducing or attempting to induce another person to enter into or to offer to enter into an agreement—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for or with a view to acquiring, disposing of, subscribing for or underwriting securities; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the purpose or pretended purpose of which is to secure a profit to any of the parties from the yield of securities or by reference to fluctuations in the value of securities,

def.continued: by the person, except where the person—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: is a recognized exchange company operating a stock market;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: is a recognized clearing house;

paragraph.name: iii
iv
paragraph.leadIn: performs the act through another person (the securities dealer)—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: who is licensed or registered for Type 1 regulated activity; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: whose name is entered in the register maintained by the Monetary Authority under section 20 of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155) as engaged in respect of Type 1 regulated activity by an authorized financial institution registered for that regulated activity,

paragraph.continued: but the person shall be regarded as dealing in securities if, in return for a commission, rebate or other remuneration, the person—

subparagraph.name: I
subparagraph.content: receives from a third person an offer or invitation to enter into an agreement referred to in paragraph (a) or (b), and communicates it, either in his name or in the name of the third person, to the securities dealer;

subparagraph.name: II
subparagraph.content: effects an introduction between the securities dealer or his representative and a third person, so that the third person may enter into, or offer or invite to enter into, an agreement referred to in paragraph (a) or (b) with the securities dealer;

subparagraph.name: III
subparagraph.content: effects an agreement referred to in paragraph (a) or (b) on behalf of a third person through the securities dealer;
makes an offer to the securities dealer on behalf of a third person to acquire or dispose of securities; or

subparagraph.name: V
subparagraph.content: accepts for the securities dealer an offer by a third person to enter into an agreement referred to in paragraph (a) or (b);

paragraph.name: v
paragraph.leadIn: as principal—

subparagraph.name: A
B
subparagraph.content: acquires, disposes of, subscribes for or underwrites securities;

paragraph.name: vi
paragraph.content: enters into a market contract;

paragraph.name: vii
paragraph.content: issues a prospectus which complies with, or is exempt from compliance with, Part II of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32) or, in the case of a corporation incorporated outside Hong Kong that is not a re-domiciled company, Part XII of that Ordinance; (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920; 14 of 2025 s. 249)

paragraph.leadIn: issues a document relating to the securities of a corporation incorporated in Hong Kong which is not a company, being a document which—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: would, if the corporation were a company, be a prospectus to which section 38 of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32) applies, or would apply if not excluded by section 38(5)(b) or 38A of that Ordinance; and (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: contains all the matters which, under Part XII of that Ordinance, would be required to contain if the corporation were a corporation incorporated outside Hong Kong that is not a re-domiciled company and the document were a prospectus issued by the corporation; (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 249)

paragraph.name: ix
paragraph.leadIn: issues a form of application for the shares or debentures of a corporation, together with—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: a prospectus which complies with, or is exempt from compliance with, Part II of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32) or, in the case of a corporation incorporated outside Hong Kong that is not a re-domiciled company, Part XII of that Ordinance; or (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920; 14 of 2025 s. 249)

subparagraph.name: B

paragraph.name: x
paragraph.leadIn: issues a prospectus the registration of which has been authorized by the Commission under section 342C of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32) in relation to a collective investment scheme that is a corporation— (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: which is or holds itself out as being engaged primarily in the business of investing, reinvesting or trading in any property (including securities and futures contracts); and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the shares in which are exclusively, or primarily, redeemable shares,

paragraph.continued: or issues together with the prospectus a form of application for the shares in the corporation;

paragraph.name: xi
11a
paragraph.content: being an open-ended fund company, issues any advertisement, invitation or document in respect of the shares in the company; (Added 16 of 2016 s. 21)

paragraph.name: xii
paragraph.content: is a trust company registered under Part 8 of the Trustee Ordinance (Cap. 29) acting as an agent for a collective investment scheme which, by performing the act, is carrying out its functions of distributing application forms, redemption notices, conversion notices and contract notes, receiving money and issuing receipts on behalf of its principal;

is licensed or registered for Type 4 or Type 6 regulated activity and, solely for the purposes of carrying on that regulated activity, he issues a document under section 175(1)(a)(i) or (ii) of this Ordinance, the content of which complies with the requirements of section 175(1)(b) and (c) of this Ordinance; (Amended L.N. 197 of 2005)
is licensed or registered for Type 9 regulated activity and performs the act solely for the purposes of carrying on that regulated activity; or (Amended L.N. 197 of 2005)

paragraph.name: xv
paragraph.content: in any case where each of the parties to the transaction or proposed transaction under which securities are or will be acquired, disposed of, subscribed for or underwritten as described in paragraph (a) is an authorized financial institution, is an approved money broker and performs the act for each of the parties to the transaction or proposed transaction; (Added L.N. 197 of 2005. Amended 6 of 2014 s. 53)

part.def: debt securities (債務證券) means debenture stocks, loan stocks, debentures, bonds, notes, indexed bonds, convertible debt securities, bonds with warrants, non-interest bearing debt securities, and other securities or instruments acknowledging, evidencing or creating indebtedness; (Added L.N. 28 of 2011)

def.name: Depositary
def.leadIn: depositary (存管人), in relation to a relevant CIS, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the relevant CIS is constituted in the form of a trust—the person who is appointed as a trustee under the trust deed constituting or governing the relevant CIS; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the relevant CIS is constituted in any other form—

subparagraph.content: the person who is appointed as the custodian (by whatever name called) of the relevant CIS under a written agreement entered into by the person with the relevant CIS; or
the person who, under an arrangement made with the relevant CIS, is in fact the custodian of the relevant CIS; (Added L.N. 62 of 2023)

def.name: ExcludedServices
def.leadIn: excluded services (豁除服務) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: services for trading in OTC derivative products that do not fall within paragraph (a), (b) or (c) of the definition of automated trading services and which are provided—

subparagraph.content: by an authorized financial institution or an approved money broker;
by means of electronic facilities; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: services for clearing OTC derivative products that—

subparagraph.content: also constitute Type 12 regulated activity; and
are provided by a person licensed for that regulated activity; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: services for clearing OTC derivative products that—

subparagraph.content: would constitute Type 12 regulated activity but for the exclusion under section 4(b) of Part 2A; and
are provided by an authorized financial institution or an approved money broker; (Added 6 of 2014 s. 53)

def.name: ForeignExchangeTrading
def.leadIn: foreign exchange trading (外匯交易) means entering into or offering to enter into, or inducing or attempting to induce a person to enter into or to offer to enter into, a contract or arrangement whereby any person undertakes to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: exchange currency with another person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: deliver an amount of foreign currency to another person; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: credit the account of another person with an amount of foreign currency,

def.proviso: but does not include any act performed for or in connection with any contract or arrangement or a proposed contract or arrangement as described in paragraphs (i) to (xv) of the definition of leveraged foreign exchange trading;

def.name: LeveragedForeignExchangeContract
def.leadIn: leveraged foreign exchange contract (槓桿式外匯交易合約) means a contract or arrangement the effect of which is that one party agrees or undertakes to—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: pay an amount of money or to deliver a quantity of any commodity determined or to be determined by reference to the change in value of a currency in relation to another currency to the other party or another person; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: deliver to the other party or another person at an agreed future time an agreed amount of currency at an agreed consideration;

def.name: LeveragedForeignExchangeTrading
def.leadIn: leveraged foreign exchange trading (槓桿式外匯交易) means—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: the act of entering into or offering to enter into, or inducing or attempting to induce a person to enter into, an arrangement with another person, on a discretionary basis or otherwise, to enter into a contract to facilitate an act referred to in paragraph (a) or (b),

def.proviso: but does not include any act performed for or in connection with any contract or arrangement or a proposed contract or arrangement—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: wholly referable to the provision of property, other than currency, or services or employment at fair or market value;

paragraph.name: ia
paragraph.content: by a person for the purpose of performing the person’s functions as a recognized clearing house; (Added 6 of 2014 s. 53)

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.leadIn: where the contract or arrangement is entered into by a corporation—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the principal business of which does not include dealing in currency in any form;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: for the purpose of hedging its exposure to currency exchange risks in connection with its business; and

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: with another corporation;

paragraph.name: iii
paragraph.content: that is an exchange transaction within the meaning of the Money Changers Ordinance (Cap. 34);

paragraph.name: iv
paragraph.leadIn: arranged by an approved money broker and every party to which is— (Amended 6 of 2014 s. 53; 14 of 2020 s. 122)

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: a corporation;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: a limited partnership registered under the Limited Partnerships Ordinance (Cap. 37); or

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: a limited partnership fund registered under the Limited Partnership Fund Ordinance (Cap. 637); (Added 14 of 2020 s. 122. Amended E.R. 5 of 2020)

paragraph.name: v
paragraph.content: that is a transaction executed solely for the purpose of its insurance business by an insurer authorized under section 8 of the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41) (Cap. 41) to carry on insurance business, or deemed to be so authorized under section 61(1) or (2) of Cap. 41 as in force immediately before the commencement date of section 10 of the Insurance Companies (Amendment) Ordinance 2015 (12 of 2015) having continuing effect by the operation of section 2(7) of Schedule 11 to Cap. 41; (Amended 12 of 2015 s. 145)

paragraph.name: vi
paragraph.content: that is a contract executed on a specified futures exchange by or through a person who is licensed or registered for Type 2 regulated activity or is wholly incidental to one or more than one such contract or a series of such contracts;

paragraph.name: vii
paragraph.leadIn: arranged by—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.leadIn: a body which, in the opinion of the Monetary Authority, is—

subparagraph.name: I
subparagraph.content: a central bank; or

subparagraph.name: II
subparagraph.content: an institution which performs the functions of a central bank; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: an organization which, with the approval of the Monetary Authority, is acting on behalf of a body referred to in subparagraph (A);

paragraph.content: that is a transaction executed on a specified stock exchange by or through a person who is licensed or registered for Type 1 regulated activity or is wholly incidental to one or more than one such transaction or a series of such transactions;

paragraph.name: ix
paragraph.content: that is a transaction executed by or through a person who is licensed or registered for Type 7 regulated activity or is wholly incidental to one or more than one such transaction or a series of such transactions;

paragraph.name: x
xi
paragraph.content: that is wholly incidental to one or more than one transaction in specified debt securities or a series of such transactions;

paragraph.name: 11a
paragraph.content: that is an OTC derivative dealing act carried out by a person who is licensed for Type 12 regulated activity and is carried out wholly incidentally to the carrying on of that regulated activity; (Added 6 of 2014 s. 53)

paragraph.name: 11b
xii
paragraph.content: by an authorized financial institution;

paragraph.name: xiv
paragraph.leadIn: by a person through a trader, but the person shall be regarded as carrying on leveraged foreign exchange trading if, in return for a commission, rebate or other remuneration, the person—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.leadIn: receives from another person an offer or invitation to—

subparagraph.name: I
subparagraph.content: enter into a leveraged foreign exchange contract; or

subparagraph.name: II
subparagraph.content: use any financial accommodation to facilitate foreign exchange trading or facilitate entering into a leveraged foreign exchange contract,

subparagraph.continued: and communicates it, either in his name or in the name of the other person, to the trader;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.leadIn: effects an introduction between the trader or its representative and another person, so that the other person may—

subparagraph.name: I
subparagraph.content: enter into a leveraged foreign exchange contract with the trader; or

subparagraph.name: II
subparagraph.content: use any financial accommodation provided by the trader to facilitate foreign exchange trading or facilitate entering into a leveraged foreign exchange contract; or

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: effects the entering into a leveraged foreign exchange contract by another person through the trader,

paragraph.def: where in this paragraph, trader (交易商) means a corporation licensed for Type 3 regulated activity or an authorized financial institution; or

paragraph.name: xv
paragraph.leadIn: by—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: a collective investment scheme; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: a person in the course of business for the purpose of operating a collective investment scheme,

paragraph.continued: authorized by the Commission under section 104 of this Ordinance;

part.def: preferred securities (優先證券) means preference shares, preferred shares or preferred stock; (Added L.N. 28 of 2011)

§providing client clearing services for OTC derivative transactions (為場外衍生工具交易提供客户結算服務), in relation to a person and subject to Part 2A, means providing services to another person for the clearing and settlement of OTC derivative transactions through a central counterparty (whether located in Hong Kong or elsewhere)— (Added 6 of 2014 s. 53. Amended 17 of 2021 s. 75)(a)as a member of the central counterparty; or(b)as a client of a member of the central counterparty (direct client), a client of a direct client (indirect client), a client of an indirect client, or a client, whether direct or indirect, of any of those persons; (Amended 17 of 2021 s. 75)

def.name: ProvidingCreditRatingServices
def.leadIn: providing credit rating services (提供信貸評級服務) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: preparing credit ratings—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: for dissemination to the public, whether in Hong Kong or elsewhere; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: with a reasonable expectation that they will be so disseminated; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: preparing credit ratings—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: for distribution by subscription, whether in Hong Kong or elsewhere; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: with a reasonable expectation that they will be so distributed,

def.continued: but does not include—

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: preparing, pursuant to a request made by a person, a credit rating which is exclusively prepared for, and provided to, the person and that is neither intended for dissemination to the public or distribution by subscription, whether in Hong Kong or elsewhere, nor reasonably expected to be so disseminated or distributed; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.text: gathering, collating, disseminating or distributing information concerning the indebtedness or credit history of any person; (Added L.N. 28 of 2011)

def.name: ProvidingDepositaryServicesForRelevantCISs
def.leadIn: providing depositary services for relevant CISs (為相關集體投資計劃提供存管服務) means providing both of the following services for 1 or more relevant CISs by a depositary (other than a delegate or subdelegate of the depositary, irrespective of whether the delegate or subdelegate is appointed by the depositary)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the custody and safekeeping of relevant CIS property;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the oversight of the relevant CIS to ensure that it is operated in accordance with its scheme documents; (Added L.N. 62 of 2023)

def.name: RealEstateInvestmentSchemeManagement
def.leadIn: real estate investment scheme management (房地產投資計劃管理), in relation to a person, means providing a service of operating a collective investment scheme for another person by the person, where—

paragraph.name: a
b

def.name: RelevantCIS
def.leadIn: relevant CIS (相關集體投資計劃) means a collective investment scheme authorized under section 104 other than any of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a registered scheme as defined by section 2(1) of the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes Ordinance (Cap. 485), or a constituent fund (as defined by that section 2(1)) of the registered scheme;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: an approved pooled investment fund as defined by section 2 of the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes (General) Regulation (Cap. 485 sub. leg. A) that is offered only to all or any of the following—

subparagraph.content: professional investors;
pooling agreements as defined by section 2(4) of the Occupational Retirement Schemes Ordinance (Cap. 426); (Added L.N. 62 of 2023)

def.name: RelevantCISProperty
def.leadIn: relevant CIS property (相關集體投資計劃財產), in relation to a relevant CIS, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the relevant CIS is constituted in the form of a trust—the property held on or subject to trust under the trust deed constituting or governing the relevant CIS; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the relevant CIS is constituted in any other form—the property of the relevant CIS; (Added L.N. 62 of 2023)

def.name: SchemeDocuments
def.leadIn: scheme documents (計劃文件), in relation to a relevant CIS, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the relevant CIS is constituted in the form of a trust—the trust deed constituting or governing the relevant CIS;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the relevant CIS is constituted in any other form—the documents governing the formation or constitution of the relevant CIS; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: other documents setting out the requirements relating to—

subparagraph.content: the custody and safekeeping of any relevant CIS property; or
the oversight of the operations of the relevant CIS; (Added L.N. 62 of 2023)

def.name: SecuritiesMarginFinancing
def.leadIn: securities margin financing (證券保證金融資) means providing a financial accommodation in order to facilitate—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: (where applicable) the continued holding of those securities,

def.continued: whether or not those or other securities are pledged as security for the accommodation, but does not include the provision of financial accommodation—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: that forms part of an arrangement to underwrite or sub-underwrite securities;

paragraph.name: ii
iii
iv
paragraph.leadIn: by a collective investment scheme that is a corporation—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: which is or holds itself out as being engaged primarily in the business of investing, reinvesting or trading in any property (including securities and futures contracts); and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the shares in which are exclusively, or primarily, redeemable shares,

paragraph.name: v
vi
paragraph.content: by an individual to a company in which he holds 10% or more of its issued shares to facilitate acquisitions or holdings of securities; or (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

paragraph.name: vii
paragraph.content: by an intermediary by way of effecting an introduction between a person and a related corporation of the intermediary in order that the corporation may provide the person with financial accommodation; (Amended L.N. 197 of 2005)

def.name: SecuritiesOrFuturesContractsManagement
def.leadIn: securities or futures contracts management (證券或期貨合約管理), in relation to a person, means providing a service of managing a portfolio of securities or futures contracts for another person by the person, otherwise than by— (Amended L.N. 197 of 2005)

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: an authorized financial institution which is registered for Type 1 or Type 2 regulated activity which provides such service wholly incidental to the carrying on of that regulated activity;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: an individual—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: whose name is entered in the register maintained by the Monetary Authority under section 20 of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155) as engaged in respect of Type 1 or Type 2 (as the case may be) regulated activity by an authorized financial institution registered for that regulated activity; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: who provides such service wholly incidental to the carrying on of that regulated activity;

paragraph.name: e
f
paragraph.content: counsel who provides such service wholly incidental to his practice as such;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: a certified public accountant who provides such service wholly incidental to his practice as such in a practice unit as defined by section 2(1) of the Accounting and Financial Reporting Council Ordinance (Cap. 588); or (Amended 23 of 2004 s. 56; L.N. 66 of 2022)

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: a trust company registered under Part 8 of the Trustee Ordinance (Cap. 29) which provides such service wholly incidental to the discharge of its duty as such. (Amended L.N. 197 of 2005)

editorialNote.content: Editorial Note:+ The new paragraph (ab) in the definition of automated trading services, Part 2, Schedule 5 added by the Securities and Futures (Amendment) Ordinance 2014 (6 of 2014) came into operation on 1 September 2016, in so far as it relates to the new paragraph (d) of the definition of automated trading services. Please see paragraph (h) of the Securities and Futures (Amendment) Ordinance 2014 (Commencement) Notice 2016 (L.N. 27 of 2016).

content.text: @ The new paragraph (ba) in the definition of automated trading services, Part 2, Schedule 5 added by the Securities and Futures (Amendment) Ordinance 2014 (6 of 2014) came into operation on 1 September 2016, in so far as it relates to the new paragraph (d) of the definition of automated trading services. Please see paragraph (j) of the Securities and Futures (Amendment) Ordinance 2014 (Commencement) Notice 2016 (L.N. 27 of 2016).

## The new paragraph (d) in the definition of automated trading services, Part 2, Schedule 5 added by the Securities and Futures (Amendment) Ordinance 2014 (6 of 2014) came into operation on 1 September 2016, except in so far as it relates to Type 7 regulated activity under the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571). Please see paragraph (l) of the Securities and Futures (Amendment) Ordinance 2014 (Commencement) Notice 2016 (L.N. 27 of 2016).

§ The new definition of providing client clearing services for OTC derivative transactions, Part 2, Schedule 5 added by the Securities and Futures (Amendment) Ordinance 2014 (6 of 2014) came into operation on 1 September 2016, in so far as it relates to paragraph (c) of the new definition of excluded services. Please see paragraph (n)(ii) of the Securities and Futures (Amendment) Ordinance 2014 (Commencement) Notice 2016 (L.N. 27 of 2016). See also section 78(3) of the Securities and Futures and Companies Legislation (Amendment) Ordinance 2021 (17 of 2021).

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: In Part 2, advising on OTC derivative products does not include the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: an act that falls within—

subparagraph.content: Type 4 regulated activity, carried out by a person licensed to carry on that regulated activity; or
Type 5 regulated activity, carried out by a person licensed to carry on that regulated activity;

paragraph.name: b
c
d
paragraph.leadIn: an OTC derivative advising act carried out in the ordinary course of business by—

subparagraph.content: an authorized financial institution; or
an approved money broker;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: an OTC derivative advising act carried out by a person licensed for Type 9 regulated activity who—

subparagraph.content: provides a service of OTC derivative products management that the person is permitted to provide under that licence; and
carries out the act solely for the purpose of providing that service;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: an OTC derivative advising act carried out by a person who—

subparagraph.content: carries on a type or description of business so prescribed;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: an OTC derivative advising act carried out by a corporation, if the giving of the advice or issuing of the analyses or reports constituting the act is solely to—

subparagraph.content: any of its wholly owned subsidiaries; or
a holding company that holds all its issued shares or to other wholly owned subsidiaries of that holding company;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.leadIn: an OTC derivative advising act carried out by—

subparagraph.content: a solicitor, if carrying out that act is wholly incidental to his or her practice as a solicitor in a Hong Kong firm or foreign firm (both as defined by section 2(1) of the Legal Practitioners Ordinance (Cap. 159));
counsel, if carrying out that act is wholly incidental to his or her practice as counsel;

a certified public accountant, if carrying out that act is wholly incidental to his or her practice as a certified public accountant in a practice unit (as defined by section 2(1) of the Professional Accountants Ordinance (Cap. 50)); or
a trust company registered under Part VIII of the Trustee Ordinance (Cap. 29), if carrying out that act is wholly incidental to the discharge of its duties as such a trust company;

paragraph.leadIn: an OTC derivative advising act carried out by a person through—

subparagraph.content: a newspaper, magazine, book or other publication that is made generally available to the public; or
a television broadcast or radio broadcast for reception by the public, whether on subscription or otherwise.

section.name: s2
section.leadIn: In Part 2, dealing in OTC derivative products does not include the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: an act that falls within—

subparagraph.content: Type 1 regulated activity, carried out by a person licensed to carry on that regulated activity;
Type 2 regulated activity, carried out by a person licensed to carry on that regulated activity; or
Type 3 regulated activity, carried out by a person licensed to carry on that regulated activity;

paragraph.name: b
c
d
e
paragraph.leadIn: an act carried out by a person for the purpose of performing the person’s functions as—

subparagraph.content: a recognized clearing house;
a recognized exchange company; or
a provider of automated trading services authorized under section 95(2) of this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: an act carried out in the ordinary course of business by—

subparagraph.content: an authorized financial institution; or
an approved money broker;

paragraph.name: g
h
paragraph.leadIn: an OTC derivative dealing act carried out by a person licensed for Type 9 regulated activity who—

subparagraph.content: provides a service of managing a portfolio of OTC derivative products for another person that the person is permitted to provide under that licence; and
carries out the act solely for the purpose of providing that service;

paragraph.leadIn: an OTC derivative dealing act—

subparagraph.content: carried out by a person who is licensed for Type 12 regulated activity; and
is carried out wholly incidentally to the carrying on of that regulated activity;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: an act that constitutes entering into a market contract;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.leadIn: an act carried out by a person who—

subparagraph.content: carries on a type or description of business so prescribed;

paragraph.name: m
paragraph.leadIn: an OTC derivative dealing act carried out by a person who—

subparagraph.content: is a member of a commodity exchange referred to in section 3(d) of the Commodity Exchanges (Prohibition) Ordinance (Cap. 82); and
carries out the act only on an exchange referred to in subparagraph (i);

paragraph.name: n
paragraph.leadIn: an OTC derivative dealing act that is carried out by a person (first person) through another person (OTC derivative products dealer) who is—

subparagraph.content: licensed for Type 11 regulated activity;
an authorized financial institution;
an approved money broker;
an officer or employee of an authorized financial institution, acting in the person’s capacity as such; or
an officer or employee of an approved money broker, acting in the person’s capacity as such,

paragraph.continued: except that the first person is to be regarded as dealing in OTC derivative products if that person, in return for a commission, rebate or other remuneration carries out an act set out in section 3.

section.name: s3
section.leadIn: The acts referred to in section 2(n) are that the first person (within the meaning of that section)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: receives from a third person an offer or invitation to enter into an OTC derivative transaction, and communicates it, either in the first person’s name or in the name of the third person to the OTC derivative products dealer (within the meaning of section 2(n));

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: effects an introduction between the OTC derivative products dealer or that dealer’s representative and a third person, so that the third person may enter into, or offer or invite to enter into, an OTC derivative transaction with the OTC derivative products dealer;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: effects the entering into an OTC derivative transaction by a third person through the OTC derivative products dealer;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: makes an offer for the OTC derivative products dealer to a third person to enter into an OTC derivative transaction; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: accepts for the OTC derivative products dealer an offer by a third person to enter into an OTC derivative transaction.

section.name: s4
section.leadIn: In Part 2, providing client clearing services for OTC derivative transactions does not include the following—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: an act carried out by an authorized financial institution or an approved money broker in the ordinary course of business;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an act of an acceptable participant of a central counterparty located in Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: an act of an agent, who does not handle client money or client assets, of such an acceptable participant.

section.name: s5
section.leadIn: In section 4—

def.name: AcceptableParticipant
def.leadIn: acceptable participant (可接受參與者) means a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: who does not have a place of business in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: who is, or has applied to become, a member of a central counterparty located in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: the provision by whom of clearing and settlement services (other than acts referred to in section 4) in respect of OTC derivative transactions or other similar transactions on behalf of another person and through a central counterparty (either directly as a member of the central counterparty or indirectly through another person that is such a member) is governed by legal or regulatory requirements of a comparable overseas jurisdiction;

def.name: ComparableOverseasJurisdiction
def.leadIn: comparable overseas jurisdiction (相若的海外司法管轄區) means a jurisdiction—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: which the Commission is satisfied has legal or regulatory requirements comparable to those of Hong Kong for regulating the provision of clearing and settlement services (other than acts referred to in section 4) in respect of OTC derivative transactions or other similar transactions on behalf of another person and through a central counterparty (either directly as a member of the central counterparty or indirectly through another person that is such a member); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: with the regulators of which the Commission has adequate cooperative arrangements or agreements.

editorialNote.text: # Not yet in operation.

@ The new section 4(b), Schedule 5, Part 2A added by the Securities and Futures (Amendment) Ordinance 2014 (6 of 2014) came into operation on 1 September 2016, in so far as it relates to the new definition of providing client clearing services for OTC derivative transactions in Part 2 of Schedule 5. Please see paragraph (o) of the Securities and Futures (Amendment) Ordinance 2014 (Commencement) Notice 2016 (L.N. 27 of 2016).

part.name: P3
part.leadIn: The following are the specified activities referred to in section 114(5) of this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the acquisition of securities listed on a stock market which is or forms part of a stock borrowing or stock return as defined in section 19(16) of the Stamp Duty Ordinance (Cap. 117), or any transaction in securities similar to such a borrowing or return; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the provision of financial accommodation—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: by a company to its directors or employees to facilitate acquisitions or holdings of its own securities; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: by a member of a group of companies to another member of the group to facilitate acquisitions or holdings of securities by that other member.
